The service is god rude and aweful.. they act like it's a privilege for us to eat there and we are pretty chill peeps. Told us we couldn't talk to each other and they try to include a built in 15% tip?? They were rude the whole time despite politeness and saw them be rude to other customers  too which I felt bad for and it's not even my business.. For was ok.. At the end.. the server asked for a 33% tip
Tasty pizza. Is it authentic? I don't know and don't really care. It was super tasty and satisfying. That's all I really care about. Would eat again, even though it was pricey.

If we could give 4.5 stars we would. We ordered an old school deep dish pizza and cesar salad. Both were very good, and wait time was not too bad. Everything was fresh, the olives on the pizza were absolutely delicious, everything in the pizza came together very well. Very underrated small place in SF. Surely expected there to be more people there on  sunday night at 7 pm. Recommend this place if you want a great meal.

We picked up the small (9 inch) Little Star Pizza and Roasted Kale tonight. The small size pizza was perfect for the two of us, we still had 2 slices leftover after our meal. We reheated the pizza when we got home at 400 for 10 minutes, per the hostess' instructions. The Little Star hit the spot for us, after a day of exploring the city. We paired it with a Tannat from Tablas Creek (Paso Robles) and it was a great combo. The pizza has an ideal balance of ingredients (spinach blended with ricotta and feta, mushroom, onion, garlic) and we enjoyed the unique cornmeal crust as well as the garlicky red sauce. The kale held up well (even after we microwaved to reheat, it still kept a crunch!). Overall, we really enjoyed our meal and plan to return here soon.

This is def one of my fav pizza places. The service here is amazing! Everyone was super friendly. I ordered the portobello mushroom thick crust, margherita thin crust, roasted kale, and the burrata caprese salad. Overall, everything just tasted fresh. I was surprised with how crispy the pizza crust for both kinds of pizza was crispy on the outside - definitely helped the texture.  My favorite was the margherita pizza. It was light and just perfect! The caprese salad was another favorite of mine. A toasted bread, olive oil, vinegar, fresh tomatoes and burrata makes the perfect combination.  I'll definitely be back for round 2:)

Really enjoyed their deep dish pizza, service, and location today. We ended up ordering a large pizza - half margherita and half little star. The sauce was so good- almost as good as what I've had in the Midwest and the crust was just right. Generally speaking, I found the deep dish the right size proportion and would come back if cravings kick in.  Was too full to order dessert :)

Their large deep dish was delicious! Their cheese was so stringy. Their crust was really corn bread like, so good: crunchy yet fluffy! I would definitely order this again. Also had their large thin crust pesto chicken pizzza. The pesto didnt taste as a fresh as I remember so I think next time, I'll ask first how their pesto is that day. Since I love the pesto so much, I might order a pesto only pizza next time!
The thin crust pesto pizza was SO GOOD. That crust was so crunchy and thin. It kept its shape instead of folding in on itself. The pesto was so fresh! Will HAVE to try the deep dish next time!

I've ordered delivery from this place a few times. The food is always fantastic! Highly recommend the deep dish pizzas. My only wish is that they would do personal size deep dish pizzas all the time! Even if they weren't on the lunch special pricing, I'd be willing to pay a bit more. If you're craving deep dish this is your spot.

Super overpriced, small pizzas with hardly any ingredients on top. I actually really enjoyed the flavor of the margherita but it was not filling at all. The crust was also pretty burned and thin as a pita chip. Won't be back for pizza, seems over-hyped for the ambiance.

Was heading home via the Mission around 8pm and decided that a Margherita pie would hit the spot. I placed my order , and by the time I got there my order was up! Parking was easy but again this was 8pm on a Monday. As for the pizza great crust, cheese , etc very happy I got dinner via Delfina. btw a few things to note,  they do family meals , and kits, and currently Matzo Ball Soup on order for the coming holidays. Delfina has a nice Wine selection with some markup but it's still very reasonable. They also have premixed cocktails for 2 just add Glass and Ice. Why Delfina ? Quality cuisine at a fair price.

Came for SF restaurant week. Overall food was good, only thing was communication of pricing to sf restaurant week was incorrect and when we spoke to server about it they were not the most accommodating. However, food was good so no complaints there :) definitely recommend if you want some yummy italian food!

Long story short, this place is popular!! Order early. Example: I ordered at around 5:30 pm on a Friday night and my order was not ready until around 6:45. But omg, the pizza!!! I got the diavola pie (salame piccante, tomato, spring onion, pepperoncini, and mozzarella) and it was just mouth watering good. Like one of the best pizzas I have ever eaten. I also got the carrots in yogurt sauce and they were maybe better than the pizza, no exaggeration. Next time I want to try their white pies and to-go cocktails for two. Their outdoor dine-in set up looks really cute as well: six separate stalls that look perfect for pandem dinning. If you are in the mission, this place is not to be missed! (Also it's close to Bi-Rite and Tartine so ya know, it's a pretty great location).

I've only been to the restaurant in the Mission one time, for a more fancy dinner. I've been to the Palo Alto location like 5 times, truly too many to count. The Mission restaurant made one of the best pizza pies I have ever had in my life - the cherry tomato pizza. Only cherry tomatoes and shards of cheese. So good.

After completing a big project yesterday, thought I would splurge on a delivery meal.  Having heard so much about the Delfina offerings in SF, went for a Funghi Pizza the a few additional topping plus the Charred Jimmy Nardello Peppers. I was really disappointed with my pizza.  While the crust was amazing and chewy, the main ingredient of Funghi was barely there.  It looked nothing like the picture posted in the delivery app.   The charred peppers while delicious, was not a portion I expected for $11.  Not sure if I would order here again though I might eat there if they're serving.

Ordered: - funghi  - Margherita - Napoletana  Funghi was everyones favorite. The Margherita had three pieces of basil on it. The crust was great!! But the base was way way too thin. You would pick up the pizza off by the crust and everything would just slide off. The base was so soggy that I could wrap it around the crust to be able to eat it with one hand.

Pick-up buyer beware: Good pizza, poor service. 1st-time customer here. Ordered pick-up of a single pie on a Friday night (admittedly busy) & was quoted a 57-minute wait time for pick-up. Fine. Arrived exactly on time & was asked to wait "just 4 more minutes." Okay. Checked back in 10 mins later (was trying to be patient) & was asked to wait "just 3 more minutes." Great. 6 mins later, staff plops my order into my hands w/o so much as a "thanks for waiting," "thanks," or even "have a good night." 16 mins past quoted pick-up time -- an hour & 13 mins -- for one pizza? Granted, it's good; & I'll think twice before ordering from this place again. Service matters.
Hi Nguyen P. Please email us at  delfina@delfinasf.com  so we connect about your experience. Best, Delfina

Note that this is a review regarding their pick up options during shelter in place. I was recently at Pizzeria Delfina to pick up an order of pizza for some relaxation time at Mission Dolores Park. It was easy walking distance from the park, and the storefront was well prepared for pickup. They had staff ready at the front door to follow-up on the order pick up, and the food was ready at the promised time. They had individual sized plates and utensils available for us as well, which was perfect. We picked up a total of 3 pizzas, a pesto pie, and two customized margherita pizzas. The food was quite good, and the pizzas were all warm even when we brought it back to the park. We appreciated the solid flavors, great crusts, and gooey cheese. Overall, we all enjoyed our order from Pizzeria Delfina and the service was great. The store was well prepared for pick-up orders in the shelter in place setting and appears to maintain a clean, hygienic food service storefront.

Yo, honestly it's such an exciting thing whenever I get to do anything outside these days. I haven't gotten a single thing from the Mission since like before the pandemic started. Was spending some time in the park with a few friends and we all decided to walk over and grab some take-out pizza from Pizzeria Delfina. I personally got the Salsiccia pizza (I think I spelled that right). I basically wanted sausage, and I got sauage. Anyway, my review of this place is probably going be a variant of every other place I review that has Neapolitan-style pizza, which is: 1. Kinda expensive (paid almost $20 for my pizza, I assume it has quality ingredients though so fine, it's San Francisco anyway).  2. Neapolitan-style pizzas are always at risk at falling apart!!! Pizzeria Delfina gets a 4-star instead of a typical 3 I would say because their pizzas actually held together DECENTLY well, I think I only had one slice that completely gave up on me lmao. But generally these thin, floppy pizzas stress me out because I'm like I'm not tryna eat this with a fork and knife. Anyway, pizza was good. Wouldn't go out of my way to get this, but not a bad spot to try.

Cash only ~ Luckily we brought cash. Lol!!! Huge portions, good deal and very tasty ~~~ We are so surprised that the price didn't go up and the portions still remained the same. We aren't unable to finish our lunch and we're going to save it for dinner or next day. Shoutout for staffs - very fast service \(^^)/

Located conveniently next to 24th and Mission Street BART station. El Farrolito has some of the best Mexican food in San Francisco. I had to revist this place to satisfy a burrito craving! One of the longest standing Mexican restaurants in San Francisco's Misson district. Hopefully it will stand strong for years to come. Lately, they haven't had my favorite meat, beef tongue,  (lengua) available. But some other restaurants haven't had lengua either.  Today, I got a super burrito with Cabeza or beef head. It was delicious! Choose your meat, beans, and style. The rice was flavorful, Cabeza or beef head was seasoned well, beans cooked decently. My second favorite thing to order here is Quesadilla Suiza!  Hope your Yelp adventures will lead you to the classic staple of the community. Stay hungry adventurous and happy Yelping!

After reading million 5 star reviews about how authentic this place is, I had to try it. But boy I was a bit disappointed, I mean don't get me wrong, the food isn't bad, but it's not the best either. It was "okay".  Parking outside: it's on mission, and street parking is plenty if you arrive at the right time. You wait in line to order food and it's pretty quick, maybe 10-15 mins wait and your order is ready within a few mins of you paying for it. So a total of 15-20 Mins.  Food: got carnitas burritos; and the first bite was super salty. The whole burrito was but it wasn't anything special. I have had better Mexican food. Maybe after a few drinks it tastes better? Lol They are open late, which is a plus but it's cash only - thought here is an atm inside Ans outside the shop. Customer service: great, they were friendly and especially their security gaurd who was helping with the line Ans busting the tables was so nice to everyone! Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, I was just expecting to be blown away by the most yummiest burrito but I wasn't.

I wondered why every time I went to El Farolito, I could not remember how it tasted. So last night I made an effort to really focus on the flavor of my carne asada super burrito- closed my eyes and everything.  It's bland. Just a very plain burrito. Not bad, but lacking seasoning, flavor, or anything to distinguish it from the sum of its ingredients. But! They're open late, it's really cheap, and it's massive (easily 2 meals), just don't blame your drunken self when you can't remember if it was good or bad. It was ok.

This place one of the best in the mission. Came here after a night out on the town, and this burrito literally brought me back to life. The portions are huge and the food is great, even if it is just cash only. Definitely recommend if you are in the area and looking for a great burrito, no matter what hour of the day!

Really amazing burritos! I had the carnitas super burrito and was very happy, and extremely full. These burritos are heafty and packed with succulence. The meat was great, but I was particularly impressed with the flavorful pinto beans and soft fluffy rice. It had a tight wrap so it didn't spill all over and I loved the salsa inside.  I was bummed they didn't have chile verde pork as an option and the tortillas seemed standard. As one of, if not THE top rated burrito in California on multiple sites, I thought it was really really good, and I'll definitely be back, but it's not the best in the world, so I'm still on the hunt. I still loved it and can't wait to try other menu items. We went on a weekend morning so there was no line and the burritos we're ready in about 5 minutes. The hardest part was finding somewhere to park.  Tips: CASH only!!! There's an ATM inside if needed. masks are required inside to order, and masks plus proof of vaccination are required to sit inside.  Order to go and go eat at your favorite park bench or scenic overlook, these burritos stay hot and fresh for a while because of how well they are wrapped.

Great burrito. Thought there was good ratio of meat, guacamole, and rice. We tried Al Pastor and Carne Asada - both were very good but Al Pastor was better. I'm a big fan of burritos and can attest to the quality of this one compared to La Taqueria and other comps. Know some reviews say there's too much sour cream but I actually thought it could have used a little bit more of that wetness inside. The green and red sauce were both very good and were great flavor supplements to the burrito. Would recommend and would come back! Place is also very close by to Delores Park so recommend bringing it to picnic!

I came here with one of my friends because it was highly rated on Yelp! It's really busy but fast moving, so you should be prepared to wait a little. I ordered their super burrito with chorizo and black beans. It was quite large, as many of the reviews alluded to, and I ended up taking a third of it home to eat for breakfast the next day. The burrito was really good, but it wasn't exceptional. I have had just as good burritos elsewhere, but this is definitely one of the better ones. The prices were great, which is something I appreciated. My burrito was around $10, super affordable for San Francisco in my opinion. The service was really fast; I believe we got our food in less than 5 minutes. There is indoor dining, but it's limited. So we walked to Dolores park, which is about 20 minutes away. It's a really nice place to eat, so I'd recommend going there if you have time. Overall, I'd go back here and maybe try their quesadillas because they looked good too.

Don't let the Cash Only sign deter you from visiting the best Mexican food location in SF. Go to the bank and withdraw all your money and give it to El Farolito and you can thank me later. I swear everytime I go, regardless of time and day, it's the same awesome line crew working. Their super burrito is so amazing and each bit is extremely flavorful. You don't even need to add salsa it's that much flavor! They have a variety of meats to choose from including Lengua (tongue), Cabeza (cheek), and even Sesos (brain). We went with Al pastor for the burrito which I think is the best combination since the pork has more of a bite which lends itself better in a burrito since their are a lot of soft elements surrounding it. The Lengua and carne asada tacos were great too and a big shoutout to the carne asada as it had a great grilled flavor that you could taste immediately. The burrito only costs $8-9 too! How is this possible when other joints charge way more at the minimum and don't taste nearly as good. Go to the mission area in SF now and eat at this Mexican gem please.

Be sure to come to El Farolito with a big appetite! I purposely planned my day to be in the Mission around dinner time so I could get burritos at El Farolito and take it to Dolores Park.  In high school I'd come here often with friends for their Super Burritos. Now that I've moved, I crave these burritos and have been waiting years for this day to happen. Last night, I ordered the Carnitas Super Burrito with no cheese and light sour cream. Every bite was an explosion of pure bliss in my mouth. My burrito was massive and stuffed to the brim with various fillings. The carnitas came in big shredded chunks. The avocado was sliced, fresh, and creamy--not guacamole. The salsas they provided weren't spicy and added extra flavor. I highly recommend adding them on top of your burrito.  El Farolito's cash only. Two burritos and one Jarritos came out to a little over $20. They're open for indoor and outdoor dining too! Even though the line went out the door, the line and our food came out relatively fast.

I came to the Mission for an authentic burrito and Farolito did not disappoint. Despite being one of the best known places to get Mission burritos, it wasn't swamped like others on the street. Everyone else's mistake! It's a no frills kind of place, but they have so many options and can work around different dietary needs. The burrito was *excellent* and easy to handle, my tortilla didn't bust and I didn't have sauce running down my hands like it would at other places. The kicker? They have a hidden patio at the back with a bunch of seating options that are well-spaced out. No need to eat indoors or on top of someone else.  If you're looking for THE Mission burrito, go no further.

Went for a quick bite after arriving in San Francisco.  Ordered the Regular Burrito with Carne Asada to go.  It was bigger than I expected.  I went with regular because there was no cream or cheese.  It really hit the spot.  The meat was full of flavor and tender.  I would definitely go back. Service was very fast.  BTW, cash only.

Late night lifesaver or a day chill snack, this is where it's at  Central location in the mission close to Dolores park as well as bars/ nightclubs serving good quality burritos and quesadillas.  PRO TIP: Cash only  Food: Super burrito Carne Asada- 3/5 : Nothing too special about this burrito and thought it was a little dry. The sour cream was a welcome addition Super Quesadilla Carne Asada- 5/5: Fantastic and juicy quesadilla with all the super toppings. Favorite thing on the menu  Location- 5/5:  Right on Mission St next to all the big attractions of the area, great spot to pick things up to eat to go  Ambiance- 3/5: Nothing too special to how the place is set up or looks inside but that's not why you're here in the first place

El Farolito Ratings: 3.8/5  Food: 3.75/5 - Ordered four tacos: shrimp, al pastor (marinated pork), carne asada, and chicken. I think on the menu it says flour tortillas, but I think we got corn tortillas instead, and was not a big of corn tortillas. I think my top two favorites were the shrimp and the al pastor, super flavorful, fresh, and tasty. I would say to eat it quickly, but the proteins are super juicy, so my tortillas got soggy real quick. The chicken and steak were both tender, but wasn't mind blowing, I had better tacos before, but their homemade sauces were pretty decent. Staple in Mission area, so need to go try it out at least once if you are in SF.  Ambiance: 3.5/5 - Nothing special or unique about the interior atmosphere. Super hole-in-the-wall Mexican place in Mission. Looks like it needs some serious renovations, but the ambiance/atmosphere isn't why the reason you are here, it's for the food.  Price: 4/5 - Reasonable price I guess for the portion. The tacos are $3.25 each before tax. Similar to other taco places.  Service: 4/5 - Staff was friendly and service was fast. Keep in mind that there was a wait and long line, but the staffs are still doing a pretty good job serving us.  BLUF: Make sure to come with a big appetite, their portions are huge and perfect for late night cravings and if you are drunk. This place is cash only, so make sure to have cash.

On a Monday tour of the Mission with visiting friends, I had two burrito places that were on SF Chronicle's Soleil Ho's "Top Burritos in the Bay Area" list targeted for lunch. The decision was made easy since our first choice was closed on Mondays so we headed to El Farolito. I did not realize that there were 12 locations around the Bay Area with this being the original that was opened in 1983.  This location again has made SF Chronicle's Top 100 Restaurants list. Arriving around 12:30pm, there was a line out the door. With a large menu above the counter, I knew I wanted to get a burrito and went with a regular al pastor burrito. After you order, you wait off to the side for your order number to be called. If you want to eat in, there are six tables in the main room and about ten tables in a back patio area. My regular al pastor burrito was large and was filled with tasty al pastor marinated pork, rice, pinto beans and salsa. Delicious! The order also came with chips and two salsas, red and verde.  At $7.75, it's a deal that's hard to beat. This is a basic no-frills place where you get your food and take out or enjoy on the premises and be on your way. Being open from 10am to 1:45am, this is a place where regulars to tourists to the late night crowd can stop by to get some tasty food.

Doesn't look like much when you walk past, but this hole in the wall has the BEST quesadilla.  The Superhero (5/5): The super quesadilla is a lifesaver for anyone who's super hungry. It's basically a two in one so you can easily split with someone. There's the perfect ratio of carne asada, avocado, sour cream, and cheese. We also tried the burrito but it really wasn't much compared to the quesadilla -- that's really the main thing to order.  The Sidekick (5/5): The salsas add some flavorful nuance but is probably needed more for the burrito which is a little on the dry side. The agua frescas are also very refreshing and complement the savory food well.  Ambiance (3/5): Skip dining inside and take your food to go to have a picnic at Dolores! It's also cash only.  Hot Tip: Lines can get pretty long around meal times or late at night from the nearby bars and nightclubs. There's usually little to no line if you go in between meals (like 1-3pm).

I don't know if it was a fluke of a day or what, but this was one of the most disappointing taco experiences I've ever had especially for one of the most popular places in SF! All the meats we tried were dry and bland (carne asada, carnitas, al pastor) and the salsa was watery and not flavorful at all. I seriously have no good things to say about this experience except the portion size was good, but overall, I don't think I want to come back for another try.

Since I first found this place during my undergrad at Cal, I have been coming here for years. Late night post concerts or just a meal to grab with friends - it always hits different. Remember to BRING CASH!  The texture, flavors, price point...everything about El Farolito is just yummy + great memories with it too! Since the pandemic, they have created an outdoor patio seating area that is comfty and shields you from the wind outside.  I always get the Super Quesadilla with Carne Asada but finally tried the tacos today. They STACK it with so much meat and it's unbelievable how affordable the prices are too. We got 4 tacos and a super quesadilla + 2 waters for $23.  My friend and I demolished everything in 15 minutes after my 10 mile workout, but needless to say...it was YUMMY and will forever be my secret spot.

BEST MEXICAN FOOD!!! BRING CASH!  The only place where there is enough flavor that you do not need any sauce and there is a generous amount of meat + it is never dry!  Whether you are taking a friend here, on a date, want a meal after clubbing, craving Mexican food, or whatever occasion.. you will be blown away with how much and how flavorful their quesadilla suiza is. It's only about $9 and I always have to share half with someone else or eat it as another meal.  This is the only place where I don't have to really use the sauces that come with the entree because the carne Asada is already so flavorful and pungent. Everything is paired so well, and nothing overpowers anything. There is also a generous portion of meat and in general, a large meal for the price point.  During Covid, I grabbed this as takeout and went over to Mission Dolores to enjoy this yummy meal!  You can also request for spinach or whole wheat tortilla.

I came here around 7pm on a weekday and there was a bit of a wait to order with about 5-7 people ahead of me. The place takes cash only so make sure to stop by a nearby ATM before coming. It also wasn't too hard to find a table as there were 2-3 available after I placed my order. There is also an outdoor seating area in the back. I ordered the carne asada super burrito and the strawberry aqua fresca. The prices were extremely fair for being in San Francisco with the total coming out to about $14. The burrito was delicious and had all the right portions of beans, meat, avocado and rice. I ended up finishing it all with sips of my aqua fresca. The drink was also really good and refreshing with the right amount of sweetness.

Amazing Mission-style burritos in the Mission Area- great size and value, quality ingredients, and perfectly flavored. The Al Pastor Super Burrito ($8.75) is incredible - the pork is slightly sweet and studded with fresh avocado. Comes with salsa too! There's seating inside, order at the counter and they call out your number.

Pretty... pretty good. Good drinks, good service. Excellent salsa. Decent entrees.  I got the house shrimp dish by recommendation of the waiter and was not disappointed. The rice was a little spice-forward (not spicy per se, but had a distinct flavor that I wasn't a huge fan of).
Thanks for your review, Clayton! We've sent you a private message with more details.

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night. Didn't realize this place was so popular so I didn't make reservations in advance. Thankfully, the outside seating is open for walk ins so I was able to get a table without a wait. The downside is there is only 1 heat lamp for the entire outdoor patio area so be prepared and wear extra layers. I appreciate that they have complimentary chips and salsa. I got the Chile Verde for my entree and the Tropisueno margarita. I absolutely loved my entree. The pork was tender but not too fatty. The portion size was perfect. Filling but not over stuffed. My drink was great also (standard SF prices). Service was 5 stars! Our water glasses always filled. They checked in on us at the appropriate times but were never intrusive. Everyone working there was genuinely warm and friendly. The bathrooms were also clean. Just hope they buy more heat lamps for the outside because I think outdoor dining is here to stay. I'll be back again and would recommend this place to family and friends.

We had a long weekend in San Francisco and are always on the lookout for good food.  When we visit California, we are always looking for good Mexican food.  So checked Yelp and found tropisueno.   This hidden gem is exactly what we needed.  Even though it was a little chilly, we sat outside but were very comfortable.  They had heaters that kept us nice and warm.  so with Mexican restaurants I always judge it by their chips and salsa.  It's a tell tale sign of things to come.  Here at Tropisueno, they didn't disappoint.   Chips were good and they came with a variety of salsas.  Personally I liked the green salsa the most.   For our entrees we picked the Chili Verde and my wife had the Chili Relleno.  Both had incredible flavor.  My pork was cooked perfectly and the portions were huge.  My wife also like her meal.  We were stuffed walking out.  I am just glad that we had a descent walk back to our hotel.   I would return when I am back in town.

I was visiting the city for work but couldn't find a Mexican place close to my building till i find this place in google maps and surprise it's really good. Ordered a plate with enchiladas and a drink everything was enjoyable the food and the service from the girl who take the order named itxel. I'll come back again

Wow what a find! Literally the best Mexican place I've been to in the Bay Area. We went on Halloween night but they managed to sneak us in for a table at 9. Drinks- I got one of their margaritas which was very refreshing - had cucumber in it and was delicious!, my friends got margaritas / bubbly cocktails. Most of the drinks were really good except one.  Appetizers- so they serve you chips and salsa to begin with. All their salsas are delivous! My favorite was tomato and lime salsa. We also ordered plantains- now I'm generally not a fan but this was differently. They were a base layer of beans to these which changed the game for me. And Queso dip - this was okay. Regular queso with a twist Mains - we got the chicken soup and that was literally the highlight of the night. The most delicious soup I've ever had, almost like a chicken gravy My friends got enchiladas which they liked too. Overall a great place- will definitely visit again!
Thanks for the great review and photos, Shruti! We've sent a private message with more details, so please check your inbox when you get the chance!

Amazing vibes here! Their complimentary chips and salsa varieties were so good. Anyways, a friend and I met up at Tropisueno for an 8PM dinner on a Saturday. She made the reservation, and I got there a couple minutes early so I went in there first. They checked my vaccination status before allowing me in. The place was pretty full, and I can see why. Beautiful, homey decorations throughout and everyone there was so nice.  The 2 of us shared a ceviche and it was delicious. I love ceviches! The one we tried was the Ceviche de Salmón Crudo - Fresh tartare of salmon, chile de arbol, cucumber, avocado, cilantro, red onion, Fresno chile and lime. It came out so fast so we had this plus the chips and salsa to munch on before our entrees arrived. My amazing friend had a strawberry margarita (I think?) and I had the Tropisueno margarita (Canton ginger liquor, lemon, El Jimador blanco, agave. Rose infused sugar-salt rim). We enjoyed these drinks and they didn't skimp out on anything. So good.  Our entrees arrived, and we got the following -  Caldo de Mariscos - Lobster-chile broth with shrimp, calamari, sea scallops, P.E.I. mussels, tilapia. Served with a side of rice. I don't have these seafoods much when I'm at home eating with the husband and kids because the husband is allergic to shellfish, so when I'm out without him, it's seafood time! The caldo de mariscos was pretty good! The broth was flavorful, not too salty or anything. There was a decent amount of the various seafoods in there in comparison to other places. The quality was great too. Each and every piece was yum. The rice was a bit on the dry side, but it's pretty good with the broth.  Tampiqueño - Grilled 8oz chile-marinaded carne asada, served with a mixed cheese enchilada, ranchera sauce & guacamole. I think that was what my friend ordered. She said it was really good! The description sounded good and it looked really delicious. I have a feeling that if the husband and I went here, this would be a dish we'd get.  Our time at Tropisueno was really great. I'd definitely come back and try more of their yummy drinks and food!

I've been coming to Tropisueno for a while now and it's never a disappointment. Always a good vibe with great authentic Mexican food. The sauce is just right with the fish. I would recommend making an appointment because it can get busy! And being a opt of your vaccine card. Guacamole is great as well!
Thank you for your continued support, Lara! Please check your inbox for a more personal message from us from when you get a chance.

RUN here! Everything is good, plentiful and spicy. The flavors are on point and the portions are filling. We got a chicken burrito, guac and the soft shell chicken enchiladas with mole. And every last thing was amazing. It was definitely $50 very well spent and we would most definitely return
We love the photos, Shami! We've sent a message to your inbox personally thanking you for this 5-star review!

Visiting San Francisco for work, and had to grab dinner while i was out trying to buy a jacket. Lol. I'm almost certain i will eat here again before i leave.  See below for pros and cons.  Pros: --food was really good.  --chips and salsa were top notch. Chips were thin and served warm. It comes with three different salsas--all of which are very delicious.  --waitstaff was attentive and pleasant. --inside and outside seating.  --nice vibes  --drinks were AWESOME!! Cons:  --kinda hard to find. It's on a weird side street.  Note: make sure you have your ID and vaxx card. You can't get in without it.
We appreciate your review, Erin! Thank you for stopping by -- we've sent a more detailed message to your inbox!

Taqueria by day, full service Mexican restaurant by night. Tropisueno offers the best of both worlds and does it at an affordable price point. Food - This was my first time back in years and the food was better than I remember. Complimentary chips and salsa are provided (which I shouldn't have to mention but a growing number of restaurants choose not to). I ordered chicken and carnitas tacos with guac, both of which were excellent. Traditional street tacos are simple but when the meat is of this quality you don't need other toppings. Ambience - Located across the street from Yerba Buena Gardens Tropisueno a favorite amongst business professionals in FiDi. The outdoor patio, decorated with planter boxes and string lights, is a refreshing change of scenery in a concrete dominant area. Indoors has ample seating (can host up to 175 guests) and a substantial bar with a lengthy drink selection. Service - We stopped in for lunch the other day and were greeted by the hostess who was checking for proof of vaccination. Lunch is served taqueria style, so you order your food inside at the counter and they bring it to your table. The staff was friendly and very helpful when I was inquiring about the menu.
Thank you for taking the time to leave this review, Dennis! We've sent you a private message with more details. Check it out!

We ordered  chicken enchiladas, chicken tacos and 2 combo of tacos :- veg tacos and tofu tacos and a couple of guacamole. They give chips for free so guacamole and salsa was a good addition.  Chicken enchiladas- average. Considering this place is a Mexican only place I was expecting much better enchiladas. The chicken was very less and was missing it's flavors.  Chicken tacos were good. Good portion of chicken.  Veg & tofu tacos were average.. I have had much better tacos at so many other places. Prices - I found my food to be very average in taste so as per the taste I found the place expensive.  The only good thing about this place is that they checked vaccination cards of all of us and then only allowed us inside which was comforting considering I was dining with an infant.  But because of average food and high prices I will probably not come back here..!!

Great service, good drinks, and tasty food. Ordered the sopa de pollo and found it to be really well spiced along with having a good amount of chicken. Depending on where you sit you might find it a little bit cramped/loud but that is probably to be expected on a weeknight in Fidi. All things considered, great option for a post work meal and I will definitely come back to try another dish :-)

The location is great. It's in the middle of downtown SF in the Union Square area. Many transit options are available to get here: bus, cable car, metro, and of course walking. It's nestled in between skyscrapers and a neat little walkway area.  The vibes inside are great. They have some heavy cumbia music playing in the restaurant. Tons of people walking by and talking. There is a nice patio area that has strong lights. I think they give you a poncho if you sit outside with is cool. Needless to say, the ambiance is great.the bathrooms are gender inclusive and clean. The service is awesome. We got seated soon after showing the hostess our vaccination card. The servers are attentive and constantly fill your water. Our meal came out very fast! I cannot state how fast it came out. The complimentary chips might be the best part of the meal. They were amazing! However, I was not satisfied with the flavor the rice at all. It kinda smelled (and tasted) like body odor? Not sure how to explain it but I'm sure if you tried it you would understand. Perhaps it was just a bad vegetable mixed in on this day or something. I'm not particularly picky but the rice wasn't it for me. I would definitely want to know if anyone else has came here and felt the same way? They have vegetarian options for the tacos. We enjoyed our jackfruit and tofu tacos but definitely ask for no salsa or for it on the side if you don't like spicy. The default salsa is a 8.5/10 on the hot scale for me. The rice really tainted my meal and is the reason for a low rating. Other than the rice, it's a good Mexican meal. The prices are alright. For being SF, $20 can't get you a lot but it also gets you enough. Our plate had rice, beans, and 2 tacos. For a meal for two, you should expect to walk out of here for about $45. I'm putting this at a $$$ but it fits right in there with any other SF restaurant. Bottom Line/TLDR: great location but alright food

Located in the heart of downtown SF, Tropisueño is an ideal and accessible spot to meet friends for dinner or happy hour in a bustling area. I've brought many friends here over the past few years, and recently returned for the first time since the pandemic. It felt really nice to sit in a crowded restaurant again! I've always loved the ambiance inside Tropisueño- slightly noisy and dimly lit. There's also a lovely patio outside on Yerba Buena Lane.  I'm always a sucker for complimentary chips and salsa, so the fact that Tropisueño offers it keeps me coming back. There's a delicious spread of three salsas- the orange one is my favorite. Today, the chips were a little stale and a bit underwhelming, but I usually love the chips and fill up on them.  I ordered the veggie tacos. They're honestly not my favorite tacos. I prefer a chewier and warmer tortilla and more substantial filling. I think Tropisueño's strength is its entrees/plates (my friends usually order the chicken mole or the enchiladas), but there are very limited vegetarian options. I would love to have more dishes to try on the menu.  Tropisueño is one of my staples in the city and I will always come back for the ambiance and the margaritas. Highly recommend if you're looking for a fun time in an exciting area!
Thank you for your feedback, Avani. We love the photos! We've sent a message to your inbox personally thanking you for this review. Check it out!
Best Mexican food in the city!!! Try the combo plate We really liked the enchiladas & tomales
Thanks for your support, Christina!  We'd love to have you back to serve you again soon -- Salud!
Amazing service. You can even grab blankets if it's too cold outside. The food has great peloton size and the queso is so cheesy and delicious! Great for a large group

Hi Coco, Although we weren't able to send you a private message, we still wanted to take a moment to personally thank you for this 5-star review! We're glad to hear you enjoyed your visit and were a fan of our queso. We appreciate your feedback and hope we get the chance to serve you again soon! Keep in touch: Facebook @Tropisueno Instagram @tropisuenosf

If Tropisueño were an MLM, I'd be writing this from my Italian sports car en route to my all-expenses-paid trip to Cabo. I've taken countless people here since discovering this place years ago, more than half of whom have told me that they later recruited, erm, brought, others. Thankfully for everyone, Tropisueño is not an MLM but rather the best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to with consistently great food, service, ambience, and surprisingly affordable as well given the gigantic portion sizes. I came last Wednesday around 6:30pm and though it was fairly busy, I was seated immediately. This was my first time back since COVID and I'm happy to report that besides the complimentary chips being not as thin and crispy, everything else was as amazing as it's always been. As an extra COVID safety precaution, you order online via QR code and also pay online.  Every item I've tried on the menu has been a banger, but my go-to is the pollo con mole poblano, which for $18 easily can feed two with leftovers to spare. This dish is especially good and I have yet to find a place that can compare. The mole is a perfect blend of spices that makes the chicken so flavourful but not salty. The dish comes with two tortillas but they will give more if you ask at no charge.  The servers are always attentive and friendly, and out of all the times I've been the food has never taken more than 20 minutes to arrive, even on the busiest of days. They place such emphasis on exemplary service that one time I came we received a dessert on the house as an apology for the extra tortillas taking a while to arrive even though we didn't even say anything.  Their cocktails and happy hours are well known too, although I haven't had the chance to see for myself. Even without them, I can't recommend this place enough. Stop reading reviews and just come give it a try!!
Wow, thank you for this outstanding review, Elaine! We've sent a more personal message to your inbox. Take a look when you get the chance!

After a long drive from redwood national park, we were looking forward to a good meal. We made reservations through Yelp and called the restaurant for an earlier seating and they were able to accommodate us.  We tried the following food: Empanadas de hongo- mushroom empanadas - this was good. The dough is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside . One of my favorite dishes here. Tacos de Cachete- braised beef tacos - this was just ok. The beef seems to lack flavor. Tampiqueno- skirt steak - ordered it medium well but it seems slightly more to well done. It was not very tender and a little salty. This was ok.  Old school platos - ordered a chicken enchiladas and carne asada tacos - the chicken enchiladas was ok. The carne asada tacos was very juicy and delicious. This is second favorite item we had.  Restaurant has a very nice ambience and great service. The food was just average.

1000/10. Soooo good. My husband and I showed up around 5:30 on a Saturday and were seated immediately. Our waiter was so attentive and friendly - I wish we caught his name but he was the best! To start, the chips and salsas were delicious. I loved the medium and the spicy salsas the most but all three were flavorful. We also ordered the chile con queso as an appetizer and it was top notch. For entrees, my husband got the chile verde and I got the tampiqueño. Oh my God - both were amazzzzing. The meats were full of flavor and cooked to perfection - and the sides were perfect. I'm serious when I say I'd eat here everyday if I could. The cherry on top was the prices!!! Soooo worth it. He had "la muerte" to drink and I had "the tempest". Both somewhat tangy as we like and strong too hehe. We were visiting the city but if and when we come back, we will definitely eat here again!!!
Glad to hear you enjoyed your visit, Natalia! Check your inbox for a personalized thank you.
Soooooooooo goooooood!!!!!! The salsas are very tasty. Chips are very fresh. We got a steak quesadilla and it did not disappoint!
Hi Sara, We're happy to hear you enjoyed our steak quesadilla and chips with salsa! Thank you so much for your review and we hope we get to serve you again soon!

La Taqueria has been my favorite place for Carne Asada burritos for over 30 years! After moving back to San Francisco, this was top restaurant I wanted to visit for Mexican food. Parking can be challenging and it could be a few blocks away but the food well worth it.  I can totally see why they don't use Doordash because they rely on steady stream of customers that are in long lines waiting for their freshly prepared delicious food.  I love La Taqueria!

So I will say that it is good. BUT if you want to take out, don't even bother; I went for the first time last week and planned on getting 3 tacos to go in order to eat them at Mission-Dolores Park. Unfortunately, when I got to the park (which took about 15 minutes), my tacos were a big soggy mess. It was kind of like how Gordon Ramsey says it's a "wet diaper", because that's honestly what it felt like. My toppings went everywhere, my soft taco shell was WET, and I made a huge mess on my hands.  I would recommend it fresh (aka if your eating there) because the food wasn't half bad. But don't even bother trying to take-out or order to-go.

Time & Date: Sunday, Nov 28th 2021 @ 2:15pm Dining: indoor + outdoor available Vaccination: proof required to dine inside  If you've ever visited SF or live here, you've probably heard of La Taqueria... as it's one of the most popular spots in the Mission. I've been here several times before, but today was my first time visiting post-pandemic. You place your order at one of the 2 ordering stations outside, and can pick it up from the window outside. I was irked because I tried to look at the menu from the entrance but a staff member essentially kicked me out and told me I needed to show my vaccination to dine it, like I'm not even dining in I'm literally staring at the menu???  When I ordered at the window there was no menu in sight so I just ordered a basic carne asada burrito (though I was looking forward to trying something new). They didn't ask me whether I wanted a regular or super burrito so I honestly don't even know what they charged me for.  Burritos weren't as good as I remembered and were so wet that my burrito kept leaking juice & the tortilla turned soggy. I paid $32 for 2 mediocre burritos... that's just outrageously overpriced for burritos. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, it's definitely just a place popularized by the hype.

After seeing it listed on top burrito lists everywhere, I finally got an opportunity to try it out. The lines weren't too bad on a Sunday afternoon around noon. We were able to place our order quickly, get a table and then we had our order within 10 minutes or so.  The burrito was unique as it was without rice but was still with a lot of other stuffing and flavors. I would come here again but don't know if i would still call it the best burrito I ever had.

La Taqueria - San Francisco, CA When we arrived at our hotel in San Francisco, our first objective was to find somewhere to eat. We searched Yelp and based on the great reviews, we decided to give La Taqueria a try. Our Lyft arrived on time and when our driver saw where we were heading, he gave his recommendations. He stated that he eats at La Taqueria at least 2-3 times a month. He also gave us a heads up that there may be a line, the portions are huge so come here hungry, and the prices are on the higher side. We arrived and yes, there was a line from the front door to the streetlights. Most orders appeared to be take-out and we barely waited 15 minutes to place our orders. I had their Asada burrito and kept it simple...just the beef and cheese. I also had a chicken quesadilla. Again, kept it simple...just the chicken and cheese. I had both dishes dry with no sauce. Our Lyft driver was on point with the portions and price. As for taste, I had better and left satisfied only because I was no longer hungry. I don't mind a little grease coming out of my burrito or quesadilla. I just don't prefer to taste a greasy mess on every bite. I'm glad over 4,000 Yelpers gave La Taqueria an average review of 4-Stars. I'm just not one of them.

A classic, a staple, a place you must go. Lives up to the hype, not just a show. Everything is solid, made hot and fresh. Love their hot sauce, it's one of the best. Now, as a tourist or a Mission-infrequent  it's a solid bet for something tasty and piquant. But, for those lucky enough to live nearby there are SO MANY good places to try. So, while yes, this food will make you smile you pay more and wait in line a while. So start here, but then venture out immerse yourself in Mission's food clout.

I was highly recommended this place on a visit to SF and stopped in before my flight out. I went at 11 right when the restaurant opened, and there was already a line forming outside the door. We placed our order with the server at the front of the restaurant, paid with a cashier on the left and took our seats. They did check our vaccine cards, which I appreciated. We ordered vegetarian and chicken tacos and were served very quickly. These tasted very fresh and delicious, and the sauce on the table was an excellent accompaniment, with just the right amount of space. I also got a Dorado (toasted) burrito with carne asada for my plane ride home. I am sure it would've tasted better at a normal altitude and not cold, but as is it was still a great burrito. One thing I didn't realise beforehand is that the restaurant is famous for burritos without rice, which means it's pretty stuffed with fillings.

Great mission style burrito and other items, a must visit ! We're in south bay and whenever we go to SF we often visit La Taqueria for lunch. I discovered this place from Dining on a Dime. Lucas is very reliable regarding his recommendation. The food here don't disappoint.  The thing you must order is their mission style burrito. What makes a burrito mission? I think it's the all inclusive ingredients and the huge size, so of course you need to order the super size. Their meat are very fragrant and it's a combination of char crispiness and flavor from the griddle. Other ingredients work together very well, guac, beans, rice, cheese all play their parts and it's a harmony in your hand. I also recommend the quesadilla, It has that extra crispiness and oily goodness from the griddle, very satisfying but you gotta watch that calories. There're some other places also selling mission style burritos but I haven't tried them yet, but La Taqueria definitely worth 5 stars.

Where do you eat when you only have 24 hrs in San Francisco?!  La Taqueria! We are traveling with friends to Napa Valley who have never been to SF, so we wanted to give them a well-rounded dining experience. This hole-in-the-wall restaurant is known to have the best burrito in the country. There are numerous awards on their walls, but the most notable is their "James Beard Award," 2017.  We stopped by on a Saturday afternoon and expected a long line, but we placed our order and found seats within 10 minutes. PROOF OF VACCINATION is required in order to eat inside.  Our group of 4 ordered: Carnitas Burrito dorado style (crispy)  Crispy Carnitas Supreme (guacamole & sour cream) Carne Asada Burrito Crispy Lengua Supreme taco All of us loved our food. My husband loved his carnitas burrito but I think my Crispy Carnitas Supreme taco was the best. Service is outstanding! Love this place!

I mean - there's nothing else to say other than that this place is great! It's definitely busy - I came here on a weekday at like 2 in the afternoon, and there was still a line. However, it moved pretty quickly after you order.  I've heard great things about all of the burritos here, but I got the carne asada burrito, "dorado" style which means they toast the tortillas. Absolutely delicious! The meat is packed great, and all of the flavors compliment. The super burritos are also super popular here - burritos in the mission are a must have when you're visiting SF!
A great example of a mission burrito - If you don't go for the food, go for the price!  Don't forget to go "super"

3.0  *Rating based solely on FOOD*  Presentation: 3 Texture: 3 Flavor: 3 Would return? No Must-try: - Limited menu, basic (but ok, decent) food, nothing special.  - Chicken super taco: well seasoned, huge portion (although good for price). I liked that the inside tortilla was crispy and the outside was soft. The avocado lacked salt. The flavors are very mild and classic.  - Carnitas regular taco: good flavors but also  lacked salt and maybe more spices. In this one both shells were soft, which was disappointing.  - Chips, salsa, avocado: the avocado had no salt! Some salt and lemon would have made a word of a difference. The chips were good, very crispy and salty.  All in all, I wouldn't come back because the food is not rememberable... but you'll get a good plate of food.   More of my reviews at @the.food.review

The best burrito I ever had, comparable in flavor to even ones in Mexico! This taqueria and el farolito in the mission are popular for a reason, their lunch crowds getting as crazy as during the late hours now. The great thing is there is no rice so way less filler, the carne asada was so good. Very fragrant and tasty, the only bad thing is your hands smell a bit like it so you'll have to wash your hands after. The meat is seriously amazing, even the plain chicken with no other toppings my gf had was delicious. Parking can be a bit difficult but hunt around mission and you'll get a spot eventually. Don't bother looking on Valencia, that's the more cool area with more popular lunch and shopping and parking is even crazier there.

Having read SF Chronicle's Soleil Ho's article on Top Burritos in the Bay Area, I made it my goal to try the burritos at the 11 restaurants on the list. Having tried the other institution on the next block recently, this visit to the area took me to La Taqueria, the other institution in the area that has been around since 1973. You download the menu with the QR code posted on their window. Then you place your order at a window on the right and take your ticket to a window on the left to pay. You can dine-in, but I picked up my order to go from the window after my number was called. What I wanted to try was their Dorado style burrito, where the burrito is grilled on the flattop so that the exterior is flaky, crispy and golden. Ordered a regular carne asada with pinto beans and a carnitas with pinto beans. Their burritos don't have any rice in them, just meat, beans and pico de gallo. There was a lot of meat in the burritos and I enjoyed the carne asada more due to flavorful and moist grilled beef, which you can see being grilled up through the window.  I loved it Dorado style, since the grilling of the burrito creates a shell-like texture of the tortilla allowing the burrito to hold together better. I really enjoyed the carne asada Dorado burrito. It was delish! Now on to the next burrito on the list.

I don't know what all the hype is about and the long lines, I've been told this is a must when looking for a taqueria in the City, I got a regular burrito, it wasn't hot it was close to cold to the touch from all the pico de gallo in there which was all one end and all the beans were sitting on the other end, the meat tasted all right and it was chewy, My wife got two tacos carnitas, again, to much pico de gallo, they felt cold to the touch, and the tortillas were soggy from all the pico de gallo, and the carnitas very dry, I'm completely dumbfounded as to why there is always long lines, definitely not worth the wait.

Two words.... Dorado Style! I highly recommend  getting your burrito dorado style because it is what makes La Taqueria's good and one of the best burrito's I have ever had. I have been to La Taqueria several times... during the pandemic and most recently two weeks ago. They currently have indoor seating again and still a line however, the line efficiently moves quickly. And every visit the food never disappointments me, and I have no regrets driving to the city for some good burritos! Parking is a little bit of a challenge because La Taqueria is located in the mission and only have street parking available. But again totally worth it. Just a friendly reminder.... DORADO STYLE!

BEST BURRITO in the US, 2014 and 2018, and always in the Top 5. James Beard "American Classic" and Michelin Guide recommended. La Taqueria is the clear must-try when there are articles with titles like "Best SF Burrito that is NOT La Taqueria". SF has as spirited debates and opinions about the Best SF Burrito as Chicago and NY have about Pizza. This is historically accurate since one street in San Francisco is credited with creating the "Mission Burrito".  It's a giant burrito wrapped in tinfoil that seems so commonplace now even Chipotle serves their burritos mission style. It's great being able to go to Mission Street and easily find 3-5 of the top 10 Burritos in the US. Because of this you'll have people telling you about El Farolita, Taq. Cancun, etc..but you must come to La Taqueria. The carne asada and carnitas are astounding, the Mexican Food Gospel plays in your head and its normal to look around and see people with their eyes closed and chewing slowly with contemplative looks on their face pondering "why is it so good". Yes getting it "Dorado" style makes it excellent but if you are in a rush the regular Burrito is still super tasty, the secrets are their fresh salsa, tenderly cooked beans, excellent meat, and no-rice. The lines are long during lunch times and parking is rough. The charm used to be it was for late-night snacks for bar-hoppers. Even with the fame nothing changes the origin story of hard-working people creating affordable world-class level Mexican food.

Tried this place for the first time and it did not disappoint! I loved the horchata the most followed by the carne asada quesadilla. Everything was super filling and delicious. I'd come back here again but probably order less because we got wayyy to much food

When it comes to taquerias in SF, the one that gets mentioned the most is easily La Taqueria, and for years I never understood why. I always thought the food was just alright but after trying a super burrito, DORADO Style, my mind has been changed. It's not listed on the menu anywhere, and all you have to do is ask for it when ordering. Dorado style is where they give your tortillas sometime on the grill and what it does it that it adds a level of crunch and crispness.  For me, I like crispy and crunchy foods, so it takes it to another level. If you aren't getting dorado style, you are missing out!  The flavors of the guacamole and pico de Gallo is super fresh. I got carne asada and I thought it was alright, i thought the meat was kinda dry and chewy, so I think I'd go carnitas next time around. Their green salsa is spicy and delicious, I have to put it on every bite. They don't put rice in the burrito, so I feel less full than I normally would for paying $14 for a super burrito, but overall still tasty.

This is hot off the press. I swear I just inhaled my burrito. Now I see why people line up at this place before opening. I've never thoroughly enjoyed a burrito as much as I enjoyed this burrito. I chose to get the Carnitas super Burrito El Dorado style. Every bite was packed with flavor and you can taste the freshness of the ingredients. My new favorite place to get a burrito. I'm definitely coming back.

Let me tell ya, Taco Tuesdays are hustling and bustling! Rolled in here around 7pm and this place was pretty packed. It's a toss up if you'll be able to get a spot but take your chances. While you wait, you can grab a drink by the bar.  I got really lucky and found parking across the street so if you're driving in, just circle around and you'll find something! On to the food- I got the chicken taco special which was 2 for $8- honestly this was a steal! My friends ordered the Nick's Special for their tacos. They really enjoyed it and its just a $1.25 extra. Meanwhile we also split massive quesadillas which were only $4 per order?! It can't get any better than that.  We had an amazing server who was so kind and even got my girlfriend some complimentary birthday churros and a shoutout from the DJ. This place has great service on lock!

I've had this restaurant saved for like a year and finally made it out there on halloween night. Me and my girls were all dressed up and being ridiculous and they could not have provided us better service. Right off the bat, they brought us a bowl of candy in a chip tray. So cute. Our server was a literal angel. We ordered the guac to start and I left to use the restroom and by the time I was back my girls had demolished it. Needless to say it was amazing. They gave us so many salsa options. They accommodated to my friends picky order so kind. She doesn't like beans or cilantro and they were so nice about it. They all got some sort of burrito, but I decided I needed to try the nick's crispy taco. HOLY MOLY! I got them with chicken! They were so so so delicious and filling.  When we arrived it looked like the bar was closed, but they said we could still get margaritas. So of course we did and they were delicious. I can't remember the flavor options exactly, since they clearly did the job hehe.  One of my friends forgot her leftovers inside and one of the angels who works their literally ran across the street to give it to her. So impressive. The definition of above and beyond.

It's aight. Nothing fancy and nothing special.  Sloppy tacos, not really easy to eat. Very greasy. The chef needs to slow down the packaging process or they need a new way of giving customers their food Togo because I got my taco and the insides were everywhere when I opened the box.  Also was expecting the steak taco  to be great but it was mostly salad.

This place is spacious enough, with a fun vibe/atmosphere and some quite delicious tacos. At first glance, the tacos seem a bit pricey, but they are at least twice as big as an "average" taco (and quite delicious), so still probably worth it.  My only complaint would be about the music... in mid-afternoon they had the music (hip-hop from the past 20 years or so, which we usually enjoy) CRANKED to unreasonable levels. It wasn't a dance club -- not even any space for dancing -- so we didn't understand that, and it made it impossible to talk or chill there (we ended up going outside to eat and finish our drinks.) The only time music should be pumping that hard is at a dance club.

Decided to finally try this restaurant out with the hubby. Tacos are a bit larger than your average and the restaurant feels like an art decco club like atmosphere with velvet lounge chairs. The tacos come wrapped with a cruchy taco shell with a soft taco wrapped around. You can have the tacos "Nick Style" with extra guacamole. Meat wasn't as flavorful as I would like, but nonetheless a good taco place. **PROs: -Fish tacos are great and filling -Guacamole add on -Street tacos available 3 for $9 -Street Parking available, free after 6PM **CONs: -Slightly outdated furnishings -Some meat choices a little bland without the salsa

Mexican food in a sports bar in the middle of SF is a weird concept, but Nick's makes it work. If you are stumped by their vast menu, I'll make it easy - elote, carnitas &/or fried fish tacos Nick's way & agua fresca (guava & pineapple if they have it). If you only get one taco, get the fried fish. Ordering is pretty easy - walk up system, you get a number & find a seat. There's indoor and outdoor seating.

This location felt so familiar...as I sat and enjoyed the ambiance, the huge crystal chandeliers and ofc Tuesday night tacos while placed on the stage with 10 other amazing people celebrating our transitions into new career paths...I was like HOLD UP A MINUTE!!! I'm in Johnny Love's Bar where I danced on the same stage that I was now celebrating professional accomplishments on. Memories, oh how they flooded in. I never did experience this venue in the light. Haha;p Nick's Crispy Tacos were amazing. The staff is quick, knowledgeable and efficient. Pitcher of Margaritas for $20. Yes please! Two tacos for $8...ummm uhhhh yeah! And willing to split checks without issue. Just let your server know at time of order! And ask to sit in J's section. She is hella cool! New memories with nostalgia creates for a good time!!!!

Wow. Let me begin by saying that I am Latina and was invited here by a white friend. I was not expecting much due to the name, but didn't have time to research a different place for us, so I ventured to Polk Street and I am so glad that I did. Nick's Crispy Tacos are amazing!  Parking is pretty tough on Polk Street. I skipped the struggle and parked for free about 3-4 blocks away on Green Street. I came in on a Tuesday and was asked where I wanted to sit. I chose outside and they had great reggaeton playing, quietly enough so I could talk but loudly enough that I could listen. I got a tequila shot (pretty cheap, friendly bartender) and went to look at the menu. You'll have to flag a server down, or you can order inside. They are busy but the service was awesome! They have a great 2 for $8 Taco Tuesday deal, so I went with the vegetarian tacos. The tacos came out quickly, were HUGE but didn't fall apart, and had an amazing taste and crunch.  Two tacos filled me up even more than a burrito and I had to take some to go (which ended up also being so good a few hours later. The melted cheese was delicious). I can't wait to come back to Nick's for the service, ambience, and the amazing and affordable tacos.

Grabbed a quick snack with the $8 street tacos deal; the tacos were disappointing, cold, and did not taste fresh at all. Perhaps because it was a deal and not their main dishes, but I was disappointed. I did like the green sauce though. Nachos dish was also large, good for sharing. Outdoor seating was fine, however it isn't cleaned too frequently and dishes are left out.

The place was not what I expected when I arrived. It was empty on a weekday night. The decor was all bright pink and black and looked more like a bar than a restaurant. There was only 1 staff member at the bar, which is where we ordered our food. It took them about 20 minutes or more to make our tacos. We ordered 2 carne asada tacos, 1 pollo taco, and 2 pescado Nick's way tacos togo. The Nick's way is a must! The crispy shell is really good. I wish I got all of my tacos Nick's way. They are also very generous with the guacamole. The other tacos were all pretty average and plain. If it weren't for Nick's way on the pescado tacos, I think those would have been pretty average too. However, I did not think that the pescado Nick's way tacos were worth $7.50 each taco.
35-45  mins
1 free Chips and Salsa with Purchase

A small group of us stopped by Nick's Crispy Tacos for our tummies before our class. Peter, the owner was very welcoming. He guided us to a table immediately upon arrival. Chips and salsa were brought to our table shortly after. I couldn't feel the warmth on the chips but my coworker said that they were warm. It was a good sign to us that the diced tomatoes in the salsa were fresh.  We ordered different items to try including the nachos but I didn't take a photo of it. (It was not as photogenic as the rest of the food. Sorry!) The serving size for tacos were definitely generous. I meant, they were huge!! Another coworker of mine enjoyed the crispy shell / Nick's style. Again, the ingredients were all fresh. If the flavors could be more significant, our taste bubs would be instantly elevated to the next level. Hopefully it will happen when we revisit in the near future.

We stopped by here on a Friday night, without fully realizing it was a sports bar (that's on us). The ambience is pretty rowdy, with music blaring, but it was still nice! On Fridays, they have a really nice 2 for 8 deal where you can get 2 tacos/nachos/chips and salsa for 8 bucks. This might seem a little expensive, but the portions are huge; two tacos would normally be enough to fill me. Each taco came with a heaping amount of fresh salsa which was delicious, and they also had a green sauce that was amazing.  The carnitas and the carne asada were both pretty dry, but were seasoned well. The pollo asado was my favorite; it had a really nice tang and the meat was super juicy. The pescado was also quite good; I feel like they do give a little too much of the cabbage slaw, so there were a few bites where I mostly got cabbage.  The highlight for me was definitely the nachos; maybe I was just super hungry, but the guacamole and the nacho cheese combo was amazing. The chips were super crispy and carried the sauces super well.  One call, they really need to get more waiters. We waited for 15 minutes to get served, and overall it just seemed super disorganized.

Nick's Crispy Taco's is a lively funky social hotspot with a warm welcoming environment.  Offerings include affordable weekly specials, discounted drinks and solid cheap eats for their signature tacos and a promising menu.  Decor is disco club penthouse vibe with mirrored walls, red velvet upholstery and a massive hanging crystal chandelier with side plush banquet booths, mid room tables with bar stools on a sprawling dance floor and multiple televisions abound as background viewing.  Festive music.  Low lighting made viewing menu difficult.  Tables are spaced generously apart.  Simple no frills dining fare dishing out Mexican comfort favorites.  Suitable for all ages as this is an unconventional blend of casual, friendly atmosphere amid the chic chandeliered decor makes this spot welcoming to all.   1) Chips snd Salsa w/guacamole (Fantastic).  Generous portions of medium thick house-made lightly salted chips smothered in their in-house fresh salsa was spectacular - I could eat this all day.  A pair well made.   Our tacos arrived soon after in their respective paper lined plastic baskets.  Three per order. My sibling ordered carnitas and he loves his moist meat, chips, guacamole, chopped tomatoes and tacos.  Enough said.   2) Carne Asada (Tasty).  Simple item on menu.  Cilantro, corn tortilla, chopped crunchy onions.  Alone, carne asada was under seasoned and dry but livens up when doused with their in-house taco condiment sauce, spoonfuls of Nick's salsa and a wedge of lime are unbeatable and becomes quite delicious.   3) Agua Fresca (Strawberry).  Icy cold and refreshing but quite sweet.  Not a "cool water" for a tasteful drink on a wonderful evening.  4) Cinnamon Churros (Yummy).  Cinnamon-sugar dusted fried dough.  Crispy exterior, chewy soft center.  Fluffy like a delicious donut and at their prime when freshly made.  No other accompaniment served along side these churros.   Affordable tasty eats.  Attentive courteous service staff.  Expanded menu with longer opening hours.  Delivery, pick-up and take-always are available.  Dining-in is optional.

I believe the hype now. I've been hearing about Nick's Crispy Tacos from just about everyone and finally got to check it out. The unique red interior was exactly like the photos and the tacos were outta this world. I came here on a Monday evening and caught some Monday night football with a friend. There are plenty of TV's and seats inside this fine establishment - (read: great for watching sports).  For food, I opted for the CRISPY FISH TACO (must-try) and a regular fish taco (very good as well!). Of course I got "Nick's Way" on all of my tacos and boy was is good. Like the name implies, these tacos were definitely crispy! Honest opinion? I can't wait to come back. I also saw the muni line can easily take me from my house in Cow Hollow straight here. If you're on the fence about checking out this spot...wait no further.

Great prices, good food and fun atmosphere! Got there around 6:30PM on a Friday night and we were sat at one of the red booths (which I think are the best tables in the house). The staff is super friendly and attentive. Love that they have TV's so you can watch live games. Will definitely come back!

Nick's Crispy Taco's is a fun restaurant to eat with friends. There's a DJ so it does get quite loud. It has a bit of a club atmosphere. They also have TVs if you want to watch sports. I intitially thought that they tacos were pricey but was surprised by how huge they were! I made the mistake of over indulging on the free chips so I was a little full when my two tacos arrived. I got my tacos Nick's way which was crispy shell with cheese, guacamole and a soft tortilla wrapped around. I liked that they were already folded which made it easier to eat. They were so stuffed with meat and toppings. Sadly, I couldn't finish my food.

These tacos were delicious! Glad I came on Yelp and saw many encouragements to get them the Nicks way. I ended up getting the fried chicken taco the NIcks way and it was delicious! Fried chicken fried to perfection and perfectly crispy. Aso got a free order of nachos for checking in on Yelp and they were surprisingly delicious! Come with pick de Gallo all on them and multiple sauces on the side. They do it right. Also tried their house margarita which was really good! Street tacos are also delicious. Got the carne asada and pollo asado and both were great!
literally garbage Literally like one bartender get fucking good like do you even know how to run a bar Clearly not don't ever go hete

Not sure how I never knew about this place, but now that I know I'm going to have to spread the word and visit more. One of my buddies put me on this place and said that the Nick's Way Fish Tacos were some of the best fish tacos he's had, and he was not lying!  The Nick's Way comes with some guacamole and cheese on the tacos, and I highly recommend getting the fried fish--especially if it's your first time.  We also ordered guacamole and chips and this was some of the best tasting guacamole that I have ever had. I was really impressed. They have outdoor dining and also quite a few tables for indoor dining as well.  If you haven't tried this spot, I highly recommend giving it a try. Next time I may try the Quesadilla and try the shrimp tacos Nick's Way.

Great service , great food, good vibes and a lot of TVs!  The ambiance is old playboy meets dollhouse mansion.  The tacos are great; if you like fish- get them! The fried chicken taco was a little dry, but still good. You'll get 4 complementary salsas with your tacos as well. Of note: the chips and guacamole is very generous on the guac side - so I'd you're not in the mood for tacos but want to much on something - get those. Cheers
35-45  mins
1 free Chips and Salsa with Purchase

I'm not even vegan and I loved this place. We came here for my friend's birthday as she is gluten and dairy intolerant. Two of us have zero food allergies and loved it here.  Their cocktails are amazing - obviously recommend the marg. Personally, I'm a skinny spicy marg kinda girl and the 3 I had here had me feeling juuust fine. I think my friend had something hibiscus and she threw a few back so musta been good.  I think I had fake meat tacos and they were bomb. Vegan or not, definitely bomb Mexican cuisine.  My only complaint: Kind of silly that they charge for chips and salsa. I think that's highway robbery at a Mexican spot, but what do I know.

I had to stop by here seeing how good the reviews. Who can turn down good Mexican Vegan food.  Make sure you bring a copy of your vaccination card as they do check it upon arrival.  There is dimmed lighting inside the restaurant with nice decor. I was really excited to see this restaurant in San Francisco as the Gracias Madre in West Hollywood was great!  Normally like other Mexican restaurants I was expecting them to give us chips to start off with as there was salsa already on our table. No chips were served to us as our starter.  We ordered the gorditas and nachos to share. There was nothing too special about the gordita and the chips inside the nachos were hard to bite into and not at all appetizing. There was no magic to the food, it felt like we were being served at a fast food joint. The menu and service was very much different from the Los Angeles location. Everything was fast and there was nothing upscale about this restaurant.  We decided to give our last try by ordering the Bowl Uno which was also gross, there was hardly any rice and there was more jackfruit if anything - worse than Chipotle.  Overpriced for the food that is served, not worth it! We ended up paying a large amount for fast food. Stale food, bad chips, food no where close to good.

It was awhile since I was last here as usually frequent some of the taquerias in the Mission for a veggie burrito. I felt why not visit Gracias Madre again since they are all vegan and love supporting all vegan places. I went here for dinner recently with my friend. I was amped to try the chimichangas yet found out they are only available for brunch. That sucks. I opted for a burrito. I got it with vegan sour cream and guac. They forgot the vegan sour cream and guac yet gave it to me on the side. I felt the burrito could have been better. Perhaps more veggies. I know other taquerias in the Mission that are more affordable, more filling, and come with a better selection of veggies in the burrito that make a better option than having a burrito here. The main reason for three stars is our server was rude. She was hesitant to give me and my friend separate bills. Our server said she had to ask the manager. This wasn't a big request and our bill was split yet didn't understand the problem. Also didn't appreciate her being unfriendly. We had a reservation and enjoyed the ambience yet the service sucked.  Hope to go here again for brunch at some point to try the chimichangas and hope the service improves next time as would love to review it here again giving them a higher rating yet overall was an underwhelming experience.

The Mission is known for great authentic Mexican food and love that Gracias Madre is an all vegan restaurant doing great authentic Mexican food. The atmosphere is quite simple and nice. Sit outdoors on a nice day. Friendly and efficient service. Great place for families and for a date. Dinner menu is a bit more expensive yet very reasonable still. Happy Hour is from 3pm to 6pm. I tried two items from Happy Hour and loved them both. I'll be sure to be back during my next visit to San Francisco!

I went to Gracias Madre for the very first time and was pleasantly surprised. This place is decorated so well and is tucked away in right on Mission.  Food: So the reason why I took a star away (which frankly may not be super warranted) is because I actually didn't know this place was vegan at all. I admittedly didn't look deep into the Yelp page but I only found out information that this place is vegan after looking deeper into the page. Anyways, the food was actually delicious. The pozole was pretty Dang good even without the meat. I got a side of the jackfruit carnitas, and while it was not actual meat, there was tons of flavor.
