The only thing wish could be better was the bread- the inside was too bland, not the typical hero bread I usually eat. Otherwise this is great place for a quick bite.

One of the best taco joints in the city. The best fish tacos I've ever had! The crispy and tasty texture with the aioli. The break-room fries are a must if it's your first time here. Honestly I wish I opted for the taco trio because amazing. Also the heavy hitter in the room is the lemonades. Just go ahead and get the large. I got the passionfruit lemonade and it was the perfect mixture--not to sweet. I'm definitely going back here for sure.

Great "bar" food place. This place offers hispanic food such as tacos or quesadias with your choice of meat as well as burgers amongst other variety of similar style foods.  I would give 5 stars if everything was perfect, the only item that wasn't that good was bacon wrapped hotdog. It was as advertised, but I think a thicker/juicier hotdog similar to Sam's Club would taste better. This one was dried out and didn't yield much flavor to the dish. This is the only bad experience of the place!  As for the good, that covers the costumer service, food, and inside. The person at the register was very helpful in explaining different food and even provided to bring food out to us. There was seating outside and inside (which is small, but give the ability to look outside).  The tacos and burgers were amazing, they weren't greasy, but are messy to eat. Lastly, the variety of hot sauces for the spiciness fan is quite large in comparison to other places. I think I counted around 7 or 9 different sauces. (Try the garlic one!)
was okay but nothing too memorable

Breakroom is a neat little spot in Chinatown for fresh tacos. Expect their service to be iffy, but they make good on their 3 mix-and-match Taco Platter. Most popular is the Tempura Fish. Batter is nice and crispy, though the fried fish can feel a bit heavy and even bland. I'm an avid fish 'n chips fan, and prefer more zing from tartar or malt vinegar. At Breakroom, I just end up being very liberal with their lineup of hot sauces instead! Grilled Steak taco is nicely charred, but also straightforward. It comes topped with only pico de gallo. Good taco, but not astounding. Cheesesteak is another popular ooey cheesy one, and Pork Belly was highly lauded by my friends for its crispy bits, so I'll have to try that next time. I also enjoy the Breakroom Fries, a combo of fries and tater tots loaded with some good and deadly stuff. Cheesy, carby, bacony fun to devour. Mint Lemonade is refreshing, sweet, and full of minty goodness. It pairs well with my (self-induced) spicy tacos. Lesson learned, be careful of all the hot sauces lined against the wall. They'll draw you in, then turn around and burn you!

Really solid tacos! I got the break room fries and a fish taco. I have been going to this place for years but not often, to be honest the prices are wayyy too high. $10 for fries and $4 per taco. It's a good place to eat just not very often and a treat yourself moment.
Website and Yelp said they were open until midnight.  Walked almost 3/4 mile and arrived at 8:45pm only to be told they were closed.  Who closes at 8:30 on a Saturday night in NYC?

Finally able to get here. I had the 3 tacos platter. Very good tacos. Fish taco  Cheesesteak taco (melted cheese and sauce) Fried prom belly taco (great crunch) They had a bunch of hot sauces as well. I will try their burgers next time.

I've been eating from break room for a while ... at this point this review is way over due .. a co-worker  referred me this place she said " the tacos are ridiculously good " and even that wasn't the best way to describe tune tacos ..  I only have the fish tempura tacos and they are extremely light and flavorful,  not grease at all , no over kill on the special sauce they use either .. most definitely hits the spot each time  the fries are good as well .  This place is usually crowded so i advise you call ahead , when they are operating  during regular business hrs , i placed a online order it only took approximately 35 mins for  the food to be ready  . The staff are super friendly as well . GOT MY VOTE AGAIN AND AGAIN

Always wanted to try Breakroom since I've heard about it so often, so I decided to pop in and pick up the Breakroom fries. I wasn't able to compare an experience to anything since I've never had it, but the fries were severely underwhelming. It boasts pork belly and bacon, and when you hear pork belly, you think tender, fatty, tasty. But the pork belly I got looked like it was double fried and re-fried, and it was crispier than some of the bacon itself, on top of it being super dry. It did lack taste, in which the cheese and spicy Mayo (I think?) made up for.  The fries itself were also quite crispy. The only thing that was decent were the tater tots it came with, since those weren't actually over-cooked. On the other end of the spectrum, the sunny side egg was under-cooked, with egg whites still running.  At this time, I'm giving it 3 stars since I wasn't able to try out the full menu yet, since I know they're more known for their tacos, so I hope to return and try those out and hope for a better experience.   This review was based solely on the fries, which I hoped would be better :/

The tempura tacos here are outstandingly tasty, and the fries are famously good.  Do yourself a favor and get the pork belly while you're at Breakroom -- you can thank me later. (And believe me -- you will.) Our entire meal was really good and came quickly after we'd ordered. The entire staff was really nice. (I can see why this place has a cult following of sorts!)

I came here with two of my friends after a long day. The food was really good and I think it's pretty cheap compared to other places in manhattan. I got the three taco platter and I chose the carnitas, fried pork belly, and chipotle chicken. The tacos were amazing. It wasn't too much or too little so when you ate it it wasn't messy and just the right amount of food in your mouth. They were pretty juicy too. I also got the chili cheese fries and that was bomb as well. The fries were crispy and it had a lot of flavor. My friends got the burger and they said that it was good as well.  I recommend getting the three taco platter since two tacos was enough to make me full. They also had outdoor dining but it's pretty small so I sat inside with my friends where it was a three seater.

This is the perfect late night bite and/or burger taco joint on a budget for NYC prices. The flavor is packed and stacked high in the break room burger and you can't go wrong with the tacos as well. We got the fish tacos and it was light and fresh. The Chipotle chicken taco is also great. The burger is definitely the highlight and the combination of the onion ring, egg, and juicy burger definitely hits the spot

Breakroom is the perfect joint in Chinatown for late night munchies.   + Breakroom Fries: a pure work of genius- loaded tater tots and fries with cheese, pork, fried egg, bacon, and green onions.  You can thank me later ;) + Breakroom Burger: beef patty with pork belly, fried onion rings, a runny egg, jalapeños, and all your traditional burger fixings.  It will get soggy in the take out bag and it will be a mess to eat, but you'll scarf it down anyway.  How could you resist that fatty goodness?

The young worker today at 7pm did not greet me Or my party when we walked in.  when I asked him about dine in or take out he didn't give me a response or make anyone feel welcome. Suggested we dine in but didn't offer a menu or anything , lead us to sit.  Then juicewrld was playing... while I'm a fan it was specifically songs about overdosing which I don't feel is appropriate music as it can trigger people to loved ones who've passed away. "All my friends are gonna die young" , to which he also didn't say anything. I then walked out because I was now having a negative experience

It's a little bit difficult to locate and with all the other restaurants around it you might get distracted, but because I was craving tacos. Tacos it was. The tacos are very tasty also depending on what kind of meat you get. We got 2 Taco platters, so got to try out 6 tacos.  The fish taco, the spicy pork were my 2 favorites.  -1* because the guac that came with the chips and guac wasn't really guac.

My friend Jordan and I both were FAMISHED by the time we came crawling to the entrance of Breakroom. It was time for a break, indeed!! I went for the chopt cheese sandwich and he went for the chicken sandwich. I can't speak for his sandwich since I haven't had a bite, in respect to COVID-19 and respectful hygiene, but I will say his sandwich didn't look too shabby. As for my chop cheese, well, you already know how it goes - it was MIGHTY FINE!!! Portions were substantial and I appreciate the diversity of hot sauces they had to offer. It's not too different from the lineup of hot sauces Hot Ones on youtube likes to offer, only in that their options are limited to 4 and don't have you crying for milk by the end of your meal. The only thing I would like to see in the future is the QR code at the door for access to a virtual menu and possibly the option of a sandwich + drink as a combo as you would see in a fast food chain. Alas, I realize this is a mom and pop shop and so perhaps what I'm asking for is merely a pipe's dream and probably won't materialize as it is more expensive to run an individual business. Thank you Breakroom for a delicious meal!! My friend is Southern and if you've impressed him, there's something to be said!! We will be back for sure.

Those nachos were worth trip alone!  Carne Asada Quesadilla was full of flavor and fresh.  Elotes are offered on the cob or off which is great when you want to share or keep your hands clean.  Next time I'm in the city I'm going back. It's just too tasty! And this is coming from a picky eater/non-foodie.

Rosa Mexicano is a massive restaurant that may be too loud for some, perfect for others. One of the challenges is to secure the waiter's/waitress's atrention, but once you do the service is good.  We thought the shrimp tacos were well made but $10 for two tacos was a little expensive, considering the tacos weren't out of the ordinary. Our entree was the pollo adobado al carbón with carne asada, which comes with Chihuahua cheese. The cheese is fantastic, and the sauces that come along help make the meats moist. It is a bit of a costly dish too, considering the relatively small portion, but we were relatively content.

Came in for a quick happy hour drink before meeting up with some friends. I was interested in the mini frozen margaritas they had for $7 (though to get a large for $12 is it really a deal), and they had a bunch of fun flavors to try out. I went with a blood orange and then got a mango after. The blood orange frozen margarita was so insanely tart but still tasty, maybe mellow that out? If it was just a little less tart (like I'm not making a face when I taste it) it would have been amazing. The mango frozen margarita was great! Highly suggest ordering this flavor if you like mango. Not too sweet.  Took off another star for the fruit flies this place has by the bar. For some reason someone on the decorating team thought it would be a good idea to have random fruit/veggies in a bowl they don't use on the bar. I actually had to ask the bartender to move the bowl near me to get the bugs away.

Went here expecting a nice cold marg but their beautiful bar from outside fooled me because they don't have their liquor license yet. Gorgeous interior and kind staff, it's definitely a very popular spot. The guac was kind of bland, though nice that it was made fresh in front of us. The quesadilla was nothing special and other Mexican places definitely make a better, more impressive ones.

We came here on a Saturday afternoon for a break after a long day. We sat down and waited and waited for someone to come over. The restaurant wasn't busy but we sat for awhile waiting for our food and drinks to come. We had ordered multiple rounds of drinks and food but, the waiter was no where to be found at times. He did appear quickly when we paid and collected the check without even clearing out the table. We ordered every single taco off the menu and we found the shrimp taco to be our favorite. Its a little spicy but, super delicious. My friend loved the margaritas and wants to come back to get more. The place has decent food but, mediocre service.

I been to this location a few times in the last few years including, their other location near Lincoln Center. We came here recently for brunch with some friends. RM has a decent brunch deal. They have a handful of brunch dishes and $20 unlimited drink deal with a purchase of an entree.  I ordered churros french toast ($11) and thought it was tasty. My friends thought it was too sweet but, I thought it was fine. The only thing I would change would be the "syrup". It was a berry honey infusion. Personally, I would have a dulce de leche sauce or caramel instead. I also wish that they included more fruit on top of the french toast because I was still a bit peckish after consuming. My dining partners got sopes benedict ($13), torta de desayuno ($13) and huevos rosa ($13.50).  Everyone enjoyed their dish and thought they were delicious I wish the brunch menu had more items including more vegetarian dishes. I did enjoy eating here as their brunch menu was more affordable than their normal menu which can be costly. The service was okay and our server rarely stopped and a few times we sat there waiting for more water.  This restaurant does charge a 3% COVID recovery fee on each check. They do offer free chips and salsa along with a fan favorite skillet of cornbread.

I really love it here. The ambiance is gorgeous.. perfect for a casual lunch OR if you wanna dress up for a fun birthday celebration. The booths and huge and beautiful and I've been 4 times now and the food has been consistently good (as well as the drinks) I feel relaxed and warm here in a weird cozy way. Does this make sense? No complaints. Great service. All the right stuff here.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch. Waiter serviced our table very well, food was great, drinks were great! We had the tacos de heuvos and churros trench toast. The latter was definitely a huge dessert and the tacos was amazing. They have $20 bottomless brunch and a wide selection of flavored drinks. Frozen mango margarita was our favorite!

One of my new favorite spots for bottomless brunch! For under $40, you can get a delicious meal and unlimited frozen margaritas, sangrias, and bloody marys.  I ordered the churro French toast which has a crispy cinnamon outer coating which a light and fluffy interior. With it, I ordered a pomegranate frozen margarita, strawberry frozen margarita, and white sangria. All were delicious!

I've been to Rosa's a few times but not since the pandemic. I was excited to see how things changed since. The food is still as amazing. The service has gotten better but could be better. I came mid-day and we were a party of two. We ordered a coco mojito and a Margarita. We got guac for the table. It was absolutely delicious. We also ordered two sets of falutas. Also a order of octopus tacos.  The drinks were both really good. The Margarita was frozen. It was delicious and really cold. My sisters cocomojito was really good as well. The guacamole and chips are a MUST. The salsa they give with the complimentary chips are also really good.  The flautas are really good. We got them stuffed with chicken. They are covered in different sauces which some are more spicy than others. Theres a green sauce. A white sauce and a mole sauce. They were SO good. Lastly the octopus taco. I didnt care for it. It was sort of dry. It needed something creamy. The grill marks from the octopus came be overpowering and need some acid, something.  I cant wait to come back. I want to try more items on the menu.

Best part of this upscale Mexican cuisine establishment is the atmosphere, almost chic.  Our group had variety of drinks, most enjoyed options of creative margaritas.  The choice of apps & entrees were OK - but not aspiring or memorable, ...kinda average
50-60  mins

First dinning experience post vaccine mandate and it was successful. Walked into Rosa and they requested our vaccine proof..2 of us were vaccinated and 2 of us werent so we sat outside...(we had no issue with that because outside is a vibe) sidewalk seating had  tables with bright red chairs and great service our waiter Benjamin was funny, made recommendations and was attentive. We had chips with salsa, a order of guacamole and happy hour margaritas. The flavors were great mango, strawberry and pomegranate. They were so good we ordered full size (well we had to it was already 615..lol..happy hour is from 3 to 6).  Ok so now the real reason im reviewing, we came to participate for resturant week but started the party early. Rosa's menu was well balanced with  food choice so we decided to try a bit of everything. Our starters were good, shrimp cocktail in a citrus sauce with avocado, tomato and cucumbers. The relleno was good also. The suef and turf was delicious however my rice was a bit grainy. The shrimp and steak were prefectly cooked. The grilled portobello with impossible chorizo was a hit as well. For dessert we tried the banana pie and the guacamole sundae...both got devoured b4 i could capture a picture. Overall we had a great time, its lively, festive and eating outside gave us the room to be loud and enjoy.

Been to this location several times pre and post pandemic. Food and service is good. Best to make reservations in advance if possible especially during prime dining hours...  During pandemic dining, one member in the party to leave their contact info in case there was need of contact tracking, scan bar code for the menu. Once the city went back to full capacity, servers provide the menus once again. Beverages: Wine, sangria, margaritas, non-alcoholic beverages...you decide. Food to share: Guacamole (pick your level of spicy), chips and salsa Pulpo Cerviche - grilled octopus  Camarones - a bit too spicy for me Grilled skirt steak tacos - a bit spicy for me Pan-seared cod - delicious and highly recommend Dessert: Tres Leches - muy delicioso and highly recommend Churros - they are small and come with raspberry and chocolate dipping sauces - was ok

Another hit! the stars was all about the food. I ordered ceviche and a shrimp & rice dish. My apologies for forgetting the correct name however, I was very happy. The service was ok. I sat outside and it was a little too much going on for me with lots of pedestrian traffic, car honking, dogs barking and the hard smell of marijuana floating across my nostrils every 5 minutes. I got high off contact a little bit. But back to the food... it was really good.

Long overdue update. This is a reliable place and they always deliver on drinks, food, and service. They are also great for post pandemic because they are diligent and their inside seating area feels more spacious and airy. Recently I enjoyed their pomegranate margarita and vegetarian quesadilla. Both were excellent.

I pass this place all the time but never stopped there. So glad I finally for a drink with a friend. We didn't do happy hours. I don't know if it is authentic Mexican. We got some nachos which was tasty. I ordered a mezcal which was fantastic. My friend ordered a mock tail with mango and liked it a lot. We are planning to bring a larger group of friends.

The outside seating was really well spaced, the staff were really nice and the food was great. The guacamole is always so fresh here and I love the chips and salsa. The grilled fish tacos were fine, a little dry. The street corn was delish and so were the margs.  Always a reliable place when in the area!
New Flatiron high quality and service Mexican!  I prefer more Mexican heat/spice but that is a personal preference!

Do not patronize an establishment who does not support civil liberties and religious freedoms. No establishment or government has the right to suppress the freedom put forth by God almighty and supported by the constitution. Vaccine mandates are segregation.

We tried this cantina yesterday after much research through Google. I use the term cantina loosely since the restaurant is cavernous. I found that they had a different take by serving foods from various regions of Mexico rather than the standard same old dishes. I opted for the tres enchiladas which were three different ones. Beef, pork and chicken. The beef enchilada was topped with a traditional red sauce, the pork with a green sauce and the chicken had mole sauce. It was fun to have three different flavors and textures on one plate. It didn't have the refried beans or yellow rice that I did not miss a bit. The flavors and spicy bite were winners all around. My SO had the carnitas which was a mixture of braised pork with cilantro, pickled red onion and grilled pineapple.  Served with handmade corn tortillas. He loved it and left sated. Unfortunately, he didn't wrap the carnitas in tortillas since he claimed that the carnitas were enough to satisfy. I drank a frozen, blood orange mango margarita and found it very good.  It costs a bit more than most Mexican places but quality comes with a price.  The service was excellent and the manager come over to see what we thought of the food.  Oh, and to the people that say vaccine requirements are against their civil liberties and religious freedom I say don't patronize them or sit outside where vaccinations are not mandatory. I am so glad to see this establishment is protecting their clientele. We are vaccinated and will continue to be vaccinated. I will not patronize a place where vaccinations are not required for indoor dining. Vaccine mandates are NOT segregation and they save lives. If your religion forbids vaccinations, cook home and leave the rest of us alone. Sorry to get political...no I'm not.

So I went here last minute mainly because it was surging on seated (app that gives cash back for dining, check it out and use my referral code afshan1 so we both get money). My first impression of this spot was woah it's so large and feels fancy( I was dressed in a tee and jeans) but then I looked around and most people were dressed casual. We sat by the steps - I would say that's the best seat bc not fully inside or on the sidewalk and started with the nachos which were amazing! Then had the salmon and Josefina's Quesadilla to share both which were great. Honestly the quality of food here is great and portion size is average. Only one star off because service was kind of super slow/they sort of forgot about us but was ok since we weren't in a crazy rush and I get that it was dinner rush.

The best part is that it's so spacious! I came for the tableside guacamole, but unfortunately they weren't doing it because of covid, so they just brought it to the table. It was pretty good, just needed some salt. Tacos were decent, I loved the Elote!! Nice service.
50-60  mins

Tl;dr great tacos Great tacos in New York, the line moves quick, the toppings are delicious, and most importantly the meat is juicy and flavorful. The portion for one taco is pretty good and I was able to taste every ingredient, a true testament to a great taco.  My only gripe is the price. I'm used to $1-3 for a taco and these start at $4 but for New York that's not terrible I suppose. Definitely would come back again.

Really good tacos!! They're a little pricey ($4-5 each) but tasty. The line can be long but it moves fairly quickly, and the kitchen staff are super sweet.  I wasn't expecting such good tacos outside of (southern) California, let alone Chelsea! Having lived in CA my entire life, the best tacos I've ever had were in San Diego and little mom and pop taco trunks in Oakland. The tacos here at Los Tacos are almost comparable but the prices here are probably at least x2 as much as tacos normally go for in CA.  Their menu is straight to the point and no frills: you have a choice of meats + nopales being the vegetarian option and can decide between tacos, empanadas, quesadillas, or a nopales plate. You can also choose whether you want guac, onions, pinto beans, and/or cilantro. After placing your order with the cashiers, you get a print out which you give to the kitchen staff. They'll ask you what you want and prepare it fresh for you. I love that you can look into the kitchen -- things are always being cooked on the stoves and pork is cooked on a vertical rotating spit. There is no question about the quality of food. I wanted to try their nopales plate with pollo asado (~$12-13). Came on a base of cooked nopales, with a scoop of pollo asado, guac, onions, cilantro, and beans. I added pico de gallo, lime, and salsa later. So good!! Tldr; would come again if I was the direct Chelsea area, but given the price per taco, I've also had better at hole in the wall places.

REALLLY GOOD TACOS!! I had the chicken tacos and it was amazing, very well seasoned and strong flavors. I do wish they did give me more toppings on the taco but overall good amount of food for the price! I also ordered the "especial" which i fell is not well highlighted on the menu because there is no description for it. It is kind of like an empanada that they fill w the meat of your choice and some other toppings. Really yummy!! Overall really great spot in Chelsea market, would want to visit again in the future!

Pretty good taco! The lines are pretty long but it is worth the wait. After placing your order, you take your receipt to the line and they make the tacos for you. I ordered the carne asada and the al pastor. Carne asada was flavorful and tender. Al pastor...probably the best ones I have eaten so far. Holy moly! Get the al pastor, you wont regret it. Its sweet and spicy...just yum Pass the horchata. Not sure if i got a watered down batch that day but it was just not good Beware of the medium and hot sauces!! It was so spicy so be mindful and put little by little haha dont be like me where i just dumped it all! My mouth was on fire!!

Not my first time here but oof, still as good as ever especially eating it while it's still warm  There's a wait time but it goes by quick enough and definitely worth the wait!  I got 2 pork, 1 steak and 1 chicken to share with a friend. They aren't big but definitely packed with good flavor so 2 tacos did the job for me. I wasn't even hungry yet but the first bite brought back my appetite, ugh I'm salivating as I think about the taste.  I thought I would enjoy the pork as I did once before but it was more mediocre than I was expecting, still good though. All those toppings of guac goodness and what not was perfection. Now for the steak or chicken, both looked the same but, I think I ate the steak because the meat was on the charred side and oh my Jesus, that was heaven.  DIVINE I would have typically avoided any hot sauce but it was already on the taco when served. That was a good move cause the dash of hot sauce gave that kick making all the flavors dance on my tongue Even as the prices steadily rise for the tacos, it's still such a good treat to have. GET IT!

Totally craving these tacos as I write this review!  Tip: Grab a beverage to enjoy while you're waiting in line! There's a bar right next to it, and you can also visit the wine shop around the corner (they have individual pre-packaged alcoholic drinks). You need a mask to order a taco!  Service/Ambiance: Super popular and located inside Chelsea Market. You will order at the register first and then bring your ticket to the counter on the left. Help yourself to the toppings/sauces! There's usually always a wait here, so prepare yourself. I did come once right when it opened, and there was already a line. There are tables outside that you can sit at and enjoy your food.   Food: choice of corn or flour tortillas (love the corn). Be sure to get the con todo (all the toppings - onions, cilantro, salsa, and guacamole)! Adobada (marinated pork) is definitely my favorite meat choice as it was delicious, juicy, and savory. You can watch them shave the meat off as it rotates over the heat. The carne asada (grilled steak) is also great! I know some people complained about the price, but I think it's actually not that expensive for authentic freshly made tacos in NYC.  Overall: lives up to the hype - brave the tourists at Chelsea Market to get your taco fix!

Located in the heart of Chelsea Market, this spot had the longest line of people of any shop and came at the recommendation of a local so we decided to try it. I am so so so so glad we did!  Ordered a carne asada tostada and an abodabo (pork) quesadilla and both were freakin' delicious. This also pumps them out QUICK so line around the market moved very quickly and we had our food lickity split. Tostada was piled high with carne asada, avocado cream, onions, and cilantro. The quesadilla was FILLED with cheese and crispy pieces of pork. Both were dripping meat juices as we ate them, so tender and delish. Topped both with self serve salsa options, including pico and a hot red salsa. Def can't wait to come back and order more tacos!

If you are looking for a quick snack/lunch to grab as you see sites, stop inside Chelsea market for some amazing tacos!! We tried the pollo asado and steak tacos as well as the quesadilla. The quesadilla isn't like your normal Americanized one, but instead it's basically a taco with cheese and sauce inside. All were very good, great quality and quick! I personally wish they had a little bigger menu with either another type of meat for the tacos or a Mexican style salad. Very good food though.

I'm gonna go straight to the point: unbelievably GOOD!!! I've tried 4 kinds of their tacos, loved the chicken the most! They're just perfect. Don't have anything negative to say! The staff is very welcoming, helpful and friendly.  You gotta try this place if you're in NYC. Easily the best tacos I've tried so far!

I feel like I'm missing something, but I didn't think Los tacos was worth the hype. I've had better tacos for less money at hole in the walls, with much shorter lines. The tacos weren't bad; they were just slightly lacking in flavor. I got the nopal and adobada tacos. Neither was that amazing. I also wish they'd been more authentic and given two taco shells. I wouldn't go back. Source: me, a slightly pretentious person who has tried Mexico City street tacos, and died and went to heaven after eating them

A friend recommended this spot and I saw it on one of Yelp's top 100 lists, so we stopped by on our most recent NYC trip.  Inside, it's pretty chaotic. There's a line to order which is normal. After you order, you go to the counter and hand your ticket to someone in a sea of people. They ask what kind of tortilla and toppings you want. Then eventually they hand you your food.  We escaped the madness inside and ate our taco outside. We got the adobada taco on a flour tortilla with all the toppings.  This is one of the best tacos I've ever had. I highly recommend checking them out!

Being not native to NYC, I just had to see what the dealio is with this place having a bunch of raving reviews. I got the carne asada quesadilla and a nopal taco. Carne asada quesadilla: weird-looking quesadilla, but it'll do. Now for the carne asada.....not the most tender carne asada that I've had but man oh man the citrusy marinade. Super flavorful. Didn't even really need the help of a lime wedge. The cheese added a bit of oomph but not an extra-dollar oomph. Nopal taco: I've never had nopal before but was very intrigued about it after seeing all of the nopales being cooked on the grill. Not too fond of the stickiness of nopal (similar to that of okra). If you like nopal though you'll probably like this taco as well. Overall I dig the food here.....but I dooo kinda agree with other reviewers in that the tacos are a bit expensive for what they are (over $4 a piece). Is it fair to say it's cuz it's NYC? Lol idk I'm just a tourist from Cali. I went on a Thursday at 7 pm. Line wasn't long at all and I got my food fairly fast from all of the cooks streamlining their efforts (was also entertained with the main food preparer dancing to the Mexican music blasting at this spot).

WOW love these tacos! Great tacos, super fresh toppings, salty fresh chips. Located inside the Chelsea Market which itself is really fun but can get a little crowded. And the ordering process can be a little confusing. You order with the cashier and they hand you a ticket which you then take to a chef who makes the order and asks about toppings. Then wait for your number to pick up your tacos. This place always hits the spot and will be one of my fave tacos in the city.

If you're in the mood for some mouthwatering, authentic Mexican tacos, then this is your place! From the warm flour tortillas to the tender meat to the fresh sauces - all incredibly delicious! We ordered the Carne Asada Taco ($4.75 each) and Pollo Asado taco ($4.50 each) con todo (includes onions, cilantro, salsa, and guacamole). The steak and chicken were juicy and tender - every single bite was an unforgettable flavor bomb. The simplicity of the ingredients yet the amount of flavor these tacos had is truly undescribable.  Tip: After paying at the register, make sure to hand your ticket to one of the cooks so they can start your order. While waiting, grab some of their homemade salsas they have on the counter along with some lime wedges to squeeze over your tacos! Once you get your tacos, just find a place to sit (or stand) and enjoy!  Los Tacos No. 1 is one of the best if not the best taco spot in NYC! I am so glad to have stumbled upon this place. These tacos truly are fresh, simple, and authentic.

LOVE this place! We were checking out the surrounding area and came across this place. The taco is a bit more on the expensive side, but you pay for what you get! The tacos were larger than usual and they gave a good amount of meat!  The line was long, but it went by pretty quickly. I definitely can't wait to come back!  If you haven't tried this place out.. Do it!!

We went on a Saturday afternoon (around 2 pm) and the line was SO long. The entire hall was crowded full of people. The line moved pretty quickly - I think we waited about 20 minutes? There was nowhere to sit inside or outside so we had to stand and eat the tacos. 2/5 for the experience. Luckily, the tacos are really yummy! I got the pollo asado (chicken) and adobo (pork) on corn tortillas. The tortilla was amazing - soft, simple, with good corn flavor and texture. Both the chicken and pork were very flavorful and not dry at all. I'm a picky eater so I didn't get any of the toppings (onions, salsa, guacamole) but it didn't matter because the meat was so good. And I appreciated that they didn't skimp on the meat. 5/5 for the food.

Best tacos in NYC! The prices have doubled but it's still a great bargain and a guaranteed delicious meal.  Amazing how busy the food hall still is and how long the line is for tacos. Everything is made fresh in front of us to order.

Some of the best "authentic" tacos I've had. Long lines and the service was not great (our order was lost and the staff didn't acknowledge we were still waiting and kept taking new orders) but despite the LONG wait the tacos (pork, chicken, and carne asada) were all good. Really enjoyed the chips and guacamole too. First time I've given a five star despite the poor service so you know the food was outstanding. Make it a point to go!

The best corn tortillas I've had in a very very long time. I tasted both chicken and pork tacos. Both were perfect, extremely flavorful. With those 2 salsas and the fried , it took the flavor to a whole other level. Lines move pretty fast. Definitely No.1 for me at Chelsea market.

wow.... This is the BEST place in NYC for tacos. I'm a huge fan of Mexican cuisine & I love me some GOOD TACOS & I must say, this place lives up to its hype!! It's best to believe the rumors that there's never NO line, haha. It's pretty long... but it goes relatively quickly so..no worries hungry fellow foodies :). I ordered the Adobada Taco, Carne Asada Quesadilla (toasted), Carne Asada Taco, Chicken Quesadilla & the Pollo Asado Taco. My goooooodness, they were all so DELICIOUS! I think my favorite was the carne asada quesadilla (the flour tortilla is toasted). It almost reminds me of a Crunchwrap supreme (which I LOVE) from Taco Bell. There are nice little self-serve stations on the bar for some fresh limes, radish, and 3 salsa flavors. If you're stuck debating whether or not to come try this place out... stop. Do yourself a favor, and just do it. You won't regret it, trust me :).

Favorite taco spot in Manhattan. This place isn't meant for lingering. Rehearse your order before you reach the register, let the assembly line workers know what type of tortilla you want and def ask for con todo/everything on top.  New to me was the accoutrement bar. My first visit here was during the peak of the pandemic when indoor dining was banned so seeing the salsas and radish was a delight. My brother, who has lived in ATX and San Diego, was a fan.

We enjoyed our quick lunch at Los Tacos No. 1 near Times Square. It was really cold and windy so it was nice to have a moment out of the wind.  Once you place your order and pay they give you a ticket. You move down the line and hand the ticket to a person behind the counter. You'll be asked if you want flour or corn tortillas and if you want them the way they come (onions, salsa, cilantro, guacamole). The guacamole is more of a guac sauce than actual guacamole. Very delicious. We also ordered the chips and guacamole. It's about a 1/4-1/2 cup of guacamole, the chips were really good. Not too thin, they hold up when you dip the guacamole and that is what I want in a chip;). There is a sauce bar where you can find pico and assorted sauces. I didn't get a picture of those but you'll see them in other reviews. I didn't add sauce to my taco because I wanted to taste the flavors as they are originally in the taco. I had the Jamaican tea and it was good, I didn't really want a soda or water so it hit the spot. Not too sweet but had a good flavor, slightly fruity flavor.  We each ordered tacos and I have to say the chicken taco was full of flavor. You can tell that they didn't just cook chicken and add spices. It takes time for the flavors in that chicken to fully incorporate. One of the best tacos I have had.  It's standing room only, I sent my family over to watch for a spot while I ordered for us #divideandconquer and that worked out alright. I wish we had tried the Chelsea Market location because there are tables there since it has more of a food hall situation going on....nonetheless it was a delicious quick lunch  and I'm glad we were able to give it a try!

Sadly, I don't have pictures because I ordered them to-go and was super careless about carrying them around... anyways, I would say the flavor of these tacos are on par with LA tacos! It just hurt me a little bit on the inside that I could buy 4 LA tacos for the price of 1 NY taco  But still worth trying!!  The adobado tacos are a little salty and didn't have as much filling, but they still tasted great. The carne asada tacos were my favorite -- super flavorful and a equal ratio of meat to tortilla in a bite. I tried my friend's nopal taco and it was surprisingly good! I liked the crunch of the cactus, but I wouldn't say it's good enough to get again. It's a good vegetarian option though!

Mexican Taco Magic! Whatever you do, make sure to order at least one taco with the cheese tortilla. Basically, instead of a corn or flour tortilla, the taco toppings are served over a tortilla made from grilled cheese!! Amazing!!

Yumm this taco place does not disappoint which is clearly reflected in the reviews. Ordering is a relatively straight through process, and they make  your order right in front of you. I ordered one of each of the asada, pollo, and adobada. They were all good, but hands down my favorite was the pollo. So freaking delicious!  There's places to eat here, but they are counter style, and you stand. It's pretty busy during the lunch rush, but well worth it!

Following popular opinion, this place is a quick and convenient stop. They have a small menu, which helps with the speedy service, though it still covers the basics and with the cactus, offers something for adventurous foodies. Even the customizations (tortilla and toppings) are kept simple. Prices are a bit high for tacos, but I'll contribute that to a mix between quality ingredients and COVID prices. What I Ordered: Pollo Asado Tacos (no cilantro)- the chicken was pretty juicy and well seasoned; onions were raw as anticipated; salsa was spicy (not expected); guacamole was creamy. P.S. Does anyone know if they make tortillas in-house?

Walked by this location and decided to get 2 tacos as a quick snack - the space is very bright and clean, with tables you can stand and eat your food. The tacos were amazing as usual, especially love the adobada!! Will be back!!

Finally got to try these in person!!! Long line but totally worth it. So reasonably priced and it comes with all the toppings like guac! Their salsas are HOT! I loved the verde and the red one was good as well. So many flavors going on. Super happy and will be a regular spot i return to when I visit nyc!

I know a good taco when I eat one. These tacos were it. Maybe some of the best I've ever had. We did delivery through Uber eats and while the tacos didn't taste that fresh, I could taste the potential and the flavors and that's why they deserve 5 stars. I really enjoyed the carne asada. The flavors were great. I like that the tacos were also loaded with guac! I didn't really like the cactus taco. Not really my thing I guess. I wish they had given us salsas such as verde. I like how the packaged the horchata. Looked kind of funny but  very clever to avoid spilling! I definitely want to try this place fresh some time, I know it'll be amazing!
Great tacos!!! Pork tacos were amazing!!. Quick and easy place to get tacos ( in and out ) 5 bucks a taco. Reminds me if 5 guys was a taco place.

Came here upon the recommendation of a friend. Coming from Texas, I was exposed to some of the best tacos there is to offer. Some of the best I've had were served out of a broken down food truck in a middle of a parking lot where the staff only spoke a few efficient words of English: flour, corn, cilantro, onion, cash only. So when I came here, to this English-speaking brick and mortar location, I was thinking, "This probably won't be as good as those late night taco truck stands in Houston." I would say that this was a pretty great experience that rivals the upper tier of good tacos in Texas. This is basically a take-out place. There is some room outside with standing tables but expect this to be a walk-and-eat situation. I got the adobada quesadillas with corn tortillas and it was pretty good. It was basically an open faced taco with cheese for a dollar more, so I don't know if the cheese was worth that extra dollar. However, price point aside, the taste was pretty good. Savory and rich. My server gave me an extra dollop of guac without any addition charge so that was pretty clutch. I don't remember it being spicy and so I think it could definitely benefit from a touch of heat. I wouldn't say it's the best tacos I've had but I would say it is still a pretty good one. Definitely come here if wherever you are from aren't known for their tacos - if that's the case, this place is pretty good for you. 4/5 stars.

Delicious and fast street tacos near Times Square! They make the tacos right in front of you, and it's fast. I ordered one Carne Asada taco and one Pollo Asado taco. Both the corn and flour tortillas were good, but the flour were my favorite. Make sure you get them "Con Todo" - with onions, cilantro, salsa, & guacamole. This place has counters where you can stand and eat.
Delicious tacos just like Tijuana mexico . Handmade Flour or corn tortillas  Asada tacos with guacamole

Not gonna lie, a bit disappointed. Everybody raves about Los Tacos No. 1 But the tacos are overpriced and the place is just so damn crowded  I pulled up on a Tuesday night with a friend, the line moved incredibly fast. I was so impressed. With a line out the door, I waited all but 5 minutes. We ordered two carne asada tacos, the cactus taco, an agua fresca, and horchata. I love that the tacos come with all the fixings (salsa, guacamole, onions, lime). And you can ask for corn or flour tortillas. I got flour tortillas.  The carne asada was really delicious; tender meat, a little bit of a kick, juicy guacamole, and petite. The agua fresca was refreshing but watered down. I know, it's water but still. My friend said the horchata was good so I'll take her word for it  But what really put the nail in the coffin was the cactus taco. Everybody in the comments said it was good so I took a leap of faith but damn. I fucked up! Cactus was slimy, lacked seasoning, and because it was diced rather than sliced, the texture was just all off for me. I wanted a crunch factor or something to relieve me from this soggy cactus. Relief never came. I simply gave up...  I paid about $20 for two and 1/2 tacos and a drink. In new york city, no surprise. But still. Pricey and it's not like it was blowing me away. Plus the fast-paced environment means lots of people crowded into a hot taco shop, shoving their faces on little counter tops. Not great for groups, not enough room. Just quick casual dates or a bite after a long day.  But I know my local taco truck can hook me up for half the price.

Such solid tacos!! Tried beef, pork and cactus tacos. Thought cactus was a bit sour for my liking- reminded me of a pickle- but the other two tacos were amazing! Wanted to get everything "con todos" except I learned the salsa was spicy, so I skipped that. The pork was cut right in front of you from a huge BBQ pole and both meats were extremely flavorful and not dry at all. The guacamole and cilantro provided a refreshing kick to each bite of taco. Will be coming back to try their quesadillas!

Visited this location right before a show with a friend and we were in and out within 30 minutes. I like how efficient this location is and we did not have any trouble finding a table to eat our food. They check vaccination status before you order if you're dining in, so make sure you have that on hand.  I had two quesadillas and my friend had their plate with nopal. I had nopal in one and carne asada in another. I would not recommend the nopal in a taco or a quesadilla because it's very wet. If you do get the nopal, I recommend a corn tortilla because it soaks up the sauce better.  We were going to see a show, so I didn't get a drink. But the horchata is always solid at Los Tacos No. 1's.

Probably my favorite tacos in Manhattan! Super authentic and simple, 4 variations and a choice of 4 toppings, you honestly need nothing. Everything is quick without being hectic. Eat at the var table or takeout. I'm a regular here...

If you are like me and get overwhelmed by NYC Midtown and food options in the city overall, a good place to start is here. It is simple and honest. Quick, affordable, and very fulfilling. Deserves the hype, I think, because of the guac crema that the tacos come with. It seems very popular by NYC Youtubers for a good reason and has multiple locations to try. The cups at the salsa bar are messy but with million people in town, kudos to the team for keeping the counters clean.

My favorite tacos!!! I order the steak, pork and chicken tacos. Changed it up today and ordered a chicken V quesadilla which is essentially a chicken taco but with cheese. The pork and steak tacos are my favorite. Very flavorful and today they seemed spicier than usual but nothing I couldn't handle. I always get a horchata; there's is perfectly made.

I hadn't planned on visiting Los Tacos No. 1 but it came recommended by multiple friends, my partner and I were in the area after (finally) checking out the High Line, and it was dinnertime - seems like a sign, right? We waited in what we thought was a pretty long line (only to see it get even longer as we waited!) and placed our order: one of each of the tacos. We figured we needed to try everything (but also leave room for dessert). This was a mistake because we practically inhaled the tacos and wanted more, but didn't have the energy to get back in line. The pollo asado was my absolute favorite - the chicken was SO flavorful and juicy. Very happy to have visited and hope to be back soon!

Oh man...where to start?  Order their adobada/al pastor.  Wish they would serve lengua, but I digress.... Their Dasani or Polan Springs is $5 or something obscene like that.  Their "make your own tacos" would be impeccable had they not charge/included multiple containers of mediocre guacs.. I'm here for your meat, not guacs.

I haven't been here in a few years, but was really glad I stoped in today.   This spot has always been tiny, but you can see. Ganges due to covid restrictions have taken place.  So be warned, seating is super limited and they are requiring proof of vaccinating to dine in.   Mint lemonade was awesome! Tortilla were a little over done today... but honestly the quality of their tacos is so good that your tastes buds over look that.

This place it tiny and hidden in China town.  It's a well worth the stop. I've come here for one thing and one thing only, their fish tacos.  They are the best fish tacos I've ever tasted. The fish isn't over cooked, it's served with a slightly spicy sauce, avocados, and pickled onions (and I'm not a onion person), but this is perfection!!! Their mint lemonade is a perfect companion!

We only got the breakroom fries here because we wanted a quick bite before Blood Manor, and it HIT THE SPOT. Exactly what I wanted my loaded fries to be - crispy and soft, sufficient cheese and meat bits, with the fried egg on top. They also have maybe a hundred hot sauce bottles (ranges from mild to super hot) inside, although there's probably only like 4-5 kinds.

This fantastic gem tucked away down Baxter st. packs a serious punch for greasy comforts.   When you walk in it's a little tight, but that just makes it all the more cozy when you throw down their juicy burgers.  I usually get the signature Double Breakroom Burger with a side of Breakroom Fries... both are out of this world.  Here's the descriptions straight from the menu. Double Breakroom Burger: 6oz Patty, Crispy Pork Belly, Tempura Onion Ring, Sunny Side Egg, Jalapenos, Lettuce, Tomato & American Cheese Breakroom Fries: Seasoned Fries, Tater Tots, Sunny Side egg, Bacon, Pork Belly, Cheese & Jalapenos You honestly can't go wrong with anything you see on the menu, just be sure to grab a friend and a fistful of napkins, you'll thank me later.

Mint lemonade was bomb- perfect balance between sweet and refreshing flavors. Most lemonades I've tried are too sweet. This one isn't. As for the rib eye steak sandwhich, the meat is well seasoned and cheesy. Very nicely wrapped to ensure the product doesn't get cold. The only thing wish could be better was the bread- the inside was too bland, not the typical hero bread I usually eat. Otherwise this is great place for a quick bite.

One of the best taco joints in the city. The best fish tacos I've ever had! The crispy and tasty texture with the aioli. The break-room fries are a must if it's your first time here. Honestly I wish I opted for the taco trio because amazing. Also the heavy hitter in the room is the lemonades. Just go ahead and get the large. I got the passionfruit lemonade and it was the perfect mixture--not to sweet. I'm definitely going back here for sure.

Great "bar" food place. This place offers hispanic food such as tacos or quesadias with your choice of meat as well as burgers amongst other variety of similar style foods.  I would give 5 stars if everything was perfect, the only item that wasn't that good was bacon wrapped hotdog. It was as advertised, but I think a thicker/juicier hotdog similar to Sam's Club would taste better. This one was dried out and didn't yield much flavor to the dish. This is the only bad experience of the place!  As for the good, that covers the costumer service, food, and inside. The person at the register was very helpful in explaining different food and even provided to bring food out to us. There was seating outside and inside (which is small, but give the ability to look outside).  The tacos and burgers were amazing, they weren't greasy, but are messy to eat. Lastly, the variety of hot sauces for the spiciness fan is quite large in comparison to other places. I think I counted around 7 or 9 different sauces. (Try the garlic one!)
was okay but nothing too memorable

Breakroom is a neat little spot in Chinatown for fresh tacos. Expect their service to be iffy, but they make good on their 3 mix-and-match Taco Platter. Most popular is the Tempura Fish. Batter is nice and crispy, though the fried fish can feel a bit heavy and even bland. I'm an avid fish 'n chips fan, and prefer more zing from tartar or malt vinegar. At Breakroom, I just end up being very liberal with their lineup of hot sauces instead! Grilled Steak taco is nicely charred, but also straightforward. It comes topped with only pico de gallo. Good taco, but not astounding. Cheesesteak is another popular ooey cheesy one, and Pork Belly was highly lauded by my friends for its crispy bits, so I'll have to try that next time. I also enjoy the Breakroom Fries, a combo of fries and tater tots loaded with some good and deadly stuff. Cheesy, carby, bacony fun to devour. Mint Lemonade is refreshing, sweet, and full of minty goodness. It pairs well with my (self-induced) spicy tacos. Lesson learned, be careful of all the hot sauces lined against the wall. They'll draw you in, then turn around and burn you!

Really solid tacos! I got the break room fries and a fish taco. I have been going to this place for years but not often, to be honest the prices are wayyy too high. $10 for fries and $4 per taco. It's a good place to eat just not very often and a treat yourself moment.
Website and Yelp said they were open until midnight.  Walked almost 3/4 mile and arrived at 8:45pm only to be told they were closed.  Who closes at 8:30 on a Saturday night in NYC?

Finally able to get here. I had the 3 tacos platter. Very good tacos. Fish taco  Cheesesteak taco (melted cheese and sauce) Fried prom belly taco (great crunch) They had a bunch of hot sauces as well. I will try their burgers next time.

I've been eating from break room for a while ... at this point this review is way over due .. a co-worker  referred me this place she said " the tacos are ridiculously good " and even that wasn't the best way to describe tune tacos ..  I only have the fish tempura tacos and they are extremely light and flavorful,  not grease at all , no over kill on the special sauce they use either .. most definitely hits the spot each time  the fries are good as well .  This place is usually crowded so i advise you call ahead , when they are operating  during regular business hrs , i placed a online order it only took approximately 35 mins for  the food to be ready  . The staff are super friendly as well . GOT MY VOTE AGAIN AND AGAIN

Always wanted to try Breakroom since I've heard about it so often, so I decided to pop in and pick up the Breakroom fries. I wasn't able to compare an experience to anything since I've never had it, but the fries were severely underwhelming. It boasts pork belly and bacon, and when you hear pork belly, you think tender, fatty, tasty. But the pork belly I got looked like it was double fried and re-fried, and it was crispier than some of the bacon itself, on top of it being super dry. It did lack taste, in which the cheese and spicy Mayo (I think?) made up for.  The fries itself were also quite crispy. The only thing that was decent were the tater tots it came with, since those weren't actually over-cooked. On the other end of the spectrum, the sunny side egg was under-cooked, with egg whites still running.  At this time, I'm giving it 3 stars since I wasn't able to try out the full menu yet, since I know they're more known for their tacos, so I hope to return and try those out and hope for a better experience.   This review was based solely on the fries, which I hoped would be better :/

The tempura tacos here are outstandingly tasty, and the fries are famously good.  Do yourself a favor and get the pork belly while you're at Breakroom -- you can thank me later. (And believe me -- you will.) Our entire meal was really good and came quickly after we'd ordered. The entire staff was really nice. (I can see why this place has a cult following of sorts!)

I came here with two of my friends after a long day. The food was really good and I think it's pretty cheap compared to other places in manhattan. I got the three taco platter and I chose the carnitas, fried pork belly, and chipotle chicken. The tacos were amazing. It wasn't too much or too little so when you ate it it wasn't messy and just the right amount of food in your mouth. They were pretty juicy too. I also got the chili cheese fries and that was bomb as well. The fries were crispy and it had a lot of flavor. My friends got the burger and they said that it was good as well.  I recommend getting the three taco platter since two tacos was enough to make me full. They also had outdoor dining but it's pretty small so I sat inside with my friends where it was a three seater.

This is the perfect late night bite and/or burger taco joint on a budget for NYC prices. The flavor is packed and stacked high in the break room burger and you can't go wrong with the tacos as well. We got the fish tacos and it was light and fresh. The Chipotle chicken taco is also great. The burger is definitely the highlight and the combination of the onion ring, egg, and juicy burger definitely hits the spot

Breakroom is the perfect joint in Chinatown for late night munchies.   + Breakroom Fries: a pure work of genius- loaded tater tots and fries with cheese, pork, fried egg, bacon, and green onions.  You can thank me later ;) + Breakroom Burger: beef patty with pork belly, fried onion rings, a runny egg, jalapeños, and all your traditional burger fixings.  It will get soggy in the take out bag and it will be a mess to eat, but you'll scarf it down anyway.  How could you resist that fatty goodness?

The young worker today at 7pm did not greet me Or my party when we walked in.  when I asked him about dine in or take out he didn't give me a response or make anyone feel welcome. Suggested we dine in but didn't offer a menu or anything , lead us to sit.  Then juicewrld was playing... while I'm a fan it was specifically songs about overdosing which I don't feel is appropriate music as it can trigger people to loved ones who've passed away. "All my friends are gonna die young" , to which he also didn't say anything. I then walked out because I was now having a negative experience

It's a little bit difficult to locate and with all the other restaurants around it you might get distracted, but because I was craving tacos. Tacos it was. The tacos are very tasty also depending on what kind of meat you get. We got 2 Taco platters, so got to try out 6 tacos.  The fish taco, the spicy pork were my 2 favorites.  -1* because the guac that came with the chips and guac wasn't really guac.

My friend Jordan and I both were FAMISHED by the time we came crawling to the entrance of Breakroom. It was time for a break, indeed!! I went for the chopt cheese sandwich and he went for the chicken sandwich. I can't speak for his sandwich since I haven't had a bite, in respect to COVID-19 and respectful hygiene, but I will say his sandwich didn't look too shabby. As for my chop cheese, well, you already know how it goes - it was MIGHTY FINE!!! Portions were substantial and I appreciate the diversity of hot sauces they had to offer. It's not too different from the lineup of hot sauces Hot Ones on youtube likes to offer, only in that their options are limited to 4 and don't have you crying for milk by the end of your meal. The only thing I would like to see in the future is the QR code at the door for access to a virtual menu and possibly the option of a sandwich + drink as a combo as you would see in a fast food chain. Alas, I realize this is a mom and pop shop and so perhaps what I'm asking for is merely a pipe's dream and probably won't materialize as it is more expensive to run an individual business. Thank you Breakroom for a delicious meal!! My friend is Southern and if you've impressed him, there's something to be said!! We will be back for sure.
Yum for the breakfast burrito to go! Sauces are yummy too, ordering online and pickup was easy and quick.
Thanks Constance!
Absolutely delicious Filipino food. The breakfast bowl may just be the best hangover cure ever created.
Thanks Aaron! I agree. That bowl rocks.
So glad this opened nearby!  The adobo burrito and adobo bowl was deliciou!
Thx Aminry! Xoxo

After a long day in NYC, we were back at our hotel relaxing. We got hungry and didn't have the energy to go out again. I don't usually like using the delivery apps, but we were tired so we ordered from this place on DoorDash.  We got a DP Burger, Beef Short Rib Taco, and Cali Burrito. Everything was fantastic and it was delivery. I can't imagine how good it would be fresh. The taco is the best birria we've had. I loved the sausage in the burger. The chicken in the burrito was delicious.  Don't let the terrible pictures I took of the takeout lead you to any conclusion about the food. I promise, it was delicious.  This Filipino/Mexican fusion is a must try in my opinion!
You’re the best Jaqueline! Thx for taking the time to review. Hopefully we’ll see in the store next time.

This might be the greasiest meal I've ever eaten but I'm not mad at it, especially because I needed to soak up some drinks... We had the longanisa poutine, birria tacos (chicken and short rib) and cali burrito. The birria tacos were the definite standout. While the longanisa sausage in the poutine was too dry/lean for my taste, doused with their hot sauce, we were happy campers.  Most importantly, the vibes here are 5 stars or as their menu says, approachable and energized. Everybody was super friendly and the dive atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming, especially for the neighborhood.
Wow. Thanks Alyssa. That’s awesome. Glad u liked it. See u soon we hope

Went around a month ago and the interior was nice, service was pretty good too. I saw a lot of great reviews and decided to try this place but the food is pricey and lacking.  I ordered the adobo taco and it was so salty, it had me chugging water for a while. My friend ordered the noodles and they were your basic instant noodles except you can get those from a supermarket and boil it yourself for less than half the price.  The fries were alright, probably the best part of the meal.

UPDATE: Owner Jordan of Flip Sigi replied to my comment below said to refund my money (initially thought was super sweet gesture due to my terrible experience) but I never got the refund after writing to him. Meh.  I really wish I could give a higher rating but our experience at Flip Sigi was VERY disappointing. I tried their food (tacos, burritos, longanisa fries, dan dan noodles, and hot wings) awhile back with friends at their other old location. We enjoyed our food then. Was craving their burritos and went out of our way to get them. We drove 2 hours and 30 mins circling around for parking and to beat traffic to spend $35 on 3 sad burnt burritos that were so so so tiny!! They were more like mini wraps to be exact not even half the size compared to a chipotle burrito. Will not be returning.
Wow. That’s not our typical response. Please write me so I can refund your money. I hate thinking you left disappointed  info@flipsigi.com  - I’ll look out someone with your name AZHLY.

Got a chance to try out flipsigi today and i did not expect to just give three stars (noooo!!) especially since this was filipino fusion! First though, we arrived and there was no wait. Staff was wonderful and orders were prompt. We sat outdoors and was grateful for the heater. To start, we ordered pork belly baos and the calamansi. I loved that the juice was refreshingly tangy and sweet! The buns were soft and nicely made. The pork was okay though. Part of the meat was tender but the other half where the skin is is chewy. I got the dandan and shouldve taken the label "spicy af!" Seriously. It was hella spicy! My eyes were watery and tongue was burning! (i may have low-medium spiciness tolerance though) I had to get some of my husbands adobo OG (which i liked) so i can eat something lol the spiciness of the dandan could've been overlooked but it was on the sour side and was just not my personal preference in terms of taste.  Im a little disappointed really since i expected to be mindblown seeing that their photos were so mouthwatering and plus its filipino food! Cmon. Maybe i shouldve tried the burrito instead? Hmm.
Lemme kno when u want to come back and try something less spicy.

Amazing Filipino fusion food! Came here on a Thursday for dinner with two other friends and there were plenty of open tables available for seating. Their regular menu looked fantastic but when we got to the restaurant I saw this poster for their Manilla Thrilla sandwich and knew I had to get it. This sandwich was a smoked brisket sandwich with kimchi coleslaw and was delicious! The portions were a little smaller than I expected but surprisingly very filling. Will absolutely be back to try more items on their menu!
Thx josh! Can’t wait to see u back in here!

Filipino fusion coming in hot in West Village. Flip Sigi melds Filipino comfort food with a mostly Mexican approach but also manages to work some other combos into the mix. The menu boasts a bunch of burritos and tacos but you can also grab yourself a sandwich or even a heap of poutine and they serve their brunch menu all day. Yours truly opted for the longanisa poutine which came plied high with fresh, house-made sausage, onions and a whole bunch of other fixings atop a mountain of fries. Nothing wrong with any of that and that could easily have been a meal in itself but why stop there? I also ordered the Plan B-Rito, which came stuffed with longanisa, ham, bacon, eggs, hashbrowns and avocado. It was breakfast meets lunch, served at around 9:00pm. Smallish place but a fair amount of seating, most of which is outdoor. Friendly staff and one of the few places in the city serving quality eats without breaking the bank.
Thanks for coming by Jason
1 free Egg-Wich

A friend had recommended this place and had been wanting to trying their dessert. The dessert was good. I love ube, so this was a nice treat! The cake was a little dry. I wish it was a bit more moist. I think it would've been great if they topped the  cake in sweetened condensed milk! The rice crispy cereal was a little random, but I did like that it provided the crunch. Their menu looked intriguing, but I unfortunately didn't get anything other than the dessert. I will definitely have to come back and visit! The service was great. The cashier was super nice and welcoming. Our orders arrived super quick!
Thank you for the great review. I’ll share your complements with the crew.

EVERY SINGLE THING WE ORDERED WAS GASP-LEVEL GOOD And for a close second place, it was super affordable. Check in on Yelp for a delicious pork belly egg sandwich.  We got the loaded fries, and my kids gobbled the garlic fried rice and cheeseburger.  Would eat here every day, no problem.  Staff is unbelievable, vibe is cool.
Thank you for the review. It means a lot to all of us. See u next time. I’ll share with the crew.

We came here today after work after seeing some cool spots on Yelp and wanted to check them out. Flip Sigi was at the top of my list. Fusion Filipino? Yes!! Located on a corner of a busy street, the restaurant itself wasn't too busy so we got a whole booth to ourselves. The waitress there was so so nice, and her energy made the experience all the better!  The menu is pretty small and the prices were very inexpensive, perfect place to go if you're looking for smaller portions. (I say small, but they're actually the perfect size for me!) We tried: Dan Dan noods, sinigang fries, chicken adobo tacos and pork belly bun. I enjoyed everything except the Dan Dan noodles, sadly! I probably hyped it up so much for myself, as it looked really good in the pictures. I felt like the noodles were a bit undercooked and the flavour wasn't hitting for me. But that didn't affect my experience at all. My fav was definitely the pork belly bun! I'll be back to try the other items! (And for the good vibes and unlimited fountain soda)

Was a really good meal, especially given I was hungover. Got a bunch of things and shared. Fries were great and had some type of vinegar seasoning- ketchup was different but awesome. Burger was solid but wouldn't order it again. The star of the show was the short rib birra tacos. So delicious and could tell the meat was smoked for a long time - full of flavor. Cali burrito was also a solid thing and would order it again. Word to the wise the Cali burritos are BOGO on mondays. Great experience I'll be back there again soon. Ps. It's BYO booze

The pork belly bao was pretty tasty but the pork was kinda dry. I did like the sauce !  The fries really disappointed me.  They were bland , didn't have any seasoning as far as I can tell and didn't taste homemade and were soft.  They do come with a small banana ketchup and their special sauce which was good.  I don't think I'll make a special trip there nor order delivery again.  .

Cali Burrito ($10): oh mannnn this is good! When I first opened the container, I was a bit surprised by how small (length wise) the burrito is, but it's actually quite stuffed, especially with the protein, so no complaints. Worthhhh. I haven't enjoyed such a good burrito in a long time! The crispy pork belly and the chicken here is realllly good. In fact, the chicken was so juicy and flavorful that I thought I was eating carnitas. Yummm. Crispy melted cheese plus fries are also such a great addition in this Short Rib Birria Taco ($5.25): the Filipino style birria tacos - the taco shells are sooo firm and crispy omg. They didn't break, has a great crunch, and the short rib is delicious. These tacos are flat and there's also not much in terms of toppings but it's hella juicy Longanisa Birria Taco ($4): not the biggest fan of the sweetness in this one

I am so happy we went here while visiting NY. Everything on the menu looked so good! My favorites are the Birrias and pork bun!  The service was great! They were all helpful and nice. I would definitely come back and try the other items!
So happy u enjoyed everything. Thx for coming thru Arianne. And thanks for taking the time to review! See u next time

A fun little spot to try! It's Filipino but kinda fusion. I had a DP burger which was super tasty and also tried the pork belly buns and the poutine. All were very flavorful. Definitely a casual place, but a good place to hang out with friends.
Thx Alyce! Looking forward to seeing u and your friends again soon

This place has a very cool concept and I'm a sucker for good fusion food combos. I was in a rush so I dropped in quickly and everyone at the restaurant was kind enough to be very quick with my food. The service is great and everyone there Is extremely kind. They have a cute outdoor seating area where they will bring the food out to you and it's a nice bustling west village spot. A great fast casual spot!  I got the Dan Dan noodles with an egg on top that were nice and spicy. They add a lot of green onions which I personally loved. One caveat I will give is the noodles are pretty spicy so if you can't handle spice don't get them because it might be too much and opt for their other bowls instead.
Thx for taking the time to give us some stars. It really helps these days. Hope we see u ’round.

Amazing!! This is my first time trying Filipino food (or Filipino fusion?) and I am so amazed. We got the Cali Burrito and the breakfast Egg Sandwich with pork belly. The way they cook the pork belly is sooo good. It's so crispy but still soft and juicy, blends so well with the eggs. It melts in your mouth! I personally liked the egg sandwich better than the burrito. The burrito is good - which I expected anything stuffed with fries to taste good. But that egg sandwich just hits differently... you gotta come try it! Gonna come back to try the burgers next time. Also did I mention their staff members are also super friendly and they also have many outdoor seating space?? You can also check-in on Yelp for a surprise. :)
Thx fir the love Anna!
1 free Egg-Wich

*ordered delivery so can only comment on food* nothing beats a hot, flavorful bowl of pho on a cold day. we ordered the house special pho and it did not disappoint. honestly wished i had ordered 3 more bowls of just the beef broth. also had the shaking beef, which was delicious but ended up just eating most of my boyfriend's pho. it's pretty hard to find solid viet food in Brooklyn but will definitely be back for more!
Cash only.  The ATM they direct you to is broken.  Drop the cash post COVID, pretty awful way to start a meal at a very clean NYC ATM in the first place.

Came here on a Friday evening. Restaurant is small and cozy. Each party is separate by a plastic barrier to maintain distance as per covid protocols. Ordered the lemongrass chicken pho. It was aromatic and delicious. Very filling and perfect pick me up on a cold night in NYC.  Highly recommend.

Surprised that I haven't left a review here yet, as it was always tradition to grab dinner here before an event at Barclays (pre pandemic). I finally returned last Saturday even though I didn't have an event - I was just craving pho! And 5ive Spice is definitely one of the best spots in Brooklyn for it. I got the Beef pho ($12) while my bf got the 5ive special pho ($17) and added an egg for an extra $2. We forgot how big these bowls were - it felt like there was actually more protein than noodles (no complaints there) and I couldn't even finish my bowl so I brought home the last several bites. Amazing.  We also got an order of the beer battered fish tacos (2 for $9.50) which were just as yummy and messy as I remember. I personally prefer the traditional style of banh xeo (and wish that they served it here!) but the tacos are a unique menu item that you can't find anywhere else. We each got a Viet Iced Coffee ($4/each) that we couldn't finish as well, bringing home almost one full cup after combining our leftovers (lol). We also shared a lemongrass porkchop banh mi ($10) which was deeelicious - the bread was so fresh. We also ate one half of this, and brought the other half home. Yes we may have over-ordered, but the value of the food here is great - not overpriced and the portions are generous. The only thing to note is that this was our first time sitting at the high chairs/table and unfortunately it was a bit awkward since we were sitting side by side, and were directly facing another couple... there was a black bar across the table that kind of separated us from them, but it still seemed like we were a bit too close for comfort. Even our server got our orders mixed up, thinking the 4 of us were together, and then accidentally swapping our banh mi orders (they got the traditional, we got the porkchop - they didn't realize they received our porkchop until they were halfway through the sandwich). Perhaps each couple should've sat across from each other instead, but I think it would've still been awkward with that black bar across the table. Not a great table for couples and a bit tricky for sharing if you are with a party of 4. Still, it's one of my favorite spots for dine-in Vietnamese food. Always look forward to coming back!

5ive Spice will not dissapoint. Browsing the drool worthy pics on Yelp, we decided to order the Beer Battered Fish Tacos (Banh Xeo), the Braised Short Rib Banh Mi and the Beer Battered  Banh Mi.  For starters, we began the Spring Rolls and Vietnamese Iced Coffees. The Vietnamese Iced Coffee is a MUST get! Imagine strong Vietnamese brewed coffee with just the right amount of added condensed milk.  The boldnest of the coffee and the sweet creaminess of the condensed milk emotes notes of rich dark chocolate note and finishes with light sweetness without being overly creamy. The Spring Rolls are on point and are unlike no other spring rolls from other Viet food places. Inside the spring rolls is a nice mix of pork with shrimp, wrapped around a light and crispy skin. The addition of the shrimp lightens the meatiness of the pork.  Served with fish sauce, romaine, pickled veg and mint, these are banging. The Beer Battered Fish that were  inside the Tacos and Banh Mi were nothing exciting but the accompanying bean sprouts, pickled veg, mint, cilantro and fried shallot garnish adds dimensions of brightness, sweet, sour and textures. The Cocnut Rice Crepes that were used as the taco shell were crisp but not crunchy crispy on the upper edges but the bottom side was soggy.   The Braised Short Rib in the Banh Mi was beefy in flavor and tender. The meat was seasoned lightly. Fully assembled, the Banh Mi was savory yet bright from the pineapple coulis, bean sprouts and basil.  All in all, 5ive Spice was a great experience and will visit again. With so many great reviews for the. The Pho and Bun, these are in our sights for our next visit!! Notes: -On the corner of 5th and Bergen St. -Outdoor seating is limited and fills up quickly during busy times -Indoor seating is available. Need to show vaccination card to dine-in. -Take-out is very popular -Scan the QR code in the restaurant for the menu - 2 locations: Brooklyn (Park Slope), LES (Mulberry)
Pretty tasty food for a pretty food price! I wish they were more explicit about cash only so they don't surprise customers like us when the check comes and we have to go hunt for an ATM.

My favorite viet spot in NYC omg I love this place so much that I ended up going again literally the day after I tried it for the first time... oops... 5ive Spice has such incredible classic Vietnamese noodle dishes such as pho, bun/vermicelli, rice dishes, banh mi sandwiches, and rolls! A unique offering of theirs is also Banh Xeo tacos where the shell of the taco is a viet rice crepe and you can choose your meat for the filling. Most dishes are in the $10-$20 range. HIGHLY recommend their 5ive Special Pho!!! The broth here is simmered for 12 hours and it tastes so flavorful and hearty. It comes with beef and short ribs and the meat is so tender.  I am also obsessed with their Lemongrass Chicken Bun / Vermicelli Salad bowl! The chicken is grilled to perfection and well seasoned. I love to get it over half rice noodle half salad because I love my veggies and the ones served here taste fresh and light, perfectly pairing with the grilled protein heh. I could eat this every day.  Honestly I've tried a lot of their menu offerings and you really can't go wrong with anything because it's all just so good. I also love their Mango Papaya salad app and the veggie pho!
