Sara, Thank you Pal for your mouth-watering and thoughtful feedback. We love hearing that both the BBQ Chicken and Chicken Burger pizzas were five-star and that you enjoyed the expanded dining area. We look forward to serving you next time you are in town.

This place has over a thousand reviews and 4 1/2 stars, I thought this place was going to have a quality pizza and wings, but I guess not. I was so disappointed and mad with the quality and over priced food. I don't know where they got the positive reviews from.  Personal opinion: I believe they got the positive reviews from the Arabic community. I noticed it in another restaurant near the area. Near perfect reviews but the food is crap and I love Arab food. A three star in Yelp that's what I think they deserve.

Hi Mauricio,  We appreciate you coming down to the pizzeria and are sorry to hear that you didn't have a five-star experience. Had we known on the spot that you were not happy with your order, we would have made things right. I will DM you here on Yelp to follow up directly with you regarding your recent visit. If you could kindly reply so I can further look into your visit. Thank you.
My sister ordered Brisket pizza.  Sooo good. First time trying it and I LOVED IT. Honestly worth trying.
Kimberly,  A BiG thank you to you and your sis for sharing the five-star Brisket pizza love!
I placed my order at 4:34 on their website for delivery. It's already 6:09 and I did not receive it and it not going to be delivered. Place is amazing and has great food tho.

Yousef,  We strive for all of our guests to have an all-around five-star experience. Please accept our sincere apologies for your recent delivery experience. We have shared your review with the third-party delivery, our team, and management. Your feedback is taken seriously. We hope to have another opportunity to serve you in the future. We would like to follow up directly with you to make things right. If you can kindly reply to our DM. Again, our genuine apologies.Thank you.

Ordered the Supreme and Garlic Chicken also the Spicy BBQ Wing's  Overall the flavors were there. They dice the veggies. I thought the Halal concept was a nice touch. Overall enjoyed my meal at Big Al. They have a separate seating are for their expansion.
Caes,  You rock Pal! Thanks for coming down to the pizzeria and sharing the love with your photos, four stars and thoughtful feedback.

Wow the pizza here is so good, it had critical food eaters (my mom) even wowed.  I got the half and half pizza. You can't do more than half and half, so don't let the pic of the pizza you see on here with many flavor slices fool you bc you can't get that. You can only get 2 flavors max for 1 pizza. Tried the Lebanese  chicken and pineapple brisket and it is SO good. I can't wait to go back and try more.  Also, I got their cinnamon crunch cheesecake. Sooooo good, recommend.

Sarah, We are winning today! We passed your mom's test and earned your five star recommendation. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your BiG AL'S experience and tasty cheesecake photo. Looking forward to serving you and your mom again soon!

PIZZA DEBATE:  Do pineapples go on pizza ? I'm a firm No, but for some reason my mom and cousins love fruit on pizza.  *** Luckily Big Al's Pizzeria was serving B.P.E (Big Pizza Energy) and their wings . Shout out to my friend for the recommendation because they did not disappoint.  *** WhileUAreHere do your self a service and try their sweet + spicy wings. Sooo good.

Dwynn, A BIG thank you Pal & a double high five for your five stars and tasty photos. The great pineapple on pizza debate continues... LOL! We loved hearing that your pizzeria experience was a win for both team pineapple (Your Mom & cousins) and your team no fruit on pizza. So glad you felt the "B.P.E (Big Pizza Energy)" as you so well phrased. Hope to see you again soon for more Sweet n Spicy wings & B.P.E.!

Undoubtedly the BEST pizza I have ever had. You're obviously paying for quality here. The premium ingredients used here are noticeable and flavorful! I thought it was a bit expensive at first but it is definitely worth noting this pizza is not like any average pizza!
Alec,  High five Pal and thank you for your five star review. We are so happy to hear that it was "Undoubtedly the BEST pizza...ever." and that you could taste the difference!

Absolutely delicious pizza.   As a New York native I can say that I was impressed.  I would recommend to everyone. I had the smoked brisket and Carne Asada. I made my order online and it was ready when I came in.  All the employees were really nice, and the store was really clean.  Thank you for the delicious meal.

Oscar, We really earned your five pizza stars since you are a NY native. An extra thank you Pal! Your recommendation is greatly appreciated. As is your acknowledgment of our friendly team, clean store and your ease of ordering online. Of course, the true love goes to your half and half pizza, Smoked Brisket and Carne Asada. We are so happy to hear it was 5/5 on the pizza scale.
No Fees
Pick up in  45-55  mins
1 free Drink of your choice

WOW THIS IS OUR NEW FAVORITE PIZZA PLACE. We got the half Lebanese chicken pizza and half jalapeño burger pizzas. I love that they let you do that. Both sides of the pizza had little pickled bits, which really cut into the heaviness of pizza. It's small things like this that let you know there was a true food mastermind behind these recipes. We also got the lemon pepper wings, which come in a bath of oil. The oil drips off, and the lemon pepper wings were delicious. They aren't a dry fry or a wet wing. Also, the wings come by the pound so they were some big wings!! Seriously, my husband kept saying that he loved the crust. He isn't crazy, the crust and quality of the dough is great.  As for covid precautions, everyone was masked. There are two registers. Heads up, I didn't see markers on the ground which meant that me and some other patrons who arrived at the same time awkwardly congregated. They were super fast, though. As soon as I said my name someone passed me my food while I waited for the transaction to go through. It's good that they have systems to keep from getting slammed!!

Grace,  A BiG thank you for taking the time to share your BiG AL'S experience. We so appreciate your thoughtful and detailed review. It is music to our ears that both you and your husband enjoyed your half Lebanese Garlic Chicken pizza and half Bacon Jalapeño Burger pizzas, Lemon Pepper wings & even the pizza crust. We look forward to serving you again soon!

2/19/2021 - Friday  Friday's are the busiest! Especially when it is just Takeout. I was craving for some halal pizza after a long time and told my dad to bring some home which is 43 miles from home, but so worth it!  We ordered 3 Large Pizzas for 6 people I know that's a lot but we couldn't resist! We ordered the: *Lebanese Garlic Chicken Pizza  *Beef Bacon Jalapeño Burger Pizza *Cheesy Bread with Marinara Sauce  *extra Ranch Sauce(best to eat with your Pizza)  First time tried the Bacon Burger Pizza and we loved it! Lebanese Garlic Chicken Pizza will always be number 1. Always Fresh! Can't wait to try their other kinds of Pizza Specialties Soon!

One of the Best Halal Pizzas to go and enjoy their famous Lebanese Garlic Chicken.  * we came in and they have finally expanded there restaurant  * where you order is separate from the seating area * a lot more space then the last fivE years ago * seating area is very clean * we ordered Lebanese Garlic Chicken  * Buffalo Flavor Wings * Lemon Pepper Wings  Later on we thought  1 Lebanese Garlic Chicken Pizza would be enough for 5 people but we were wrong  * our friends orderEd half Lebanese Garlic Chicken and half BBQ Chicken Pizza  I'm not fond of sweet pizza it also had pineapple on it and I was like No Way!, but my mom didn't enjoy it either I just can't mix savory with sweet at all.  * Next time will love to try the Jalapeño Bacon Cheeseburger that sounds delicious  * Eating Fresh at the restaurant is better than eating at home  Please try this Halal Pizza Place out you won't regret it :)
You guys really need to have a sign up about your dining room. Best pizza in the area. You got to try the carna asada pizza
Jan, Thank you Pal for your five star recommendation of the pizzeria. We really appreciate your feedback and have taken that into consideration and will be implementing soon!

Without exaggeration, this place has probably the best pizza my wife and I have ever had. We will be back anytime we are in the area. Protip: get the Big Al's Supreme pizza. You will be hard pressed to find anything that tastes better. Only thing I took off was mushrooms. As a final note, their wings are also exceptional. The "Sweet and Spicy" sauce is the way to go for their wings. We'll be back soon!

Rodrigo,  Wow, thank you so much for your generous five stars and feedback! We are delighted it's the best pizza you and your wife have ever had. Very much look forward to serving you both again soon.
The food is delicious, the staff is friendly and the place is clean.  Too bad that I live so far but truly love their brisket and carne asada pizza.

My favorite pizzas there are the carne asada pizza and the brisket pizza.  I normally don't like wings but their Red Dragon wings are delicious and the skin is crunchy not soggy.  Just try it once and I bet you will enjoy their food.  Service has always been good.

Ordered takeout. They are known for their unique pizza. I got the half BBQ chicken(without pineapple) and half lebanese garlic chicken. The lebanese garlic chicken was definitely unique. The turnips and pickles added a crunchy refreshing texture. I do wish it was a bit more garlicky.  I definitely liked the BBQ chicken more. The sweet tangy BBQ sauce went well with the red onion, cilantro and ranch. Very flavorful.  I really liked their crust. It had both the crispy baked texture but also was very fluffy on the inside. Usually I don't end up eating the crust or I have to dip is in ranch but the crust itself was tasty.  I think I will be back to try their beef brisket next.  Beware though. They seem to be really busy and it was hard to get through on the phone. I was told the wait is anywhere between 45-90min.

Eriko, A BiG thank you for your sharing your BiG AL’S experience! Delighted that enjoyed your Half and Half Signature pizza. Your combo of BBQ Chicken & Lebanese Garlic Chicken are absolutely drool worthy! It’s music to our ears to hear you did dip your pizza crust, it didn’t meet the sad fate of most pizza crust lol! We look forward to serving you again soon for the Beef Brisket.  You can order online directly @  bigalspizzeria.com  & skip the line to reduce your wait during peak times.

Me and my battle buddies came here after a long week of training and I have to say it was some of the best pizza we had. A well deserved lunch this was. Everything about this pizza was amazing from the proportions of sauces, meat and veggies to how well baked the pizza dough was. I will be coming back here next time I'm in town.!

Maurice, The smile on your face says it all! We SO appreciate you and your buddies coming to dine with us after your long week of training. Delighted to hear that everyone enjoyed their food as well as the balance of flavors, proportions of toppings and the crust. It's our pleasure to serve you and your buddies next time you are in town. Another thanks for sharing the great photo.

Y'all, this place slaps. I've had my fair share of pizza places before, but this? Big Al's takes the cake. I took a bite of this pizza (half Buffalo ranch and half carne asada [and wings and Oreo strawberry cheesecake]) and it cured me of my circumstantial depression: it was THAT good. I will be coming back, hands down- I don't write many reviews but this place was so good that it warrants it. It's in Maywood, CA, so depending on where you live, you may want to call your order in so it's ready when you arrive and you can dine in with them. It was about a 30 minute wait but it was more than worth it.

Corey, Thank you so much Pal for your thoughtful review and five star recommendation. We appreciate that you took the time to share your BiG AL'S experience esp considering that you don't write reviews often. So darn happy to hear that your Half and Half Pizza, Wings and Strawberry Oreo Cheesecake  provided you with culinary delight and eased mental anguish We look forward to serving you again soon. You can always pre-order @www.BiGALSPizzeria.com and you will get an ETA pick up confirmation via email once you place your order.

This place is amazing, came in on my birthday and got the best service from Anthony. If you haven't yet, you have to check out their Instagram for daily reminders of why you should come back every weekend. Everything tastes as amazing as it looks. Absolute meat lovers dream, highly recommend, keep killing it guys!

Tanner, A BiG thank you for dining with us on your birthday, so happy to hear it was five out of five meat lovers heaven. We will pass your praise onto our wonderful manager, Anthony! Here's to a wonderful year ahead Pal, your five stars are greatly appreciated.

Update, update, update... The Lebanese garlic chicken pizza from Big Al's is so good!  I finally tried it on 9/26/20. A personal size is $17.18.  While that is a bit steep, trust me, this pizza is made with serious love. No skimping on toppings. All fresh.  The owner is the coolest dude in Maywood f-ing California. Raising the 4 stars to 5. Easy.

With "the rocket's red glare, the bombs bursting in air" Fourth of July 2020 style, my little family - when all four of us were still together - felt hunger pangs like no other. We had been watching fireworks (even as they were all pretty much illegal) all around us from a rooftop nearby when I remembered I had bookmarked Big Al's Pizzeria what seemed ages ago. I submitted an order via the GrubHub app at 7:15PM. While our order took quite a bit longer than anticipated to come out, the wait was worth it. Received a $5 PayPal promo code that brought my grand total down to $30.25. Still fairly pricey for a smoked beef brisket sub sandwich ($14.31) and a large beef pepperoni pizza ($17.88). The brisket sandwich was all I had to eat that night. It was finger-licking good, however, the "Spicy Call'em BBQ Sauce" wasn't all that spicy to me.  So I will have to go back for pizza, however, the Lebanese garlic chicken pie sounds way more intriguing than a single topping pepperoni.  USDA Certified Halal meat. Plenty of free parking in a shared lot. During COVID-19, masks for takeout are required and only one customer  allowed inside at a time.  Nice crew working that night. Thanks!
No Fees
Pick up in  45-55  mins
1 free Drink of your choice

No matter how many times I come to Salsa and Beer, I always have mad love for this place. Please bring your vaccination card to ensure a smooth time coming in! Salsa and Beer proportions are unlike any other restaurant I've been to. Yeah, the items do get pricy. But the servings are basically two meals, so you're saving money in the long run. I got their Asada Burrito which comes with a delicious red sauce over it with a side of beans, Mexican rice, little salad and some sour cream. There's a separate area where you can get your salsa buffet style. The meat is so juicy and the salsa was so flavorful. The pico de gallo is such a nice touch to balance the heavy taste of the dish.

I am shocked by these reviews.   This Mexican food was not terrible, but it was subbparr.  And this is after going not ONCE but multiple times hoping that maybe I just ordered the wrong type of dish because holey smokes there is always a long line of people waiting to be seated so it must be worth it, right? CONS_______________________ 1. LOW QUALITY MEXICAN FOOD - In Los Angeles, we are so fortunate to have a plethora of delicious Mexican food available.  Salsa & Beer does not meet the minimum line of selling tasty and fulfilling dishes. And the whole point of eating out is to have an appetizing,  high grade meal.  I recommend definitely NOT getting the burritos (oversalted) nor the salad (it's like requesting a salad from del taco or taco bell).  If you're going to go to Salsa & Beer no matter what then order the shrimp fajitas. Also, I would stick with water because the horchata and jamaica have way too much sugar in them.  2. LONG WAIT - If you want to dine in, expect to wait 45 minutes to an hour before you're even allowed to walk into the vicinity.  3. SLOW SERVICE - You really have to try to flag someone down. In my most recent visit, I had to get up and head towards the hostess station to ask for water and this was after our table was waiving our hands trying to get the attention of our waiter... it was about 25 minutes before I got up and asked someone else.  4. COCKROACH IN TAKE OUT BOX  - The last time I went was with my family. We ordered some take out.  My brother was the one to notice whilst he was eating at home that there was a roach in his meal.  PROS______________________ 1. COMPETITIVE PORTION-SIZE - Nowadays, as a consumer, we get less and less for what we pay.  The portion sizes here are decent. You could share your meal.  2. STYLISH RESTAURANT - Although this is a pro, having a nice looking restaurant is nothing without good food and efficient service (which Salsa & Beer lacks).  CONCLUSION_____________ *I do not recommend Salsa & Beer.  The food here has more misses than hits. And even when the food is a "hit" it's still not mouthwatering, it's just okay food.  I gave it a 2/5 but I really wanted to give it a 1/5; however, the cockroach in my food was probably (hopefully) just a one-time unlucky situation.

If you want a meal that will last you four days, delicious and reasonably priced, come to this place! By pure coincidence, someone recommended this place so we can avoid the LA traffic. And who knew that I would find a good Mexican food in North Hollywood? They have a parking lot in the back and street parking is also available. Quick service and some friendly staff. I am just not a fan of having a self-service salsa bar despite being given gloves for handling the ladles. But it still makes people congregate in one section. I still recommend trying this place Put and would return if I'm ever in the neighborhood.

I can see why the line for this place is always long. The food is delicious, portions are huge and the price is cheap. My michelada was made really well. The bean dip for the chips is very good. For my entree i had the creamy chicken fajita and had to stop myself from eating the entire thing. I brought leftovers home, warned them in the air fryer and they were still delicious. I'd for sure come here again.

You know when you walk into a joint after getting a primo parking spot and can hear the late great Selena beating over the speaker system  it's going to be a good experience and nothing beats the experience at the Salsa & Beer of North Hollywood (Sun Valley adjacent). Located just down the street from Home Depot and Public Storage near the intersection of Sherman Way and Lankershim this authentic Latinx restaurant of mega portions, beer and the perfect margaritas is definitely where you want to go to enjoy an experience. You'll be seated right away whether at one of their two bar seating locations, at a table or booth. The have complimentary chips and dip and an epic self serve salsa bar with containers which are great for to go as you might not finish this jumbo plate of eats. The Vegetarian Burrito (with no sour cream, cheese or ranchera sauce is my default) go to but they also have grilled potato tacos, salads, sides and a bean and cheese burrito option that can all be made more plant based friendly or already are by default. Modifications are super easy and they always accommodate.  The combination plates seem to be the favorite for most as you get an entree dish with two sides and a salad. I would definitely partake if they ever add a more vegan friendly option to their constantly growing and expanding menu. The famous  house Margaritas are a must, especially blended and even more especially Raspberry, Strawberry and Mango... Pineapple can hangout too. Make sure you get that chilli powder/tajin rim also.... Muy feugo! I can't say enough great things about S&B numero dos... Even the parking attendant on duty is just as warm and friendly as your host, hostess and as much as our amazing server.  We were greeted the moment we walked in and and thanked highly for or late lunch/dinner experience here on our way out by all the staff near the door. Te amo Salsa y Cerveza! Be back soon!

This is literally the best Mexican food I have ever had. The bean dip with the chips is insanely good and the portions are massive. I'd avoid appetizers since they give chips and dip. I strongly recommend you come here.

Food is good, wait time is horrendous. Definitely not worth a two hour wait, plus they don't take reservations. It's been years since I've been and I won't be back atleast to this location. There is no reason you should be waiting 2 hours to be seated

SPECTACULAR SHRIMP FAJITAS =========================== My friend wanted to take me to Salsa & Beer for awhile now as we both love good Mexican food.  We are a bit burned out on local places, so we went there on June 23, 2021. I knew right off the bat I would be ordering the shrimp fajitas after reading other Yelp reviews.  Jill told me they are always really busy too so we decided to go right when they open at 11:00 a.m..  We arrived at least fifteen minutes before they opened and there was already two people in line.   Jill and I decided to split an order of the shrimp fajitas that comes with rice, beans and a little guacamole.  We made a mistake when we ordered the skinny Cadillac margaritas.  They were alright, but we should have just ordered a regular ones.  We'll try to get our husbands to go when we can figure out a good time. Tip: I highly recommend going the back route from the Crescenta Valley if you are in the Foothills.  Take the 210 West, Exit La Tuna Canyon, head south to Lankershim Blvd. and turn left on Sherman Way.  So much easier than dealing with the 2 Freeway, 134 West and 170 North.

Parking, horrible. Service, mediocre. Fajitas, delicious.  When I tell you the fajitas were sizzling, I mean they were LOUD hahaha  It was tricky finding parking around here since their parking lot was full/closed? but the fajitas were so good. I think it came out to about 18 dollars but it was an unreal amount of food. You're definitely going to have leftovers for lunch the next day unless you're sharing.  The wait and the service were mehhh but I'd be willing to give it another try.

In my visit, I was not surprised. The main room Somewhat traditional and not very showy. But I did like the temporary installation outside, the parking area, since due to the covid-19 pandemic they had to improvise and that has been good. As for the menu, personally too large the portions, and if for most people that is the best part. Unfortunately, my chosen option did not taste as good, very spicy. My companions, out of 5 of us, 3 found it very good food.
Super yummy! I always come here and the service is great! They get super packed and the parking lot is super small so make sure to be ready to wait. The Zacatecas fajitas are also amazing!!

Salsa & beer is such a good spot! The prices are reasonable and the portions are massive. Parking can be tough but it's worth it. The service is always mediocre at best but the food makes up for it.  My favorite is the Guadalajara fajitas! Comes with chicken, steak and shrimp topped with a spicy sauce. And of course the traditional fajita fixings of onions and peppers and 3 tortillas of choose! I always ask for extra to have with my leftovers! It is also served with a side of rice, beans, guacamole and a tomato salsa.  They have this bean dip that's served with warms chips at the beginning that is absolutely amazing. As well as their margaritas!

The customer service here was really good. The waiters were attentive and they had free parking with an attendant who guided you to park. The fajitas were mediocre but the dips, sauces, and a margaritas were perfect. I can see this place being super packed with a line on weekends but we were able to get seated right a way without any wait at all.  I would like to go back and try something different but I don't recommend the fajitas from my personal taste buds but someone else may beg to differ. Everyone I encountered was very friendly and inviting.  The exterior setup was nice and creative. They also had heaters to keep guests warm bc nights in Cali can be very breezy lol. Nonetheless, give this place a try

This place is amazing! I have been here twice (I live in San Diego) and I have tasted quite a bit of their menu, and still just amazed. I got here right before 11 am, when they open their doors, and there was a line out around the corner. This place does very well.. By the entrance there is a salsa bar where you can go get as much salsa as your little heart desires. And each one is VERY tasty! Today we ordered a combination plate with taquitos and shredded beef enchiladas, and a carne asada & grilled shrimp plate. Everything was fabulously plated, cooked and seasoned. Great food. Our waitress was very attentive, as well. I will continue to come here anytime I am in the vicinity! Yup!!

This was my first and last!!!!I am  sorry but I don't understand why a lot of people come here maybe because they put a looot of food !!!!! when You see the plate the hungry goes away it is too much but ok ok what about the flavor, I am Mexican and this food is not authentic Mexican food not flavor at all . my carnitas really dry the molcajete wasn't on a molcajete they was on a fajitas plate margarita no flavor I am sorry but I stick with la barca or el Ranchito  from HP

A great to go place but don't expect to get in on the spur of the moment. Their login app is wonderful snd their greeting staff work very hard to seat you on time. The best part other than great food is their salsa bar. You would me amiss if you didn't try any of their homemade sslsa's

After almost a year of not coming to salsa and beer I finally gave in to my craving. Due to COVID I hadn't wanted to come because it's a 1 hour drive and i thought the food would be cold by the time I arrived back home but I finally decided to go buy food. I called ahead of time so my food would be ready when I arrived. It was ready within 45 min and their COVID safety is really good. They have all the to go bags packed and you just give them your name and they hand you your items. I definitely miss dinning in there but I guess for now I have to settle with take out until I feel comfortable enough to eat out again.

I love this place! I really enjoy coming to this place because the food is delicious. The drinks are good too. I always get the steak fajitas, it's a big portion. You get the tray of fajitas and then a plate with beans, rice, and guacamole.They give you a lot of food and I can never finish it but I have food to take home.  The only downside to this place is the wait time. The first time I came, I arrived at around 12pm and it took an hour to be seated. After that we learned the lesson and since they open at 11 am we are there 20min before they open. If you arrive anytime after 11:30 then you will probably have to wait an hour.  They have a parking lot behind the restaurant, depending on what time you arrive then you might not find parking.

This restaurant has really gone down hill. First I want to say my husband and I would come here all the time since 2013. I've been their when they were jam packed and was still provided with amazing service, food, and drinks.  Yesterday was our first time back since the pandemic started. Everything was horrible. Food wasn't no where near as good as it use to be, the margaritas sucked, salsa bar sucked, and service was horrible (besides the bus boy, he was amazing and was doing the waitress job pretty much). My daughter chesse enchilada plate was burnt. Mine and my husband combo fajita plate had HUGE pieces of veggies. Like the prep person in the kitchen doesn't give a @$%*. The fajita plate had no flavor. We ordered a chicken tortilla soup and our soup had no chicken and tortilla but HUGE pieces of veggies. Like come on cut and prep right. Also they never brought us spoons so we can eat our soup. I had to walk to the host in the front for a spoon and it took her 10mins to bring back two plastic spoons. They were never like this. Mind you it wasn't packed/busy at all when we went on a Thursday @5pm.  I ordered a mango margarita but our waitress gave me a peach one. I was waiting for her to come check on us so they can remake my drink. She never came by so I decided to drink it. When she came by 25mins later I asked for a pineapple margarita. She brings me back a lime margarita. I had to hunt down our waitress so she can tell the bar to remake my drink. She takes my drink back. When she comes back it's the same lime margarita and they added pineapple juice.  Salsas were horrible. No flavor what so ever and their salsa were bomb as hell before!  They also charge a 4% fee for using plastic. They never ever did that before. Also our waitress seemed like she didn't want to be their or work. Definitely won't be coming back. It's sad because this places use to be one of my favorite restaurants in SFV, it's definitely not the same as it use to be.
5 stars to the one on Sherman Way.  Best Mexican food I have ever had.  Yes the wait is long but IMO it's worth it.  Oh how I wished they would serve breakfast.  Bet it would be amazing.

This place is amazing. Delicious margaritas and food all at affordable prices. Plates are huge and are easily shareable. My husband and I shared the chicken, shrimp and steak fajitas and it was incredible. Margs were also on point. Don't just walk here - run. And make sure to get there early because there is always a wait.  Also, I love that all of the vaccinated staff where pins to say they are vaccinated.

*Reservation Option Available +Vaccine Card Request FIRST TIME HERE: Sunday Nov, 28th 2021 around 8PM We didn't have a reservation so wait time was about 30-40min * Plenty of seating outside to wait * In door & out door seating  * Bar * Paid Parking We sat inside our waiter was "Jaime" Friendly guy Food: Was Delicious, Flavorful, Amazing Mole for sure & I love the idea of complimentary Chips & Mole.  Staff: Attentive  Unfortunately, I found a hair on my plate :( So I couldn't really enjoy my food as I would've wanted...you know that uneasy feeling after. I didn't want my husband to know so he could enjoy his food, but couldn't keep him. One thing I really appreciated - Jaime, did an amazing job handling my concern, I appreciated his service and just for that I'd like to come back and give it another shot and try more plate options.

I would actually give this restaurant a 4.5 rating. The mole is very good. Our party of three split the Festival de Moles for $35 and enjoyed it. Ideally, you want to make a reservation for dinner weeks in advance. Both times I came here there was a 20 to 30 minute wait.

Disclaimer: I am not a big fan of mole and I think this is what this place is mainly known for Parking- a lot right behind the restaurant...we didn't see any street parking available...a valet will park your car for $7 Location- it wasn't beautiful or updated in any way but had a clean authentic feel to it Staff- the people who greet you as you come in and take you to your seat were friendly and made a good first impression; our waiter was attentive without feeling intrusive Food- we ordered the mole sampler which comes with 4 different moles and rice and tortillas...mole is just not my thing...the lightest one was the best tasting; we also ordered the tlayuda which we thought was really good...it has a crispy base and three meets on top to eat it with...this is something that is easly shareable with a couple people; the chips were served with what I think was a mole and cheese on top and were different and pretty good Drinks- the jamaica was tasty and natural tasting; the pina colada was $1 more on the bill then what the menu said but I didn't feel like complaining for a $1...it was delicious Prices: overall, I just feel like everything is about 20% more expensive than what you think and lunch for 2 was over $100

The feeling of true Mexican cuisine while not having to leave the states. Guelaguetza was actually recommended by my girlfriends professor. And it was well worth the trip. Never having mole i didn't know what to expect and with that being said I am no professional in the mole field, but I will say for my first time, I wouldn't have wanted to try from anywhere other than Guelaguetza. It was very flavorful and enjoyable. Came for lunch and got the sampler. It was more than enough food for my girlfriend and I. We left full and content. Four different moles which came with a very yummy large fresh tortilla as well as a side of rice. It was a fun experience and allowed for me to expand my food horizons. It doesn't get much more authentic than here. The service was attentive and passionate  for what they do as if you ask for recommendations or what something is they explain everything with pride and detail. Much recommended for an authentic Mexican bites

After taking a brief 3wk sojourn from my restaurant reviews, your diligent culinary correspondent returns, his eyes + appetite laser focused on the Oaxacan sensation Guelaguetza, a Family run restaurant recently awarded the LA Times prestigious "Restaurant of the Year" honor.  Though Guelaguetza rocketed straight to the top of our "restaurant bucket list" the moment I read its effusive review in the Times, it took beautiful wife + I a moment to make the 35 mile trek from Diamond Bar.  ... But the worth was well worth it!!  You arrive to valet parking off the restaurants Irolo Street entrance- In this heavily compressed neighborhood where parking is as precious as gold, trust me- Pay the $7 for the valet parking.  Guelaguetza welcomes it's guests with a bright red, cavernous box shaped restaurant, throbbing to the beat of the live bands that play every F & SAT evening.  If you arrive during "Date Night Rush Hour" (6-9pm F-SAT eves) expect to wait 75 minutes, minimum.  Or do like we did and take your meal at the well stocked bar.  For Mole lovers, Guelaguetza could well herald your Heaven on earth moment. The restaurant lavishes guests with no less than SIX handmade moles: Negro, Rojo, Estofado (stew), Verde, Coloradito and Amarilla.  Tonight we sampled the Coloradito over the warm chips. It's a savory but mild Mole that carries a sweeter than expected taste profile.  While I know it has its legions of fans, neither Leti or I were crazy for it.  The Amarilla (yellow) Mole ladled copiously over her chicken + rice entree, however, was a guaranteed showstopper! Rich, velvety, complex and savory but NOT too spicy. Excellence on a plate, guaranteed to stick to your ribs and be licked off your fingertips!  For our hard-core Mole partisans out there, we suggest the Festival de Moles, where Guelaguetza serves you its world famous black (negro), yellow (amarilla), red (rojo) and Coloradito moles over mounds of shredded chicken + rice. $35.  Oaxacan cuisine is best understood as a pre-Hispanic food, complete with huge, savory dishes like tlayudas (pizza shaped thin tortillas layered w/ ingredients), dried meats like tasajo and memelas. And yes, for the stout-hearted amongst you, you can order Oaxaxa's protein dense chapulines (grasshoppers), served plain or Mexican style (fried with jalapeño, onions, tomatoes + avocado).  Guelaguetza serves up all facets of its wonderful, complex dishes in a family friendly climate. We look forward to bringing our children and friends to this remarkable establishment!

Scott thank you so much! We truly appreciate words like yours. It fills us with so much joy and gratitude to know that you truly enjoyed your meal and experience. We look forward to having you back soon!

I really enjoyed my experience here partly due to the food and the rest due to the great service. The staff here are so friendly and accommodating. When my grandmother told our waiter she got spiced up from the chilaquiles, they brought out a small plate of fruit to help her out! So cute. And their tlayudas are so delicious and enormous. One alone could feed 2-3 people. I got mine with mole negro and egg, and I liked that the mole was really sweet, and the base was nice and crispy. I appreciate that they sliced them up like pizza, easier to eat it that way.
Thank you so much Kaya! Words like yours give us so much energy to keep going! It makes us so happy to know that you enjoyed your food and service. Can't wait to have you back!

Came here on a random Tuesday night for dinner. Guelaguetza is located on Olympic, and there is street parking available behind the restaurant. Honestly, I would not recommend parking there (safety). There is a massive valet lot that you can park in :-) This place gets very busy, even on weeknights. I recommend making a reservation. You'll need to make a reservation a couple of weeks in advance.  When you walk in, you're greeted by a gorgeous colorful interior that feels like a nice, family restaurant. Lots of big families celebrating birthdays come here. I love it. I asked my server for this recommendations (it was just me by myself and I don't eat much). He recommend the Horchata. It's a beautiful pink color with fruit and nuts I believe. Highly recommend.  I then got the Enchiladas Campesinas, which are chicken enchiladas covered in their famous mole sauce and topped with cheese. Ask for the Oaxacan cheese! It's very filling so can be shared with others. It also comes with bread and a side of rice.  Overall, I would come back to try their other traditional Oaxacan dishes! So many options!
Thank so much for your words Donna! We are so happy to know that you enjoyed your horchata and enchiladas. We can't wait to have you back!

My second time here. Still very delicious  they start you off with chips covered in Mole sauce . This restaurant is inspired by Oaxaca flavors .  They have a variety flavors of Mole ,which is one of my favorite foods.  I love their choices of appetizers that way you get a bit of everything. I really enjoyed the quesadilla frita ,has potatoes with cheese ,covered with black beans ,deep fried perfectly  Another good choice is their variety of tacos ,great way to taste different flavors ,try the memela sampler (keep in mind the tacos are homemade tortillas)  Another favorite is Molotes ,potatoes with chorizo ,tiny bit spicy .  I noticed everyone had rice on there table. I decide to order my own. It came a small 8 oz of white rice with veggies. Nice and light .  I noticed all customer tables  had different colorful flavored drinks . I decide to order a cocktail (Paloma) loved it ,they also have a lot of non alcohol drinks as well to choose from.  Many more big plates options .
Brenda thank you so much for coming back! Words like yours fill our hearts! It makes us so happy to know that you enjoyed a variety of our foods. We can't wait to have you back!

This is easily the best Oaxacan food on this side of the border! I don't care if you mom is from Oaxaca and makes Oaxacan food in your house, this restaurant is still better!  Everything from the food to the drinks was INCREDIBLE! The enchiladas almost brought tears to my eyes because the flavor took me back to my trip to Mexico. The mole sauce packed so much flavor that with each bite it was literally an explosion in my mouth... pause... I visited on a Friday evening without reservations. I waited approximately an hour to get seated. It was worth the wait, especially since there was a live band playing Spanish jams.

Bryan thank you so much for your kind words! This give us life and makes us feel very happy to hear that you enjoyed our food! It fills our hearts to know that the enchiladas brought you so much joy, we pride ourselves in bringing authentic food and flavors from Oaxaca. We can't wait to have you back!

More like 3.5 stars. I've been coming here for years and didn't really understand what all the fuss was about. Yes, putting sauce and queso on the chips is a nice touch, but then they get all soggy, not cool. The moles were OK too, but nothing out of the ordinary (maybe it was just the varieties available that made people rave) and the chicken was often on the dry side. Black beans were pretty good and the molded white rice, well... That all changed recently; we went off the beaten path a little bit and had what was the best meal I've had at this establishment in many years. We ordered the molotes, which look like empanadas shapped like kibbeh, and are stuffed with a mixture of Oaxacan chorizo and potatoes, think Mexican "corned beef hash" and there you go. The guac on top was a little bland but these things were delicious, and the chorizo had a nice little kick.  They were followed by chile rellenos, one of each, cheese and chicken (thanks to our server for suggesting). The chiles were on the smallish side (I understand they're from Oaxaca and not Pasillas) and generously stuffed. The chicken is shredded and seasoned with among other things, raisins, but not overly sweet. The cheese one is crammed chock-full of queso (which I find oddly flavorless) but the real star here is the sauce, which was delicious. In fact, the cheese relleno and sauce kind of reminded me of the old winter standby, Campbell's tomato soup & a grilled cheese sandwich, but much better. Delicious. There's a huge bar menu, but only one white wine, wtf??? Drinks are generous but you can run up a bar tab if you're not careful. Food portions are generous, too, and at these prices they should be. Service is friendly and attentive, and be forewarned, you will almost always have to wait. We arrived at 6:30 on a Wednesday evening and waited 45 minutes for our table. The room is big and loud (it was a Chinese restaurant in another life) so this isn't the best choice for a romantic dinner, but the live music on Wednesdays and Fridays is very cool. Guelaguetza is kind of an L.A. cult favorite and those places aren't always everything they're made out to be, but at least now I know what to order if/when I return. Took long enough...
Thank you Juan! It makes us so happy to know that you enjoyed your meal and experience. We are grateful you gave us another chance, thank you! We hope to see you again soon!

3.5 stars. Tasty Mexican food with a focus on Oaxaca. As others have mentioned it's pricy, though. The moles are tasty and the tlayudas are good as well. They sprinkle the chips with Oaxacan cheese and the salsa is OK. It's a big, boomy place and the service can be pokey and somewhat distracted. Live music most nights, too. Worth going to at least once if you're a local. They have a full bar and a large selection of tequilas and mescals if that's your bag. Valet parking or take your chances on the street.
40-50  mins

I've been waiting to come and try this establishment for the longest time, today it finally happened.  Got there 15 minutes before they opened to avoid the crowds and long waits to be seated! That's always a good idea for very popular places people!  They opened and we were 3rd in line, hostes greeted us and showed us to a table right away! Our waiter showed up right away and took our drink order.  I ordered a Chocolate de Leche and my wife a Cafe de olla, waiter brought some chips topped with mole and our drinks.  Chips with mole were delicious, the chocolate and cafe de olla were superb! My wife ordered La feria de los moles dish, 4 different types of mole with chicken breast. I ordered a Tlayuda Guelaguetza with tasajo, chorizo and pork cecina. I also odered a empanada con Huitlacoche, all of this items were very tasty, flavorful and delicious! Great ambiance, great service and very reasonable prices for what you get. High quality ingredients go in the process and preparation of this amazing dishes! I highly recommend this establishment!
Jose thank you so much! Words like yours fill our hearts with so much happiness and gratitude! We are so happy to know that you enjoyed your dining experience with us. We can't wait to have you back!

Everything was absolutely flavorful! We got the Molotes de Papa con Chorizo as an appetizer. The plate comes with three pieces - they're big and are stuffed with lots of meat. It's a super filling appetizer.  We ordered the Enchiladas Campesinas and the Tlayuda Guelaguetza. Both were huge servings! The enchiladas are three tortillas stuffed with plain shredded chicken in a mole of your choice. I picked the Mole Negro. It was good, but a bit too sweet for my taste. Either way, it was a still a very good mole. The tlayuda was about the size of a medium pizza. It's essentially a big tortilla covered in beans & oaxaca cheese and topped with three types of meats: grilled chorizo, grilled beef tasajo and grilled marinated pork cecina. Food was so flavorful & authentic! It makes sense the restaurant always has a huge line outside.
Thank you so much Erika! Words like your makes us very happy. It fills our hearts to know that you enjoyed your dining experience. We hope to see you again soon!

I like the Mexican vibe of the restaurant. They served crickets and moles. The crickets were quite sour, probably to kill off any funky taste. It was my first time trying the moles and maybe moles were just not my thing. A bit too sweet for dinner.
Absolutely wonderful. The food is delicious and the staff is nice. Queso fundido, pozole, birria chile relleno are all so good! Easy parking too. Highly recommend.
Chile Relenos, tacos and drinks.  Everything was great!  I come here everytime I am in LS!
Wowo! El sabor exquisito y unico, buen servicio, los meseros amables Gracias Gabriel.

The food was interesting and tasty. My favorite dish was definitely the Especial de Carnes and Queso Fundido.   My review is primarily for the great service! Our server Jair was exceptional! I had additional friends joining us for dinner and Jair was very accommodating. I had asked if we needed to put our name down again to get a larger table and he suggested a few ideas. He check with the host and the wait was about 1hr. So there was a single table next to us that was wrapping up on their tab. Jair quick and accommodating response to join the table was greatly appreciated although he could of easily said there is nothing he can do.  My observation was that there were different servers. There were some in white shirts and some in black shirts. The ones in white shirts seemed to be the primary servers and the ones in black shirts seemed to be the helpers. We were there for almost 4hr until they were closing and of course we were ordering a lot of drinks. There was multiple times my rowdy group was trying to get more drinks and while the main servers were not available (it was a busy night), the helpers stepped right in and tried to help us. I love how they all helped each other and demonstrated great teamwork!

This place is soo pretty we got to eat outside in the patio.  Service was amazing everyone super nice and attentive,  But the food!!  That was on another level of food coma!  Everything was super super delicious   We had seen this place on a YouTube video and knew we had to try it when we came out to California. And sure enough it didn't disappoint us!  Amazing place they have here!

Tried the meat and cheese platter for 4, as well as the queso app. The place is delicious and seems fairly authentic? Lots of Hispanic families when we went, always a good sign. The little mole I was able to try was also really good. Horchata came with a prickly pear fruit topper that made it a little different than the ones you see most days.  Live music was a pleasant surprise, though my only gripe is that it was SO LOUD that I had to almost scream across the table to a single friend and STILL couldn't really hear them. It was a bit of a bummer because it was the first time we'd been out in a long time and was looking forward to chatting. It was also hilarious watching the lone kid on the stage - he really looked like he didn't want to be there. His dad or whoever was singing and playing and he was just like =___=.  Plenty of parking in front of the restaurant on Olympic after 7pm.
Cindy thank you so much for your kind words! It make us happy to know that you enjoyed your meal. We hope to see you again soon!

Excellent festival of mole: negro, rojo, coloradito, and estofado (light, with olives and pickled chiles). Was surprised at how sweet each was. Rojo was my fave: my favorite balance of Chile flavor with all the nuts, spices and chocolate. Negro and coloradito were runners up, each deeply flavored in their own way, coloradito tasted somewhat sweeter. Estofado was good but very mild, but I liked the pickled chili kick in there. They put coloradito on their tortilla chips appetizer which is very tasty. Cocktails are pretty flavorful, and horchata is very mild flavored and exceptionally pretty with bright pink cactus syrup.  Service was very friendly but wait was quite long even at 3pm on Saturday afternoon: about 70 minutes for a table for 2. We sat outside and it was comfortable.  We'll be back to try some of the other dishes.

Thank you John! We love your description of the moles. We are very glad to know that you enjoyed your food and cocktails. Thank you so much for your patience and waiting to be seated. We look forward to having you back soon!
40-50  mins

Omg this place is AMAZIng  Was invited to a private birthday party ... The place is gorgeous the food is amazing  Yes Amazing ...great service delicious drinks  God whiling I will be back soon... This place is a must Definitely recommend.

Been to Toca Madera a handful of times now - and it never disappoints! It is consistent in its vibe, menu options, quality of food and service ; the downside is it's almost predictable how the night will unfold.  I've now tried so many things on the menu I don't even have a specific recommendation exception there really isn't a dish I wouldn't try again! If I had to pick a top three it would be:  1. Ceviche Blanco  2. Mexican Sashimi  3. Tostaditas  #4 as a bonus would be the tomahawk steak (if you have enough people to split it). Feel free to skip the calamari.  Definitely recommend Toca Madera, it is quite loud in many places, so a heads up to know your dinner party and make sure they're down for the vibe.

I absolutely LOVE Toca Madera, such a cool atmostphore. I've gone twice now, and the fire twirler is reason enough to come. But even more so if you are a tequila drinker like me as they have everything posssible under the sun including delicious specialty cocktails that are beyond extravaggent. Both times I've been there a guy with dirty blonde hair named Mikey was behind the bar where we sat. Amazing service, he knew the drinks so well and truly made our evenings special.  We also got a rare steak and honestly it beats any steakhouse! Yum! Pro tip: this place gets busy! Be sure to make a reservation! This is definitely a spot I'll be hitting up more due to ambience, perfect bartender service, and above all the best tequilas and food is outstanding. Their tacos are so bomb!! On blue corn tortilla, must have.  Can't wait to come back!
Always love coming here! Vibes and food are on point as usual! The music is so fun. Our server was amazing this time. Can't wait to come back!

Love the vibe, food and drinks! The cocktails are SO good, lots to choose from! Seriously felt like I was at a restaurant in Tulum. We came on a Wednesday and it was lit, I could only imagine how the weekends are here.

To say this is our new favorite Happy Hour place in LA is an understatement!  First of all, interior is absolutely gorgeous. We got a seat at the front of the restaurant next to the window and got a perfect view of the whole place. They offer complimentary chips and salsa which was 10/10. We also ordered the ceviche which was served with plantain chips which was very unique but so good!! We also got the guava margarita and ghost rider cocktails which were great as well and super spiked lol

Where do I start?! I wish Yelp allowed us to upload videos! Most of my footage was video. I really enjoyed this place!!  We came on a Tuesday at 7:30P and it was a good amount of ppl. We had Taylor as our server and he was awesome! We sat on the third floor level which was so nice and offered an awesome view.  Two of us ordered the Carne Asada -- and the presentation was very nice. It's served on a hot rock that continues to cook the steak to your liking. Very cool! The other two order the Salmon which they enjoyed but not as much as we enjoy those steaks. At some point Taylor was feeling great and sent us the first Passion Fruit hot shot on the house! Such a cool experience too! Thank you Taylor for that! We liked them so much, I ordered another round. They bring it out on fire and it's a whole thing.  We must've come on a good night too because they had live entertainment (pictured, but the video is a better depiction). She ate the fire and did a little dance and whatnot -- very cool and on point. The whole thing was a vibe!  I would go back 10 times a week! Go and check it out. There was paid parking in a small lot next door that we were lucky enough to get. It was a very good time! One of favorite spots that we visited. Can't wait to visit L.A. again to go here.

Talk about being smokin' HOT ‍ almost a year later, and Toca Madera is still the place to be! I absolutely love everything about this restaurant. From the food (obviously), to the decor, to the ambiance, and right down to the amazing staff. Special shout-out to our waiter Justin. Who asked my family and I, if we were celebrating anything- to which we said yes- a birthday, and he brought us over some cool shots! If you're reading this, thank you- you're awesome! My experience when dining here is never short of a great time. I can't recommend this place enough! As I write this, my mouth is drooling thinking about the carne asada, and the spicy habanero sauce that comes with it! Check out my foodie page on Instagram @kimeats.la for more!

Come to Toca Madera if you want to be surrounded by good vibes, and are ready to eat delicious food!  This place is seriously so cool, from the decor to the ambiance, right down to their tasty food.  This review is a bit late, as I went pre covid, but I just had to share my wonderful experience with you all! The staff are patient, knowledgeable of menu items, and attentive- which is great because they're usually always busy.  A huge plus about this place, is that the drinks aren't watered down! Best of all, everything here is super Instagram worthy. I can't wait to come back for more.

First time here and everything was incredible. If there are levels of Mexican restaurants, this is a 4 star restaurant.  The service, the dim lighting, the greenery around the bar, the sofa bar cushions were actually comfortable. There is a gorgeous patio out back. We got lucky and found parking on the street. We had great service with lots of suggests.  The passion fruit margarita is a must! The Caesar salad with chicken was phenomenal. There is a rub on the chicken that had the perfect amount of spice and flavor, very juicy.  I came around 3pm but it does state there is a dress code, I'm sure for dinner.

I love that they have a variety of vegan and low carb dishes to choose from. Not only does the food look good but it tastes even better. And omghe their drink selection and presentation is quite impressive. Great atmosphere and whoever designed this place, definetly made me feel whatever the Toca Madera vibes was supposed to be.

Hello Mazen,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review. We are so pleased to hear your positive feedback from the entrees, to the drinks and the overall ambiance of Toca Madera!  Please reach out to us via Direct Message if you need anything in the future! We look forwarding to seeing you again soon.

Sexy, lively, lovely ambiance and great drinks. Definitely reserve this place ahead of time so you can skip the queue because this place does get poppin at night, especially weekends.  Got the Los Muertos drink. Mind you I am not a tequila drinker (I'm a gin cocktail type of girl), and this tequila cocktail got me hooketh. Had blood orange, lime, agave, hibiscus and topped with sprinkled brown sugar which would be later torched on fire, adding that bit of sweet twist to the tequila cocktail. Delicious and entertaining to watch the bartender sprinkle fired sugar into your drink.  Came here to grab some bites; which were the Mexican Sashimi and grilles scallops. Both were so good! Both dishes had stunning presentation which made the whole experience even better. Mexican Sashimi was served in tuna in the shape of a rose, with avocado slides, radish, and thin cucumber slices adorned with pomegranate seeds and edible flowers. Sashimi itself was excellent but the presentation definitely made the tasting better. Grilled scallops were cooked to perfection. Super soft and had a lot of flavor too. You dip it in the yellow sauce and take a small chunk of the pickled radish as you devour the scallops. You could taste the charr and crunchiness of the scallops too.  Towards the end of the night, there was a fire performer doing amazing fire stunts in the dining room and it definitely took me by surprise. The music was awesome. Mostly EDM (deep house/club music vibe) which elevated my overall dining experience because I love me some good food and good dance/house music. It did give me a bit of a Tulum vibe. Overall it exceeded my expectation and I can't wait to be back, but for future dinner reservation.

My second time at Toca Madera for brunch, and the experience was just OK.  I don't know if it was just an off day or what, but everything was blah. The first time I ate at Toca Madera was for a friend's birthday, and the food was terrific. The second time I went, I ordered the same thing, and my steak was undercooked, and overall the taste was not good. I will say that the atmosphere is amazing, but aside from that, I don't think I will be back. Also, the hostess was rude. We made our reservation through OpenTable, and when we arrived a few minutes late. She lectured us about being late, and she said they would accommodate us now but not in the future. Mind you; the restaurant was basically empty. Anyways that was a complete turn-off as I did not appreciate the way she spoke to use.
Thank you for your feedback. I'm sorry to hear about your latest experience with us. Please be on the lookout for a DM from us so we can talk more about what happened.

Food and drinks were amazing.  The atmosphere was lively,  the decor was beautiful.  The tree and lanterns set the mood. The walls were covered with plants, and the restaurant had a woman perform a fire dance a few times during our visit.
Thanks for visiting Toca Madera and for taking the time to leave a review. I am pleased to hear you had a wonderful experience with us. We hope to see you soon!

If you're in West Hollywood looking for strong drinks and good food, look no further.   The hubby and I popped in after making reservations and before seeing a show to get loose.  We started with very strong drinks.  So strong that I couldn't even finish my guava margarita and had to pass it over to him.   We shared the queso fundido with warm tortillas which was excellent.  It had mushrooms, onions, soyrizo and poblanos which was comforting, warm and delicious.  We not only used the tortillas that came with it but also the corn chips that were complimentary when we were seated.   Next came the chicken enchiladas.  Though they could've been a few degrees warmer inside, the flavors were very good, tasted fresh and well put together.  They had a kick to them for those that aren't used to any spice in their food but we devoured them nonetheless.   LA isn't cheap and the bill after tip was over $100 for an appetizer, entree and two drinks.  Steep but the company was good, so I'd do it again.

Look out every other restaurant ever - because Toca Madera has taken first place in my heart. The ambience, the food, the gorgeous bar, and the beautiful dining area surrounded by plants and vines .. it was all such a great experience. I actually cried after taking the first bite of my Enchiladas...I haven't been able to eat dairy in years and haven't had a cheese enchilada in probably 4 years (that actually tasted like real cheese)! It made my entire evening. Im sitting and eating leftovers as I type, and it's seriously just as good. Everything we ordered was absolutely incredible - from the drinks, to the appetizers, and the chocolate vegan mousse! Our server, Michaella, was INCREDIBLY kind, attentive, and knowledgeable. She made my birthday so special and we really enjoyed talking to her. We will absolutely be requesting her in the future when we return.  Tips:  they have valet parking to the left of the restaurant for $14  we were able to sit at the bar and enjoy a cocktail while they were getting our table ready they have Mezcal Monday's and Taco Tuesday's!!

Thank you for visiting Toca Madera and for taking the time to leave a review. I am pleased to hear your all around experience with us was great! I will be sure to let Michaella know your positive feedback! Thanks again we hope to see you soon!

Strong drinks, decent food, great ambiance.  Firstly, the drinks are strong yet delicious. I ordered a drink with honey and ginger, per the Bartender's recommendation (forgot the name, but you can mention it to the Bartender). The drink itself was lightly sweetened yet not overpowering. On top of that, you don't really taste the alcohol and you'll feel the buzz when you're ready to order a 2nd round. They also serve shots with a cucumbers as garnish and somehow lit on fire. It's very unique imho. The guava marg was also very refreshing.  Next, the food. They have great presentations with their shrimp tacos. The color pairings on the taco plates looked very vibrant. It had green and pink garnish on top, then shrimp, followed by a purple tortilla, served on a bamboo/wooden platter. The flavor of the shrimp tacos were decent.  The Carne Asada entrée' I ordered was served on hot plate, and the rice, beans and salsa was served in a separate bowl with another napkin for the hot tortillas. Again, the Carne Asada entrée' was decent.  The ambiance of Toca Madera was very modern and luxurious with a hint of rustic. The roof was basically the sky, and though the interior may seem dark prior to entry, once you step in, it becomes very bright and upbeat. They also have a back section which is even brighter, though I didn't tour that area as much.  Overall, the ambiance, atmosphere and strong drinks were the top selling points of Toca Madera; the drinks were moderately priced for the location its in. Unfortunately, the food was a bit more on the lackluster side and seems overly priced. The service was also a bit slow though I believe there were only 2 servers working that day...though they had at least 4 bussers around.

What We Ordered: Drink - Winnie de Pooh Appetizer (not pictured) - Flautas Entree - American Waygu, A La Roca, beans and rice  Pros: Toca Madera was a great experience! It an upscale Mexican restaurant that is lively and energetic. The food was AMAZING! The pico de Gallo (which I believe was complimentary) was the freshest I've had in a LONG time! Please also try the flautas, so good and spicy! I would surely visit Toca Madera again when visiting LA.  Cons: None! Make a reservation now!

2nd review for this business  UNPROFESSIONAL AND CHILDISH!!!  so apparently someone Was upset about my last review ( most likely the owner). I got a private message from a fake page stating that I should just stay home and eat Taco Bell. LOL.  Sir/ma'am. I've had Taco Bell, and I'd rather eat there dude. Trust me . Don't be mad at me, be better.

Not all are treated equal that's for sure... so I came in with a group in influencers that apparently had a set menu.  That's cool.  But I told the waiter before hand that I would like to order the steak and he can charge me separately. This never happened. I never received my entree. The entire time he was no where to be found. It was like trying to spot a rare bird. I guess we weren't as important as the other customers because we were getting things for free. So he didn't feel as if he needed to check on us.  But danggg. IM TRYING TO PAY YOU!  HEELLLOOOO.  The food that I did try was okay. Nothing to bring about. This place did have vegan options which is nice. Not that it matters to me much. It was more like a club in there than anything. Really LOUD. Maybe he didn't hear me say "Hey I wanna pay you for my steak thanks".

I've had this place bookmarked for some time and I was excited to know that it was walking distance from Kyle Chan's Jewelry store. I was even happier to find out that we made it just in time for happy hour. We were seated outdoors at a high table top. It was a bit warm but it cooled off as the evening rolled in. The husband and I ordered a few things to share. We ordered: -Manchengo truffle fries ($9): curly fries that were thankfully not too salty or oily. Served with a somewhat spicy cream sauce   -Street taco box- ($18) 5 tacos in a box. pro tip: they're in the box's drawer! A few options available but all tacos need to be the same protein (vegan chicken, jidori chicken or shredded beef). We ordered the shredded beef. The tacos were super small and in my opinion, a bit over priced. Nothing special other than being served in some fancy box.  -Ceviche blanco ($10): Chilean sea bass poke style type of ceviche. This was pretty darn good! All the ingredients were super fresh, plenty of fish and avocado to go with each bite. Highly recommended. I also had one glass of their happy hour cabernet. It was a nice pour. I was tempted to get their guava margarita too but held back. Do I regret it? Kinda. I would have added the 4th star if our waitress would have told us after she walked by multiple times that our tacos were inside the box. I had to ask her if she could check in on the tacos since we were pretty much done with all our other food. Sadly our tacos had been sitting inside the box the whole time.. they def weren't hot anymore but just warm since they were individually wrapped in foil. We just stared at the box with the condiments for almost an hour waiting for our tacos to come out. Sigh... Who knew. I would say skip the tacos for sure if you come here and be ready for a semi expensive happy hour. Service is ok, you might have to be on top of your game and be the one proactive about getting their attention..

First thing first....get yourself a reservation if you can. We got lucky, and was able to get a spot in the front patio. But, we did have to hang out for a bit.  We yelped this place and didn't read all the reviews. Lol. So, this is like a classy Mexican cuisine restaurant and a day club at the same time. Lol. Loud music. Like club music. And look, I wasn't mad by it....just wasn't prepared for it. Lol.  Once we got seated, service was pretty good. Cocktail list is pretty exquisite. The presentation on the drinks were excellent and the drinks also tasted delicious and unique.  Meals also came out the same. Hot. Beautiful presentation. Unique and powerful flavors. And as far as price...I'd say reasonably priced for the items they present.  I would definitely eat here again. Will bring my club attire next time tho. Lol.

Went here last Thursday with my best friend. It was nice! I enjoyed my time here. It was very loud, and we were seated right under a speaker, which made it super hard for my friend and I to hear each other. We wanted to sit in the indoor garden area, but the way reservations work is weird. It's not specific.  We ordered the queso Fundido, it was amazing!!, The guacamole was good. I got chicken enchiladas and my friend got ceviche! Everything was delicious! I'm not sure I'd come back here based on how loud it is, but otherwise the food was good. I can't complain :).

Hey Esmeralda,  Thank you so much for leaving a review. We love hearing you enjoyed the food and drinks, but were disappointed that you may not return because of the music! We are always looking for feedback, so if at any point the music is too loud we are happy to adjust. We do hope to see you in again soon, and would love to seat you in the Garden!

I got the papas breakfast tacos and added black beans. I also got the mole poblano and both were delicious. It hit the spot.  I also got the horchata and added cold brew. Sheesh!!! We just finished a 5k so this was the right move. Try them out! You won't regret it!

We are coming here for long time now and have tried every taco they have and they were all delicious. They have some great vegeritian options also.  Staff and service is amazing also. I will definitely come back again and again

Fresh tortillas and incredibly flavorful tacos! Any taco that is priced three dollars and over I tend to have higher expectations. Guisado delivered! I opted with trying out the sampler, which consists of 6 mini tacos. Tinga de pollo and the steak picado stood out to me, in all honesty however, I loved every bite of each taco. The freshly made tortillas and ingredients are what separates Guisado from the sea of taco trucks & restaurants in LA. The horchata is also slightly milkier than most taco joints. Tastes like cinnamon toast crunch in a cup  I left smiling. Felt the love in each bite!

Ooh man so yummy!!! I love Mexican food and tbh I don't think we have anything as good as this in Hawaii.. so sad LOL. But I really liked Guisados and everything I tried. The taco sampler was so worth it there was just one I wasn't too into but still! Really great flavors and each was unique in its own way. I also loved the ceviche special! So worth it and was a nice change up because it was refreshing and crunchy!! And tart! The tamales were yummy too I've never had these kinds of flavors in it and I wish I got more honestly. The location was a bit surprising but I would 100% go back for this food. OH and of course the horchata was amazing. Wishing I got their other drinks because they looked amazing too. So stoked I tried this. I recommend!

It was my first time here and I'm so glad I decided to try it. Customer service is friendly and helpful. They have their own parking lot, but it's quite small. Luckily there is street parking too right next to it. My absolute favorite taco I tried here was the Cochinita Pibil. This taco has a sweetness to it that balances out the savory. Amazing flavor. My second favorite had to be Pescado. Honestly all of them were amazing but my least favorite was the shrimp. I tried almost one of each taco to see what it was all about. I am definitely a fan of the different flavors they have going on with the different meats. Funny enough they have a taco with ONLY peppers in it which is extremely spicy- try at your own risk lol. One thing too- I hate horchata but I tried the one here and I'm still thinking about it! Omg! Please do yourself a favor and try their horchata. It had the perfect level of sweetness and cinammon. It definitely slapped my sweet tooth after eating all those tacos! Definitely would come back here again.
Everything was good, and the samplers are a great way to try six different mini tacos for poco dinero. Best tacos were the pescado and the vegan pepper tacos.

Easily some of the best tacos I've ever had. Can't remember what I ordered but the shrimp and beef tacos are the best of the lot. The slow braised beef had beautiful texture and flavors.  Lots of street parking available.

Delicious! My tastebuds were very happy today with the varied flavors of tacos, quesadillas, and ceviche! The Armando Palmer was refreshing as well! And there's plenty of seating inside or out on the back patio. I definitely will come back!

Did you even visit LA if you don't stop at a recommended taco joint? We met a friend here who promised some of the best tacos we've ever had, and he kept his promise! Would recommend starting with the taco sampler, which allows you to choose 6 mini tacos, if you still have room after that you can get favorites in the next round. Our top hits include the quesadilla, frijoles & cheese, cochinita, and steak picado. Don't forget your agua fresca to cool off from the hot LA heat.  Tip: parking in LA can be tough, but they have a dedicated lot a few lots down so keep your eyes peeled.

OK... I gotta say that third time's a charm at Guisados. The first two times (in downtown) the tacos didn't change my life... However, this time around, I was impressed.  Maybe because I got my own tacos instead of doing the sampler and also now discovering that I have an allergy to peanuts, I have to avoid all molé options everywhere I go and choosing my own tacos was the wayyyy better route. The white fish taco is divine - will be a must get the next time I come here.  The bistek was another great one.  I may skip the shrimp just because it wasn't as flavorful as I hoped (in comparison to the other tacos!)  The pork and chicken were cool and good choices to supplement my two other choices. My favorite part?  Their house-made corn tortilla!!!  Whew, the texture is everything. You need about three or four tacos to get full or you can always opt for the sampler (six min tacos) If you are anything like me and the first time wasn't as hyped up as you'd hope it'd be then give it a try another time!  May be worth a shot :)
45-55  mins

Erik from the front is so rude. He was giving me attitude for no reason when all I asked was if I could get sauce on the side. He proceeded to be rude through the whole transaction.  If I'm paying more than $60 for tacos at least have good service.  Ps food is good especially the drinks but I'd rather take my business to somewhere they appreciate it

Have been here many times since 2016. In in love w the cochinita and the mole tacos. Today my bf and I got the sampler plate for $8 then went back to get more. He loved the cochinita tacos. Everything was tasty with some heat! The house made tortillas were so fresh and you could taste the corn. The service was friendly and quick. We didn't realize their was a dodger game until we drove by the line. It's cool they offer blue horchata. We had the jamaica agua fresca. It was floral and sweet. My bf said it was too sweet and strong for him, but I enjoyed it. The fountain had a leak, so if you sit at the table to the left on the decline, your feet will get wet. My sock got wet since I wore slides lol. The customers had sticks up their  the local hipsters were pretty obnoxious and entitled about the extra chairs that were next to me. - just a tip if you're tired of the new "locals".

Every time I'm in LA I always try to stop by a Guisados.   Best horchata I've ever had, hands down.  I would like to be baptized in their horchata before I die. I get the Quesadilla con Chorizo & the Mole Poblano every single time and then I cycle through these ones:  - Camarones - Pescado - Tinga De Pollo - Bistek en Salsa Roja - Steak Picado - Chicharron They're all so good and really filling!

After running an errand in the area, I figured I might as well enjoy some awesome LA eats. Ever since I visited this taco spot with my buddy, I've been craving a return trip, so I made my way back to Guisados recently. Just like the first time, these tacos were just as amazing as I had remembered them!  Service: Great! Just as friendly and polite as previous trip! Decor: Cozy entranceway to place the order at the counter, but it opens up to a spacious back patio. Beautiful ambient lighting above, a small waterfall along the side wall, and a gorgeous mural on the all of the small parking lot (recommend you street park somewhere and walk over) Food: For my drink, I had a cup of their Jamaica (about $2.50). It is a drink that is both refreshing and slightly tart at the same time. A great drink that pairs well with the meal.  My all-time fave and MVP of them all - the Cochinita Pibil ($3.25). I can't get over that incredibly, melt-in-your-mouth, tender shredded pork mixed with that perfect blend of sweet and spicy achiote chile/habanero salsa. Also, the tart from the pickled onions compliments it all very well. I loved the quesadilla on my last trip, so I kicked it up a notch by going for the Quesadilla con Chorizo ($5.75). Oh man, I have to say, this is a thing of beauty nestled in that homemade, warm corn tortilla. Imagine a giant block of gooey queso panela surrounded by that smoky, slightly sweet and spicy, seasoned ground pork tastiness. A new fave of mine instantly! Speaking of new faves, have to add their Bistek en Salsa Roja ($3.25) to my list. Juicy strips of flank steak are dressed with red bell peppers, tomatoes, chile arbol, and an avocado slice. Truly yummy!  While not bad, this was probably the most ordinary of all the tacos I tried - their Camarones ($3.50) taco. Generous servings of shrimp are surrounded by a fajita filling (grilled onions and red/green peppers) along with a chipotle crema (sauce is on the faint side in terms of flavor, so I actually wish it had a bit impact).  Each bite was pure joy t! With such consistent quality and flavors, I will be making return trips to #guisados for sure!

My favorite, new, go-to taco shop in LA! Why have I become such a quick, passionate new fan? First, I really enjoy the ambiance of the atmosphere they have created there. The corridor to the ordering desk is cozy but it opens up to a bigger, interior dining area. The outdoor patio is this super relaxing and tranquil seating area with hanging lights, beautiful Latin art murals, a small waterfall, etc. The mural out in the parking area wall is fantastic! Second, the service was super great. The cashier had a bright, warm smile and a super enthusiastic, pleasant, positive personality. She genuinely was excited to share with me all the dishes they had to offer at this shop. Third, the tortillas are absolutely great! You can tell it is handmade and fresh because of how fluffy and lightly, pleasantly corn flavoring it is (no old tinge in taste). Fourth, their horchata is the right balance of milky, sweet, and cinnamon bite. Fifth, the tacos are just simply amazing - yummy overload. I tried the four recommendations I received. Item #1 is the quesadilla which contains this grilled, giant chunk of queso panela that is supported with a light chipotle cream sauce and the smokiness of the grilling. Item #2 was the pescado (fish) taco which is composed of a flaky fish center balanced by crisp cabbage, a light cilantro and avocado sauce, black beans, and refreshing pico de Gallo. Item #3 was the mole poblano taco - soft but giant chunks of stewed meat topped with a scattering of queso fresco, sour cream, dried chile flakes, and red onion. To me, had this wonderful meaty, peppery flavor to it. The final item, my buddy and my favorite, was the Cochinita Pibil. It's a taco with an addictive blend of sweet, tangy, and spicy all-in-one! The taco is composed of marinated pork, red achiote spice, black beans, pickled onion, and habanero chile. All of these were solid tacos in my opinion. Will definitely visit again to try the other tacos!
