Love this place! We went evening on the swan rental, this place was nearby. Due to the ratings and it being close we gave it a try.  Shout out to the cashier that was here on Saturday evening, they were super welcoming and helpful.  Parking is a little tight, we're lucky to grab a spot but they do have an additional lot within  walking distance with a banner.   We got the OG sampler, consist of 6 mini tacos, horchata (blue dodger theme),Jamaica, lime Aguas frescas.   We sat outside, weather was nice and they have a great outdoor seating that's inviting. Out of all the tacos we tried, I absolutely love the chicharron, steak en salsa Roja, the shrimp, and fish tacos. The only one I didn't like was the chile verde pork I thought was on the tough dry side. But that's what the sampler is for.  For the vegetarians, they also have a nice selection. I tried their mushrooms with cilantro  very flavorful!  All in all great place to try Guisados and FRESHLY made tortillas!

This place is so good the tacos are legit and reasonable, with some great and patient service. The drinks are good and well priced this is definitely a repeat spot with great artwork as well. Anytime I come by this place has a line and I can see why, if you ever see it free definitely go by.
Always delicious! Love their homemade tortillas. Great selection, tasty and flavorful tacos. They are small, but we just buy more!
Sampler is the best! Love their handmade tortilla is super delicious. Steak one is the best.
Would I recommend this business? Does a bear shit in the woods?! Delicious, fresh, deeply flavorful and lite tacos every time. Reliably satisfying.
Consistently incredible tacos that will make you want to take a drive here from any part if town just to eat them.
45-55  mins
Start your review of  Guisados DTLA .

Hands down some of the THE BEST tacos I have had in a long time!  I am sad that they are all the way in DTLA because I live in Orange County lol.  I ordered 3 tacos: Bistek en Salsa Roja (5/5):  Chef's kiss.  Delicious AF.  Flavors galore.  SO. GOOD. Steak Picado (4/5):  Very good meat and flavoring.  I honestly did not need any extra sauces. Camarones (5/5):  Mmm... Spicy spicy but oh so good.  This is not a mild spicy, it's a kick in your mouth spicy so if you can't handle the spice, it won't be too nice (for you) lol. The staff here are tremendous.  Very upbeat and friendly.  The food was so good I had to go to the counter to compliment the cooks.  Will be back if I am ever in the area!

Food: 3/5 Service: 3.5/5 Ambiance: 3.5/5 Overall: Pretty Standard fare in my mind. The extended review... Food: 3/5 - I had a few different flavors and the flavors were fairly standard.  There wasn't anything that particularly stood out for me.   Service: 3.5/5 - Friendly staff but it's more of a order at the counter and seat yourself restaurant. Ambiance: 3.5/5 - Good outdoor seating in the arcade but of course you don't know who will be around you.  There were a few smokers near by so I wasn't ecstatic about that.

I came here twice and I surely wasn't disappointed. This review will just be straight to the point that this place is absolutely great. Delicious, affordable, and plenty of seating in the back to enjoy your delicious and affordable tacos. They also make great drinks too and offer a variety of options that you can pick.  I highly recommend you get their sampler plate and if that is not filling, you can easily order more after you are done with the sampler plate so that you know which tacos you like the most.

Camarones  and Pescado tacos are straight delish. I am truly glad to have experienced a foodgasm before I left the area.... Much respect for such a simple but authentic dining experience.   is the best way I can put it.  The taste was so fresh every bite.........

Bottom Line: Inferior to the original location, Guisados DTLA has a little trouble being prompt on their orders, but is worthy of a visit. I'd recommend the East LA location. Ordered the Asada and the shrimp taco. I feel both tacos were homogeneously tasteful. The tortilla shells themselves were a little over-fried and greasier than I'd like. Still above average than most places. On the plus side, their tortillas are homemade.

Some of the best tacos I've had!!! They were pretty cheap and the service was really good. We got a few different options and were not disappointed by any of the tacos. The lemonades were also refreshing and much needed on a warm day.

The sampler is a great choice because you can taste all their different tacos   tasty food well seasoned plus they sell alcohol it doesn't get any better than this! Og sampler must get! Staff extremely friendly and clean atmosphere most importantly!! Will definitely be returning!

I knew I would eventually have a true 5-star experience that relied solely on the deliciousness of the food and not the nice service or cool ambience. This food, without anything else factored in, is a 10 out of 5 I will remember this spot and come back to it religiously from now on.  The tortillas are hand made and the food is straight from grandmas cookbook. The essence of Mexican food, not just tacos, is here. The home style selection is what true Mexicans call tacos. The homemade dishes that ppl out into a soft fresh tortilla during dinner to make a "taco" No ppl we don't eat al pastor tacos or carne asada tacos at home. I can't get over how yummy each and every morsel was.  I had the carne en salsa roja taco. Steak with red sauce. Tasted like my mom made it. Tortilla was delicious as well.  The tinga taco tasted so much like my sisters famous recipe that I think it may not be so secret after all. Wow! And a kick of heat on this one that will make you want more. Also comes with avocado, several do.  The mole poblano taco was also a textbook rendition with nice sweet notes and small warm chocolate vibes. Good to change it up.  Then I had the chicharrón taco and let's just say it stole the show. So flavorful and served with a bit of frijoles (beans) it was like a bite of home.  Overall I cannot overstate how much this place has impressed me. The cheapest meal was my most memorable.

With so many options for tacos nearby, I feel lucky to have found such a gem of a spot.  I actually never had tacos with braised meats...I'm hooked! We got 2 sampler plates and everything was delicious. Saucy, juicy and not dried out, flavorful and not too spicy.  I came hungry and was worried the sampler size tacos wouldn't be filling but it was plentiful.

Tasty tacos, beautiful Mexican atmosphere and outdoor seating, hole in the wall type place. Wonderful for cheap tacos with good flavor.  I got the spiciest taco with like 5 different types of peppers, and boy did I cry. Was fun to eat and totally worth it, just to clear out my nostrils. ;p  Otherwise, I'd recommend the steak (which creatively had sesame seeds and pumpkin seeds for a secret crunchy texture) over the chicken taco, tho both were great.
45-55  mins
Start your review of  Guisados DTLA .
Tome el sampler. Las tortillas hechas a Mano. Mole, bistec, cochinita pibil y mas. Porciones perfectas. Aguas frescos y cervezas. Muy atentos y amables.

These tacos are some of the best in LA! First off, the price is spot on for the serving size. We had more than enough food for dinner for 2 people for $40.  We ordered from postmates and the order was wrapped well.  We got 9 different tacos (all types - vegan, vegetarian, pork, etc) and they were ALL absolutely delicious. The only one I will call out - we did get one of the Chiles Toreados tacos and it was killer. I got hiccups from the spiciness on the first bite and couldn't even finish it. I was warned and was expecting that when I ordered it though, I guess I was just in the mood for pain. They were unfortunately out of tamales so we didn't get to try those, more to look forward to on our next order!

I went out on a taco splurge to find the best tacos in Downtown Los Angeles. For this unofficial competition, I decided to try Sonoratown, Tacos 1986, and Guisados. Determining these taquerias was based on most Yelp reviews, proximity, and somewhere I haven't tried before. Details of each review will be posted individually to the shop, respectively. And in one of the reviews, I will reveal the winner.  We were the only group inside waiting for our food. A stranger comes in and approaches the cook. The cook hands him food covered in aluminum foil, and the person immediately walks out. I think charity is remarkable goodwill, but when someone pays full price (as these tacos were on the pricier side) and is patiently waiting for his food, I just thought it was not the right time to be doing that in front of my face.  I hope that incident was a misunderstanding.  I ordered: STEAK PICADO TACO - Flank steak simmered with green bell peppers and bacon. Served with green serrano chile atop black beans - This taco was so soft that a person with no teeth would not have difficulties to finish this meal. The meat was juicy and packed so much flavor. Between the three taquerias, I enjoyed this taco the most. Bravo! CHICHARON TACO - Pork rinds simmered in chile verde. Served with green serrano chile, atop black beans - This was another soft taco that melted in my mouth. The texture of chicharon was very smooth and buttery. Both tacos were super delish.  I learned that tacos come in all sizes and forms. This restaurant shows that meat does not always have to be grilled for satisfaction; instead, braised meat is perfectly acceptable in a taco culture.

My undergrad old stomping grounds! I was studying at FIDM when I first discovered this place! I was instantly hooked! It was definitely nostalgic to come by not only because it had been a place I frequented a lot in my FIDM days but because of Covid. It breaks my soul to see so many restaurants and businesses suffering a huge loss as a result of COVID-19.   Anyhow, the tacos here are amazing! I have tried pretty much almost everything on the menu. My favorite is still, the chicharrón tacos!!  the chorizo quesadilla is a close second! Last night I of course had a chicharrón taco but I also had the mole poblano taco. Best part in my opinion is the hand made tortillas! They taste just as good as the tortillas I've had in many parts of Mexico during my travels! The aguas frescas are also so yummy!  I'm staying at the biltmore hotel so this was just around the corner for me to walk to. It was still early but he streets in DTLA were eerily desolate! :/ I was the only customer there and Tina, who took my order came and just started a conversation with me and asked me if my food was ok because I took out my tacos to take a picture lol . It was nice to talk to her and share our mutual thoughts/feelings  on the whole covid 19 situation and not being able to have a dine-in experience in many restaurants. I thanked her again for my food/order and I walked through the indoor/outdoor plaza/corridor and went back to my hotel room to enjoy my tacos! Guisados has several locations, definitely recommend stopping by if you're near any of the locations!

This place is so great!  The service is fast and the food is delicious.   Did I mention the prices are awesome too.   I work in the film/tv industry, so I love that this DTLA location is generally close to where we are filming.  I usually get the chicken mole tacos and sometimes the carne asada.    Both are excellent choices and they don't skimp on the meat.   The family packs are a great value too!
Thought they were rather bland. I had higher expectations but most of the tacos tasted similar to each other.  Overall it's OK.

First time at Guisados and I have mixed emotions.  I ordered the shrimp taco which was 5 and the grilled fish taco which was also a 5 but the asada tacos are not carne asada as there more of a beef stew type meat. The potato taco was just as good as the picture shows . Probably the worst potato taco I've ever had. And the queso tamale was dry and nothing to rave about. The tortillas are what will make me come back again as they are phenomenal. Oh yeah the salsa is tasty definitely a 5

Ahhhh, Guisados you have me at braised meats!!  Came here in January when the lockdown was lifted and outdoor dining was open. We sat at one of the indoor patio tables and ordered the sampler (6 mini tacos) plus a mushroom taco and a shrimp taco. TBH, I couldn't tell you which one I liked the best, I inhaled them all so fast.  Every single one of them was packed with flavors and meats were perfectly juicy. I didn't even stop to take pictures of the food, it was that good!   The agua Fresca was good too, but a bit too sweet for my liking. Staff was friendly and chill. A total gem in DTLA!!
I luv Guisados. Their tinga and mole tacos are the  bomb.com . las Aguas frescas, de limon y melon son tan refrescantes. I luv luv them.
This is not your traditional taco place, but definitely worth a try! The fillings are more "wet" - imagine chile verde inside of a taco.  The horchata WITH cold brew is a must have!!!!
45-55  mins

Their carne asada is delicious very good and flavor. Their red chile is spicy and green chile is flavorful, but not much spice. Everything else on the menu is okay, but their carne asada tacos is what my husband and I keep going back for. The place itself is not very aesthetic and it can get crowded and rowdy in the evening, especially on weekends.

Fast, inexpensive authentic tacos and burritos. An LA staple. Can never go wrong with El Taurino or King Taco, although, I'm a bit bias, and tend to favor King Taco  ... but either's great, and can never go wrong with their red sauce. CMON NOW  Just gotta come back on the weekend one day! To try their "Castillas Rancheras" !! And "Barbacoa" !!

We stopped by for a late night taco run, and this place was busy on a Friday night around 11:30 pm. I ordered carne asada tacos, and my friends ordered carne asada burritos. The table we sat at in the dining area had not been bussed (not sure if they even do that there) but we had to clean up someones mess before we sat down to eat.  The food was good, as was the green salsa and horchata....but the one thing that irked me is the DISGUST  inside the ladies room.  Ladies do better! Management BE better at caring about the cleanliness of your facility! If your bathroom looks this way, what does your kitchen look like? The bathrooms had no paper towels, a backed up toilet, and very little toilet paper as well as trash everywhere. Bathrooms say a lot about an establishment caring about the cleanliness and being hygienic , and based on that alone, I would not dine there ever again.

Famous taco place in town. Unhappy experience. I gave one star because terrible customer service  Today I order 10 beef tacos, 10 pork tacos and nachos with cheese. Usually they give good portions of jalapeños. I asked jalapeño for nachos, they give me tiny container of jalapeño. I paid $50 and terrible customer service, I'm not going back from now on
***THEIR CONSOME FLAVOR HAS CHANGED!!!*** been commingto eat  here for years with my husband and lately their consome has been so watery  anyone else noticed?

Have loved this place for many many years. Today however the customer service, which may be managements fault, was incredibly slow. Have been sitting here for an hour already and there are still probably 10 or so people ahead of us. Ordering was very fast but they just don't have enough employees working or something. We've waited before but this is ridiculous! No food should take this long! There are lots of people waiting but their calling of numbers has been so slow. The food just isn't coming out fast enough for some reason. Hire people!

Like other Yelpers, El Taurino, carries childhood nostalgia. I remember delicious carne asada tacos, horchata, and long lines. None of those things have changed! Granted, it is about 1.80 a taco, which is kind of expensive for what it is. The horchata is the damn best. Not too sweet, and not chalky. Just perfect. The carne asada taco is solid. The thing that brings it over the top are the SAUCES. I love their red hot sauce. It burns my mouth, but has such good flavor. I wish they sold fries here too. I would love their red hot sauce with asada and guacamole. They sell fried platanos, potatoes, and churros. The oil was new and a good color. Platanos were sweet and fresh.  Restaurants are no different than favorite household brands. I could go to a King Taco closer to home, but it wouldn't illicit the same feeling.

I ordered toco from here and they treat customers poorly and even if they aren't English speakers, they should understand what is beef and pork is. All the person who works here they give attitude and rude face towards us and if I asked questions to them, they are literally give me a uglyass looks. I NEVER WANT TO GO HERE AGAIN.Poor service. This experience is so awful. I literally made a yelp account to write this comment. LEARN HOW TO TREAT CUSTOMERS U RACIST EMPLOYEES
The service of the cashier are really bad the place was really dutty not coming back again

Minus two stars because they are stingy and racist. They are so stingy when it comes to sauces and everything else. As time goes by, portions are definitely getting smaller. Also racist because as an Asian, they will charge you for every sauce but when a hispanic person asks for more sauce they don't charge. My husband is Mexican and whenever he asks for extra sauces they don't charge. Wtf. Lol.
The best taco in town! Their carne asada and al pastor are sooo good:) Didn't know we can ask for single taco shell, try it you can have more tacos this way XD

Service is bad, workers need to learn how to handle employees, place has no salt, no veggies to give or lemon so don't ask, and the lady at front handling the food orders is mean so learn some customer service or don't work at all ..

I've been coming here since I was very little. The food used to be great. I stopped coming here a couple decades ago when they started charging for the hot sauce and removed the radishes and the lack of meat in their burritos. And today I came back just due to convenience and I was reminded why I stopped coming here. I ordered a "burrito de asada" and I may as well have ordered a rice burrito. In this picture, my burrito is half way eaten. Where is the meat? I really wish el taurino didn't lower their standards THIS low.

Food is okay but there are so many other good taco places in town too with much better service.  Don't even think about placing a pick up order from them because they do not put in the order until you get there and pay for your food.   It is understandable that some restaurants would do this,  even though most restaurants would make the pick up order because they trust their customers.  El Taurino should let customers know on the phone that they will not make the order until it's been paid.  They did not say anything when I placed my order.  I ended up standing in line to pay, only to know that they would never start to make it untill I paid and I  had to walk away.  I felt like I had been tricked by them. I wasted time driving there and standing in line.

Food is just ok, not worth all the wait. Last time I ordered pick up over the phone, and when I arrive to pick up about 45 minutes later I saw the phone orders don't get put in until you arrive and pay. So they actually do not take pick up orders it's first come first serve. This place needs to stop hiring family members and start hiring people that know how to work in a restaurant. When I dine in. It's usually chaos and food takes usually over 45 minutes to be ready.  Also don't order Uber eats or any other app from them, I noticed they apply the same dumb rule that food doesn't start being prepared until the driver arrives.  Overall I think this place needs better management

I love coming here for their carne asada tostadas and its pretty much the only thing I get. They always hit the spot and never disappoint. They also hook it up and load the tostadas with a lot of meat so that's always a plus! Eating this can get messy though so be prepared for it to fall apart from the weight of the meat. I've also tried their quesadilla with al pastor and it was good but I was expecting a little more meat in it.

Best Torta that I have personally had in Los Angeles; Bistec con queso con todo. Unfortuantely it does get a little busy because everybody knows how fire the food is. They probably have the best decor of any restaraunt I have seen, go check it out for yourself, it won't dissapoint.

Best tacos and way better than their sister restaurant King Taco. Been a regular for 12 years and the people who are giving this place less than 5 stars don't know what they're talking about. Obvi during covid there were going to be some hiccups but last time I went I could tell the regular cooks/preparers were back! The red salsa was spicy just like it used to be and my burrito was FAT. Also Taurino has certain peak times and they stay the same unless it's Christmas time. Annnnnd if you haven't been born and raised in LA then you wouldn't appreciate this establishment and everything that it is. Please take your gentrified a** somewhere else. Side note...if you want more meat just ask for extra carne!

First visit in five hundred+ visits within twenty or so years I am able to walk in, walk straight to the cashier and order without waiting shoulder to shoulder with fellow belligerents in a Six Flags line, wow, there is nein a bloody soul in sight, oh my baby-jesus I have died and gone to taco heaven! Ever see that South Park episode where Cartman buys a theme park? Yes, that is how this peels. Wouldn't say anything's a wowzer, no pickled veg bar, bully yet dilapitading decore, but the saving grace is ET's salsa roja ay-caramba, its extraterrestrial, the holy grail of spicy, it is literally to-die-for and elevates ETs flavors over competitors. TBH their meat variety is more limited, no tripas, good asada, cabeza isn't very juicy... but it's simple Mexican food done right, reasonably priced, and always consistent, having fed starving drunk angelinos for decades and going strong. ET team's sense-of-urgency is always en pointe, y'all rock, if the virus wasn't an issue I'd be smothering y'all in taco-flavored kisses. They hardly speak a lick of English but are always welcoming, least to me, just be positive, it radiates. Tacos, sopes, tortas, tamales, and slices of ooey-gooey stretchy-cheesy quesadillas con carne dunked in sweat-my-elephantitus-balls-off here-comes-the-pain but it's-so-deliciously-addicting salsa roja, if my stomach was immune I'd be chugging this like Dracula, in fact, this must be what Tom Cruise's blood tastes like, drink from El Taurino and live forever...

Interesting joint. Their food is not better in anyway whatsoever compared to competitors, but their Salsa Roja... .... the Holy Grail must've been brimming with this stuff for those knights to go galavanting into oblivion, it's bloody bunny worth it. It's SO addicting that after waking up, weeping on the throne for thirty dirty minutes, here we are at 07:47, cheeks bulging with Butter Pecan ice cream that's been drizzled with caramel Pepto Bismo in attempts to battle the infernal wrath of the tamales heating up in the oven at this very moment! The POWER of Bismo compels you! Aye lads, we.. have zero willpower, but dude you try it, resistance is futile. Decor is bully, literally, cool mural, staff hardly speaks a lick of English so you being inebriated and limited to simple phrases like "Carne Asada Fries" is beneficial. Here is where you gorge after raging in LA if you have $7, don't worry if you're wasted, every man, woman, and child in there is too cause that sauce is sprinkled with crack. -1 Star for your dreadful restroom which deems your cleanliness as questionable, aim for In-N-Out! YOU CAN DO IT!

I have missed you dearly oh Roja...Since my first taste of you in high school it is so difficult to enjoy another spicier, flavorful, and umami up the whazoo salsa roja then you. Yes, your cousin at King Taco taste wonderful as well. But there is something about you here...Maybe it's the fact that I can those wonderful Carnitas Tostadas here where the oil form the meat drenches the bottom tostada, and the top is layered with tomato, guacomole, onions (upon request), cotija cheese, and cream. Or is it when I order an all-meat al pastor nachos with onions...and I douse you with meat and cheese my head is in extreme bliss...But oh, every time I come I do need to wait, but I can be patient for you. I due wish that this wonderful salsa roja was in Orange County.  Till the next time. Nice.

Wow! Tacos are one of my favorite foods, and Leo's tacos really is one of the best taco places I've had. What really brings me back is the al-pastor (pork) huarache. Huaraches are oval-shaped masa (corn dough) that resemble a Mexican sandal (huarache).  The masa is about 0.5 cm thick, packed with pastor (whichever meat of your choice), avocado, cabbage, tomato, and I believe sour cream and queso fresco crumble.  I've also had the Hawaiian Quesadilla. If you love the pineapples with pastor, you might love this too! This particular quesdilla order is filled with pineapple, cheese, pastor, and ham.  This taco truck location is located on a gas station lot, so parking can be quite difficult. There's a line to order at the stand in front of the truck.  After ordering, you'll receive a receipt with your number on it. The most recent time I went, they had a separate Leo's truck specifically for condiments. They have a sign that says it is $1 for extra condiments. I usually show my receipt to them. There are sauces, radish, lime, and onion/green onions.  There are 3 sauces: green, red, guac. My favorite are the green and guac, which both have a slight nice kick of spice to it.  Yum! And service is great. They were very sweet each time I've been here!

CASH ONLY We went on a Sunday afternoon around 3-4PM. Parking could be tight but it is manageable. You can park at the gas station or street parking. It was a long wait because the person in front of us ordered 50 tacos. We ordered chicken, carne asada, and al pastor tacos. Their al pastor tacos were really good. I really liked their salsas. My boyfriend liked the chicken and carne asada but they were a bit dry so add extra lime and salsas. They give you radish too. The carne asada fries is $11.

This was the second stop on our self guided taco tour while we were in LA.  We just got a single Al Pastor taco. I thought the taco was pretty good, but I've had better Al Pastor tacos.  I wouldn't go out of my way to try this spot since I think there are better taco spots in LA, but if you're in the area, it's not a bad choice.
The service is quick, food is not bad! The portions of side items (viggies for tacos, salsas) was perfect amount. My kids where happy with everything too.

When in LA you need to go to a taco truck and good thing Leo's has multiple locations! We came around noon and were able to order pretty quickly. We had to get their Al pastor tacos so we got those plus a cabeza and Asada taco alongside their red sauce. All the tacos were great and I did enjoy the asada and cabeza more than the Al pastor which was surprising considering they are known for Al pastor. I just wish the Al pastor was a bit more tender. The slices are thin and perfect yet they had more of a bite then I'd like. The cabeza was cooked perfectly and had that great softness too it. The asada was also damn good so I recommend getting those for sure. And it must be mentioned that these tacos are only $1.75 each! I'm used to tacos in NorCal costing at least $2.50 if not $3.00 smh.

Pulled up to Leo's Taco Truck around 10:30pm and there was a fat line and it was so hard to find parking ;-; We ordered the well known al pastor tacos, a carne asada taco, and an al pastor quesadilla! The tacos were pretty good and I liked how there was pineapple on it!! I know Leo's is known for their al pastor but I lowkey liked the carne asada more. The quesadilla was alright...the cheese was just not super melty which definitely made a difference. Overall, the wait was reasonable for the amount of people that were there, but I'd be okay skipping out on it.

Leo's Tacos serves some of LA's freshest tacos. I often find myself here with friends on a late night after going out or for a spontaneous hang out. Leo's Tacos is located in a corner in the parking lot of a gas station. The lines can get pretty long, but they're still relatively quick.

Hot this taco truck up on a late night while I was in Hollywood. It was ok! I ordered carnitas tacos and for some reason my carnitas tasted like chicken. I think they gave me chicken! Lol the only downside was my taco shells didn't seem cooked like they were right out of the package. I returned my horchata it wasn't sweet and tasted really watery. The light green sauce was really really good if your not into spicy. Will I go back? I'm not sure!  maybe!

Leo how I love you.... or at least your nachos.... My nachos were absolutely incredible but tacos? My al pastor tacos were terrible! Flavorless the only thing I tasted was the pineapple. I would come back for the nachos but the tacos nope. They also should say the numbers in english because not everyone understands Spanish

As a Bay Area native we often hear the tacos in LA are superior. My partner and I came to Los Angeles for the first time together and we're on a mission to try various types of tacos. This was our first location as we arrive pretty late. There was a pretty impressive line and they had a really cool set up with one track where you order the food and the other truck is where you receive your salsas and additional items for your food. There was a little bit of confusion as our order did not come out and 15 minutes later we checked in and they stated our order had already been picked up. They graciously made us a new order and overall the tacos were pretty good. I was expecting a little bit more flavor in the meat, and I'm happy I tried this place but I can't say it was the best tacos I've ever had. I suggest you come and check this place out and judge for yourself.

AMAZING! Nothing more is needed. Honestly, because this location was next to the gas station, I doubted the taste. However, many people were ordering and waiting for the food to be ready. Once I tasted the food, I knew I'd come back for sure. This place was CASH ONLY.

The tacos are decent, not my favorite. All 3 sauces are great, the al pastor obviously a winner. I wish they put some like grilled onions peppers or jalapeños to spice it up. BUT - what made the experience 5 stars was the quesadilla hawaiana... oh my lord. I've never had pineapple in a quesadilla before but I'm definitely going to look out for it now!!! Life changing. Their horchata was deep in the cinnamon flavor too. So good.

This is a taco truck in a gas station. It is incredibly busy . The tacos are 1.75 and are delicious . Get the pork with grilled pineapple , el pastor , it's amazing. They only take cash so be ready . The salsas are hot and fresh . Definitely go !

You might see the pics and be like meh, but once you taste that green salsa with the tacos or the quesadilla...you'll be shocked and how good it is!!! We also got the asada fries - very saucy and the meat was good. Love that they give you a little bag with the onions, cilantro, salsas, and turnip things. It lets you really control how much you want on your tacos.

I don't know how people get the pics of the sliced al pastor as my al pastor tacos looked diced and supermarket level quality. I've been here twice in the day time and it hasn't blown me away. El flamin taco is miles better as the al pastor is crispy and delicious. I'm a bit disappointed.

Leo's tacos always tastes delicious no matter what time of day. Apparently they are always busy so expect a wait when you get there after finding that parking spot. Order al pastor tacos and you're welcome. Don't forget to take cash.

The truck literally says "best tacos al pastor" and they aren't kidding. They've earned that name for sure.  We stopped by for late night tacos. They're parked at a corner gas station so it can get pretty packed. They have two trucks, one to order food and the other one just for condiments. Make sure you bring cash! Even just $10 goes a long way here.  We tried out the al pastor tacos, cabeza taco, and a mulita. We ate the al pastor first but I wish we saved it for last. It was so flavorful but my favorite part was how they shave the meat down and how thinly sliced it was. The cabeza taco was good too, but better with all the toppings and salsa. The mulita is definitely a heavier option, perfect if you want the cheesy aspect. But honestly you could just order a dozen of the al pastor tacos only and be in heaven already. It's good by itself already since it has the flavor with the grilled pineapple, but add on their guac, salsa, lime, cilantro and onions for the ultimate experience.  We came back the next night but just our luck, they were closed for Good Friday. This is definitely going to be a spot we return to every time we come to SoCal. They have multiple trucks at different locations too so there's just no excuse!

Al pastor tacos at a great price. The quesadilla was a 10/10 and I could drink the red sauce every day. The spot is in a busy intersection and there is no seating or bathrooms so plan to eat somewhere else!
Better than a restaurant, The food is always fresh and authentic. I love supporting local businesses and it feels right with Leo's Tacos Truck

Where do I begin , well for starters I don't normally buy from food trucks but I've heard a lot about it so I thought I'd give it a try I arrived around 10:30 am a couple of people were there once I was leaving there was already a big line and I can see why . It's only cash no card I paid about $35 for 3 tacos 2 burritos 2 sopes and 2 large horchatas. The meat, in general, is so soft and flavorful I got Asada and tripa for tacos and Asada and al pastor for burritos and just regular Asada for the sopes none of the meat was burned or no stale tortillas I would definitely come back to buy some more it is a 30 min. Drive from where I live but so worth it!
Given that I still think about these tacos weekly, 10 years after moving from LA, I think it warrants an upgrade to five stars These are the best tacos

Nice. Ricky sets up his fish fryers in the garden adjacent to Mi Alma every weekend from 12:30ish to 5:30ish. The fish, and sometimes shrimp, are cooked up in a delicious golden hot tub of oil and flavor. The tacos are big and simple: just a fish filet (or two shrimp), some cabbage, and some pico de gallo. Two should fill you up, though you may want three just because they taste so good. Hell, have four! Go for it. Try them with all four sauces, but my personal fave is a little mayo, a little spicy red. The garden itself is charming and unique, but has a glaringly problematic lack of shade. They either blast KCRW's eclectic music or have someone playing on the stage. All in all, it makes for a pleasant weekend lunch.

Ricky's is friendly and the tacos are fresh! I like how they use clean oil and the refreshing slaw, jalapeño, tomatoes on top adds nice texture and flavor to the tacos. Salsas were also great, i really like all three-mild, med and spicy.  The thing I didn't enjoy was the batter of the fish-its too salty. Also the shrimp was kinda small.  I ordered 2fish and 2 Shrimp and it was enough for me. However, $20 for four tacos seem a little steep.
never misses Make sure to try all the sauces/salsas  Fish and shrimp tacos are equally as great  staff is great too

Got 3 fish tacos and 1 rickys special, which had fried fish and fried shrimp. The fish is fried to perfection! I wish they gave lime or something or salted the fish a littleeee. I did feel like it was missing something. The fried shrimp was good!  I love the freshnesss of the tacos. Definitely need to get more salsa next time though!

Delicious fish tacos!!! The food truck is a bit hidden in a random neighborhood and is under a bridge overpass so it could seem off-putting at first but don't let that deter you! The tacos here are super light and refreshing. Some fish tacos can be too heavy but not this one!  I'm excited to come back here again! Definitely one of my top taco places in LA.

I would drive past this place all the time when leaving Griffith Park, and always wanted to try it but was really skeptical. It's pretty common for most places to say they have "the best fish tacos" but this places wasn't joking. They had fish, shrimp and a 50/50 one, so we ordered one of each. Each taco was delicious my favorite was the regular fish tacos. It was flavorful had a nice texture, and a little kick at the end of your bite. Overall it really was the best fish tacos I've had, can't wait to go back.

This taco joint sets the standard for what Baja style fried fish taco means in SoCal! The beach style food is a symbol of fresh cooking right off the grill, and this popular joint always draws a busy line where folks are waiting for our hungry tacos. Go ahead and walk to the order window, or place your order online, for the refreshing and crunchy fried fish tacos. The fat flour tortillas are layered with bits of veggies and condiments and a thick meaty fillet. The fried shrimp is crunchy on the outside and tender on the inside - a must for me every time I'm here!

Yeah, you ain't ever gonna go wrong with RICKYS FISH TACOS. Ever.  With that being said, the beautiful ambiance underneath the historic 5 free with all the passing vehicles, completes the CALI lifestyle.  3 options of "hot" sauces, and they are all beyond flavorful and you're not going wrong even if you dab em all at once. Also crema! Can't forget the cream based sauce it's fire! I doused my tacos like they have never been drenched in my life. Saucier the better I say.  Refreshing and so light. You don't feel off after consuming 5 tacos. You don't get an unpleasant seafood flavor, it's all fresh.  So I can't remember how many of what I got, but it was a variation between the "fish taco" and rickys special. Both were FANTASTIC. A++ in my book. You're greeted by friendly staff from the truck and just the from the feels you already know you're in for a treat. Can't believe it took my this long to finally take a nab at RICKYS FISH TACOS. Thanks for being bomb! Everything was phenomenal. Can't wait to go back!

I love a good fish taco... Ricky's makes a damn good one. Ricky's Fish Tacos was new to me. I had no idea until recently. Shame on me for that. We tried a couple of times, drove by but they werent there. Today, finally the stars aligned. It was just after lunch time on a cool Wednesday in LA. We made our way along Riverside Dr between Los Feliz and Glendale Blvd and spotted Ricky's. Yes!! I ordered 2 fish tacos ($3.75 each) and the lady ordered 2 fish tacos and a shrimp taco ($3.75). You order and pay at the small window on the right. Cash or card. You're given a number and pick up at the small window on the left. When we walked up, there was just one person ordering before us. We ordered and waited about 5-7 mins before our tacos were ready. Sodas & drinks in the cooler door to the left. Pour your own squeeze bottle salsas (in varying heat) and crema inside the cooler door to the right. We walked to the car and posted up there to eat. First thought upon seeing the tacos. Wow. They dont skimp. The cabbage, diced tomatoes and diced jalapenos are aplenty and a generous portion of battered and fried fish. Deliciously crispy battered and fried fish, I might add. Perfect crunch, fresh flaky fish, great slaw with a kick and the perfect crema to drizzle. They are some of the best fish tacos I've had. It's the crunch of the batter and the flakiness of the fresh fish for me. I guess there's a reason why so many people flock here. Jonathan Gold never lied... never. He knew what LA liked and LA liked what he knew. Ricky's Fish Tacos was one of those places.  Street parking along Riverside only. Finding a spot may be tough. Its worth it when you do. I like how they accept credit cards. Service was quick and friendly. There is a letter written in pencil posted on the window that was obviously written by a young fan of Ricky's Fish Tacos. It's a good read.

The batter on these are so delicious !!  Lots of flavor and super fresh !!!  Great service Fast and safe  My only reason for 4 and not 5 stars is that they don't believe in limes with there fish tacos !! Even though the batter is delicious it can be a bit salty and needed that zest to freshen it up and cut through that salt !! Other then that every was delicious and all the sauce cups were a must try on the tacos !
The tacos are good but the prices are very high. I don't think you get for you are paying for.

Mmm absolutely loved Ricky's Fish Tacos. There's a reason why this truck was on Jonathan Gold's 101 Best Restaurants list. They have just a few offerings-- mainly fish tacos, shrimp tacos, half shrimp/ half fish, and occasionally lobster tacos-- and all of their options are stellar. The shrimp tacos, which I doused with the verde sauce, were my favorite! You might want to order ahead as they're pretty popular, and we had a bit of a wait ordering at the truck on a Saturday afternoon.

Hubby had waited a long time to try this.  At last...   The truck is parked right by the 5 South onramp on Riverside Dr. near Los Feliz.  We went on a Sunday soon after it opened.  5th in line or so, we got our tacos after under 20 minutes.  We tried Fish, Shrimp & Special (combo of fish & shrimp), and they are all tasty.  Good-sized tacos, and they did not skimp on the ingredients.  I was full from just eating 2.   Hubby had 4, and he said it was probably too much.  My only gripe is they are a bit too spicy.  Next time I'd ask them to hold the jalapeño.  Don't forget to sauce up your tacos.   They range from Not Spicy to Hot and are stored in the fridge built into the truck.   The door handle is to your right when you order at the window.  We would not have known had we not seen the patrons before us open the fridge. Street parking is available but might get tough with all the red curb, but if you don't mind crossing the street, it's not bad.   Go try Rick's.

Both the Fish Taco and the Ricky Special are incredible. Always fresh and really fast. Wish they had more hours, their food is a craving all the time.  Their staff is very friendly and helpful.  I wish they did the lobster tacos so we could try them! We found this on buzzfeed and they're the best tacos in LA for sure. I tried this week and I came ten minutes too late

Deserving if its fame. Fish is so light and crispy and the slaw is so refreshing with a nice kick. All their sauces are amazing and would recommend just putting all of them on. Only real downsides is you have to catch them in their limited hours so it might be real busy. Its only a two man show, but that helps you appreciate the effort and expertise that goes into these tacos

I love a good fish taco so I was excited to see that I was near Ricky's on my day trip in LA. Even after a day of eating, I had to drop by to try them out. They are located in an underpass which was a bit difficult to get to, so I had to rely on Google maps to get me there. Because it was a weekend, I was surprised to see that there was no wait, but I won't complain.  I ordered 1 Fish Taco and 1 Shrimp Taco to split with my girlfriend. My first impression was the lack of sauce on the tacos, which now after reading some of the reviews, seems like I needed to ask for it. Kind of disappointing that they didn't offer anything when I picked up the food. The undressed slaw definitely took away from the deliciousness of the fish. I can imagine it would be been significantly better with the sauces. The shrimp taco wasn't too great as well.  Overall, it wasn't the best fish taco I've ever had but now that I know that I needed to ask for the sauce and salsa, maybe I'll give it another shot if I'm ever in the area.

Review During Covid: For the amount of reviews this truck has, it did not meet my expectations, sadly.  Here's why: Fish and shrimp were well seasoned, but the other components were mediocre. The slaw was just cabbage, tomatoes, and jalapeños-- so it was a tad spicy with that kick. Be mindful how much salsa you put! I put a ton of salsa, so it was spicy! The ratio of batter and protein was not good as well. I didn't taste the fish much, only the batter. I actually liked the shrimp taco better than the fish in this case, but I was looking forward to some bomb fish tacos. The tortillas also did not taste fresh. They had that hard chew type of texture, so it tasted like a day old tortillas.  I liked that you can put salsas on your own, but make sure to use hand sanitizer after. Communal salsa bottles don't feel right to me during this time. I wish they can put it into little containers for us or sanitize the bottles regularly (which I don't know if they do).

Ugh. Does anyone do it better than Ricky's? I think not. The batter is so crispy, yet the fish always so tender. They top it with a basic slaw that probably wouldn't be great undressed, but add one of their salsas and white sauce and the end result in an unbelievable flavor explosion.  Their spicy salsa will knock you off your feet, so I like to start with one taco with the spiciest salsa, and chase the next taco(s) with the mildest. To me, I don't really like the medium tier salsa because I think the smokiness detracts from my taco experience, but to each their own.  COVID update: they are definitely still operating, but wait times can be 30+ minutes if you go during the lunch rush! Bring a book. Or make yourself drool by looking at photos of the delicious tacos you are about to eat.
Truly some of the best fish tacos.  I always send people to rickys fish taco truck for a fix and they always come back satisfied! Definitely a must try.

2 stars based on availability. Been coming here on Wednesday and Thursday and the truck hasn't been here. Called a few times with no response. Not sure what's going on with this truck but I suggest updating hours and time availabilities.

Excellent experience coming to HomeState for brunch. I did not stay to eat at the shop, but there seemed to be nice outdoor seating - though on this particular Sunday morning, it was packed and I would have had to wait for a seat. I was in and out in 10 minutes, including the line to order. Ordered the Trinity, Pechos, and Potato tacos. Thoroughly enjoyed the portion sizes and three tacos might've even been too much if I hadn't been starving. I'd say on a normal outing (read: when I come back), two tacos would be a sufficient meal. I got them on flour tortillas and love em.  The packaging was excellent for take-out, and each taco is wrapped in a burrito of aluminum foil and clearly labeled via colorful tape that's easy to rip off when it's time to unwrap the goodness within. Mine were still warm 30 minutes after I picked them up.  The staff member at the counter was super courteous and patient with my indecisive ordering. He said I should expect to wait 10 minutes, but the food was out in 5. The place is very busy so everything served was freshly prepared.  Overall 5 star experience.

I was jonesing for some queso and remembered that HomeState was on my list.  Drove to the Hollywood location and waited in line for a couple of minutes. FYI - parking was a huge pain, so beware that you might have to search for a bit. The service was absolutely amazing.  I asked the cashier server what an appropriate amount of tacos would be and he said 3-4 is a good starting point.  We got the Blanco, Potatoes, Emo's tacos with the house flour tortilla and it was so freaking delish!   Also got the Lil' Queso and it came with a decent amount of chips. Once we were done, a waiter came over with another serving of chips and we had to sadly turn him down.  Great service for sure! Food all tasted great, and the queso hit the spot. They do check for vaccinations, which made me feel safe. All in all, I'll definitely be back! Ambiance: 3/5 Food: 4/5 Service: 5/5 Overall: 4/5 Would Return: Yes

Really, really good food--and they give you a lot of food for the price.  My only disappointment here was the chicken taco, which wasn't bad, but just wasn't good. The potato taco, however, was DELICIOUS! Reallllly crispy potatoes and the pickled jalapeños were so good, I'm going to come back specifically for this taco.  The spicy frozen Paloma was great too, and super necessary after waiting in that long line in the heat. I'm not a huge fan of queso but that was also really yummy!

Texas-Toast brisket/chicken sandwich makes for a nice quick lunch. And even though Homeastate reps the Texan style, the brisket is more of a deli/roast instead of smoked. Can you imagine if it were, how much of a knockout this would be?  I felt the sandwich to be dry in certain places, that it required the spicier homemade salsa in order to bring out its better qualities. For eleven or twelve bucks in 2021, I think the restaurant can afford to provide some tortilla chips on the side. Instead, an order is gonna cost you a few dollars more. For busy lunch/dinner hours, expect wait times between 15-25 minutes -- possibly more if you're ordering the Texas toast sandwich.

Seriously great breakfast tacos. Can beat the price, quality, quantity, or that flour tortilla. Tried one corn tortilla, it was good but don't play yourself, go flour only.  My favorite was the don't mess with Texas taco, the beans were amazing. I eat a good amount but 2 tacos was plenty for me. Potatoes are on the salty side but very tasty, & that queso was worth every dip. Very generous portions here & great quality, worth the hype. Came on a Saturday a little before 11am and no line/issues getting seating but by 11:30 there was a huge line and no seating left.

We should have called in before standing in the long line through scorching hot weather. My blood sugar levels dropped before we got to the counter so I headed back to the car to revive myself with some snacks and A/C. They tossed an extra taco with our order for free, we only ordered 6 : Potato, Trinity and Pecos. Thanks guys!  They were all good but my favorite was Potato. The sauces were good too. Nothing mind blowing but an easy meal if you need some fuel. I liked the masking tape they used with the printed names, cute details or what? If you're in the area and are craving some decent breakfast tacos, hit them up. Customer service gets an A+ according to my gal that placed the order before I headed back to the car for relief. There's also a super kewl bookstore across the street too if you want to take a trip back to nostalgia lane..

I've been eating at HomeState since the day they opened. This Tex-Mex taqueria sources only the best ingredients and uses them in their magnificent rolled-up tacos. I've tried quite a few of the offerings and now know what I like: the BLANCO and the PECOS.  The Blanco is their vegetarian taco with egg whites and portobello mushrooms. I add avocado on it for a buck more. It's just a healthy and heavenly morsel, a soft flour tortilla wrapped around fluffy eggs and 'shrooms to do with as you please...  The Pecos taco, I get w avo also and, again, always w the flour tortilla. The brisket is perfectly seasoned, miraculously almost as soft as the fluffy egg, and just combines sooooo well w it and the cheese. That first bite just rolls the eyes back in my head each time. You get HomeState's homemade green salsa verde and red rioja salsa sauce for dipping and while I prefer the green, I always alternate between the two for some reason. Certain tacos are best served with a particular salsa but that's a personal call so just play around with it all. One thing you'll quickly determine though? They just complete the taco, like how Rene Zellweger completes Tom Cruise in JERRY MAGUIRE-- by the end of the meal (film), you cannot have imagined one without the other. (*Yes, I crack myself up.) HomeState has scaled out some and there is probably one near you. I've only eaten at the first one in Los Angeles as it's closest to me, the one on Hollywood Blvd in Los Feliz. I usually carry the HomeState grub over to Go Get Em Tiger for their superlative coffee and it's always just a great way to start the day.

Such good tacos and well packaged too (so you don't have to worry about them falling apart in transit). I went with the potato tacos and it was packed with ingredients. The sauces also pack a punch--pretty spicy in a subtle way. Very satisfying and memorable. Will definitely be coming back for more  P.S I went on a taco tour in LA and this place has by far the best vegetarian options

Ok ok ok. Yes yes yes!!! My bf and I have been dying to try this place and for some reason never did... until today!! Everything was fresh and delicious. We got 2 picadilla tacos (then ordered another to share cause they were sooo dang good!), one chicken and one potato taco! We also got the lil queso dip! Which is an absolute MUST!!!  We will be back very soon :)  Also the root beer they have is BOMB!

Homestate had me with the mention they make their tortillas in house!  A few friends had been here before and had good things to say.  The interior is very clean and organized. I ordered the Trinity (Bacon, eggs, potato, and cheese) and a Guadalupe (Chorizo, eggs, and cheese) taco.  For our party of 4, our order came out quickly.  Both tacos were really good and the tortilla itself had the texture and slight pull I was hoping for.  The queso was pretty good too. Both sauces were so good and I found myself bouncing back and forth between the red and green for every bite, culminating in both on my last bite.  It doesn't top my fav tacos from Austin, but it's up there.  I'm guessing they're among the best in LA!

This is one of my favorite Tex mex places and would come here in a heartbeat. A friend reminded me that a cute coffee shop was situated here prior. The parking is not super great though. They have a small lot and an extra lot next to it, but maybe a total of 20 spaces. It seems like people somehow make their way here because the rush seemed to come and go around 11:30-12:30 on a Saturday.  My friend and I ordered the loaded queso. Not usually a fan of beans but it was really good over the chips. Don't forget to save a little extra queso for your tacos! Sooooo good!  I got the potato tacos and this one is a classic with cheese melted with some slices cabbage and other goodness on a flour tortilla. I also got the chicken but didn't find it to have any spark.  My friend ordered us both the peach green tea lemonade and it was super watered down and the hibiscus was super tart. I think I'd rather stick to my own water for now. So glad that home state finally came to Pasadena and the food did not disappoint!
Great Tacos, from carnivore to Vegan. Margarita's rock too. I'm a fan of corn tortillas, but they make their own flour in house, I recommend them.

My husband raved about the breakfast tacos here before, and we happened to be across the street already and needed a quick bite before our long drive home. I placed an order through their website for some tacos and it was ready in about 15 minutes. They pack everything so nicely and the tacos are clearly labeled, and comes with red and green salsa.  The blanco was my least favorite of the three but it's a great veggie and healthier option because of the egg whites. It's definitely better with the spicy salsa though. It was a close call between the pecos breakfast taco (shredded brisket) and the tijuana panthers taco but I had to pick the latter as my favorite, because of the addition of queso and potatoes. The pico de gallo added another layer of juiciness to the taco too.  They have more on the menu here than just tacos but I don't blame you if you wanna just come for the tacos itself. Can't beat an all day breakfast taco menu either!
All you need to know is to Just look at the line!  Tasty hipster tacos across the street from an unhoused sidewalk encampment.  This is LA!

Second time ordering pick up through Yelp from HomeState. The cheese quesadilla and buñuelos take the win over the tacos. The food was five stars but the delivery timing isn't accurate. I received an email stating my order would be ready in 12 minutes but Yelp never updated an order time even after I picked up my order.  After waiting for the time frame mentioned in Yelp the food was completely cold.

Got 2 breakfast tacos to go. Came 5 minutes after I ordered online and it was ready. Got the brisket and bacon breakfast taco. The bacon one was way better. It was very good. Bacon was crispy. The brisket one lacked flavors, luckily they gave 2 mini salsas (red and green), so added them made it a bit better. Not the best salsa I've ever had, but I'd come back to try their other items. Staff was friendly and polite.

I loved this place. I would drive a long distance for Austin-style breakfast tacos, and this was the best version of those I've had in California. There was a big line, so prepare for a wait, but wow it was absolutely worth it. Strongly recommend.

I was craving some Mexican food and this place hits the spot in Los Feliz. There are definitely cheaper alternatives like taco stands scattered across west LA but don't skip out on this place that offers some Tex-mex style tacos! I personally ordered the popular non-vegetarian choices: Trinity and brisket taco. The trinity consisted of egg, potato, bacon, and cheese and although it appears to be a basic breakfast taco, the execution is excellent. The bacon and potato is quite crispy and gives a good contrast to the soft tortilla. The beef brisket taco is overloaded with brisket along with guacamole. The tacos are filling and at an excellent price point for a standard meal, although it's definitely more than taco stands. The busy-ness of this place varies a lot; we went for dinner and ordered ahead in anticipation of crowds but it wasn't busy, but according to a friend, ordering online helps a lot since the place is takeout style anyway. I've heard that the morning and lunchtime is where it's the busiest so keep that in mind. Note that as of now, there is absolutely no seating options available so you will need to find a bench somewhere to eat or take the food home. Slight inconvenience but it's most likely due to covid precautions

This place just hits the spot! My friends and I have been wanting to come to Homestate ever since they were featured on Buzzfeed and finally were able to. The breakfast tacos are so delicious -- especially with the red and green sauces. Queso is a dream as well. We got three tacos each and our favorites are the Guadalupe, Blanco, and Pecos (Trinity was delicious too)! Drinks are nice and refreshing -- beware the Hibiscus Limeade is tart (like ooh you can really really taste the lime in there) but so good and moreish. When we arrived, there was a line but service is really fast and seats get emptied quickly. They have outdoor and indoor seating (indoor has larger tables for big groups) but both work really well! The music is great, atmosphere is so casual and trendy -- love it!

Surprisingly good! We had the brisket and chicken tacos. The brisket was soft and tasty. The only thing about the tacos is they do get expensive once you add more things to the taco. The tortilla cinnamon dessert was a nice addition! Will definitely be back since my 2 year old devoured the quesadilla.

I had an hour to kill and a hungry stomach to fill, so I looked here on Yelp for a good burrito close to my location. This place didn't disappoint. I asked the very helpful girl at the window if the carnitas were a specialty. She enthusiastically said "YES" (while also telling me the shrimp burrito was what they are most known for).  I ordered it. I liked it. Crispy carnitas in small pieces with a wonderful flavor. Too many places give you big chunks of pork. That's not how you want to do it. Sky's lived up to its "Gourmet" name. I recommend it.  Outdoor patio is inviting despite some of the traffic noise from Pico.

Sad to say that Sky's isn't as good as I remember.  I used to live on Hauser near Pico but moved in 2010...back then, Skys was in a tiny spot right near that intersection. They've since moved (4 years ago) to a larger space across the street a few blocks down. The ambiance is lovely and staff is fine, but it took a really long time to get my food, and there were only two people who had ordered before me. The food is what was really lacking though. I had one potato and cheese taco and one tofu taco. The tofu taco was DROWNING in oil. Unbearable and inedible. The potato taco was swimming in oil. Not quite drowning...treading oil, if you will. Ha. I took them to the front counter where you place your order and showed the cashier and she didn't seem surprised. I asked her if this is normally how the tofu taco is served and she said yes because that's how you have to cook tofu..."in oil and butter"!!  Ummm...I've been vegetarian since 1996, so needless to say I've cooked my fair share of tofu. Overkill. Big time.  She asked if I wanted something else and because I didn't want to wait another 20 minutes for one taco, I asked for two new tortillas instead. The tortillas used in both of my tacos were so drenched in oil and butter that they literally ripped in half when I picked one up for the first bite. I am sorely disappointed, as I've been waiting to come back and try Sky's tacos for over ten years since I moved. The owner is lovely, I remember meeting her a decade ago...she may want to speak to the cooks because this was just so unappealing. Super sad and feeling rather sick as to what I just partially ate.

I've had their mushroom tacos, yummm!  I understand they won't always have them but there isn't a tofu scramble or good vegan breakfast at all.  There wasn't anyone there and they took so long for a small order for 2 people. I didn't see anyone go pick up good either.  I don't recommend to go if you're starving they are slow!!  Also note No raw sugar or non dairy creamer!!?? Really? The coffee tasted awful btw and I did return it. I won't go back for sure.

It's a no for me. I ordered 2 beef tacos for me and a cheese quesadilla for my son. The tacos were just okay. The quesadilla was really bad. The quesadilla contained lettuce tomatoes cilantro and a LOT of sour cream. And when I say a lot, I mean there was more sour cream than actual cheese. No where on the menu does it mention that there were all these extra ingredients in the quesadilla. In addition, there was a photo attached to the menu and it did not show the ingredients either. I had to unfortunately order food elsewhere for my child so it was a complete waste of money. I probably won't be back again.

Sky's! Where have you been all my life? Right under my nose, apparently. I was in the mood for Ground Beef Tacos which are surprisingly, hard to find aside from fast food joints. My initial Google search brought up Yelp's Top 10 Ground Beef tacos "near me" and honestly, there aren't a lot except for Sky's Gourmet in Mid-City. So I made my way over there -- there is a small parking lot that only houses two spots (occupied that day) so I parked on Pico and walked up. The outdoor dining is all moved to the side -- you notice all the markings for appropriate social distancing, as well as available sanitizers for safety. They did a great job with the Patio, turning it into a walk-up window with the Menu on a big screen TV so no one has to touch anything. The Staff was so nice and helpful - all worth the wait! I went home and had really, really delicious tacos and the ground beef is so flavorful! The Potato and Cheese is really good (they use red potatoes) and the Peach cobbler is yum! I've been back since (twice this month) and tried the Chicken Burrito which is OK -- I really prefer the Beef. The Chicken taco is good too, but be sure to get a sauce in it like sour cream, etc. My family got orders of the Carnitas tostadas which are smallish but very good and made with black beans as well. I definitely look forward to my future taco-relationship with Sky's, and want to try the all-day Breakfast menu and of course, can't wait to dine-in when it's safe to do so!

Covid delivery review: This morning I woke up craving tacos! So to satisfy my craving I ordered from here. My Seamless delivery man even said their food is good. Boy this spot did not disappoint! I got the carnitas taco, this was FILLING like they packed the taco very generously. I also got a beef burrito which was huge and flavorful which I really liked as well. Last but not least I ordered Sky French toast to satisfy my sweet tooth. It was soft and delicious w maple syrup and powdered sugar already on top and doesn't taste like your typical French toast.

When people see that Sky's is built on a Spanish Mexican architectural plan with outdoor patio, it seems automatically assumed that it is Mexican run & operated.  Like Bill's Taco House on MLK Blvd., Sky's in Mid City is run by Barbara Burrel who is Black so expect an interesting fusion of Mexican, Cajun- Créole, and Southern cooking.  Sky's has been on my list way before my Yelping days and am sorry I didn't come earlier. I would have loved to have been seated at the counter to see how the food was prepared. (Refer to Taco Maven Yelper Jay K. for excellent blow by blow descriptions of the cooking process.) Unfortunately, w/ the Pandemic all is take out ordered from the takeout window although it can be eaten in their patio. Since the food can get messy from the thick sauces, there is a convenient outdoor faucet & sink, soap, paper towels to wash up those sauce coated fingers.  1) Auténtico Mini Taco: cubed Carne Asada  steak, moist, beefy chaw. Grilled onions, cilantro and citrus juice that adds a fruity sourness. On two small, street-size, corn tortillas. Mild flavour for those who can't handle piquancy.  2)  SKY'S FAMOUS GOURMET TACOS: 6-inch corn tortillas: Chock full of chewy, fibrous crawfish in a thick, red chile oil like Brazilian Dende. The red chile used reminds me of Hungarian paprika that adds a sweet, light smokiness, not spicy heat.  Tomato sauce flavours with what may be cumin to add a woody, earthy, herbal smokey tones. Chopped fresh tomato adds sweet acidity, and cilantro adds another layer of green herbal funk that some say tastes like soap. Scattered grating of yellow orange cheddar.  3)  SKY'S TEXAS-STYLE RIBS: Meaty, porky, fatty, moist   baby-back ribs, baked and slathered with Sky's special BBQ Sauce that may have tomato sauce, brown sugar, cumin. Since these ribs are baked, there is no natural smoke infused quality. Ample sized. Good home style oven baked Sunday dinner.  Two hot sauces:  Mild, thick red tomato based sauce makes up for lack of chile heat with an almost sweet, medicinal cough syrup-like taste.  Hot, pale yellow Habanero looking salsa is garlic scented as well as having a mild fermented, satisfying funkiness. It has an ineffable ultra hot chile pepper scent.  Sky provides another interesting take on the protean ability of the Mexican Taco to take in prepared foods that are not particularly Mexican in origin.  Witness Roy Choi for placing Korean Bulgogi, Daeji Gogi inside of a corn tortilla as well as Wes Ávila who puts in chefly French technique based cuisine into corn tortillas at Guerilla Tacos. Sky's Gourmet Tacos is possibly an only in L.A. phenomenon.

Dear Gary - This is such a cool review. You are a true gastronome. Not only did you nail the ingredients (Paprika and Cumin), you also "Got it". After 30 years of cooking, it is a pleasure having a true aficionado taste my inventions and think they are worth eating. I never claimed to be the greatest cook in the world, but to rate this highly with someone clearly so knowledgeable - well, all I can say is, that it's gratifying. I hope you will try our Cheesecakes too - I realize it seems weird, but believe it or not we have been awarded "Best Cheesecake" in Los Angeles three years in a row! By the way we now sell our sauces and spice on Amazon and our web-site - just in case you miss them! Anyway - really appreciated the detail and time you took to write the review. Kind Regards!

I came here because signs (the appearance of silver blonde haired and long limbed females around the Los Angeles area) were indicating I should seek Icelandic delights, and since Sky is the abbreviation for Iceland's monetary currency on ISO 4217, I chose to come here to investigate.  I ordered the $7 chips and guacamole (AVOcado, olive oil, and lime juice), which came as a tiny bag of chips and 1/4 cup of guacamole. Their chips were crunchy, light, warm, and dusted with spice that wasn't too aggressive to be the accompaniment.  The bill said tax was 9%, but I think Los Angeles has a 9.5% tax, so they should consult a computer security professional to make sure they haven't been short-changed by a computer error. I gave them a couple of dollars to correct the situation and mentioned to their employee what the tax should be.

Sky's Tacos The Spirit Airlines of taco stands.  I ordered a Turkey Burger, with grilled onions.  Thought I'd try Sky's.  The Turkey Burger was a hot greasy mess.  I ordered from Sky's.  That burger's sitting in my stomach like a sack of cement.  I ordered from Sky's,  I ordered from Sky's.  I ordered from Sky's.  I tried a lobster taco, it was from Sky's.  It was a soggy mess, it was from Sky's.  Now I'm left disappointed, because I got Sky's, because I got Sky's. Because I got Sky's.  I was used to like chips and guacamole before I got Sky's. I didn't know what too much salt on chips was until I got Sky's (uh uh la la da da) I've never had less inspired guacamole, you know why?  (why man?) (hey hey) Because I got Sky's, because I got Sky's, because I got Sky's!!

Got to pick up food here seems like a really cool joint to hang and enjoy dinner with great fam and friends, no doubt. I can see the folks who work here, be total family. Just great vibes when you come here.  Got food here on Cinco de Mayo and food took over an hour but wasn't upset cause it seems like an app messed up everyone. But everyone was all over the place and can imagine busy weekends must also be a nightmare. So maybe don't show up hungry? I'm not completely sold on the food. Price point and quality wasn't aligned. We got beef, tilapia, chicken, and shrimp..  tacos, burrito, torta, and quesadilla but aside from beef flavor that you can taste, everything else wasn't really present.

The problem with being great at something is that greatness becomes expected. When this place is "on", it's fantastic. The problem we've had is consistency. One week the tilapia taco is perfection. Next week, it's fishy and inedible. The BBQ taco can range from "lie awake in bed craving it" to "I just got three bites in a row of disgusting greasy gristle". We really want to love this place but the lack of consistency has us feeling disappointed half the time, and elated half the time. It's exhausting. I think I'd rather frequent a spot that's just consistently above average so I'm never disappointed.
Love their food, love that they are a long term member of my neighborhood. Highly recommend this place! Try the wild yam taco! So so so good!!!
20 min to get an order of 4 tacos and 1 burrito?? The only good thing is that they gift you cheesecake.. but for the price definitely not worth it! Sorry you need to change prices or do better food

We picked this place because it seemed like they had lots of options.  We got there around 9ish so that was the first mistake. (Out here for work related business and that's the best time we could leave to get some food) The guy taking everyone's orders was just ready to go and you could tell he was just rushing us.  As for the food, for me it was just ok. My family liked their food. We were disappointed in the salsas though. We like spice and heat and the spicy salsa had no real flavor in our opinion.

Went here on a friend's recommendation and came from out of town. Giving a 2.5 stars to the taste of my friend's lobster tacos and pico de gallo were not bad.  I ordered the beef taco, meat was ground beef not steak like, taste was all wrong - taco meat tasted and smelled like spaghetti meat. I couldn't even finish my meal. So disappointing.  Also the lemonade was too high in sugar as was the cheesecake. Ordered the plain cheesecake, came FROZEN, waited for it to thaw for cheesecake consistency and was too sweet to eat.

Jesus these are really good burritos. The sassy sauce is so good it makes up for its incredibly annoying name.  Wow, though. I can't wait to come back. I'm especially looking forward to dining in. But, to go, this is already hard to beat.

I haven't been here in a really long time since they were still at their last location. I ordered the shrimp burrito, open faced and it was amazing!!! Just how I remembered it. My friend got the vegan burrito and loved it as well. The lemonade was good I added a little water to mine and it was perfect. I love their food and will be going back more often.  I placed my order threw yelp. When I arrived I told the young lady my name and she told me she would call me when my order was ready. So I sat at a little table and waited a few minutes until called. Right now the table and chairs outside are just for waiting no eating (because of COVID-19). Great service and great food

A friend and I came after work one day. We order the authentic chicken, grilled chicken, beef, and mushroom tacos. They have a cute patio that we sat on to enjoy the tacos. All were delicious.  They don't serve alcohol yet but will be a super cute happy hour spot once they do with music kn the patio.

We were on our way to a park for a picnic, and decided to order take out from Sky's. We ordered an assortment of tacos including: 1. Shitake Mushroom 2. Chicken 3. Potato and Cheese 4. Asada At about $3.50 or more per taco, I expected them to be bursting with meat, sauce, and veggies. And that is exactly what I got. My favorite has got to be their potato cheese taco. I'm used to the potato being mashed, but they slice it here. It's a game changer for me! I really liked the saltiness of the cheese combined with the seasoned potatoes along with the marinated coleslaw...It was so good I wish I ordered more of it lol. Adding salsa is not a bad thing, but I think a taco should be flavorful on its own and adding salsa should enhance or add another layer to those flavors. That being said, I thought the chicken and asada were a little dry and needed salsa. The mushroom was a bit oily, but I really like shitake mushrooms, so I enjoyed eating this along with salsa.  Speaking of salsa, they have two types - green and red. I prefer the green as it's more spicy and flavorful than the sweet, almost tomato-sauce red version. But that's my preference. I also wish I ordered chips with this meal! I think next time I visit I will definitely get some. Social distancing and mask wearing is enforced. What's nice is that they have a window where you can either order food or pick up food (so you don't have to go inside). There's also a sanitation area, if you want/need it. I have to also say that the staff didn't get our order wrong. These days I noticed that more of my orders are incorrect - People are not being present with their job. And it's nice to know that the workers at Sky are professionals.

Wow! The Sky is the limit for how awful everything was! If I could rate negative stars I would.  In short: Food was refrigerator cold, overcooked (3 times), skimpy, and bad tasting. Long: Do not order food here unless you like it cold AND overcooked (didn't know this was possible). I ordered a salmon burrito after asking if it is cooked fresh and could be made rare. Apparently this was a risk that was too grand to fulfill. I got a skimpy, grey fish-smear tortilla that was not even room temperature, but cold to the touch. I ordered at the restaurant, waited in the parking lot, and picked up my food once it was called. There is no reason why it should have been cold. Perhaps refrigerator-to-microwave is the cooking method. I went back to report poor food quality and asked for a carne asada burrito instead (thinking that it would be a safer bet), this time medium-rare. I was again served cold food with shredded beef bits and lots of sauce (not good sauce). This time the food was even colder and the sauce on the side was nearly iced.  The "managers" (more than one was present), Jennifer and Lupé, informed me after the first screw up that they asked the cook, Maria, to remake the 1st burrito because it was overcooked. They confirmed that they checked the food quality for the cold food that was served to me each time and thought it was acceptable. So my food was messed up 3 times.... I barely even got an apology and Jennifer even mentioned that sour cream, which was not on my burrito, sometimes makes the food cold. The cold items that I expected on the burrito (lettuce and tomato) were barely present. Again, I do not understand how my order could have been so atrociously bad.  I got a stomach ache from simply tasting their cold meat tortillas. I've worked in the food industry for a number of years and I'm fairly certain there are health code violations here. I hope the owner hires new staff. If you're really craving a burrito, order from the food truck, Cemitas Poblanas, down the street. Great service there!

Perch was an amazing restaurant with amazing views. The ambiance had my friends and me so excited to enjoy a great meal after a stressful week. The lighting and views are breathtaking as well as the food. I couldn't stop eating once I picked up my fork. The drinks were very delicious as well. I had a cocktail (Berry something... I forgot the name) and it was phenomenal. Our servers Nathan and Lathan were both great high energy, funny, and professional servers. They were quick and fun to chat with. They definitely elevated the night and made the experience so much better. All in all, I would definitely come back and I had a great time!
Latham was a fantastic server, he made sure we were well taken care of. He was very attentive and if we were unhappy with our drink he made sure it was right. Thank you so much!

This is it. This is the place when I think of LA eats. The barriers include needing valet, needing a reservation (they take walk-ins but good luck with that), and a dress code (not jacket required but don't look too casual or they'll reject you at the door according to my boyfriend that just hopped off the plane). It takes two elevators to get here, but it's worth it.  The place is more affordable than I initially thought. The inside is like an old timey French bar while the patio is more of a softly lit romantic dinner spot overlooking the LA sky. The frou frou rabbit ravioli was great! A tiny hint of spice was perfect. I initially ordered it because I wasn't too hungry by the time of my reservation, but I enjoyed the food and ambience so much that we kept the night going. The Brussels sprouts are delicious and the bottle for table was a perfect pairing. You could easily spent anywhere between a casual $25 here or $200+ depending on how you treat the night. Service was awesome as well. The orange cardamom crème brûlée was a beautiful end to the night. Unique dish that I highly recommend. Perhaps by favorite place of all of LA so far. 5/5 would recommend for any occasion!
