Like the owner said though, talk to the server, don't get into a mood and post about it online..  Probably why your marriage didn't work out, lol jk but it helps big time when you use your words

Jake, thanks so much for the support! We're happy to make adjustments to your food if need be, so be sure to let us know if that's the case. Hope to see you again soon!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

Recommendation: Not necessarily worth the wait or hype, but still good and large portions. I had higher expectations because of the line outside and the previous reviews. I got the Don Juan which seemed like their most popular item and it was just a solid breakfast taco. Salsa was good, potatoes and tortilla were fluffy, eggs were light, bacon was a little soggy, cheese wasn't melted; altogether decent but nothing amazing. I will say it is dense and heavy and very filling. Ordered: Don Juan El Taco Grande Price: ~$7

Joshua, we're glad you decided to give us a shot! Sorry to hear that the Don Juan wasn't what you expected though. Next time, we know you'll be more wow-ed by our food!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

My friend and I had a big day ahead and decided to start our breakfast out right with some good food from Juan in a Million. We ordered their popular Don Juan El Taco Grande...which was indeed grande. Filled with eggs, potatoes, bacon, and cheese, it was the perfect breakfast taco. I got a side of sour cream as well.  Lots of seating and their Horchata tasted great!
Raychel, thanks so much for the support! We're glad the horchata and breakfast food hit the spot. Hope to see you again soon.  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

Great bang for your buck for breakfast tacos. A generous portion of egg, potato,  bacon and cheese served with 3 tortillas will leave you full and ready to conquer your day. Plus they offer chips and salsa so it's a win-win. The service is quick and friendly so you can't go wrong with breakfast from Juan in a Million!!

Open since 1980, Juan in A Million is a bit of a hole in the wall. I had seen Juan in A Million on the TV show, Man Vs. Food, but wasn't really expecting much. The dining area is much larger than I was expecting. They have multiple rooms with multiple tables, including a covered patio. There was no wait for breakfast on a Monday morning. We were seated, given some chips and salsa, and the menu. Chips and salsa tasted fresh and homemade. Good low level spice on the salsa too. Still wasn't expecting much looking at the menu. We placed our orders and the food arrived soon after, less than 10 minutes. Excellent service.  Figured I would order the Don Juan El Taco Grande since I had seen it on TV. Per the menu, it's a secret combination of potato, egg, bacon and cheese in a deliciously hot tortilla. It's also ginormous. The waitress offered me extra tortillas, and one Don Juan was enough to make four huge tacos. It's also surprisingly delicious despite the common ingredients. Makes me wonder how I can make it for myself at home.  I also tried a barbacoa taco because I wanted to try something more Mexican. Best barbacoa I have ever had. It was fall apart tender, extremely juicy, rich, and flavorful.  If I had a choice between barbacoa from Juan in a Million and some brisket from Franklin BBQ, I would choose the barbacoa, based on flavor alone. It's also ludicrously cheap. A huge breakfast for two was about $15.  5 stars. 1200th Review!

Nick, we're so glad you decided to swing by and give us a shot! Thanks so much for the support and kind words. Hope to see you again soon for another Don Juan and some barbacoa! All the best, Juan in a Million Family

I did not want to wait an hour in line for a table, so I ordered my tacos to-go. I feel like I saved so much time and avoided the extra frills involved in getting a table. I placed my order, was able to pay with Apple Pay, and got my food in less than 15 minutes! They were so crowded on a Sunday morning - both indoor and outdoor tables were full. They have a parking lot in the back. I'd be lying if I said I didn't just come here because I love the pun in their name.  I've also heard so much about the Don Juan taco, and it definitely lived up to its hype. At $6.75, it is massive. The cheese doesn't even fit inside the tortilla. I'm pretty sure I took a couple of bites and didn't even look like I did any damage. I really enjoyed the migas taco $3.95 with cheese. Their salsa is great. I'm not sure if I'd come back for the Don Juan, but the migas was for sure something I'd come back for.
Clara, we're happy to hear that our puns and the Don Juan hype got you to stop by. Thanks for the support and kind words! Hope you'll be back for more migas! All the best, Juan in a Million Family

This OG Austin eatery gives me a lot of nostalgia. I used to come here in college and several years later, this place is still as busy as ever. The owner and all the employees are exceptionally nice. My favorite item on the menu is the Don Juan. You practically get five whole tacos out of this monstrous plate of bacon, cheese, egg, and potatoes. Their tortillas are very well made. For $6.75, it's a steal! I had to talk my partner out of ordering one for himself because there was no way he would finish it. We were full sharing one. If any of my friends are in town visiting, Juan in a Million would definitely be a place where I'd bring them.

Lan, we've loved having you join us over the years -- thanks for all your kind words! The Don Juan is always a great choice, and we can't wait to cook for you again sometime soon. Don't forget to bring your appetite! All the best, Juan in a Million Family

We came here based on a recommendation from a friend. It's a pretty nice hole-in-the-wall spot and was pretty packed on a Saturday morning. The food was definitely a lot better than what I was expecting. We ordered the con queso breakfasts and the Don Juan el taco grande. The portions were huge, especially the Don Juan special which was stacked for only $6.75. Definitely recommended!
Victoria, thanks so much for the support! We're happy to hear that you enjoy dining with us. Hope to see you again for another Don Juan!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

WASN'T WORTH IT.  ALSO, A FEW ISSUES OCCURRED! & WHY IS THEIR GUACAMOLE IS 7.00 FOR A DOLLUP?!  Okay, since I am a fellow yelper (elites and non stand up!! Haha jk) I really researched this place and decided hey, why not! It's in the more rural side of town, but that never bothered me one bit! In LA some of the best eats have tents nearby with the homeless. So, this wasn't bad at all! When we walked in, man, I thought we were going to sit outside and the way that humidity it set up it's a HELL NO. We asked the older man if we can sit inside and he said yes. . Well, he didn't know English and my sister began to sit inside because the man said yes. .  and the waitress rudely said "no! We have seating over there!" We were like okayyyy, the man told us to sit here! We were about to leave, but I just figured let's see where they're talking about first/way just to go outside in another closed off seating area. Weird? But okay. Like we bypassed the restaurant to go outside to another a/c building LOL.  FOOD: let's get right into this, for Austin it's rated a 8/9. For regular folk, it's a solid 5. I ordered a single tostada, (7.50) my sister got nachos and a soda  (16.00), my nephew got a quesadilla & soda  ($12.18), my dad got eggs and chili with coffee (18.00) , and table guacamole (7.00). It was 60.00+ dollars. The guacamole from chipotle is better, I kid you not. My tostada was nothing special, at all. My dad did like his food, but said it could have been better. He said the coffee was great though. My nephew got a quesadilla, and he said he didn't like it. My sister liked her nachos but said it was worth 16.00 at all. Their chips are really great though!  Price: NOT WORTH IT AT ALL! I think they definitely do too much here, and not in a good way. I was told they would take money off for my nephews plate since he's 6. They didn't give him an adult quesadilla, but it was an adult price. She never fixed it. The guacamole for the table is TINY! I could go pick 2 avocados myself and make a bigger bowl for less than 2.00 lol. My tostada was not worth 7.50 with tax. I'll leave a picture below, so you all can tell me if you'd pay 7.50 for it vs 1.00 for one at del taco. Lol SERVICE: 50/50. The older ladies are rude. There was one younger one who was nice, and that's about it. Our server didn't say much at all, at this rate I'm just assuming Texas waitresses are not like CA. In CA we are talkative/ laid back/ and...nice! We didn't find that here one bit.  All in all, I will not be coming back. Between the prices, service, portion, and taste, it was a no for me. Onto the next food place please.

Chrystina, we're sorry to hear that our food wasn't what you were expecting. Additionally, we hope you'll chalk the service issues up to a miscommunication -- our team would never try to be rude to any of our guests. Hopefully you'll give us another shot if you're ever back in the area.  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

A real Austin gem! The location was easy to find, and there was a parking lot in the back. We were immediately warmly greeted by the owner who was both friendly and charismatic. It genuinely felt as if I had entered a friend's home.  The free salsa was too spicy for the tortilla chips but perfect to put on the Don Juan El Taco Grande! The Don Juan El Taco Grande without bacon was mediocre and had too much cheese. It came with two additional tortillas and had a large portion of filling.  However, the horchata was sweet, milky, and delightfully light! The cup was also the ideal size to share with a significant other. My boyfriend ordered the Huevos a La Mexicana and remarked that it reminded him of his grandmother's recipe!  There were beautifully painted murals and vivid colorful walls throughout the restaurant. The plants and flowers were alive and thriving. You could easily tell that a lot of love and hard work had been put into the restaurant. Additionally, there was plenty of shade to sit outside on a hot summer day. The only main feedback I have is that it would be nice if there was free wifi there.
Christine, we're glad you all felt right at home when you walked in! Thanks for the support and kind words. Can't wait to have you back for another Don Juan!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family
Chelsea, we're happy to hear that the Don Juan and horchata hit the spot! Thanks for giving us a shot. Hope to see you again soon for more!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

An Austin classic that's definitely worth a visit! From the shaded patio seating and the vibrantly colored floors, to the hole in the wall vibes and neighborhood location, this place screams Austin. The Don Juan is a massive $6 plate of breakfast taco goodness that's hard to not enjoy. It has all the essential ingredients: bacon, eggs, cheese, and potatoes, and combines them in a massive serving. It's a hearty meal alone, but we especially enjoyed the tortillas that came with. They're soft with the perfect amount of chew, which fit perfectly with the fluffy eggs. Our group of 3 even struggled to finish it! Whether as a nice brunch or hangover cure, it's a definitely worth a visit!
Daniel, thanks so much for the support! We're happy to hear that our food hit the spot. Hopefully we can serve you again in the near future!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

I can't believe it took me four years to finally come to Juan in a Million, but I definitely saved one of Austin's treasures for last. This place doesn't have any frills and doesn't seem like much on first glance, but everything is incredible. Service is great, which surprised me because I didn't think anyone would come to our table more than once. However, our food, drinks, chip refills, and check came promptly. Servers are really nice and helpful. Get their most popular item because it's a lot of food and great value too. Their horchata is one of the best in Austin and it's also a huge cup too. Their salsa and chips are great, and my friends who are big fans of salsa love this place.  I highly recommend! Anytime I crave breakfast tacos I will be coming here.

Megan, we're so glad you had a chance to stop by and give us a shot! Thanks so much for the support. We can't wait to serve you up more horchata and goodies from our menu.  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

"Old Austin Establishments" need to keep their game strong if they're going to stay in business. Juan in a Million didn't give me my money's worth and didn't offer to make things right.  I came in with one thing on my mind: queso and eggs. Things started off wrong when I asked for water with no ice and the server came back with a glass of ice water. It's not like she had other distractions between when I ordered it and when she brought it out. It was immediate. She just didn't listen. It was past their lunch rush. But that's just water. Not a deal breaker. Their Con Queso Breakfast seemed like what I was craving, but not all of it. I wasn't feeling the meat and potatoes that came with it. I asked the server if I could sub these things for extra eggs and queso. She said I could. However, when the meal came out it sure looked like the normal size serving of eggs and queso. When she brought me my ticket to pay, it just said no cg (carne guisada) or potatoes, no note to the kitchen about extra anything else. When I brought this up, I was told they don't do substitutions. That would have been fine, if they told me that in the beginning. I would have ordered the full meal as is. Instead they just gave me an empty apology and I left with only half the food I paid for. Communication, folks! You failed.  Also, the food was meh. The queso was more like a combination of something between queso and ranchero sauce. The tortillas were dry.  Not coming back in a million years.

Amy, we're sorry to hear that there were so many communication issues during your visit. Our team is much better than that, so we hope one day you'll give us another shot.  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

I've heard many things about the famous Don Juan El Grande Taco but unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype. Don't get me wrong - it's a ton of food and definitely a great deal but I didn't think it was anything special. If you're looking for an affordable meal, this taco is for you. However, if you're looking for great tasting tacos... maybe not the spot.  Still, the service was great and they had complimentary chips + salsa for dine-in customers.

Callie, it's really disappointing to know that your experience wasn't everything you hoped it would be. We're proud to be an Austin staple, and we strive to impress every Austin visitor, too! We hope you'll make it back our way in the future for a chance to impress you more. All the best, Juan in a Million Family

Welll 2 stars or 3?  It's been around a while and is quite the locals' find. That being said, in a town with more taco spots than Manhattan has Starbucks, it has some tough competition to fend off.  The positive? The taco was huge, with a lot of stuffing.  The negative? The flavors were just not there - migas was bland, meats were way too salty, and the salsa tasted ketchupy.  I had expected more from this self-proclaimed "authentic" place.

Shradha, we're sorry to hear that the migas and tacos weren't what you expected. Our team is always happy to make changes to your order, so next time let us know if you'd like something different. Hope you'll give us another shot. All the best, Juan in a Million Family

My friends and I stopped here for brunch on a suggestion from our Lyft driver. It did not disappoint! This local staple has been making delicious Mexican food since the 1980s!  I had a great mimosa for $2.50 and the Don Juan El taco grande. This is huge! Definitely enough to share with at least one person. It's a yummy scramble of potato, egg, bacon and cheese with a side of fresh tortillas! They also have free chips and salsa -- even for breakfast. I would recommend getting here early because they always have a wait. I would definitely like to check this out in a return trip to Austin.
Miranda, we're happy that you followed up on that recommendation! Thanks so much for the support. Hope to see you back again soon for another Don Juan!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

Visiting from San Antonio, I have never seen anything like this place. When you have over 100 people eating at one location and about 50 of them are waiting in line to just get in or place an order you know what to expect. I personally met Juan and I can not say enough about him! He is the true definition of "if you want something done right do it yourself" mentality. The way he handles every customer as a usual and a friend makes me feel so welcomed that I didn't want to leave. The way he transitions from greeting customers, to taking orders, to the registers is completely unmatched by any means. Most people complain about having to do someone else's job, this guy thrives and Excels from this. Now for the food part, we'll if you haven't seen the 5 stars, then let me tell you ! The best breakfast spot you can find as an outsider coming in. You will be full and not know what to do with the left overs. Absolutely great place, great energy, and unmatched customer service. If you can find somewhere else that matches or even competes to this In Austin , let me know! (I really wish my phone hadn't lost all my pictures, I could of had plenty of photos for you guys; but please take my word for it!!!)

Jose, we're happy to hear that your drive from San Antonio was worth it! Thanks so much for the support. We're glad everything from the food to the service hit the spot. Hope to see you again soon!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

You know those obnoxious people from the west coast who say Tex-Mex sucks and there is no good Mexican food in central Texas? I am one of those humans......... And the found Juan In A Million (thanks Yelp!!)  I picked Juan's specifically because of the great reviews and close proximity to the Austin airport. I am going to go back to Juan's for fantastic breakfast and Bloody Mary's.  From the menu: DON JUAN EL TACO GRANDE- while I did not order one of these delightful looking breakfast tacos, every table around us seemed to order them and they looked amazing. Huge portions!  CON QUESO BREAKFAST- this is what my hubby ordered. Two eggs served any style with queso, carne guisada, refried beans, potatoes and two flour tortillas. Absolutely delicious. Thank god for splits rules, because I got half. Carne Guisada Plate: this is what I got, (well, + splits rules) served with Rice and Beans. On Friday it is on their daily special list.... and I am a sucker for a daily special! This one is Served all day :) I would absolutely order this again (and again and again)  Drinks: I got a Bloody Mary, it was wonderful. Perfect amount of spice. Bae ordered a Marg... at 10am... on a weekday. It happens *shrug* Chips and salsa. Fabulous salsa. We needed 3 refills because it was THAT good. To be clear: the portions were large, the salsa dish was large, it was just that good. Who can I bribe for the recipe? Hit me up.  Covid: tables are spaced apart. Large indoor and outdoor space. We felt safe eating here.  Staff: fabulous. Pretty sure our waitress was my best friend by the time we left.  Thank you Juan in a Million for a fabulous meal!

You just can't beat a daily special, Julia! We've been the first stop and last stop for tons of folks visiting Austin, and we're glad you're now a part of that club. From our Don Juan to our chips and salsa, you can always expect a fabulous, authentic meal here at Juan in a Million. Come back and see us for another round whenever you're in town again!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

I came for dinner with my family on a Sunday and we had a great time! It was fairly busy but we were only quoted 30 minutes for a wait and were able to pass that by getting a table in the open seating area anyway. Chips and salsa are self-serve in the open seating area, I'm not sure if this applies to the whole restaurant or not, but you can go back as many times as you want which is nice. I ordered the quesadillas and they were solid! The portion sizes are big so I went home with basically an entire meal still but I'm not complaining. Overall, the service was good but not necessarily the quickest. My biggest complaint was the spider family living in the umbrella over our table. We noticed them once it got later in the evening and while they technically didn't do anything, I felt uneasy knowing there were 10+ spiders hanging above my head while I ate.  COVID Precautions: Some employees wore masks but they didn't seem to be required. Social distancing was minimal.

Heard great reviews of this place. Location wise this has one of the best views of the river. Parking though can be a pain if it's packed, which it was for me when I came on a Friday afternoon) Along that same thread, I didn't actually sit in the restaurant because it was so packed. So I ended up ordering something to go and sitting at one of the tables outside the restaurant that was overlooking the water. Food was great though, would love to try the tacos next time (when it's not so busy)
Great ambiance good food service could be better but all in all not bad! Definitely recommend!  The quesadilla was by far my favorite

Came here on a Sunday around 1:30pm and luckily it was not crowded. The parking is challenging but they had a valet for $7 so we paid and didn't bother with driving all around to find a spot. FYI there is a lot across the street and the walk up isn't bad. The complimentary chips and salsa was amazing! The food was good as well. The steak options are good so I would strongly advise you order anything with steak in it. The views on the river were really nice and we took pictures after lunch. We got lucky with a nice day with awesome weather.

Come here for the scenery, not the food. The drinks are actually pretty good too. The food is average Mexican food, great for day drinking with friends to share some nachos or quesadillas. Staff was very friendly. Pro Tip:  get there around mid day when they open the deck seating (around the bar) and that is first come, first serve. We didn't wait at all. Our food came out very quickly. The queso was fantastic.  We got the stuffed avocado appetizer because it looked unique. It was pretty good, worth the try. I ordered plain old chicken quesadillas and they were nothing special but good. Another note: they are currently not serving the fish bowl Hu-La-La drink for 2. I ordered 2 of the halves and the drink was very good and refreshing.

Hula Hut is a place that you come for the environment and to hang with friends. Do not come here during the weekend, just a tourist trap. However pretty fun to sit on their patio on the water for lunch during a weekday.  You come here for the fun atmosphere. Not the food. Chips are terrible. My blackened fish burger was not bad. And the flan for dessert was good. Service was good. Checked on multiple times during our meal, food came out in 10 minutes.

5 stars means the place was extraordinary.  4 stars means it was pretty good.  3 means it's about average.  Which is why I'm leaving the 3 stars. The stuffed avocado was decent, but the place feels a little dirty. I sat on the patio one Sunday afternoon and it felt like the bar top hadn't been wiped down in days and the bar itself looked disheveled.  If you can look past the cleanliness, then this place is pretty unique and definitely has a Hawaiian-ish vibe.

Oooh So good! First time here, while visiting family, and I highly recommend!  The service was amazing. And the food was delicious. Our server made sure to let us know that if we needed to move in case it rain, she would have an area available. And when it did, she was very helpful. She gave quick service. We got plenty of leftovers too! 10/10 would visit again!

My sister absolutely loves this place, but I think the food is just mediocre. The views, however, are stellar, and I will come back time and time again just to sit and eat chips and enjoy the beautiful lake and lovely ambience! We shared the hawaiian fajitas, which were just fine (too sweet, and too chewy of meat for my taste), and I had a very average pina colada. They seemed quite understaffed, and our server kept forgetting about us (lol), but he did apologize profusely and give us a free drink because of it, so that was nice. The bathrooms were also very dirty, which I only hope was due to being understaffed?
We went for an early lunch. Found a parking place. Amazing service and food.  I can't wait to go back again. This is the place I take out of town folk. Great menu. On lake Austin near downtown.

Great place to take people that are from out of town!  Great queso and fish dishes.   Try the pu pu platters.  Enough food for many.  The combo of the platter sound strange but lighten up and give it a go. Just don't throw chips into the water or you will be greeted by tons of wildlife. Not the best place for vegetarians.
60-70  mins

Hula Hut offers indoor, deck, and covered outdoor dining. With all the seats they offer, you would think they would have a better handle on organization, however, it's a bit of a rodeo.... NOTE: deck dining does NOT require a wait list, it's first come, first serve. All other dining options, you must either book inside or out at the hostess stands. & what the other seating is next to Hula Hut, someone please educate me because I'm just as confused with that one... Service, not the fastest, which wasn't a surprise. Food, just as much of a disappointment. Hula Hut claims themselves as "Mexican Food with a Hawaiian Twist", but honestly this was more Tex-Mex... and that's being polite.  We ordered the BBQ Baby Back Ribs, the Chicken Flautas, and the Guacamole Salad. The Baby Back Ribs were overly salty, the Flautas too fried, and the Guacamole underwhelming.

I moved here in 1991. My first job was at Lakeview Cafe across the street on Lake Austin Blvd. where Hula Hut is now. I still live in Austin and have watched that area develop. I've eaten at HH multiple times. The last time was 6 years ago (even though I live less than 2 miles away). We decided to try it again tonight and it will be the last time ever! Terrible food, terrible service. Staff that can't even answer basic questions like "what wine do you have, any beers on tap?" Chips that are crushed. All around a HUGE disappointment !!

Food was great, location and atmosphere was great. Drinks were alrighty and restaurant is pricey. But all in all everybody was satisfied with the taste of their food. It was a great view good location. We would definitely return there again

I forget how special this place is in Austin.  You really do feel like you are on an island somewhere. We sat near the window inside and got the view while inside with the ac.  It's really hot in Austin especially in the summer but we totally could have gone outside to sit.  There were fans and while we are waiting it was cool near the water.  We got there before they opened.  I downed that they had started a waitlist because we were the first ones there but we weren't the first ones to be seated because they asked us to wait outside and others walked in right when they opened and got seated.  It was the first time taking my mom here for lunch and we wanted her to have a good time since she loves being near the water.  I ordered a margarita and my sister ordered a Mai tai.  She said it was a little on the sweet side. They were happy to exchange it for something else. She got the strawberry coconut mojito and it was delicious.  We got my mom the macadamia crusted magi magi fish dish.  It was perfect.  If you are looking for a healthier dish this would be it.  We ordered one fillet and it was plenty for her. My sister and I shared a half order of fajitas.  Didn't get a picture because we devoured it before I could get one. Love the cheese that it came with. The big shredded cheesy cheese for the win.  For dessert we had the fried ice cream.  I am not sure if it was suppose to be crunchy on the outside but it wasn't. Super soggy and soft shell that covered the ice cream.  The side slices of crispy chips I think they are sopapillas were hot and crispy just the way I would imagine fried ice cream would be.  I was little disappointed with the outside shell of this ice cream bc it was soft.  We peeled it off and didn't even eat them. Other than that our server, Naz, was super sweet! Very friendly and all smiles.

My friend had been raving about this place for months and she finally took me there for lunch last week. This is one of my new favorite (not so hidden because there's always a wait) gems of Austin and did not disappoint!  Atmosphere: first, it was way larger than it looks from the outside. They have both indoor and outdoor seating but recommend sitting outdoors so you can have an unobstructed view of Lake Austin and daydream about one day owning a boat.  Food: We shared the queso (which was incredible) but for me the show stopper was the table chips! They were warm, thin and crispy - not too heavy but held up when dipped in salsa or cheese. We each got a different quesadilla (chicken pictured here) and it was melt in your mouth delicious. The tortillas were fresh and soft and featured the perfect chicken to cheese ratio.  Drinks: My friend drove so I got a margarita with an add-shot and with the heat outside, was surprisingly strong. They have great happy hour deals, we will definitely be going back to catch them another time soon.

Hawaiian Tex mex... didn't know I needed it till I had it now I can't go back, them fajitas are like gods gift to the world... imma be honest that's all I had here. Yes I get the same thing every time but its like sex in a tortilla. Who doesn't want that

I like Hula Hut. Really, it's okay exactly deserving of its 3.5 stars, but since I can't give half stars I round up. The service is always solid, and I love getting to eat on the water. That alone is worth the price of the food and drinks, in my opinion. Now, for the food and drinks portion of the evening: if you keep to fair simple orders (queso, nachos, etc) then you'll be happy with the food, but I don't think either the recipes or the cooks are necessarily top notch. The drinks, though, are fun and taste good so in the end I keep coming back and drinking and ordering simple appetizers, which I'd recommend others do the same.
If you come here,  the chips and salsa are"help yourself" and the coconut shrimp is an absolute must. If you don't know what to order for a drink, trust Sam's judgement :)

I don't give 5s often, but for a chill ambiance and great,  flavorful food THIS is the place to go. They do a great job with their island vibe, you forget where you are! The waitress was well attentive to our needs. I love that they brought out chips and salsa as we waited for our food. The salsa is spicy! They brought our dog water as well as my table. The specialty cocktail pineapple cherry drink was amazing! The portions were HUEGE and so filling.  The BBQ sandwich could have had more BBQ sauce and it was hard to eat like a practical sandwich.

This was in my list of to-visit restaurants for a long time. Went on a Tuesday evening for friends anniversary. There was no wait time and we were seated in the open restaurant next to the water. The ambience was pretty good. Our waitress was pretty good and gave good suggestions for all the vegetarians in the group. We ordered stuffed avocado, veg tubular taco and veg tub enchilada.. stuffed avocado with chicken was the best of the lot. The vegetarian entrees were bland. Too much cheese. 3 stars only for the ambience and service. Food was just okay.
60-70  mins

*COVID Update* Not much to update on safety precautions as by August 2021, there's mostly none. Servers don't wear masks and certainly don't require patrons to do so. No hand sanitizer around, and tables are not socially distanced. Parking in this area is pretty much paid parking on the street. You're very lucky if you find something farther in the residential areas.  This review is for the outdoor bar area next to the restaurant. The line starts at the bar. That is where you order both food and drinks. They'll make your drink right there, and they'll give you a receipt for food. You take the receipt to the small kitchen in the back. There was live music on a Sunday afternoon, so it was really fun to chill, listen, and watch people dance. Most of the outdoor seating here is shaded, so it's not too bad. There's a water station at the bar.  They serve chilled margaritas, and the cup is laced with salt. They have  beers (can), Don Julio tequila, and other hard liquors. The selection is nice. The bartenders are just trying to make the line go by faster.  The tacos are great!  I think the best one was the al pastor taco $2.75. They're like the small LA street tacos, but I liked that the al pastor taco was served with chopped pineapple. Guac is $5.85. It's alright, but it's nice to share. The menu inside the restaurant might be more extensive.

First, I feel like I need to say - we had good service from our waiter during our lunch here and it was appreciated. That being said, the rest of this meal unfortunately disappointed. The food was a bit worse than my already pretty mediocre expectations - my queso tamales seemed reasonably moist and might have had some nice flavor to them, but the amount of queso on top of them made it almost impossible to taste. The queso itself was the classic velveeta / rotel variety, which I don't have a problem with per se but I don't think lends itself to the $11 price tag on the entree. The free chips and salsa were appreciated and not bad - though I found myself a bit confused that it tasted like they'd sweetened both the red and green varieties with some added sugar which I'd consider wholly unnecessary. However, my biggest reason for a two star instead of a three star review was the margarita. I love a quality marg but was not expecting one from Guero's house blend. This marg, however, was almost entirely undrinkable. I couldn't taste anything but extremely watered down tequila and maybe a squirt of lime juice - I found myself pushing it away after a couple sips. And the icing on the cake - an $8 price tag. In conclusion, you can eat much better on South Congress for half the price.

Hello Jack,  We sincerely apologize for your recent experience at Güero's. We're so sorry to hear that our food and drinks were not up to standards. As a family run business, we continuously evolve from our guests and always appreciate feedback and will pass it along to the team.

Stoppped in for a cold beer. Bartender was friendly maybe becuase my wife speaks spanish and they bonded. He was attentive and made good recommendations.  Chips and salsa (they serve red & green which we like) were very good.  Other items on the menu looked good ands there is a lady in the rear part of the restaurant making fresh tortillas! Booya!

Hi Rick,  Thank you so much for sharing your recent experience with us! We're happy to hear you enjoyed our drinks, food, and service. We hope you stop by again and give us another chance to give you a 5 star experience.

The worst tourist food I have ever tasted.... It is not Mexican food, and I don't  believe it is Tex-Mex..... You know it is for unaware tourists and locals who have never eaten ,"real" down home MEXICAN food. When a "MEXICAN" restaurant  does not bother to serve  "Chiles en vinagre".... or the hottest sauce they serve is as hot as diced tomatoes .... you know that grandma from Kentucky... or a young college student that cares more about slcohol  than good food... are the target clientele.....

My fiancé and I came here one night during our vacation after going to the Contienetal Club, and we enjoyed ourselves immensely! The tacos and enchiladas were killer, and the casamigos marg was my fave! Kim was the best waitress--thank you, Kim, for making our night!!
Such a fun place to listen to live music- Sundays it starts at three.  Would love to see the garden open an hour before the music starts :)

I wouldn't recommend them for food - though their chips and salsa are really good! The food was below average in terms of flavors, stuffing, taste. The hour-long wait is expected on a busy stretch. Service was okay - it wasn't attentive and diligent. The drinks were small and watered down. The ambiance and history are the only things saving this, besides the location win.

Hi Shradha, Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We're so sorry to hear that our food and drinks were not up to standards. We hope that when you're back in the area, you'd be willing to give us a try again. As a family run business, we continuously evolve from our guests and always appreciate feedback and will pass it along to the team.

"I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed." I'd say that phrase that every adult has to utter at least once in their lifetimes (and kids have to hear wayyyy too often) sums up my Güero's experience. Was really looking forward to queso and margaritas while bopping along South Congress, and while that's definitely what I got from Güero's, I left weeping like the skies above (it was a monsoon that day).  I knew it wasn't going to be mind blowing Tex-mex, but I passed on a bougier place down the street because I thought G's would at least be a little more gritty and authentic and that's what I wanted. Sadly, the queso and guac and margaritas, for that matter, were just ho hum. There's was nothing distinctive about them.  Things worth noting: -Service was fast and friendly -Chips and salsa flow freely (and are free) -They validate parking

Was soooo looking forward to coming to Gueros! "Our place"...maybe it's just the post Covid era...maybe we are just older and have become more picky? It was fun to "see" them still kickin it but everything was just I dunno ho-hummm. I can't believe I'm even saying it! This time we both felt they missed the mark. The food the service the drinks ...all majorly meh... Take aways: *Zero friendly service...I mean zilch!  *Waitress didn't give 2 bleeps if she was doing her job *Completely dead and on a Monday late afternoon, and we still waited 20 minutes for drinks!!  *Had to track waitress down to ask about said drinks *Super dirty area where we sat (which was right by a make shift bussing station in the entry way)...yuck. *Drinks were super watered down.  Overall felt disappointed... we've been coming here for years upon years for 24 years and it wasn't the same ol Gueros we've grown up with. Maybe this was a hit or miss day...dunno. But left feeling underwhelmed by everything.  Hope one day to return...and maybe we will find that sweet spot we once loved.

We still love coming here after 20 years!  Yup, years after we moved away from Austin we always enjoy coming back to this little gem on South Congress! This place used to be our favorite tex-mex weekly staple for killer tacos and trustworthy chips n' salsa!  They even serve breakfast all day everyday!  We just ate here yesterday and brought the kids with us and it's as if nothing's changed. Fish tacos al'a cart still the bomb!  Quest still killer and all the little salsas! (*note mix a few of them together for a real treat). Charro beans mixed with side of rice still send us back to 1997!! #perfection  Ambiance still has that cool to be "weird" vibe.  Sometimes the traffic in and around the area can get heavy but just go knowing that could be the case especially on three weekends!  But go grab a delish Rita from the bar or out door Gueros lemonade stand.  Hard to believe "our place" still has its touch and it's as yummy as it was back then!  I love that even though Austin's so different and has grown sooooo much since the 90's it's nice to see Guero's hasn't gone down the franchise road or compromised on what makes them one cool place to visit when you come to Austin.  ***Casa Rita (aka house margarita) on the rocks is great so is the Tito Rita and The Don! Nothing but lots of love for this place.

The location is perfect.  Our server was Gabriel - he took great care of us. Our original server disappeared and he came and saved the day!  This is my first  restaurant to visit on my Austin Texas adventure. I've heard some great things about this place. So I thought, why not check this out? We came in, and the man in the front was a bit rude and sassy, but it was busy and hot so I gave some grace (: We got seating inside (I suggest). Immediately we were greeted with chips and salsa. But it took time to order our drinks and food, about a 20 min wait. (Because our original server left) We orders the queso and guacamole which was delicious, so get that! Not even going to lie, the coke tasted fantastic lol.  We all ordered the El Pastor tacos, steak and chicken tacos.  *steak - BOMB * el pastor - BOMB  * chicken - good a little dry, but I think it's meant to be a a dry rub chicken  Over all 4 stars and happy I got to visit ! Check them out!

Hm.. not sure about the poor reviews on here because I LOVED my food and the service was great. We had to wait about 20 mins to get in (kinda says a lot about a place when it's busy like that) but once we were seated, were brought chips, salsa and water immediately and the waiter came by for our drink order right after that. I had the Chicken Al Carbon Taco plate which was delicious. I wasn't sure about the artichoke and orange juice marinade they cooked it in but it was really tasty! They even validate the parking if you park in the structure behind the restaurant. I'm definitely going back the next time I'm in Austin!

First off, the drinks here are INCREDIBLE!!! I loved how you could change up the flavors of the margaritas. We could have spent our whole time there just drinking and trying all the flavors. We did also order food but it was your standard Mexican food. Nothing rave-wrothy. My friend got the 2 chalupas plate and I got the 2 tacos plate and we both shared the chips and queso. Tacos were decent and the queso was pretty good, but I was more impressed with their drinks! Server was very attentive and all the tables were spaced out really well.

We sat outside at Guero's for the live music yesterday and had a very nice time! We started with some margaritas which were a little bit watery, but not so bad that we didn't have a couple more with dinner. My husband ordered some tacos which he enjoyed and I had a black bean tamale (the only vegetarian option). I liked my food even though it was slightly bland, and we loved the chips and guacamole we got to supplement. For what it is, Guero's does a great job. The atmosphere is very fun and relaxed, the band was good, and there was no cover charge for the show. The food and drinks were decent and very affordable. Not a bad choice for a chill night out!

The absolute worst! Should have read other reviews on here before walking in. Totally ruined our lunch with our parents from out of town. As other have said, the chips n salsa and the pleasant service was the only highlight. The food is just utterly horrible. Queso - watery Velveeta garbage. Every other entree we ordered was just bland, lacking in salt and flavor. Unbelievable they'd pass this as food let alone Mexican food.  And I don't think the owner or the management have any desire to do anything about their trashy food. Every reply the owner has left for a negative review here is just a standard lame copy paste job.  It looks like they'd happily bring in the floating touristy population here who don't know how pathetic their food is.  Stay far away from this place. Plenty of other restaurants in the neighborhood.

This makes us sad to read. We have been a family-run restaurant for over 35 years and we always try to make everyone's experience as best as possible. We clearly dropped the ball this time around, and are working to make it right. We see that you were disappointed in the flavor of our food and want to work on it. Thank you for bringing this to our attention - we plan on having a kitchen meeting to go over improving the flavor of our food. We would like to hear what entrees you ordered. If can please email us at  info@gueros.com  so we can work on improving.

I had excellent service with the host spotting us outside before walking in. The bathroom was clean and smelled of freshly mopped floors with fabuloso. My server was polite, attentive, and our food was out within minutes of ordering. My drinks were fine. My biggest problem was the food.  I guess I'm spoiled by living and eating Mexican food for 20 years in San Antonio. No, this is not a comparative analysis of Tex-Mex between SA and Austin. The green salsa was really well done, actually. But my macho taco was tasteless. Terey's enchiladas with beef al carbon were soggy wet blankets served with sweet beans. The windows at our booth were dirty, and the fly living there bothered us the entire time. Would we be back? Yes! But only for the margaritas.

Hi Peggy,  Thank you so much for sharing your recent experience with us! We're happy to hear you enjoyed our drinks and service, and will absolutely take into account the additional feedback you provided to better our hospitality. We hope you stop by again and give us another chance to give you a 5 star experience.

Taco Bell is more authentic Tex Mex than Guero's. If you're traveling in Austin looking for Tex Mex, keep going. This is not authentic Austin cuisine and is a tourist trap with piss poor service. You're better off going to a good truck.

We would like to make our service better. If you have time can you please email us at  info@gueros.com  about your experience so we can speak with our staff and management about specifics on how to improve in the future.
No.  No. No.  Consider yourself spared. You ask for a host or hostess & they look at you like you have a unicorn jutting out of your head.

Hi Kimberly. We're sorry to hear about your negative experience with our staff when you visited us. We always strive to provide a positive experience for all of our guests and we regret to hear about yours. Please know this is not the standard we hold. Thank you for taking the time to share your review, as they help us improve our services overall.

All four of us loved our food! Enchiladas, tamales or tacos. You can't go wrong. Fun atmosphere. After dinner, we went next door to the Guero music garden and listened to a well oiled jazz group. Could buy drinks and snacks. We didn't as we were very full from dinner. A perfect evening.
Everything I tasted here was amazing - from the chips and queso to the tacos themselves. When visiting Austin guero's should be a stop on your list for some truly authentic Mexican food.

Looked great from the outside, but it was a total disappointment. Service was very slow and chaotic, ordered a "The Don" margie, and it was very small for the price, and sour... with very little alcohol. Also a glass of Sangria was watery and not fruity, and had no fresh fruit either. The Mushroom tacos were dreadful - zero flavor or spices, and for $12 was only two tacos with no rice and beans or anything. Last and least was the poor excuse for black bean soup - watery canned and bland. If you come here - make sure to ask for salt and pepper! You're gonna need it!
Thank you for letting us know that you were disappointed with the quality of your meal. We are working on improving the flavor of our food and hope you can give us another try.

Visiting from Dallas.  Seemed to be a busy Saturday. Our server was fine, but as mentioned she must have been busy, but still courteous. Food was good.  Tacos a little too oily. Took a while to come out I felt. No worries, she restocked the chips and I had great company. I did like that, they had patio seating and the weather was nice and cool.

In Austin for a football game and grabbed a bite before heading back to Houston. Found this jewel and glad we stopped by. The parking lot is very small but there is street parking available, if you find a spot. We were seated quickly inside. There is plenty of patio seating but we had a lil one with us and it was chilly out. The service was great but it took a while to get our food after we ordered. I didn't mind because they have a salsa bar but it's 4 bucks per table, if decide to indulge. Not many choices on the salsa bar: spicy, mild and veggies. I ordered the street tacos  and they were yummy. The meat was seasoned very well but it was something about the seasoning that was a lil different than what I've had before. Not a bad thing, just different. I would definitely come back again if I am back in Austin. The prices were reasonable and service was wonderful. If you're looking for a new place to try while visiting, give Polvos a chance.  Bianca

Pretty decent food here. The portions are pretty huge here which helps justify the pricing. I would say it is pretty standard good food but nothing super unique.  I would come here for the atmosphere and decor.

A couple of years ago, a friend suggested that I check out Polvos and then yesterday another wanted to check out Polvos so I went and had a culinary experience. As we traversed the parking lot and approached the entrance, our server  Carlos N. came out to genuinely greeted us, asking if we preferred to be seated outside or inside, we opted to be seated inside. First order on this glorious day was Top Shelf Margaritas with a generous splashing of Grand Marnier that accompanied the chips and delicious salsa whilst waiting for the main course. The lite afternoon snack consisted of the Ribeye Fajitas served  with rice, beans and tortillas and I do declare that my discerning palate was totally satisfied.  I must add that in lieu of dessert, Top Shelf Margaritas were ordered for digestive purposes only. I will definitely be back to tried some of the delectable delights that I eyeballed on the menu.

Polvo's is a classic Tex Mex with a heart-of-Austin vibe! The long and short is... Try it out! My order: - Chips and Salsa - I guess technically I don't order this because it magically appears at the table when you sit down but their chips are perfectly thick and salty and their two salsa provide excellent variety for all spice palates!  - House Margarita (on the rocks, no salt) - I LOVE their margaritas and they offer an excellent happy hour so I 10/10 recommend stopping by early in the evening to get the night going! - Enchiladas - I ordered a two enchilada plate this time with cheese enchiladas, one with carne guisada on top (HOLY CRAP WILL ORDER THIS AGAIN!) and the other with salsa verde (also wonderful but not as show stopping). The rice and beans are classic and always worth it! - Beef fajitas - My friend ordered these and MAN did they smell amazing the whole dinner! She said she was very impressed and will crave them! As I always say, there are so many Tex Mex restaurants in Austin that you have to be choosy (or not and eat Mexican food constantly like I do) but Polvos will not let you down!

I was recommended to check out Polvos while I was looking around for quality Tex Mex. the first thing that caught my eye when I walked in was the salsa bar. I was excited since I'm the type of person who eats way too many chips and salsa and then struggles to finish the entrees. The salsa was awesome and well worth the extra $3.50/table. It's a must get when you go here. I ordered a pitcher of margaritas for the table and the burrito compuestas for my meal. The food was above average but not worth the money. $18 for tex mex seems a bit steep for me. If you love Tex Mex then I suggest giving this place a try. Aside from the salsa bar there wasn't much else that stuck out to me.

We recently came here for a late night meal. The dish we tried was pretty good but the restaurant did not feel welcoming at all.  The options for food after 10 PM in this area are fairly limited but we found this place online. We showed up at 10:25 and were rather curtly told that they close at 11:00 (the hours on Yelp are wrong). I don't think that showing up 35 minutes before closing is that unreasonable. After being given a table we got water and chips but nobody came to give us a menu. Eventually we flagged down a waiter who just had us scan a QR code to get the menu on our phones because apparently printed menus aren't a thing anymore?  When our food finally arrived (we split an order of their Nachos de Luja) it was actually very good but the whole experience surrounding it didn't feel very pleasant. Prices are also very high compared to other Mexican places in this area.

Coming from Mexico City, visiting Austin my friends toke Me to have dinner here. U can imagine how doubting I was as a good Mexican I am very picky when I eat Mexican in USA.  I have to say I am very very impressed with the food and the service ! Best best food I had outside of Mexico since I've lived in USA hands down. Brick was amazing taking care of us, very friendly and with a knowledge of his menu, he is truly what a server suppose to be, not just a robot taking orders. I will for sure come back for more and if you come to Austin; make sure you visit this place
The food is great and the restaurant is nice. My favorite are the chicken fajitas, they are SOOOO good!!! I would come here for dinner everyday if I could! 10/10 recommend:)

My husband and I came here on a whim with our toddler. We were pleasantly surprised with the warm complimentary chips and ordered guac ($16) to go with it. Because of Covid there's no menus so you scan a QR code at the table. And since we're all vegan it was easier to ask what we could have and modify it. If you have a dietary restriction they were very accommodating. We ordered 2 veggie fajitas ($22ea) which came with flour tortillas.  I'm not uptight about Covid but something a bit off putting is the salsa bar. There's 3 large bowls in the center of the restaurant where you go help yourself. That means a lot of people using the ladle all day. So skip the salsa.  The entrees were really good and we were happy. We didn't know the price until we got the bill. The guac wasn't that special and was spoonfuls scooped on a plate. The fajitas didn't even have tofu, just veggies, nothing warranted it being $22. I asked the server and she said they raised prices 3 days ago. We never paid this in NYC and we've had way better. We had a nice time and found the food to be authentic but it didn't impress enough to shock us with a $73 tab + 20% tip. This rubbed us wrong and we already said we'll never come back.

Maybe an off night, but the nachos were not very good- tortillas that were tough and chewy and could not eat.  The small amount of guac on the side looked to be the kind you purchase prepackaged.  We were also at a table near the kitchen so it was warm. Margs were good as was the salsa bar.

The best frozen margs ever!  Service is fast and friendly and the food is delicious!  Parking is limited so taking a ride share can be a real benefit.  We like to go early as the place is popular and fills up quickly!

Came here after swimming at barton springs all day and it was a pleasant surprise because pretty much nothing was available on a Saturday night. I didn't come here prior because the reviews only gave it 3.5 stars but the food here is insanely good. It took a little less than 30 minutes to be seated but we weren't tripping since it was the only place without an hour long wait. Location is beautiful inside and i loved the decor. We paid for the chips and salsa bar which was like $3.50 which didn't make any sense to me since most mexican restaurants give complimentary salsa obviously. But their salsa was super good and SPICY , it tasted like authentic mexican salsa which is probably why they charge extra for all the extra ingredients that go into it , but still lowkey kinda expensive for something that should be complimentary. Anyways, food was super good and fresh. Service was super mid  we barely got asked anything but oh well
Cane to this place cus it was my aunts birthday. My first time being there. It was delicious! And they sale a pitcher of maragrita!? Dont mind if i do!

I actually really liked the food at Polvo's so it was very disappointing that there service wasn't good. We ordered the beef fajitas and the tacos al pastor, both super yummy! The service was the down side. They never came over to fill our waters and brought our food over without silverware. We had to ask twice for silverware and waited over 10 minutes while our food was getting cold.  My sister also ordered an enchilada and that didn't come until we got up and asked the manager for it. By that point we were finished and paying the bill. Long story short, I'd stick to take out from Polvo's.
Love this place. Food and service always on point.  Mole enchiladas and flautas delicious.
The food is fantastic.  Mole enchiladas.  Chile relleno.  Great service. Prices very reasonable.

Been going here for years cause I live in the neighborhood.  The food is tasty if you order the right thing, but it's normal Mexican food. Their prices have Sky rocketed and don't seem to match the product. $11 for a bowl of cheese, and $4.50 added to your bill for Salsa bar. The exterior has plastic tables and blue encampment looking tarps as a roof.   Sorry Polvos, but I feel you have the attitude that No matter what you present and serve, people will come anyway just cause it's AUSTIN There are many other places In Austin I rather eat at.

Not a huge fan of how they make their breakfast tacos. Asked for bacon, egg, bean and cheese. They were excited to load it full of beans, though i have to dissect it to find the small bacon bits they put in.
Greatest margaritas in Austin 5 star for years.  Pork great pastor. Get it.  Thank me later

The food was good, but overpriced. Everything on their menu was a few dollars more than most other similar restaurants. Additionally, their salsa is not free. This would have been fine. However, it was brought to our table without us requesting it. I knew it would be for a charge, but this could easily trick an unsuspecting customer. It's only a few bucks, but a good business wouldn't need or want to trick their customers. My friends wanted to come here for dinner, so it was worth going to spend time with them, but I would be extremely unlikely to visit or recommend the restaurant on any other occasion.  I had the cerveza beef fajitas. They were alright. I would have liked to have an option with bell peppers instead of poblanos but fortunately the poblanos did not overpower the dish. I also added on an order or queso after I forgot that it was $10. That's almost unheard of! I cannot believe their guac is $15 and we certainly didn't splurge on that. A friend got enchiladas that had tons of onions. She likes onions but I could never eat something that oniony! Along with their salsa, they offered escabeche which was the only thing that made paying extra for salsa worth the charge.

Talk about one of the best spots for Mexican food, front their choriqueso to their fajitas. Even their special plates, such like the Chile rellenos or carne guisada. Never disappoint on taste and quality. Great for big groups of people or just take out.  I really enjoy everything you guys have to offer, just one thing I wish you can change. Splitting tickets!! When going with big groups, I thinks it's unfair for you guys not to be able to split our ticket cost. Y'all's plates vary in prices and it's a little unfair for someone who had a plate from $15.00 and someone who has a $20+ plate have to pay the same amount of money when paying. Just something I wanted to bring up to y'all's attention. Would've give y'all 5 stars but this really is a bummer sometimes for y'all's customer service.  Keep on doing what y'all do and for sure, I'll be back for more (Just not with my friends Lol).

Dined in on a weekend evening and seeing the parking lot full made us think we'd have a long wait so pleasantly surprised when seated immediate upon requesting a table. Wow!! Plenty of indoor dining and a wonderful patio with ample seating.   Great place, delicious food, prompt service, attentive staff, tasty drinks and great pricing.  Will definitely be back.
Thank you for stopping by, Rachel! We hope to have you back soon.

Welllll, they certainly build up the expectation with their signage.... I ordered the special Asadero taco they glorified on the menu. Hubby had the brisket tacos.  I was sadly disappointed by the experience. The patio is amazing and I will pump that wholeheartedly - great outdoor seating ! And I will say the nachos were fabulous- think they were homemade!! But what they charge and how much they build up their ' award winning' specialty taco, was extremely disappointing. The meat was chewy and had SO Little flavor  . The beans that come with it were flavorless. Except for the chewy meat that I literally spat out(gross but true) the ingredients were of good quality. And I just think if someone had paid attention, the meat would have eventually been tender.  The staff was plentiful but just didn't provide the service you would have expected for some many staff to be present. The brisket in my hubby's taco was tasty and the size was good. Both dishes were fairly costly. I'd def pay what he did for hubby's but I wouldn't pay $5 for what I was served. It's a great location, great outdoor seating and I wish I good do more for a better review but I can't sadly.

Kim, thank you for the review. I am glad you felt the brisket was well done. If you are not happy with your original choice, we are always happy to quickly prepare you something else. Next time, please ask to speak to a manager anytime your food does not meet your expectations.

salsa is good also got the chile con queso & what was funny is that i only got a bowl of queso no chile anyways got the tacos al carbon 2nd time getting this plate & 2nd time disappointed its good but not for its price like my friends & I would say its some mid & thats a compliment also charro beans are not good  drinks are good forsure
Edward, please know that all our entrees are 100% guaranteed. If you are not happy with your original choice, we would be happy to quickly make you something else!

It was very crowded! We sat at the bar and the bartender was great. I don't understand why the bragging about the queso, it was pretty terrible. Better if you mix it with the guacamole or salsa. Check out the picture- it's basically velvetta. Chips were ok, nothing to rave about and lots were too small to dip. The guacamole was delicious and had lots of big chunks of avocado (that apparently is a negative for some but I liked it!).

There are several quality Tex Mex establishments in and all around Austin.  The line of people waiting for a table was so long on a Friday night that we made it a point to return the following night earlier ( 5:00 pm) when the wait was manageable.  Was told the wait would be 45 minutes but ended up being closer to 30 minutes.  Our party of 9 enjoyed each and every entree we ordered.  From the tortilla chips, salsa, margaritas, and the various menu choices, this establishment will not disappoint you.  Our server Ed was top notch.  My carnitas entree was most flavorful and delicious. If you have a group of 4-10 or more I highly recommend this restaurant.
Dano, you're the best! Thanks for your review. I am glad your party enjoyed every entree! Looking forward to seeing you again.  -Paul, General Manager

Passed by on a Thursday night with at least 50 people waiting outside so decided must be great lets try! Since ive gone vegetarian, Mexican restaurants are not my favorite to go to due to VERY limited options and this place was no exception. I got a spinach/mushroom enchilada which i forced myself to eat. It wasnt really bad but it wasnt good either. The tortillas not my favorite. Our server was extremely lovely and even offered and changed my food for me. Plenty of space, outdoor too which is nice for friends to go maybe for margaritas or something. Overall i wouldnt recommend it for vegetarians but dont have a comment for others.

From the time we walked into this place, we knew that we were in for a treat. The restaurant itself is stunningly gorgeous as are the friendly staff and the utterly delicious food and drinks. Their queso is without any doubt the best ever. Their salsa is fresh and spicy, and their house made chips are sturdy enough for both.  Without question, this is definitely our new favorite for Tex-Mex.

This place is a hoot and a half. Feels like a Mexican resort and is huuuuuuge! Room after room after room. Came here with a party of 10-12 and the service was incredible, 10/10. The food is pretty good, not insane. But the atmosphere is so fun. It can get pretty loud here so would avoid for a date.

Laure, you deserve a restaurant you can count on for a good time! Thank you for spending your evening with us. We hope to welcome you and your friends back again sometime soon!  Best,  Paul, General Manager

Oh my gosh this was the best Mexican food I've had in a long time.  The service was great. Our waitress was wonderful.  The chips and salsa are to die for. I could have just had that for my meal.  I had beef Al carbon with rice and a cheese puff. It was so good I had the lunch portion and I couldn't even finish it. The plates are well portioned. We had plenty to take home for the next day.  I would recommend sitting outside. It was so nice. I loved the patio atmosphere. The weather was perfect.

Matts El Ranch is an Austin staple.  When someone comes to town and wants to know where to eat good tex mex this is where I send them.  The food is great, the drinks are great. The service is great.  I love that some of the meals come with complimentary pecan pralines.  My favorite thing here is the Bob Armstrong Dip, its basically a queso compuesto but theres just something about their cheese  that makes it extra special.  They also have to die for Mexican Martinis and hella good margaritas.  I'm giving them an easy two thumbs up. Make the trip to Matts you wont regret it.

Steve, we appreciate you sending all your friends our way! You can never go wrong with starting your meal off with the Bob Armstrong Dip. Thank you for supporting our local business! We can't wait to whip up another Mexican martini for you soon. Warmly, Paul, General Manager

I usually love Matt's. I ordered to go while dining in. I was instructed to order my to go order from the host stand. I did . The manager told the Hostess to give me a big chips and salsa to go since I was dining in. I went to get my ($20 )to go burrito and there was one 2 oz. salsa and no chips . I asked for the chips and was told it only comes with the 2 oz. I reminded her I was told I could get more chips since i dined in. She then left and came back  and was given chips and another salsa . When I got home I realized there was no ranchero sauce on the side as specified and listed on the receipt and the burrito was rather pathetic looking. Highly disappointed considering how much I go to Matt's and typically enjoy the food and service.

I'm not a huge fan of Tex Mex.  However I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed the food and experience at Matt's El Rancho.  When we walked in, it was clean and the quality of the decor and furniture was at a standard above what I was expecting.  They have a huge private parking lot.  There was no wait time for Sunday lunch.   The waitress was friendly and got our order quickly.  We ordered Bob Armstrong queso as our appetizer.  They gave complementary salsa and chips.  The chips were not greasy and the salsa was spicy.  The queso was thick and gooey with sausage and guacamole.  It was very good.  Great complement to the salsa.  For lunch, I got the Asadero tacos and my husband got the green enchiladas.  We were served guacamole on the side.   The asadero tacos were the best!  It's like a fajita but with more flavor from the beef and big chunk of cheese.  It's very filling.  I highly recommend it.  The green enchilada was good.  I suggested requesting extra green sauce.  They used chicken breast which is healthy but can be dry.  The sauce helps.  Overall we recommend this place.  This is a great place to bring out of town guests to try Tex Mex.

Chips were really hard but Matt's Queso was good.  Enchiladas were not that good and they gave us little bit of fajitas in the fajita plate. Tortillas were great and the margaritas were really good too but I wouldn't come here again.

Liz, you should love every aspect of your meal. If that's ever not the case, please let us know so that we can correct portions of your meal while you're still dining with us. We hope you can reconsider and give us another chance to wow you. Sincerely, Paul, General Manager

Honestly Matt's handled our large group like a bunch of champs! I'm fully aware that having a group of 20ish people can be overwhelming but they did such a good job. The Bob Armstrong dip was killer as always and the fajitas absolutely slapped. There's a reason why I always have to come here every time I'm in Austin!!!! Major shoutout to Matt's!!!

I'm not kidding when I say this is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in Austin. It's always packed and I can totally understand why! The margaritas and Mexican martinis are killer and nothing can beat the Bob Armstrong dip! You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu. They also have good lunch specials!!

Finally made it here! Matt's is a "must try" if you're going to be an Austinite. I've lived here since '92, and finally made it. Great atmosphere- this place has been here a long time (since 1952). You can feel the nostalgia in the architecture and the decor. I love a place with a rich history. It was packed for lunch with a 1/2 hour wait the day I went. I'd recommend an early lunch or dinner to get ahead of the crowd.  The chips are fresh and the salsa is flavorful without being too hot. The menu has lots of great food and drink options. My "go to" Mexican dish is usually verde chicken enchiladas, but I tried the el pastor tacos at Matt's. They were "okay"-maybe too much seasoning for my liking. My date and I shared a Matt's Mexican Martini which was perfect (not something I would recommend if you've got a Zoom call right after drinking).  All in all, Matt's is an experience- I'm all about the "experience" of dining out. It has to hit all the right buttons- service, atmosphere, good food and drink, and clean. I'll be back to try my "go to" dish. I hope you'll give this iconic place a try too.

Steffie, we're glad we could help you complete your Austinite bucket list! Thank you for trusting us to deliver on not just a lunch, but a complete experience. We look forward to whipping up verde chicken enchiladas for you soon and a Mexican martini to go with it! (As long as you don't have a Zoom call anytime soon after.) Warmly, Paul, General Manager

Matt's is a good dependable go-to spot for Tex Mex, drinks, and a little ambiance. Every dish on the menu is pretty what you'd expect, no frills here. Matt's is all about size. Size of the menu and size of the restaurant. Just about anything you have a hankering for will be on the menu. And you're practically guaranteed minimal wait for the size of their restaurant. We were able to sit on the patio and have a nice dinner next to the fountain. Really enjoyed the ambiance of that patio. We got a pot of queso which was pretty solid. I went with the Matt's special to sample a couple things and enjoyed. Again, nothing I can necessarily bad about this place. But nothing I'm going to rave about. Really good service. Worth going to if you want a casual Tex mex meal

Ryan, if you're craving it, we have it! We're so glad you got to enjoy a relaxing meal on our patio by our fountain. If there's ever anything we can do to take your meal to the next level, please let us know. We hope to really wow you with our Tex-Mex in the future!  Warmly, Paul, General Manager

This place is one of the last beacons of old Austin. The day Matt's closes their doors is the day Austin is truly dead.  Wife and I came for dinner after having moved to Cedar Park a few years ago (yay Austin real estate!). It had been easily 3 or 4 years since our last meal at this classic Tex-Mex spot. The chips were just as crunchy as I remember (they are lil thicker than the others), the salsa had the same heat, and the Grilled Old Fashioned Tacos were still on the menu.  Happy to be back, sorry it took so long.

Ordinarily, I try and go somewhere twice before reviewing, but I'm only in town a week for a work conference and won't be back. To be honest, probably wouldn't go back anyway.  Came here with a large group of coworkers attending the conference. For a large party, we were seated faster than we expected, which was nice.  I ordered the chicken fajitas, because I heard they were known for their fajitas. I'll be honest, there was some "sticker shock" when I first saw the price, but I immediately figured that meant the portion must be HUGE.  BOY. WAS. I. WRONG.  What came to the table was no where near worth the price. No way. And, the fajitas weren't any better than any I've had anywhere else. Disappointing. I left still hungry.  The only thing I appreciated was the service. Boy our server was FANTASTIC, especially considering the large group.  Apparently, this place is a big deal, but it wasn't for me. Do yourself a favor: if you do go here, pass on the fajitas.

Bailey, no matter how big your party is, you can always count on friendly, attentive service from us! We're sorry that the fajitas didn't knock it out of the park for you. If you're ever unhappy with your meal, please let us know while you are here so that we can make things right.   All ou entrees are 100% guaranteed.   If you don’t love it, we are always here to quickly prepare you something else.   We hope you can give us another chance the next time you're in town to find you a meal that'll keep you coming back.  Sincerely, Paul, General Manager
No wait, excellent service, great food and drinks. Had the chicken flautas and Carne guisada. Both were great. Rancho margs were perfect. Parking was a nightmare but they try.

Clayton, we're so glad we could seat you right as you walked in. Thank you for trying out a few of our classics -- nothing like a Rancho margarita to wash down all that good food! We hope parking is a little easier during your next visit. Sincerely, Paul, General Manager

An Austin classic! Gotta always have the Bob's Armstrong dip....in fact it's perfectly acceptable if you come here only for the dip and margs. I had their fish tacos for my main dish, I liked how they grilled the Mahi Mahi. Actually I wish I can just order a dish of their grilled fish and rice. Their tortillas are good, I just wish I can customize them to be crispy. Staff are always nice here, and the place can get busy. Interior is super clean and their aesthetic is perfect for tex mex.

Alysia, some days just call for queso and margaritas! We're so glad you got to sample a main entrée while dining with us. Whether you're craving a full meal or just an appetizer, we hope to welcome you back again sometime soon!  Best, Paul, General Manager
Start your review of  Tacodeli .

Morning, noon, night. I could eat Tacodeli for every meal. My waistline is thankful that there's not one (yet) in Denver. But I do beeline to the closest location whenever in Austin.  The Otto breakfast taco is just the right amount of beans, bacon, avocado. And this time I tried the steak and egg brekkie taco as well.  And the queso. Don't even get me started on the queso. It's on the thinner side, which is much more palpable after a steamy morning walk.  Pro hangover tip: Mix the sparkling water with OJ in a cup. Helps keep the taste buds alive.

Came here on a Friday afternoon and ordered the shrimp salad. The line moved somewhat slowly, and the food also came out somewhat slowly. I enjoyed the salad and the queso very much! They also have 4 different salsas of varying heat intensity. The ambiance is casual, and it wasn't difficult to secure a table for 5 people at the time we went.  Overall the service was friendly but could have been better. My friend (the bachelorette for a bachelorette's party) ordered a swirled marg but it didn't come with a swirl. After bringing this up to staff, they simply handed her the juice for the swirl instead of remaking it. Now, for normal occasion, this would have sufficed, but I was disappointed to see that they did not show extra effort for such an important occasion.

THE BIG: This location is nicely tucked away in the South Austin area. Parking is tough especially during peak eating hours. THE BLACK AND WHITE: Fun fact, Tacodeli was my first taco joint I've visited in Austin and I have to say, their tacos are amazing! I came here with a buddy before going on a rafting trip and the breakfast tacos here held me over until late in the afternoon. I know! It's that hefty and delicious. I got the Jess Special, which had something called the migas. Apparently migas is just leftover corn tortillas re-invented into a delicious breakfast taco. Big fan! The Vaquero is also good. You can't go wrong with any selection here THE FINAL BAMBOO: Overall, two tacos was about $7. Not bad and I'll definitely be back again!

I ordered the most popular dish, the Cowboy Taco. The dry-rubbed beef tenderloin was very flavorful but could have been slightly more tender and juicy. The guacamole and queso fresco was the perfect amount of spicy to add just the right amount of kick to the taco.

Tacodeli is always so busy when I go, which is a testament to how popular it really is!  The staff are always so friendly and really go the extra mile to help. I got Frontera Fundido with shrimp - decent taco, i can't eat dairy so I got it without cheese but it honestly kind of lacked flavor.  Also got the vaquero taco - pretty standard taco, huge serving of egg.  I got the hot sauce with both, not spicy at all, would recommend the 4th spicy option if I were to come again.  Pretty good price for the breakfast tacos!

It was alright. I ordered a bunch of tacos and they weren't as memorable. I think the cowboy was the best out of the bunch. I tried the queso with chips. The chips wasn't fresh and I am not a fan of queso in general. The best thing about this location is all the different sauces that can match your preference of heat.

Went to Tacodeli today to eat tacos after hearing so much about the place. It was sprinkling a little bit when we went and there wasn't too much of a line which was nice. I ended up ordering: *cowboy - I liked this taco - all the flavors went pretty well together *frontera fundido sirloin - DIDNT like this taco - really lacked any flavor and the meat was a little tough *large queso - this was good and edible but not great. Don't think I'd order again - wish the queso was thicker for sure. Came with chips but wasn't fresh unfortunately  Overall I'd go to try the cowboy and maybe the Delhi belly which my friend said was good but other items were not yummy.

Shrimp taco with poblano pepper and onion rajas is very good: plump fresh shrimp. Salmon taco could be mistaken for meat because of its spicy seasoning. Highlight: refried black beans are really tasty.
