I came here expecting a delicious hot meal and unfortunately I was disappoint. The pizza give to us was half cooked through and cold additionally, the lagaña ($9) was reheated from frozen and had a pool of water at the bottom. While I was eating it there was many hard small objects that got stuck In my teeth as well. My friends had cold fries and the whole restaurant was dirty and unclean. Worst of all After leaving my boyfriend, friend, and I immediately threw up and became sick.

Freaking outstandingly outrageous pizza !  Live for it - but your closing at 9 is pretty bad..should be later (or at least a carry out only from 9-11) in my opinion.  My review is for the Harvard location

Our go to place for take out pizza. The pizzas while expensive, are of high quality and great preperarion. They have some unique toppings and a choice of  Hand Tossed or Deep Dish as well as white or wheat crust. Yum!

Oh my gosh!  Sorry my peeps but I don't know what to say!  Other than "Meh".  At least for the Chicago style anyway.  Knowing what I know...the crust was too "I don't know".  Very little flavor almost as if it did not have enough time to rise.  Sauce was ok and ingredients were good.  I might stop by for the New York style but this was very mediocre.  Gotta run to a convert else I'd leave more!

Loved this place! me and my mom both split a small pizza and the meatball trio. the meatballs are amazing! the staff is incredible!! the whole experience here is amazing. they give you a sharpie to leave your mark on their walls which i think is the coolest considering we were from out of town. the coolest, hippest place in town!

Star Pizza is one of Houston's go-to places for "fancy pizza," and it's easy to see why once you taste their pizzas. They have some unique toppings as well as the classics you'd expect. I've tried the starburst. My favorite part is the chewy homemade crust! The service is fine, and the ordering process is easy. I'd recommend giving them a try if you're wanting a non brand name pizza.

This is my partner's absolute favorite pizza place so I decided to have him a surprise pizza party here for his birthday - second year in a row. We are pretty simple - he loves the Joe's, I love the Starburst. We got a few different ones for the table including the Chicken Alfredo. They have to be deep dish! We've been coming here for years! We had about 8-9 ppl show up and Sean did such a great job taking care of us! I had him store the bday cake for me in the back. He was so on top of it with our order. Thanks for such a great evening with friends!
Definitely one of my favorite places to visit when I'm home...that deep dish pizza is just to die for! This spot is one of Houston's best places to go!

This place has some of the best pizza I have ever had!! We got the starburst pizza and it was amazinngggg. Their sauce they put on the pizza is what I think makes it so good. The ingredients were fresh, we got it Chicago style with flour crust. I will definitely be ordering from here. We ordered directly from them for delivery and they brought the pizza within 40 minutes and it was still hot and fresh.

Garlic cheese bread and Caesar salad was the best thing we ordered. Got the starburst pizza Ny style. The ground beef on the pizza is interesting! My boyfriend didn't hate it but it wasn't for me. Would love to try their deep dish next time! Ordered and delivered in less than 30 minutes!

I had been craving some pizza after church and this was one of the pizza places next to me. I'm more of a chain pizza company type of girl but every once in a while, I like to step out of my comfort zone.  Service- I ordered online and they said it would take about 30 minutes and it did! I decided to do curbside pickup so I called the number and they brought it out to me right right away. Very convenient.  Food- I ordered a personal of the  Starburst and Chicken Alfredo (no mushroom, added sautéed spinach & garlic with pesto drizzled on top). They both were delicious and no regrets. I'm definitely a fan of the way I made my Chicken Alfredo.  Overall- this place is definitely worth trying if you're in the area...a good alternative to those who want to step out of their chain pizza company comfort zone lol.

A coworker had my husband try a slice and my husband raved about how good the pizza was. We ordered pizza from this place today and it's covered in tomato sauce and black olives, no meat. Needless to say the pizza was horrible.

I've been going to the original Star Pizza since the late 80s, and I still adore it.  For me, Star is all about the deep dish pizzas.  I'm partial to the deep dish Joe's (featuring sautéed spinach and garlic) on a whole wheat crust.  The Starburst is my first runner-up.  I also appreciate the funky vibe of Star that sadly is disappearing from the neighborhood.  Plus, the staff have always been friendly and chill.  Give this place your business and keep your fingers crossed that they don't get bought-out to make way for a sports car dealership or some nonsense like that.

I haven't been to Star Pizza in years and was glad to be back and dining in! I started off with the breadsticks and marinara.  The bread was hot and fresh with herbs and the marinara was great.  I had a wonderful waiter that kept my Dr. Pepper glass full and refilled.  I ordered two pizzas by the slice - a cheese pizza, New York Style and a pepperoni pizza, Chicago Style.  Both slices were hot and fresh, cheesy and delicious.  The Chicago Style pepperoni slice was fresh and tasty and the crust was very bready and not dried out and crusty.  The meal was delicious all the way around.

Used to LOVE this spot when I lived in Houston in the early 2000's, so I was pumped to try it again upon my return, especially when I found out they had gluten free options now!! Unfortunately, I was super disappointed with my most recent experience. While my boyfriend's regular pizza was fine, my gluten free one was burnt. Pretty badly. It's always disappointed to not only pay more for gluten free food, but have the quality be noticeably less than the other options. Also had very little pineapple topping. May order again to see if it was a fluke, but I was surprised they felt it was good enough to deliver. Pictures included for reference.

I love the pizza here, but they need to fix their parking lot. I now have a damaged car because their Norfolk/Shepard entrance has a makeshift curb ramp that my car fell off of with no warning. Please do something about this, I hate to think of the next person driving this same route having the same thing happen to them.

I ordered 2 pizzas for the family for carry out this evening through the DoorDash app. The pizza was good - especially the starburst Chicago style but the pick up experience was terrible.  I pulled into curbside and called for my order. I was told that since I used DoorDash they would not bring my order to the car. I explained that it was an order for me, I have two young kids in the car, and I picked this place because of curbside. The girl at the phone told me they aren't staffed for third party curbside and hung up. While I went in to pick up my order I watched them bring orders out to the other cars at curbside.

Wow. I am so so so happy that I ordered Star Pizza. This place is a gem. I ordered the chicago style 14 inch pizza, 1/2 chicken Alfredo and 1/2 Cowbell w the fixins. Both were TO DIE FOR!!  The chicken Alfredo was not too alfredo-y, which is always a concern of mine when getting a pizza like this. The crust was thick and flaky, not burnt or too hard. I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken Alfredo and will get it again. 5/5.  The cowbell with the fixins was also delicious. The BBQ is not overpowering, and the pizza was all around incredible. 5/5.  The 1/2 and 1/2 worked out perfectly. There was not a lot of run over and the pizzas were split evenly without either halves being compromised with a lot of the other half's toppings.  One of my issues with ordering chicago style is that you get too much cheese and not enough of the rest of the pizza. Do not worry about this here. The pizza is balanced, very delicious, and worth every penny. I ordered it online for delivery, and it arrived before the ETA. The driver called me when he pulled up and pickup was quick and easy. I could not be more satisfied and you have won yourself a repeat customer!

This was our first trip in to store pizza and we went to the original location to see what they had to offer. Our waiter was Carlton and he was extremely helpful as they have a very diverse and large menu. We had the Hanks sandwich and a Chicago pizza along with meatball, goat cheese, and garlic bread appetizers. Everything was delicious and the portions were huge! We will be back :-)

Post-quarantine and this place has still got it. Service was phenomenal as usual. Decided to mix it up and get a cannelloni. Pasta was delicious. Good portion for sharing. Also got our usual Ben's with mushrooms and an order of the baked goat cheese. Don't know if it was the giddiness of dining out for the first time in months or what, but the food was extra delicious. We almost demolished it all.

We come here a lot. Like a lot a lot. I hate pizza chains so we will gladly make the 20 minute drive across town to get some bomb pizza. We always get the goat cheese and Chicago style crust, usually Starburst or Margherita. Bens is awesome and Chicken Alfredo is awesome too. The restaurant has a cool lil vibe, the patio outside and the upstairs are good options to sit at if you have kiddos. Great pizza. I'm drooling thinking about it.

I ordered their 12 inch NY style Joe's Pizza togo this time with mushrooms added to it. It was fantastic. It was very delicious with a great crust, great sauce, great cheese and full of spinach, a lot of garlic flavor and plenty of fresh, well cooked mushrooms. The pizza was rich, while not being too greasy nor too salty. Usually the only good places down here for pizza are the ones that sell very similar pizzas to the ones in NY, etc. I would say Star Pizza is more Texan in style than Northern, but still very good n the best pizza around for a good TX type of pizza. I also still prefer their Chi. Deep Dish even more for crust options over their NY style, but my pizza order was still awesome which was the key for tonight. My order was fifteen bucks and pretty big and very filling compared to other 12 inch pizzas I have had before. For pizza styles similar to up North down here, my favorite places are Big Z's, Pink's, Grimaldi's and Solario.

I ordered a 12 inch Chicago Deep Dish Mushroom Pizza for curbside takeout and it was fantastic. The cheese on it was great, stretchy and abundant. The sauce was very tasty and this pizza has a lot of it being deep dish. The crust was very thick and kinda crispy with a fresh from the oven taste n texture to it. The mushrooms on it were very fresh and cooked in the pizza too, not raw like some places sometimes do. This pizza is also extremely filling for a 12 inch size. This is one of the only pizza places around Texas that sells Chicago style deep dish pizzas, unless you go all the way to Katy for Big Z's. The pizza order I got was awesome and full of sauce, cheese and crust the way a deep dish pizza should just like last time when I ordered from here.

This is one of the best pizza places down South and has been in Houston, TX since the 70s. I ordered the 10 inch Chicago Deep Dish Joe's Pizza for curbside takeout and it was fantastic. It had a lot of sauce, great amount of cheese, spinach, garlic and a very thick deep dish crust. It was cheesy, super saucy, heavy, gooey, crispy and delicious as a whole, bc the cheese, crust and sauce were each very tasty individually too. It was also huge for a 10 inch pizza. Very tasty and very satisfying. It's hard to find good deep dish pizzas down here n feel glad Star is great for that and pizza in general. Most places don't even sell Chicago style down here, while Star sells 2-3 pizza styles. If you especially like a lot of sauce and a very thick crust, Chicago style is for you. I personally love Chicago, NY and Naples styles and yet I probably like Chicago style the best, bc of the surplus of sauce and very thick crispy edged crust it has.
I adore star pizza! The best crust, the BEST salad, bread sticks. Homemade ranch. It's all heaven.

Came here with my husband on a Wednesday night, because we heard about the great happy hour deal, and we were not disappointed! The happy hour deal consists of one pizza  and a bottle of house wine for only It's definitely $20 (such a great deal!). We got the margherita pizza and added pepperonis for $2 extra, and it was delicious! The pizza was big enough for my husband and I to share.  The restaurant had a nice vibe as well, very chill, casual, and intimate. We will definitely come back. I'm sure this will turn into one of our staple restaurants to go to lol.
It is great to hear about your experience.  We are thrilled to have you enjoy the pizza and wine and the atmosphere.  Thank you for taking the time to share it.  Hope to see you again soon!!

When I had dinner here last week it was only my second visit here with the first time trying a pizza. This occasion I went with pasta going with the spaghetti, meat sauce and meatballs for $15. The waiter asked if I wanted to upgrade the meatballs and meat sauce to 44 Farms grade beef and I said yes. I don't remember what the extra cost was. The meal was ready in about 15 minutes and served in a bowl with some bread on top of the pasta. It was a good tasting and filling meal. I enjoyed the home made pasta and the red sauce had a nice flavor to it. The meatballs were good but am not sure that I could taste the difference between the 44 Farms version and regular ground beef. Table service was good.  Overall I would give the meal a 3.5 but will round up for Yelp purposes.
Thank you for your feedback.  We work to provide the best in food and service.  Glad you enjoyed your experience and hope you will be back soon.

I came by for dinner last week for my first visit. Upon entering I immediately realized that I liked the interior decor of this place. Being seated I ordered a pizza, of course. At the suggestion of the waitress I went with an olive oil based Bianco de Bollo pizza and since I wanted some seafood added shrimp to it for an extra $4 above the regular retail price of $9.  The pizza came out almost 15 minutes later and looked really good. It also tasted really good. The mozzarella cheese with tomatoes and basil and shrimp was just what I wanted. The pizza had a nice pillowy crust. It was a quality pie. My only slight complaint was I wished that a few more shrimp were on the pizza.  My table service was good. There is outdoor seating here and the restaurant has a nice vibe going with it. I would be happy to return. There is a free parking lot in front.

After a day of enjoying the lazy river at the Marriott Marquis, we were jonesing for some pizza.  We always work to support local, independent businesses, so Bollo fit that description.   We started with a few appetizers: the meatballs, the mozzarella sticks and the hummus.  All were delicious and high quality.  Normally, I don't eat fried foods, but the mozzarella sticks were delightful.  The hummus was abundant and exceptional and the meatballs were tender and flavorful.  Then our pizza came out!  We ordered the Carne Trio (3 meat) and we were delighted!  Abundant toppings and a savory sauce, the pizza burst with flavors including arugula, red onion and light cheese.   I'm a Chicago (pizza capitol of the world) native and rarely find good pizza in my new Texas paradise, but I'll give Bollo huge props.  This was a really excellent dinner experience and I highly recommend you support this wonderful small business.

Thank you!  It is awesome that you took the time to provide such a great review.  We really appreciate it.  We are so happy to hear of your experience.  We work to provide the best in food and service.  Our staff will be proud to hear that you enjoyed Bollo!!

I came here for dinner with some friends and we were very impressed by the food. The flavor is really good, especially the Cotto Funghi although it did get a bit too salty the more I ate it. I like how they wood fire their pizzas so it tastes very fresh when it's served. The ambiance of the place is alright and the prices are a bit expensive for a pizza so I'm not too sure if I'd come back just for this place but not a bad experience.
Great delivery and good ingredients! Very happy with our pies. In my Houston top 10 pizza joints thus far!
That's aweseome!  Thank you for taking the time to provide such a great and informative review.  We appreciate our customers and hope that you will visit again soon.  Thank you again!

Awesome spot!  Took the family here for a casual pizza night and Bollo did not disappoint. They have great drinks ($5 specials every day 4-7pm, including weekends), food is delicious, and service was awesome.  Highly recommend coming here if you enjoy a fresh cooked pizza. Ask for Shannon!

Authentic! We stumbled upon Bollo Woodfired Pizza when looking for a dog friendly place to eat, and I'm glad we did. Everything was so yummy! We tried the calamari, garlic Parmesan bread, linguine carbonara (added gulf shrimp) , and the carne trio pizza. Everything was delicious and you can tell everything was freshly made. Fresh pasta hits different! The only thing I'd prefer is the calamari batter to be a little more flavorful. We'll def be back! ;)

Tried this place cos the spot I usually go to was closed. Got pizza and chicken parm Pizza was 3/5. I got the Margherita pizza and it was very average. it wasn't bad and i'd probably get it again, but it wasn't anything special Chicken parm was 1/5  the chicken had a rubber texture, the breading was awful and soggy, the tomato sauce tasted canned and the portion was tiny for such a high price. would never order again

Guaranteed great dining experience, you can count on Bollo! We love coming here, because  -pizza is consistently amazing: the crust is lightly toasted and the dough is fluffy and light, and the ratio between the sauce and the cheese is perfectly balanced, paired with fresh vegetable ingredients, you will come back again and again.  -fast and super friendly service. They do tend to get busier on Friday and weekend evenings, but we didn't have to wait for too long.  -delicious baked calzone (huge portion)  -filling & refreshing baby Arugula salad (it has goat cheese, cranberries, candied walnuts, white truffle honey vinaigrette!) with added grilled chicken, a perfect light meal packed with flavors.
That's awesome!!  We work to provide the best in food and service.  Our staff will be so proud reviewing this feedback.  Thank you!!

Well...  The wings were ok. A bit too much fat and cartilage.  Buffalo sauce was actually pretty good though. Nice amount of tang, and not to sour. Good enough heat. Good stuff. Pizza was interesting. The crust wasnt bad. But too thin. Not too thick. Soft enough to absorb some of the oil and sauce.  Tomato sauce was pretty good. Flavorful. Stuck out in flavor, even with the beef and cheeses.  Pasta was so damn heavy. Three bites and already I was giving up on it. It honestly didn't need the salty pork. It made the dish too salty. Salty. Creamy. Heavy. No good. Overall it was jus so... Eh. It wasn't Terrible. But it wasn't good. And honestly did not make me want to come at all, especially for the price!!

Sorry about your experience.  We work hard to provide the best in food and service.  We will review with our staff and look to see if there are any issues. Normally we are provided a good review.  So sorry again.
35-45  mins

My cousin suggested Bollo after I told her I was craving pizza and it was so good! We ordered the black truffle burrata, hand-cut garlic fries (extra crispy), and the baby arugula salad which were all delicious! I LOVED the burrata, flavor harmony   For pizza we got the cotto funghi and diavola with added truffle zest. The cotto funghi was our favorite pizza, and the diavola was good, but it was missing something.. maybe a drizzle of honey would've been nice. Overall a delicious meal if you're craving pizza! (Pictures taken by my cousin bc my camera quality sucks)

This place is a hidden gem! Delicious wood oven pizza, great appetizers and good choices for cocktails, beer and wine. Lots of outdoor seating and a really cool bar inside to enjoy a cocktail and small bites.

That is wonderful!  We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience at Bollo.  Thank you for sharing.  We appreciate you taking the time to let everyone know how we work to provide th best in food and service.  Thank you!!

To keep up with growing pizza orders they have added a new oven, wait time for pizzas just got faster, I love these guys What a great restaurant, friendly staff, fresh food and fun environment, they go over and above to try and please Every customer, every time I go in it's not only a pleasure to be served by their staff but also to watch the care that the staff takes in giving their customers a great experience. Wonderful pizzas, great pastas Not to mention all of the different small plates that can be combined to make a versatile meal. Cheers

What a great restaurant, friendly staff, fresh food and fun environment, they go over and above to try and please Every customer, every time I go in it's not only a pleasure to be served by their staff but also to watch the care that the staff takes in giving their customers a great experience. Wonderful pizzas, great pastas Not to mention all of the different small plates that can be combined to make a versatile meal. Cheers

Trendy, yet not pretentious, this neighborhood restaurant serves up great pizzas wonderful sandwiches, and array of well-prepared pastas and a wait staff that is always attentive and friendly and Ready to serve you up a great experience. And a true gem in the upper Kirby area,And today I had their pork chops served over mashed potatoes with a beautiful mushroom sauce on top that is my absolute favorite dish so far

I've been to Bollo before with a friend and loved the food and service we got on a Saturday for lunch. We ordered take out last night and wow! Everything was so delicious and fresh! We ordered 3 pizzas, a salad and an app for us and some friends and had plenty leftover for lunch today.  Another great thing was they told us 45 minutes and it was actually done during that time. So many places get it wrong on time for take out. All our food was still very hot and ready to eat fresh when picked up! I definitely will be coming back for some more pizza from Bollo!! Especially that Anglio pizza!!
That's awesome!  We are so happy to know that our customers are getting the products and service that we work to provide.  Thank you and hope to see you soon!

We have finally made it to try you!! For starters, your staff was very welcoming, the atmosphere is nice, and they follow proper COVID protocol. Speaking of, they even have an advanced air filtration system! On to the food...  the Black Truffle Burrata was very tasty.  Not overpowered by the truffle flavor, but not lacking either. The Linguine Carbonara was also very good, which was surprising, since this place specializes in pizza (so we thought.) Better still, the pasta noodles are made locally at Fabio's, right down the street.  Please read below in the description for details about the delicious pizzas.

Arrived at 7:00, our reservation time only to have two very vague, unapologetic hostesses shrug and stare unaffected that our reservation for 7 was unavailable, no tables were free. I repeated, as did my husband, that we have a reservation, and five people with us. Hostesses just shrugged again and said they didn't have an open table. Since my husband had a client with us, I was ticked. There luckily was six open seats at the bar so my husband stood most of the time while we ordered drinks and food. Owner who I don't know his name, was apologetic at least, was attentive and friendly coming over occasionally to chat.  The food was pretty good. Ordered a margarita pizza and a caprese salad. Both very good. Others ordered salads, pizza and wings.  Other than the reservation issue, I'd probably return.

Danielle, I am so sorry.  This is NOT the type of experience we want you to have.  We really value you as a customer.  We will work with the staff to prevent this from repeating.  Thank you for your patience and support at Bollo.  Hope to see you again soon!!

So I gave this place two chances, and while it's a decent choice for a neighborhood restaurant, it's not a destination spot. Excellent, attentive service both times. Their wood-fired pizzas did *not* have that crispy exterior to the chewy crust that are expected with wood-fired pizzas. Not very flavorful cheese, sauce, and crust. Pasta was al dente, but again, not really better than what I can cook up at home. Decent choice if you live in the area and don't feel like cooking.

My husband and I grabbed take-out from here after eyeing Bollo for awhile. We ordered an Arugulo pizza that is a white pizza with goat cheese, prosciutto, and peppery arugula. Very easy to re-heat in the air fryer. Pretty decent pizza size. Ended up being about $19 including tax.
Glad you enjoyed the pizza at Bollo's.  Thank you for your review.  We appreciate you taking the time to provide your input.  Thank you again and hope to see you again soon.

I was first introduced to Bollo by way of DoorDash. I was skeptical, since pizza delivery was normally underwhelming, but Bollo offered me a pleasant surprise.The pizza was perfect!! It wasn't soggy, it was full of flavor and visibly fresh ingredients.  It was so good I had to try it again, so I did. I ate Bollo four times in a 7-day period. Everything I ordered was as good as the first time. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the fried calamari (someone I was with actually ordered that).  The things I tried that I highly recommend: Salads: *The Chopped Caesar *Baby Arugula *Classic Greek Small plates: *Beef meatballs *Chicken wings (original hot) Pizze *Bianco de Bollo (The pizza that started it all) *Shrimp Scampi Pizza The chocolate cake was also very good. The best thing about Bollo is the service matched the food, *shoutout to Carlos!* Bollo took an otherwise terrible trip to Houston and made it somewhat memorable.

That is awesome!!  It is great to hear about such a great experience.  Thank you for taking the time to provide this high end review.  We appreciate our customers and do our best.  Thank you for providing praise to Carlos! Hope to see you again soon!!

This place is Fantastic! Food is delicious, super fresh pasta, the garlic bread is great, their tomato sauce Is simply to die for! Pizza is spot on, delicious wood oven oven crust , the taste is just right.  Desserts , Ohhh Desserts !, Tiramisu, Nutella gelato out of this world !  Staff is  beyond attentive, super clean place, a Must Go, will definitely recommend to anyone who wants to eat great delicious and unpretentious Italian food and  great prices!
Awesome!!  We appreciate you.  Thank you for taking the time to provide such a great review.  Thank you and hope to see you again soon!!
35-45  mins

Craig Hockenberry: Ninfa's on Navigation  I took my boys to eat here based on a recommendation from a local.  It was in the top 5 best Mexican food I have eaten anywhere in the United States.  the people made us feel like family, clean, great food, great drinks, and amazing atmosphere.   Craig Hockenberry Cincinnati
Thank you for sharing, Craig!

I finally got to try the famous Ninfas! I have tried coming here multiple times in the past but this place STAYS packed. This time I was smart enough to make a reservation!  My friends and I got a few pitchers of the Ninfarita to start off. Not the best margarita around, but they did the trick. For my entree, my boyfriend and I shared the medium beef fajitas and added quail and a chile con queso. This was more than enough for both of us and we had left overs. The beef was tender and juicy, cooked to perfection. The quail was falling off the bone, also cooked perfectly! I was very impressed. For dessert I ordered the tres leches and I absolutely loved it!  The only thing that was surprising to me about this place was the price. Be prepared to spend 100+ for two people. Although this place was completely packed on a Saturday night, service did not miss a beat. Our server was very attentive, we never saw empty glasses, and never had to ask for dishes to be removed from the table. I will be back!
Thank you for coming to see us, Alexandra!

This restaurant is a sad excuse for a restaurant!!! Very small, very tight and just needs to be remodeled!!!  Very hectic and if you have to go to the rest room, you have to be a very small person to fit through the hallway, very narrow and unforgiven!!!   We ordered mixed drinks with rum and coke, the waiter charged us for the rum and coke as two separate orders!!! It is called mixed drink for a reason!!!  I felt like a sardine in a can!!! Mother Nina's Would be disappointed at the way customers   Tolerate this so called Mexican Restaurant  Top class!!! I will never return!!! What a disappointment!!!

Hey Raul, thank you for coming to see us! This is where it all started, where Mama Ninfa first stuffed chargrilled sliced beef into a handmade flour tortilla and launched the national fajita craze. We've done our best to maintain the character, and Mama Ninfa's touch that makes this place so special. We're sorry to hear you had such a disappointing visit, but we do appreciate your feedback and hope to have another shot to impress you!

I could not be happier with my experience. I was celebrating my birthday and had over 15 people. It was easy to make a reservation and they offered a fajita (chicken and beer) package that made it super easy. The wait staff was super accommodating and very nice! They brought us chips when we ran out and we didn't have to ask for them, which was nice. Highly recommend if you have a large party!!!!  (Plus, complimentary valet)
Thank you for coming to celebrate your special day with us, Francis!

Omg have you ever had real Mexican food if you haven't gone to ninfas ?!  If you're reading this right now please start heading over, you have to try this place!  I found out if you check in you get a free queso which is bomb!  I shared the beef fajitas with my friend and it was the perfect size. Super filling and cooked to perfection.  We also ordered margaritas and they were perfectly cold and strong.  This place get packed but we were seated immediately which is amazing.  This place is a much try + I hear it has a great history. I believe they were the place that invented fajitas WOW!
Thank you for sharing, Nicholas!

I came to Houston last month (June 2021) for a quick overnight trip. My hotel luckily was close to this iconic Houston landmark. It was on my "must" list.  With Yelp check-in, I got a free queso with chips. The queso was delicious, and the chips they bring out are thicker than the ones that come with the salsa. They scoop that queso with ease.  I ordered the famous Fajita Burger. First, understand that this restaurant claims to have invented fajitas as we know them today. A bold claim, but whether they invented them or not, they have them down pat. So when I hear from people and see on TV that the Fajita Burger is the ultimate here, I had to see for myself.  When you look at the pic I posted, it is hard to see any meat under that cheese. Trust me, it's there. My first bite rewarded me with that sort of satisfaction and surprise that catches your first chew for a second. When you stop and think about how damn good it is. This burger is one of the best I have ever had, and, my Yelpies, I have had some of the best.  The burger comes out with huge steak fries, a spicy ketchup (freaking delicious), and escabeche (a mix of pickled carrots and jalapeños). The food is a bit pricy, but well worth it. Expect a wait accordingly. I can't wait to come back here again for the food and excellent service.
Thank you so much for sharing, Ricardo!

Friendly staff, and the avocado tomatillo salsa was amazing!!! I got the salmon tacos which were pretty good especially on the corn tortillas that are a bit more like masa! The mole salmon was ahmazing! Ninfas however is known to introduce fajitas to Texas but found fajitas just okay! Would definitely come back but note that this place is pricier than your average joint!
Thank you for the review, Arshiya!

Everything the 5-star reviews say!  I'm not Mexican and I'm from California.  I wanted to taste authentic Mex-Tex and Ninfa did not disappoint.  My waiter was excellent.  I love seeing him wearing a guayabera and the girls in grades bordados.  It's quite an experience in taste and ambiance.   I ordered the cucumber margarita (YUM!), and the Tejano Plate.  Don't forget to order their pico de Gallo to complete the taste tour.
Thank you, Johanna! We appreciate you coming to see us and taking the time to share!

This place is as good as my mom said it was. She moved here in 80s ans said it was great. Glad to say she was right. I loved the fajitas margaritas were strong and delicious Tex Mex was all I wanted and more Fresh guac made up to my standard  I had the most wonderful time
Thank you for coming to see us, Bella! We're so glad you enjoyed it!

If you're looking for some good TexMex, this is the place to visit. We knew we had to get some while in the area, and several people recommended the Original Ninfa's. The area around the restaurant is pretty cool, but busy even on a week night. The complimentary valet made ease of the parking though! We started with some queso to go with the included chips and salsa. This queso seemed as it may have began life in a can, but was doctored up pretty good if that was the case. It filled our cheese craving regardless! The entrees were quick and hot on arrival. She ordered the Del Mar enchiladas, which were very cheesy and had a good amount of the crab and shrimp inside. The chipotle sauce had a good flavor, and wasn't too spicy (even for her haha). I went with our waiters recommendation of the Tejas Combo with beef. The beef fajitas was perfectly tender, seasoned well and a real highlight of the dish. The beef taco and cheese enchilada were also very tasty!  Overall, the food was good quality, the drinks are on point and the service was top notch. Ninfa's will be a favorite for each time we visit Houston!
We're so glad you enjoyed it, Nathanial! Thank you for sharing!
1 free small queso

OMG! If your in Houston and love Mexican food you must go here!  Parking was crazy, we had to wait a little while to find parking,  but it's so worth it. You can also valet. Staff is so friendly, we were seated right away and got a basket of chips and salsa. All good! I got the classic frozen margaritas, delicious!! I ordered the pork tamales. Oh my gosh! It was the best tamales I have ever had! The outside just melted in your mouth. Pork is tender and flavorful. Black beans and rice came on the side both are good. Awesome food!!
Thank you for sharing, Theresa!

So fire! When I read that The Original Ninfa's on Navigation created fajitas by "Mama" Ninfa Laurenzo in 1973, I knew this would be our Tex-Mex experience in Houston.  Ninfa started selling cut grilled skirt steak in a tortilla and called them fajitas, she is known in Houston as the inventor of Tex-Mex cuisine.  They are the gold standard.  We ordered three plates of chicken fajitas with a side of rice and charro beans. Their tortillas are handmade, just like their tamales and the masa flavors are fresh! Their grilled chicken is seasoned well, tender and juicy with those amazing grill marks and flavor. The rice and charro frijoles were top notch stewed slow beans.  The service was excellent and everything was overall great! Super causal with amazing food!
Thank you for the great review, Natalie!

Found myself in Houston for a volleyball tournament and this place shows up on YELP.  Naturally I'm always down for any eating spot with a story and good reviews. We pull up and there is a wait.  We give them our number and take a seat outside.  I've said this before and I'll say it again.  While some my frown on waiting for good food, I welcome the wait, especially if the food is worth it.  If people are THAT desperate to get in here and eat, it must be good. We get the call and head in, we are seated quickly and our server brings us water.  Upon our initial drink order, my son decides he wants to try an original Mexican Coca Cola.  I order a beer and my wife orders a Sprite. We're asked do we want appetizers, so I ask the server what's a good appetizer?  The server suggests oysters.  I'm not an oyster fan, but what the heck, I order 2 of them since you gotta try new things. WOW WOW WOW!! The oysters were nothing short of INCREDIBLE.  I mean they were so good my son ate more than my wife and I.  It was incredible and every bite and chew was fantastic. When it came time to order our meals, I ordered the mole enchiladas, my wife ordered the Fajitas and split them with my son. Every part of the meal was delicious, even the chips and salsa were unique and wonderful. I don't head out to Houston often, but when I go again, this place is first on my list.
Thank you for the great review, Desmond!

Service was decent  . However our food was awful . Caldo was bland . Looked like just plain broth and bland chicken . Beef fajitas were over cooked and tasted so charred . Drinks ... HOT . The whole restaurant was SO HOT. I shouldn't be sweating at dinner . When the server came by and saw my friend hadn't eaten her soup he asked if she liked it and she replied no. Didn't offer her another entree or to remove it from our ticket . This place has gone downhill ...

. Our server took forever to bring drinks . Took forever to take our order and of course was nowhere to be found when we needed our ticket . The food is just not the same Anymore . To go along with  the bad service it was so ridiculously hot In the restaurant ! Like the AC HAD BROKEN! It's too hot in houston for there to be no AC in an establishment .

Hate to leave a very average review but i have to be honest - I'm a little confused but the glowing reviews I see here.  We got the steak and chicken fajitas. The chicken was very tender and the beef had good flavor as well but unfortunately did not live up to the hype that we've heard. 1 large and 1 medium size is really plenty for 5-6 people.  We also tried the queso and I would definitely not order this again. It was like the cheese you see at movie theaters. The salsas were also pretty bland and the tortillas tasted far from fresh...Again, hate to leave a very average review but i have to be honest - I'm used to more flavorful Mexican food! Especially in Texas.
Thank you so much for your review, Anitha. We appreciate your feedback and hope to have another shot to impress you!

Pretty classic staple in Houston. We came here on Cinco De Mayo. Plenty of parking available.  Orderd fajita platter and it was solid. The other combo dishes looked great as well. Desserts were also very good, especially the flan and sopapilla. It's the 2nd time here and the food here is great texmex both times.
Thank you for sharing, Jason! Come see us again soon!

Honestly.... Wayyy better than I expected. We ordered the the El Henry, Fajita burger, and flameados... all were very very delicious... fresh made tortillas, sauces, and chips. This is the spot for great Mexican food. You can tell the food is freshly made. One of my new favorite spots... Hands down! Just go, don't second guess it.
Thank you so much for sharing, Brittanii!

I love the look and feel of this location. The neighborhood is fun to walk around as you wait (~45 min on a Friday night). The dishes themselves were fine. The rice on the side was pretty different from other Tex Mex places I've tried (contained potatoes and spiced carrots) and the enchiladas filling was made fresh.  We ordered: Carnitas Enchiladas - Fine Tejas Plate - Would order something else next time Tres Leches - Best Tres Leches I have ever had!
Thank you for taking the time to share your review, Melanie!

While in Houston we had to stop by the original Ninfa's. The server took a while to come but afterwards was very attentive. We had the mixed fajitas. Lots of meat but very little bell peppers. The flavor was great. We added on the Tampico Shrimp which was also very tasty! The margaritas were cold and delicious and during happy hour $5 to boot! We tried the chocolate cake for dessert we weren't really fans as it had a very coffe-ish taste, but that was just preference. The plating and presentation was superb. The green salsa is my favorite thing here and I ate enough to tide me over til I can get back to Houston. We will definitely stop in again!
Thank you for coming to see us, Megan!

My favorite tex mex place in town! Over the years we've tried a decent amount of items, but the combination fajitas, Chile con queso, quail, and TORTILLAS of course, are my favorites! The service is always great! The margaritas are good too, but be sure to differentiate if you want frozen or on the rocks cause they default to frozen. I would highly recommend making a reservation since they fill up fast and there's usually a wait on the weekends. I also prefer sitting in the outdoor patio since covid, but it looks like they've expanded their outdoor space so kudos to Ninfa's!
Thank you for sharing your review, Liz!
1 free small queso

Hugo's seem like a very classy place - simple and elegant. I stopped by for brunch with my friend and we ordered chilaquiles, chicken enchilada, and Chile relleno pork, and a small plate of octopus.  I was a bit skeptic of the chips in chilaquiles being soggy but when it arrived, the chips were still crisp and tasty. The green salsa was very delicious and the chicken was so tender that it was falling apart if you stick a fork or chip in it. It's served with 2 sunny side eggs and feta which just enhances the whole taste to another level.  We got the chicken enchiladas with the mole sauce and it was tasty as well. I really liked the tangy and sweet-ish taste of the mole sauce.  My friend who got the octopus was also happy since it's served with 4 small tortillas and salsa, so you can make four small octopus tacos from it. He really liked it and it's one of the dish Hugo's is famous for. Finally he really liked the pork Chile relleno as well, it was huge. Most of the entrees come with a small serving of rice and beans.  My recommendation is to make a reservation before visiting.

Hugo's certainly has great upscale Mexican food but I would prefer it's relative restaurants.  The food: The food tastes great. There's a decent variety of options to try and most things are good. I do think that their portioning is kind of all over the place. I've had a meal here and left feeling stuffed and another one where I was left hungry. I really like the braised ribs and then tamales (which they do not always have).  The space: Its pretty nice, a bit dimly lit. I enjoyed sitting in the curtained area because the main room just kind of gets too busy. Overall as a more expensive restaurant I kind of want to be wowed more.

I usually don't write reviews of this nature because I check the restaurants pet policy .  We were asked to walk out of the restaurant today (11/11/2021) because we had two little dogs both in a carrier.    We checked the pet policy on their website in which they are encouraging to bring Fido along.  When we entered the restaurant we asked the the receptionist if dogs were allowed and she said it was ok.  After we ordered our food the waiter came back and said we had to leave because dogs were not allowed and that he did not know why.  Please change your website and train your staff to avoid future embarrassment to people.    Not coming back to this restaurant.

Definitely had to give Hugo's a try for Houston Restaurant Week! I've always heard so many delightful things about this restaurant.  For the first course, I went with the Enmolada! It came with a savory corn tortilla with the most delicious crema fresco. Second course was the Garnachas De Tinga De Pollo. Delicious masa cakes topped with a delightful chicken stew. For the third course, I tried the Costilla De Res. Short rib cooked to perfection! The meat was practically falling off the bone. The ending desert was the highlight of the entire meal. The Tres Leches was one of the best cakes I've ever had. The combination of the three milks made it perfectly moist.  An unforgettable experience! Service and food were top notch! The only downside is parking can be difficult at times. You won't regret this choice!
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for supporting HRW!

A bunch of us came here for lunch and we thoroughly enjoyed the restaurant. The food was presented beautifully, it was clearly very fresh and thoughtfully prepared. They also offer a dedicated vegetarian menu which was handy. The service was a little slow but the staff were very friendly, at the end, the host waited around for us and chatted for a while, giving us some context on the restaurant which was a nice touch.
We are pleased to hear that our team made your experience pleasant and you approved of our services!

Would highly recommend Hugo's for brunch. The service was great and the ambience was wonderful. I don't love their parking situation though. If you're going to have valet, they should take non cash options such as Venmo or Cashapp too.

Im starting to really find love for Mexican food and this spot helped in a big way. Went for brunch and had the chicken chilaquiles which wasn't over sauced and had a tasty salsa verde. The grilled octopus was amazing. Perfectly grilled and seasoned with a lil heat. I could have easily ate another order of that. Octopus was tender and nicely charred. Oddly enough the star was the table made hot chocolate. Ive never had hot chocolate until i had this. Please do not leave without trying the hot chocolate. Buen provecho!
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Chris!

The food and service are top notch. This is our favorite (not Tex-Mex) Mexican restaurant in town. Everything we've tried is consistently great. Highly recommend Hugo's, and all the other restaurants in their family.
Delightful dinner out, a delicious healthy meal. Highlights from the Pescatarian 2021 Houston Restaurants Week menu at Hugos.  #hrw2021  #foodbliss
That is really great to hear. Thank you for supporting HRW!

Sometimes, in the morning you might feel like eating Mexican food and when I do, I love coming to Hugo's for a delicious meal. It's the perfect spot for brunch and their omlettes are spectacular. For lunch, I enjoy munching on their lobster tacos because their lobsters are seasoned with cajun and taco seasoning. If you have a chance to spend a little more, try their clams because they're really fresh. If you get there early before dinner rush, you can catch their happy hour, which serves amazing dishes like ceviche and their various tacos including fish, pulled pork, and steak! All three are so good I can't choose a favorite. The fish was fresh, the pulled pork was fatty, and the steak was cooked medium rare and perfect for taco night.

TL; DR: Absolutely remarkable ceviche.  Who hasn't been to Hugo's? Restauranteur turned a full-on group, Hugo (I want to say his last name is Ortega) has been elevating the Houston food scene for multiple decades.  But I had been here only a couple of times for brunch and even that was almost a decade ago.  So we decided to give this oldie but a goodie a try for my birthday.  We tend to eat early and had a 5pm reservation through the link on the website. We were happy to find that the Happy Hour menu is extensive. Weekdays until 6pm.  Gil was our server and he's such a gentleman. Attentive without being overbearing. We appreciated his measured politeness and kindness.  I had chosen Hugo's wanting to try the whole fish but my mom made an awesome grilled barramundi earlier in the day so I decided to switch things up.  The cocktails apparently allow no substitutions so I held off, but we got: Happy Hour menu: - Ceviche tradicional - Aguachile de camarones  - Fish, pulled pork, and steak tacos  Regular menu: - Pulpo al carbon (grilled octopus) - Chile relleno (stuffed pepper) I almost always get the octopus when I see it on a menu, and unlike the one at Oporto (I have yet to see an octopus in Houston beat Oporto's - if you have a challenger, please let me know), this one was a letdown. It came cut, and the pieces (and the whole plate) were itty bitty - the plate itself was smaller than my palm. The flavors were ok. 2/5 The tacos were a bit pricy at $4.50-5 per taco even during Happy Hour, but they were stuffed and filling. I had the fish taco and a bite of the steak taco - the fish was lightly fried and on a pillow of cabbage, and the steak meats were chopped too small for me to actually enjoy its texture but were delightfully chargrilled. 5/5 for the fish and 4.5/5 for the steak.  The tacos and the crudo got us full so we didn't try the stuffed pepper and took it to go, but from the bite of refried beans I have had, my guess is that there must've so much pork fat in those beans - it tastes like pork in lard (not necessarily a bad thing). The sauce atop the pepper was a nut purée - judging by the color, pistachio.  So onto the crudo.  The flavors of the shrimp aguachile were spot on as well but especially after the beautiful ebi aguachile at Mastrantos last week, the shrimp here was severely lacking in both quality and amount. 4 tiny shrimps for $8. I'm glad to have tried it but I wouldn't get it again. 3/5  But the highlight: el ceviche tradicional.  This dish alone would have me come back just so that I can have two or three of this dish. It's beautiful to look at and even better to taste. The brightness of the citrus and the salt is perfectly balanced, and the catch of the day happened to be snapper - the perfect fish for its chewy texture, cooked slightly by the lemon. It was perfect. 6/5.  All in all, this was an unexpected revisit and find for Hugo's to reign as one of the top happy hour spots in my book. It's a bit loud inside but coupled with great service and comfortable, distanced seating, it's no wonder why it is a rooted establishment in the Houston food scene. Enjoy!

This review is for HRW 2021. Not my first visit here. And in the past I have enjoyed. But this experience was very underwhelming. All of the dishes sounded good on the menu, but ended up being lackluster. We tried the Menu Entre Las Olas and Menu Vegetariano. They both had bold colors and phenomenal plating, but flavors were lacking. My first course was lukewarm. The tostada de atun was the size of a tortilla chip. And the cauliflower steak was literally grilled and placed on the plate. It wasn't even seasoned and there was barely any sauce. Cauliflower only costs 97 cent! Nothing was bad, it just wasn't great. We left still hungry. At these prices, I cannot recommend. Drinks were good as usual. And I am a big fan of Hugo Ortega and his restaurants. But today I was not impressed.

Thanks for telling me this. I am so sorry you didn't enjoy your meal Lorece. I will let the chefs know. I will check on the cauliflower steak in case we have gone astray in their preparation. Thanks for joining us!

Does Hugo's even need another review?  My favourite restaurants by this group are Hugo's and Caracol- delivering solid quality food every time. My only missed mark would be on the cocktails- maybe I chose wrong but I wasn't that impressed.  Went for HRW with some girlfriends and enjoyed the meaty menu. The short ribs are the way to go for sure! So tender and juicy, and the salsa verde they rest on brought the right amount of acid to cut the fatty richness. You won't be disappointed! Pro tip- street parking is hard to come by- but if you venture out closer to the park a couple of blocks down, you'll probably find something.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Lalanica!

I don't know how we went so long without knowing about this place... I ordered a spicy margarita and chips and salsa to start off with.  The salsa is some of the best salsa I've ever had! We ordered a bunch of appetizers as our dinner and they were each amazing in their own way .  The service was a little slow as they were busy, but overall it was a great dining experience.

I had some heavy debates on whether I should come here. This was THE Mexican place that showed up on my radar while in Houston every time I looked. From what it appears, this is an OG establishment that's been around before modern mexican food even had much representation. This aint your typical tex-mex menu, but rather, a more sophisticated approach with some nods to tex-mex (like the taquitos). Although I wish I had more of a appetite to have some of their main dishes, Id say its worth eating here. Its not cutting edge compared to the rest of whats on Montrose, but its still worth being brought up in conversations for great places to eat in Houston, based on two dishes I had.  This place is beautiful, inside and out. There's an elegance to it that feels old and new at the same time (perhaps it's the art deco influence that helps with that). Not overly noisy inside, but definitely not quiet. I was able to sit at the bar, and luckily there were a few seats available. The bartender was attentive, but certainly not there to have a conversation. He was quite busy as lots of people came his way.  The taquitos are damn good. I don't normally get excited over chicken, but this was actually moist and had some grilled flavor to it. They deep fry the suckers fin house, and I can tell by the corn oil that its quite fragrant. They give you a generous amount of guacamole and queso fresco for this dish, so I definitely cant complain.  The ceviche with snapper was good, but not a must have. This was the least lime driven ceviche I've had (and that's a good thing). The olive is the blessing and curse of the dish. While the olive grounds the dish, it also caps the ceiling on the high tones more than I would like. The lime, jalapeño and cilantro can never really stand out to its heights with the olives present.  This is still a great choice for anyone who doesn't want to feel bloated after their meal.
Thank you for taking the time to leave this review. I will go over this with the chefs. Thanks for coming Gill!
Wonderful dining experience. It was my first and won't be my last. Customer service was amazing. Server was knowledgeable of the menu and assist us with pairing our meal with perfect wine.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Divine!

Surprised this place doesn't have 5 stars. Absolutely LOVED the lamb tacos.  It's nice they have a valet outback. A calm patio. I took a recommendation coming here and even on the food.  Very great experience!!!
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Corbin!

Unbelievable experience! My husband and I came to Hugo's after hearing so much about it for our anniversary. There was excellent customer service. Everyone was so friendly and they gave us free champagne and dessert for our anniversary. We ordered the ceviche tradicional which was very fresh and acidic. So delicious. The scallops were my favorite over a bed of soft, creamy cornbread, and my husband loved his rice with seafood. It was a beautiful ambiance and the staff was consistently masking. Tables were spaced out with good distancing.

We came here for my friends bday! Love the atmosphere and loved the food. However, I found out that halfway through my meal,!8 was given the wrong one. Obviously I never knew since it was my first time there. I mean it still tasted great! Just wasn't what I apparently ordered. The staff kinda just threw the plates on the table and didn't check to see who was given what. But the food was good! Lastly, I am not sure what what was going on, but there were more flys inside than there were outside. And they weren't small. Super big annoyance. Other than those two issues, I loved the food and I WILL BE BACK to give this place a second chance.

Tim, we are throwing everything we've got at the fly problem. They are particularly bad this summer. I am very sorry they pestered you. Their "season" will soon be over, thank goodness. Thank you for telling me about the service, I will review this with the managers and we will address this in our staff meeting.

Incredible birthday brunch at Hugo's! Clean, beautiful ambiance. My favorite dishes were the lechon and lamb barbacoa. The sauce for the lechon was absolutely delicious, great flavor and a good amount of heat. I actually really enjoyed their tortilla chips and salsa, very fresh and you can tell they're homemade. Don't skip out on their cocktails either! Will be back very soon. Great great meal.
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Tuong-Vi!
Start your review of  Caracol .

*BRUNCH REVIEW* During a recent visit to Houston, my friend picked Caracol as our Sunday brunch spot and it was a selection that absolutely knocked it out the park.  The service as absolutely superb. Everyone we interacted with from the Valet to the hostess to our amazing server - was efficient, friendly, and completely accommodating.  More importantly, however, the food was AMAZING. It took me a while to decided on an entree because there were SO MANY options that sounded amazing. And every dish I was being served at tables around me looked absolutely delicious.  After much deliberation I settled on the Pollo Pibil dish and my friend the Arrachera con Huevo dish with a shared flan dessert between us. When I say the food was AMAZING - it's no exaggeration. My chicken dish was hands down one of the best meals I've had a Mexican restaurant. AND the serving is so huge that I had enough left over for dinner later that night.  Add Caracol to your Houston dining list. You won't regret it!
We really appreciate your kind words and support. Thank you for joining us Brandy!

A fancy spot just on the other side of a shopping plaza! Upon arrival, we were seated right away (made reservations for 6pm on a Saturday) and they had very tasteful decorations (a few weeks before Halloween). The service was awesome - we were offered the choice of still or sparkling water upon seating.  We took advantage of the HH and ordered some items from the HH menu and appetizers from the main menu.  Started off with a half dozen of Ostiones En Su Concha, raw oysters. They were okay! To be fair, we recently went on a trip to Cabo and had really delicious oysters so it was not a fair comparison. However, we were telling our server of a habanero sauce we had in Mexico and he brought a little dish out for us to try. I felt these were a bit on the small side but nothing we can do about it!  Tostadas de Campechana - I thought these little shrimp tostadas were excellent! It was a big pile of seafood on a little chip so upon first bite, everything fell over but the flavor was so fresh, I liked it a lot.  Ceviche de coco - a unique ceviche dish in a half coconut shell. The snapper was soft without being so soft I fell apart when it was picked up. The tangerine added a tang that cut through the coconut cream. Yum.  Tostadas de atun crudo - refreshing little bite but with a big ol piece of tuna atop. It was a fresh bite with flavors that complimented the fish well.  We asked our server what tapas style dishes we had to try on the menu and he recommended the ceviche de coco and the ceviche de Chile Canario so we got that one as well. The sauce in this dish was awesome, I used the chunks of snapper to sop of the sauce. The bites of tomato and cucumber added a pop of freshness to the creamy sauce.  We finished off the meal with a great slice of.. I believe it was a tres leches. I honestly can't remember the name but I know it was delicious.  The menu had a great variety. Service was on point. I would recommend for a special occasion or a nice dinner!
Thank you for taking the time to leave this review. We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Jessica!
Delicious! Didn't remember to take pics of everything. Really wishing they still had a Sunday brunch buffet so I could try everything!  A bit on the pricier side but enjoyed everything we ordered.
That is really great to hear. We are planning to go back to having buffet but are waiting for more guest to be fully vaccinated since people do crowd around the table. Thank you for joining us Kelly!

Caracol is a costal themed Spanish Seafood restaurant in the Houston Galleria area. The costal theme can be seen in the sleek modern decor and the blue umbrellas situated in the patio area. The place seems to be busy, so reservations are probably necessary if you do not want a long wait!  My boyfriend and I came for restaurant week and ordered a slew of food so on to the review! Our first appetizer was a masa pancake with what I believed to be mushrooms, mole, queso fresco, and some type of sauce. This was exceptionally good and had great Spanish flavors 4.5/5 Next, we ordered the raw oysters, which in my humble opinion was the best thing I had at dinner. The oysters were HUGE. They also had a Spanish twist and was served with blue corn tortillas and a pico de Gallo garnish. 5/5  Also had the grilled oysters that were topped with bread crumbs. Not sure if it was due to the Houston restaurant week menu but these oysters were really small but had good flavor. 3/5  I had the shrimp and cilantro rice. To be honest this was nothing exceptional and I was slightly disappointed with this dish. The shrimp were good but it seemed like an element was missing from the dish (maybe a sauce?) 3/5 My boyfriend had the pork wrapped with bacon and grilled vegetables. This was done so well and the pork fell off the bone with just a swipe of a fork. This was served with fresh corn tortillas that really pulled all the flavors together. There was also a sliver of sauce neatly tucked away under the delicious meat, oh how I wish I could have swam in that sauce, but sadly there was only a little so I had to ration it out with each bite. 4.5/5  Eh the desert was a little too many flavors and textures for me. I feel like there could have been some editing done when it came to the desert. I had a pistachio cake topped with grilled pineapple with condensed milk and drops of caramel; this was accompanied with dollop of mint ice cream. 2/5  My boyfriend had the chocolate mousse cake with a orange filling. Extremely chocolatey rich cake but the orange fell short for me and didn't pair well. Just think these flavors weren't for me. 2/5  Last but not least the drinks were good but not exceptional. I had the blackberry monito which was good but I would have preferred it to be more sweet. My boyfriend had a Michelada that he said needed more Michelada mix. 3/5 I would like to come back again and try more dishes that aren't on the Houston restaurant week menu.

I am looking into your observations with the chef and managers. I will also go over this with the bartenders and check the drinks incase we have gone astray in their preparations. Thank you for taking the time to leave this review.

I am very picky when it cones to Mexican restaurants and Caracol surprised me in a good way. Real Mexican modern cousin in a good location. The only improvement i can suggest would be to include in the menu few Mexican craft beers.  The Ceviche and the deserts were fenomenal
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Roberto!

Delicious dinner - too many dishes to choose from! Wish I could have tried everything. Tasty margaritas. Recommend the scallops as they are perfect! Tamals were great, the Brussels sprouts were to die for. Highly recommend
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Debbie!

While in Houston with family, my sweet sister in law made a dinner reservation for us at Caracol.  Thank goodness she had the foresight to reserve a table, because this is a hotspot.   We valeted and made our way inside. There is indoor and outdoor seating, and as it was a little chilly, we chose to sit inside.  The hostesses were very welcoming and our table was ready so we were seated.  The food: We ordered the crispy roasted potatoes and they were delicious!! I could've eaten the whole bowl!  We also ordered the roasted Brussels sprouts.  They were very good, but were sort of basic. I decided to order an appetizer - campechano estilo - good, but I found the sauce a little sweet, and a small plate - calamar y pulpo ahumado - delicious! Tender calamari, octopus and other yummy grilled seafood.  And the house made tortillas were killer good. Oh, and it was happy hour too.  There were several small bites and cocktails on the menu that sounded amazing. I went with a $7 mojito.  I love a drink special, especially when it's this refreshing. This place is hopping for a reason. Good stuff.

Came her for an early dinner on a Saturday afternoon - at 5pm. They were having a happy hour on Saturday which is awesome. Pretty solid wine list with some options for Latin America - the sparkling rose from Argentina was really good as was the rose from Mexico. We got two different ceviches which for six people was a little on the slim side. Both were really good! One was a coconut ceviche and was unique, very good coconut flavor.  If you ask they can provide a vegetarian menu - lots of veggie options. I ordered the verdes enchiladas. It was okay, it tasted healthy - could have used more sauce and cheese for my liking. Enjoyed that it was filled with lots of nice veggies.  We tried different desserts. One was the El Coco that you got to crack open with a mallet which was fun. It was really good, lots of coconut flavor! We also tried the tres leches which was good, some in the group thought to be the best.

Date night for the hubby and I, boy am I so happy he chose this restaurant! All the food we ate here was out of this world!  We started with the popular Ostiones Asados (wood-roasted oysters) and the ceviche for our appetizers. Then for our entrees we split the Mariscos Al Ajillo and the Callo de Hacha (scallops). Everything was so tasty and super fresh. The sauces in the dishes complimented the seafood so well. For our dessert we chose the churros; best churros I've had in years. And to make it even better it comes with the Mexican hot cocoa!  I really like the concept of this restaurant; Mexican Seafood. You won't find this just anywhere you go. Everyone has to experience this at least once. I can't wait for another date night here.  Tip: Parking is free with validation.

Had an amazing dinner on the patio.  We have been here before and it has always been very solid but this time was amazing.  The food was spectacular - after starting off with the tuna taco appetize (rare with a nice sear, even the guacamole was good and I am not a fan of guac) I had the bass and my wife had a vegetarian dish (MOLE AMARILLO CON HONGOS) that was mind blowingly good.  We ended with the chocolate mousse cake.  We are not big drinkers and like different wines - so the nice selection of the wines by the glass were a plus.  Service was perfect. Tip: If you don't mind a wee walk or don't like valet for the principal there is free parking in the garage above the restaurant with one flight of stairs or elevator right to the restaurant.

Been here a few times and it seems to have its ups and downs.  For Valentines we had a perfect meal.  This last time we went for Houston restaurant Weeks.  The service was not great (forgot my wine, my coffee came after my dessert when I explicitly requested it with my dessert).  There were 4 HRW menus to chose from - but I actually chose the special menu that night and my wife and friends chose the HRW.  the fixed menus were rather heavy on meat.  You can swap items - for an extra $5.  We all thought the food was very good to great.  Note - you get free parking in the attached parking garage (don't need valet unless, well 20 feet is just too much for you to walk).
Start your review of  Caracol .

Still amazing place, we went a couple weeks ago to celebrate my friend's birthday. Service nice as usual, food amazing, however their margaritas are a big NO. My husband had to overpaid for a Margarita to actually taste good $29!  Their original Margarita is a big NO. You should revise this recipe please.  Since Hugo's is same chain, theirs are way better. It was your I think Caracol Margarita he ordered two, then they brought him another one that he can't remember and he ended up ordering the $29. He paid for every single one of them. We told our server so she could tell bartender

Thank you for taking the time to leave this review. Can you tell me what margarita was not to your liking? I would like to go over this with the bartenders and check the drink incase we have gone astray in their preparations.

We went to celebrate my husband's bday with friends. Had a reservation  We had an amazing time, and the food!! Amazing. Hugo's chain never disappoints  Excellent service, servers are knowledgeable. Only thing My friend and I had the seafood plate, which Hugo's used to served. It was my favorite entree, but the scallops on my friend's dish tastes a bit funny. We told server and they took it out of the bill, we didn't expect that, a high class quality restaurant takes responsibility for their actions. We will definitely come back

We had a delicious 4 course HRW dinner at Caracol for 2!  - Parking: There's an adjacent parking garage. Parking is free after restaurant validation, so make sure to bring your ticket inside to the restaurant! Plenty of parking w/o the stress of parallel or street parking  - Reservations: We had a reservation at OpenTable for 5 & were seated immediately. Would recommend making a reservation as it gets super packed around prime time especially if you want indoor seating at the peak of Houston summers.  - Menu: The HRW dinner menu is tailored with 3 fixed options from 1st-4th course. Was kind of bummed about this b/c there's less freedom to pick exactly what you want but it all turned out great. 2 meat-menu options were $49/person, and there is a vegetarian option for $35/person. We got the 2 meat-containing options.  My favorites: 1. MEMELITA (1st course): So good. Crispy tortilla texture was perfectly paired with the mushrooms. Loved how warm this was & the mole was to die for!  2. Ostiones asados (2nd course): 3 gigantic oysters with a delicious cheesy bread crumb topping. The touch of lime w/ pink salt was incredible and soooo yummy!  3. Canita de puerco (3rd course): This pork chop wrapped with bacon was HUMONGOUS! The pork melts right off the bone, and the mole with surrounding crisp veggies was heavenly. This was an enormous portion and so worth it.  4. Camarones a la talla (3rd course): Crispy shrimp & delicious rice! Definitely more simple and lowkey than the canita de puerco was still good.  The desserts were alright but definitely very rich. I found the ceviche (2nd course) most disappointing b/c it wasn't as fresh as I anticipated & that was one of the dishes I was looking forward to most.  Overall great dining experience and an impressive selection for HRW! Our service was also very personable and the music selection was great. Will come back again!
Thank you for taking the time to leave this review. I will check on the ceviche incase we have gone astray in their preparation. Thank you for joining us Ann!

The best seafood we have had in Houston! The oysters were plump and juicy, the Pescado was delicious, and the deserts were scrumptious. Best of all was the top of the line service! Definitely our best dining experience in a very long time.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Kevin!

The happy hour oysters make this place worth it alone. Delicious gulf coast oysters you can't resist. The happy hour menu also has some other bites and libations to get your fill. I've also dined off the regular menu. They have beautiful entrees that are pretty good, but I wouldn't necessarily come here frequently to eat them. Valet available in the front or self parking in the garage behind the restaurant.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Erin!

The food was absolutely amazing! We got ostiones asados, mariscos Al ajillo, papas martajadas, scallops, and this one other appetizer, it was rice and beans wrapped in banana leaf. The appetizer was such a unique concept and tasted fantastic. Everything tasted so so delicious! We also got the churros and the French toast for desserts. Again, everything was just mouthwatering. It's the perfect date night restaurant. The ambience and music is very romantic and up beat.  The one thing my husband and I did not appreciate and the reason for 3 stars is because our waiter literally left for a good 30 min to introduce some guy to two girls sitting at a table across from us. It's inappropriate and unprofessional. As a professional on the job, this should not be allowed especially at a high class restaurant as such. It took almost 20 min for us to get our bill. Not to mention the guy looked 50 and the two women looked like they were in their thirties.
One of my favorite restaurants in Houston.  And they have terrific vegetarian options.  Service is, as usual in a Tracy & Hugo enterprise, brisk and friendly.  The happy hour is a good value, too.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Laura!

I recently visited Caracol for happy hour and was very pleased with the few cocktails we tried! Love the ambience of the restaurant -- both the main dining area and patio. Ample parking in the garage. Only knocking 1 star off due to the music in the restaurant being loud; it was difficult to have a conversation.
I'm so sorry it was loud, I will get with the managers and have it corrected. Thank you for joining us Hillary!
It has been on my list to try. The food is pretty decent but not highly memorable or outstanding. Service is great. I'll give it another go next time. Might have just ordered the wrong items.
Thank you for joining us Michael!

Taking some time out of Dallas, and thought I'd start with some seafood. Caracol was phenomenal! We got a bunch of dishes that we shared and everything was excellent. We got oysters, squid, and the Pescado Zarandeado. They even gave us a small lobster taco dish on the house! We had wanted ceviche but they were out :(. Excellent food, great service!
Aradhna, thank you for taking the time to leave this review. We're glad you enjoyed our services.

Drinks, wood fired oysters, guacamole,  and their vegetarian dish with mole are some of my favorites here! Love this place, love the service, love the environment. For a more casual easy going vibe, I love to sit at the bar. Definitely worth checking out if you like sea food and get sick of the greasy, cheesy Tex mex food you find at almost all the "mexican" restaurants in Houston. This place is one of the more authentic restaurants to eat. I have to say I have had better ceviche in Mexico City but the ceviche here is a solid 8/10 and as good as it gets here. Also, I tried their chiles enogadas and again, the one i had in CDMX was way better but if you've never had this traditional dish, it's worth a try to taste them at Caracol.
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Mariana!

Update: Went to Tacos Tierra Caliente again. And wanted to include my thoughts on my more recent experience. This time, we ordered the Beef, Chicken, Trompo, Chicharron and the Veggie tacos. (We would have ordered Barbacoa, but they were out!)  By far, the best tacos were the (1) Beef and (2) Chicken (and based on my previous experience Barbacoa as well). Next time, I will be sticking with those. The green salsa is awesome, and next time I will ask for extra!  P.S. The prices are now $2.00 for Corn, $2.50 for Flour tortillas.

Every Houstonian should come here to try the tacos! The food is made very very quickly and comes warm and fresh! $1.50 for Corn Tacos and $2.00 for Flour Tacos They have a good variety of proteins: barbacoa, fajita, pastor, lengua, chicharon, pollo. My favorite are barbacoa and pastor! Get those! Green Salsa is SPICY and very good. Ordering 5 tacos is a dinner-sized portion. 2 tacos is a light snack. Great location, right on West Alabama next to the West Alabama Ice House.

Tacos were very cheap and decent. You may need to speak up and repeat yourself because our orders were a little messed up. I ordered the Trompo, Barbacoa, Chicken, and Beef, and didn't get the beef.  Trompo was very meh, a little dry honestly. Chicken was good, more moist. Barbacoa was very moist, the best of the bunch. The corn tortillas were a little soft for my liking but had a good chew to them.  I'd probably give this a 3.5 but pricing makes this a 4.

Cash only!  The meat can be a hit or miss, it can be bomb as hell, or it can be a little tough. They are open for breakfast tacos, and the green sauce is good and spicy!  I usually park on the street, and grab drinks at the convenience store it is in front of.  See ya there!

TLDR: come for simple pure Mexican street tacos!  Barbacoa was especially top notch.  Beef was not stringy or chewy like some places tend to be.  Chicharrón is never for me, so will encourage newbies to stick with other options.

I think this place has the best street tacos hands down!! I brought 40 tacos to a party and they were gone so quick and everyone enjoyed them. I also like their sauces and the fresh toppings. The ladies who work there are super sweet and it seems like a family owned place. Don't forget to bring cash as they don't take any cards. But we were able to get cash at the mini grocery store right infront.

The skinny: Amazing authentic tacos The food: amazingly delicious and authentic tacos. The green salsa had an amazing kick as well. Went there and ordered one of everything to try. A favorite was the Lengua. Everything is no frills just as it should be. Tortilla, meat, cilantro, onions and salsa if you want. Do yourself a favor and swing by! Value/cost: $ Cheap tacos, authentic so on the smaller side. Cash only.  Ambiance: Unassuming food truck in a parking lot. No seating nearby so make sure you are aware of that. Don't let that stop you - the food here is amazing. Quick service.  Would I come back: Yes! Amazing tacos, drooling just thinking about it.

Not bad, we got 2 of each off the different types of meat and 1 lengua quesadilla it was only less than $25! So inexpensive! The quesadilla however was too salty to enjoy unfortunately. Really enjoyed the Al Pastor out of all of them. The chicharron was too jelly for me, needed to mix my fajita with it for texture. Had everything on corn tortilla which was perfect! Food trucks was easy to find but parking was a little random. Ended up parking in front of convenience store briefly.

Places like this do not exist in a vacuum. They share a symbiotic relationship with other stuff that's around, such as the Alabama Ice House across the street. And what beautiful symbiosis it is. Anyways, the barbacoa is particularly good so get stuff with barbacoa. Then take it across the street and get some beer.

We were so excited to try out this taco truck because of all the positive things we've heard from our friends. We have two trucks we frequent often and wanted to add this one to our rotation.
