The first thing I noticed was the new prices, most items have gone up about 50 cents up to $2 for the tortas. I did my research and was excited to see some reviews stating they have complimentary avocado, however, that was not the case when we went. I also saw their tacos were small so I ordered 6 just for myself which was a good idea because I ate them all. The new menu doesn't have pastor listed as a meat but I asked the worker and they did have it. The pastor was really good especially with the pineapple. Barbacoa and fajita were solid but not the best we've had. I would skip the chicken. The two sauces were good but watch out for the red sauce, a few drops goes a loooong way.  Overall, the tacos were good but not the best I've had. They also were a little pricey for their size. I would come again for the pastor but prob won't be stopping by too often.

We were so excited to try out this place because of their outstanding reviews and we love taco trucks, but some items were very disappointing. To start we tried their beef torta, the meat was ok so we mostly tasted the bread. I wouldn't suggest getting the torta here. We ordered chicken quesadilla, but they gave us beef so that was already disappointing. The beef quesadilla was ok too, the beef meat was a let down for both. The two tacos we got were the best things we ordered. We ordered the beef flour taco and a barbacoa corn taco. Both were delicious and the spicy green sauce was amazing! The tortillas for both were soft and yummy. I'd order strictly taco if we were ever to come back again.
Seriously the best. I try other places and the next day I'll be craving tierras. My fav is pastor tacos but the chicharron, barbacoa, fajita are good too.

The wife and I visited Tacos Tierra Caliente to review them as part of our "highest rated" YouTube series. They are the highest rated taco joint in Houston according to Yelp, so we had to check them out! I got two tacos de al pastor and one barbacoa, all on corn tortillas. The wife got two fajita and one chicken, all on flour. We asked for tomatoes, cilantro and avocado on all. Each time the lady repeated the order, she left off the avocado, and I added "and avocado." She'd simply nod and start over. The order came out quickly (within 5 minutes) and we were off to the car to film our "eating show." We discovered really quickly that something got lost between my placing the order, her writing the order, and her relaying the order to the cook. I got my 3 tacos but my wife ended up with 5, which included one al pastor and an extra chicken--both on corn tortillas. And none of them had avocado. The tacos were so delicious I won't even trip about the avocado, but will just add that if you don't have avocado, just say that!  :-) So yea, the tacos were delicious! The chicken was meh, but we've learned that authentic Mexican joints don't really do chicken tacos. I guess no one really orders them so they don't put much effort into seasoning them. But all the herbs, veggies and salsas made up for the lack of seasoning on the chicken itself. Great tacos!

I was visiting from Atlanta on a work trip with my co-worker.   We decided to go taco food truck hopping the first night we arrived.  This was the first spot we hit.  Little food truck tucked on the corner of a small shopping strip, right next to a popping bar (Alabama Icehouse or something). The menu looked a little slim, but my co-worker spoke fluent Spanish and asked if there was anything else not listed...YES, THEY HAVE MORE!   We got several tacos, the al pastor rocked my socks off.  These were street style tacos, smaller.  Ate them on the back of the trunk with a few glass cokes bought from the convenience store, they didn't have drinks at the truck unfortunately.   We were in Houston for three days and ate at every taco truck/bar we could find, this one was the absolutely BEST.  We managed to hit this spot a second time on our last night after being disappointed by a different place. I will be back next time I'm in H-town! Hands down, delicious!

This unassuming food truck has some of the most perfect tacos I've ever tasted.  I got a beef, chicken, and barbacoa. They swapped my flour and corn tortillas, but the tacos were so insanely delicious I didn't even care.  The meat in all was wonderfully flavorful and perfectly moist and tender (you can't tell by looking at them!), and the salsas just took it over the edge.  Every bite was decadent, and I can't wait to come back for more.

If you're looking for authentic tacos this is the spot. This is the place where you buy super cheap and delicious tacos (cash only) and eat them across the street at Alabama Ice house with some cold beers and some doggies. Perfect date night for you and your pet!  We got the chicken quesadilla, then tacos were beef, barbacoa, tropo, and al pastor in flour and corn tortilla. It comes with 2 different salsas that are also amazing. We are definitely coming back!

I've been coming here quite a few times and never noticed if they've overcharged me or not, but never missed any items til now. Make sure you double check your bag, I had a taco missing and make sure you calculate correctly before paying. I paid 3 dollars extra and missing tacos. Pissed I've read comments that they've been overcharging and items missing as well.  Wish I read ahead of time.

Cheap delicious tacos! Craved for some tacos after some drinking and I found this place right off of Alabama.  They take CASH ONLY, so we had to go to the convenient store to get the the ATM.  It was that serious. Grabbed me a fajita taco and it was phenomenal!  I think some of the meat pieces were crispy and topped that with cilantro onions along with that green and super spicy red sauce.  To die for! Definitely a place to get some quick authentic tacos.

My housemates and I decided to stop by for tacos, and it was all of our first times. We thought everything we got was super delicious, and the lady taking orders was sweet as well. I ordered tacos on corn with barbacoa, trompo (marinated pork), and chicken. The trompo was my favorite because of just how well seasoned the pork was, but the flavors of all of the tacos were phenomenal and really allowed you to savor the food. Moreover, although the tacos are small, the portion of meat that they give you is pretty big. I will definitely be coming back here often moving forward!  For your information, they always ask if you want cilantro and onions on your taco and provide free salsa (green and red). My housemates and I didn't know that the truck only takes cash, but there is an ATM in the convenience store nearby. However, there is a withdrawal fee, so that's something to keep in mind! The lot the truck is in is pretty small, so parking may be harder during a busier time of the day.

Wow a hidden gem! My bf took me here today and the tacos were so juicy and filling. I was really hungry and ate 5, but I could've only ate 3-4 to be content. I had the beef, barbacoa and chicken today. The beef was my favorite. I need to try the pastor next time! I would pass on the chicken because it wasn't seasoned and was just boiled and shredded. Give this place a try, and a grab a drink from the convenience store in the same center. They are cash only.

Sometimes you just want some street tacos without the fancy new-fangled fusion or fluff. Then come to the almost unassuming but pretty bomb street taco spot in H-Town. For $2-2.50, you can get a corn or flour taco about the size of your palm packed with juicy, flavorful meat and two sides of green and spicy red salsa. Around 2-3 will leave you satisfied, or get more because their prices won't leave your wallet hurting. I highly recommend the trompo (pork) and barbacoa. The flour taco is slightly bigger, and therefore costs $0.50 more. They only take cash. And while you're waiting, they have a small bowl of Mexican candy!

I went to this white and red food truck that permanently resides on W Alabama St & Shepherd called Tacos Tierra Caliente (no IG). Their tacos are authentic & tasty! You can pick from green or red sauces too but green is my favorite. I tried flour tortillas this time around just to switch it up but they do offer corn. They have very fast service so you won't have to wait long for your food. Also, THEY ARE CASH ONLY! One of my favorite hidden gems of Houston!
It was really authentic and very very tasty.I really recommend this restaurant to any people who enjoy tacos and like Mexican food!
Your "live" reviews sign is a lie, but the food is delicious. I love this place. The food is delicious authentic Mexican that makes me want to move back to HTX!

Provide useful, constructive feedback. Talk about a range of elements, including customer service. Be detailed, specific, and honest. Leave out links and personal information. Keep it civil and friendly.

Chilaquiles is one of my go to breakfast dishes, especially when it's crunchy from the chips and spicy due to the salsa  For $9 you get a hefty plate with their Famously delicious corn tortilla chips cooked in their special salsa with chorizo refried beans, fresh avocado, mayocrema, cotija cheese, onions, and cilantro.   Talk about a hint of lime with a punch! At La Calle not only do they have tasty chilaquiles and bomb fajita tacos, they have amazingly delicious margaritas!!!  Mondays they have a daily special for $4 each regular margarita so you can start your week with a buzz!

So the bathrooms in this place were completely DISGUSTING! Which made me a bit concerned on the cleanliness of the workers. My husband and I had the birra tacos and a pineapple soda (they didn't have any water). The birria dipping sauce was spicy and the tacos didn't have any toppings on it.  The tacos weren't bad but it wasn't the best tacos I've ever had. The pineapple soda was good though.  Also, every person in the restaurant was staring at us, which was a bit strange. Nevertheless, this wouldn't be a restaurant if immediately go to if in Houston again.

When I tell you these tacos knocked me off my feet I mean THEY KNOCKED ME OFF MY FEET. I have heard about these tacos many times from fellow food fans,but I wasn't ready for the amazing taste, energy, flavors, and beers I experienced.  I'm lucky and was able to walk here from my loft. While I waited in line (you know the food is great when you wait in line at 10:30pm on a Tuesday) I cracked a beer and was able to finish the whole thing while waiting/ordering and grabbed another ice cold one to enjoy with my food. We love the convenience. I made friends and danced with the couple waiting in line behind me. My new friends were kind enough to advise me on what to order. One of everything and two el pastor! They were correct!! Everything was fantastic. One taco was even garnished with a pork cracklin so crunchy and delish I almost lost my mind.  Don't forget to add on a cup of the sauce. It's extra and it's worth it. Duo it all babes.  Also the breakfast tacos are life changing. They feature a full bar with food service in the deceivingly large bar/lounge/dinning room.  I want to try more of their drinks and the people watching is top notch. Expect to see a full range of Houston foodies, Astros fans, rappers, lawyers, and groovy neighbors. They also open early and close super late.

Say it ain't so! No cans, nothing frozen, no microwave. I am sold. The line was busy flowing - customer service is on point. There are two sitting areas, TV's, tables for smaller parties and benches for larger groups. Fresh produce proudly displayed. The food got no photos this time because I was hungry! However one note I will add is ..say "mild" if you pallet is weak. Everything came out spicy and delicious but spicy. I wouldn't have it any other way but just a fair warning. Enjoy :)
Food over all was ok, like took to long, by the time you check out your food is very cold. The best thing they had was the corn  on a cob

Wow!! The tacos at this restaurant are packed with flavor! The meat is so tender and the tortillas are fresh. The corn is good but has a serious kick so if you can't handle spicy food, please avoid that dish.

This place was highly recommended. I was so disappointed with the service and the cleanliness of this place. The lady's taking your order is super rude and disrespectful. They have no business working here being that rude. This was my first time here and will never return because of her service. I don't think she understands how customer service should work. The food was ok, nothing special. I don't recommend this place at all. Safe Travels. Prost
1 free Suadero Taco or Pina Colada

When I first came in this place I thought it was going to be ok tacos. But it's actually was very good .friend of mine  had the tostadas  which were beautiful taste good look good I wish I would've had got a picture... I absolutely love the view very clean place and fast .. Definitely recommend it..

Visiting Houston for the weekend, we stopped by La Calle Tacos at 1:23 am. The line was to the door. My impression was these had to be great tacos. The wait to the counter to order your food was 1 hour. By the time we ordered it was after 2:20 am. They only served tacos at this time. So I ordered  the 5 tacos. Finally we sat down to eat and the tortillas fell apart so all the meat feel through. I think the meat needed seasoning. Honestly I didn't like this place at all. The line was long. There system in the kitchen isn't working out for them. Very unorganized and the food didn't have any flavor.

I've had Yelp for years- this is the first time I've written a review. The tacos: garbage. The service: disrespectful. Loose tacos in the paper bag? Ridiculous. Overpriced bs.  Extremely disappointed.

This is my 2nd time in 2 weeks visiting La Calle and my my my I do love it. I've gotten the street tacos (beef and chicken) both times and it's been great both times. Let me tell y'all about the pineapple margarita...my gosh all mighty!!! Food is on point, drinks are definitely it and the atmosphere is very laid back. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the parking but that's a small downfall if any. Overall...I love this spot!!!

Super friendly staff and surprisingly short line for the first time ever! We stopped in for #tacotuesday and happy we did! You can get 5 street tacos plus birra soup/sauce for 9.99. (There are other taco Tuesday deals too) There's a good-size salsa and topping bar where you can help yourself. Limes, fresh chopped onions, cilantro and 5+ salsa options.  Yep my mouth was on FIRE when I left, but it was legit worth it. I missed the tequila selection at first, but saw it later. They have a bunch of good options and TVs in the bar area with games on.  The vibe is fun and authentic, seems like the team enjoys being there - apparently you get free tacos if You work there!!
This place reminds me of Austin. It's cool. One side is food area and the other is bar with seating. It was very hard to hear and understand ladies taking orders also cooking. But tacos were great.

At a friend's suggestion, I checked it out. It's downtown so I'm guessing lunchtime pre-COVID has some parking challenges. Luckily, when I went there was plenty of street parking to grab a to-go order or even dine inside. I was also surprised to see it had so much seating on the other side of the ordering system.  Ordering was easy and pretty quick. I got an order of  5 Chilango Street Chicken Tacos. They're really small so 5 isn't too much. It's comes with a side of spicy Birria to dip. I'm guessing that's the reason my friend loved the place but since I don't eat beef or pork, I didn't try the Burria. Without it, the tacos were just okay. Not the worst taco I've had nor the best.

Taco Tuesday for my birthday  first thing first ! Make sure you pay the meter ! The parking meter authorities are fast ! The tacos are so delicious , not an ounce of it was dry The people who work there were sweet . Thank you

I've been here more than a dozen times and have never had a problem with service at the bar. ‍‍ SMH, I guess Austin was having a bad day yesterday. It won't stop me from coming back as I love the food and drinks, was just disappointed as we brought a new patron to your establishment and she was NOT impressed at all. Wish Santos was serving at the bar, he's great! Very friendly and outgoing!!! ‍‍‍

Very disappointed with our visit this past weekend. After, the half marathon we were looking forward to eating there. It's our go to in downtown. After the little drama between the cooks cause one didn't tell the other what I had ordered. We finally sat down and ate. The food was waaayyyy too spicy. The chorizo, esquites, and the birria were just too much. Definitely looks like plenty of new staff. Maybe these new ones use a different recipe, but it sure was different. Hope it gets fixed.
1 free Suadero Taco or Pina Colada

This is a great spot that you need to try!  When I'm anywhere near this place, I will go out of my way to go here for lunch. The tacos are some of the best and most unique in my opinion. The chicken and waffles taco is my favorite! It's a waffle shell! So good!  The atmosphere and ambiance is cool with indoor and outdoor seating. Food is delivered quickly so you can get in and out quick if you need to too.
Hey Jerry! Thanks for stopping by and leaving a stellar review! We can’t wait to see you again and serve you your favorite Chicken and Waffle again! See you soon!

If Street tacos and tacos from a fine-dining restaurant had a baby, it would be Velvet Taco. Nothing is compromised in making these tacos. They are extremely delicious and rich in flavor. My only gripe is the cost per taco. At around $5.00 each, you will undoubtedly wonder if the two biter was worth it.  I typically order the pork items as they are jam packed with flavor. The Cuban won't nearly taste like the sandwich itself but it is there. The cheese combined with the ham and pork leaves you begging for more. The green chile pork taco was no different. The creamy corn topping mixture is such a compliment to the pork. Definitely a must try when you happen to see a Velvet Taco in town.

Yes!!! So good! The margs are off the chain!!! Chicken n waffles tacos are the best! The barbacoa and fish n chips are great too!!! Cute spot with indoor and outdoor seating. Self serve sodas and no servers. Plenty of parking and seating. No wait when we were there.
Jordan, that’s awesome to hear! We are fired up that your visit was 5-star worthy ️ Thanks for coming in and we hope to serve you tacos and margaritas soon!

Street tacos with nice twists. My fav taco was the chicken and waffle taco. The taco shell was a waffle and then there was chicken, maple syrup, bacon and more! I also liked the elote. Great flavors and not too expensive!
Elizabeth, we’re thrilled that you shared this review about our tacos. We love hearing we earned 5 stars in your book! Thanks for visiting us and we hope to see you soon for more of your favorites

Velvet Taco serves up the best fusion tacos in Houston. Amazing food, open late, and great vibe.   They have a Weekly Taco Feature that keeps rotating to keep the menu interesting. My favorite item on their menu is not even a taco though - the spicy curry chicken queso is BOMB. Highly recommend, you have to try it if you're in the Washington area.
It is ok if you like overpriced gourmet tacos that don't really taste that interesting

One of my favorite taco places in the area! Love the variety of fun and unique flavors and everything I've tried has been excellent. The white queso is so good and the chips are fresh and crisp. I've tried the Flank Steak tacos, Shrimp & Grits, the new Mexicali Shrimp Taco and the Chicken & Waffles taco over several trips. All of them were delicious! My only warning is the waffle taco shell is a soft shell which is what you want but seemed counter intuitive since it's very similar to the look of ice cream waffle cones - but still very good.

Most of the menu is filled with items and toppings I wouldn't normally order, but I didn't let that stop me from trying most of them (with no substitutions).  Used a Delivery service every time, but EVERY TIME, the order was CORRECT. Which deserves 5 with that accomplishment alone!
Hey Sharla! We appreciate the shout out and the   ❤️!! We can’t wait to serve you some delicious, globally inspired tacos again.

Velvet is always a good taco but I feel it is a little overpriced. I love the constant changing of tacos and the way you can be in the mood for Asian and get a fried rice taco or for Indian and get a tikki masala taco. Definitely a fan favorite with my friend group!

Delicious and tasty tacos. We were glad to see 4 different vegetarian taco options on the menu (more options than Torchy's), that had fusion ingredients such as tofu, paneer, falafel and the beer battered cauliflower. We ordered the paneer, falafel and cauliflower tacos and devoured each one!! The falafel one is in a lettuce wrap, but you can sub it for a flour tortilla. Service is fast. A lot of people were coming in for pickup.  The location can be revamped as it does look outdated/slightly ghetto.  The place gets crowded, so I recommend coming in a bit earlier to beat the crowd and get parking. There wasn't much social distancing being enforced.

I love all the taco options they have here! Was staying at a nearby hotel during the snow storm and this located saved the day. After being stuck with limited food in the area, I found that they were open. I ordered enough tacos to last a day so I've tried a lot of them. I like them all esp- the tofu one, salmon, and tikka chicken. Still not sick of tacos yet.
Jessica, thank you so much for your awesome review! I'm glad we could save the day during the winter storm! Hope to see you back soon for more tacos!

TLDR: Be drunk, or desperate... otherwise I wouldn't wanna taco bout it.  Visit: Weekday (Fri. @ 1 a.m. Should I have expected more... apparently not.) Order:  Chicken Parmesan- 4.2/10 If this had been served fresh... mayyyybe in the 7.8/10 range... but it wasn't even warm.  Falafel: 4.4/10 akin to a strange mushy fried patty. It's was served in a lettuce wrap and was the only one of the three that was remotely warm.  Beer Battered Cauliflower: 4.2/10 the flavors actually made sense and would have been quite enjoyable had anything been fresh.  Sigh... I've been to this location many a time thrashed from a night of bar hopping... even then, it was hit or miss. However, tonight I made the mistake of stopping by un-inebriated and got a full experience of why I'll never consciously eat here again. It was a lackluster Friday night, with approximately 1/4 the restaurant's capacity. Waited an appropriate 8-10 minutes for my order... only to bite into tacos that were clearly not prepared to order... the "special" of the day was the chicken parmesan taco. Elementary school cold chicken tenders accompanied with an assortment of other items that couldn't save it. The beer battered cauliflower had a good flavor profile... but was also lukewarm at best. Finally, the falafel was barely warm, mushy, and just a sad bite surrounded by more cold items. I couldn't bring myself to finish anything because truth be told it's not worth the calories. I ended up dropping it off to the delivering employee, stated my complaint, and left. Personally, it wasn't worth the interaction with a manager.
I like coming here, as it's a guilty pleasure due to work, but I am so happy I did. I absolutely enjoyed their Vegetarian Tacos.
The food is really good (I'm defined addicted to the sauce lol). Only this is that I wish that the tacos were more hotter (temperature wise).   Good fast food  Buffalo Chicken Rotisserie Chicken
Dig this place a lot. It's near my place, so I frequent it. The tacos are very unique and non-traditional, which I dig. I like regular street tacos as well, but this place is a bit of a twist.

Wow, I can't believe I didn't try this place sooner! My experience at Velvet Taco was a 10/10. First of all, there are so many unique tacos on the menu that it was very hard to decide what to order. My friend and I both went with the spicy tikka chicken and shrimp & grits. I was so excited to taste a chicken tikka masala and taco hybrid, and it did not disappoint. This taco was delicious with the perfect amount of flavorful sauce! I was surprised by how much I enjoyed the shrimp & grits taco as well. There was a good amount of cheese in this one which really added to the flavor. I can't wait to come back and try more tacos! The chicken & waffles and Korean pork are at the top of my list for next time.
The barbecue nachos are my favorite & the elote ! Husband always gets the tacos - different kind all the time.
Great tacos spicy queso wide variety of options.They are pretty quick and very friendly tacos are just a tad expensive
Hey John! Thanks for the shout out! We can’t wait to serve your favorite tacos again!

For years I've been claiming that Velvet taco is overpriced and not that good- but I decided to come back after a friend suggested to. Still overpriced but very good, better than I remember. We got the spicy tikka, Cuban pig and shrimp and grits. All were good but the spicy tikka was the best. But so overpriced which is why it is a four stars.... I mean the shrimp and grits tacos is $5.75- like are you kidding me? This is Houston for goodness sake haha anyways here is my review- in summary, great tacos, really unique but pricey!

Very solid tacos! A bit pricey but worth the try! Got the spicy tikka chicken and the slow-roasted angus brisket! Both were good! The spicy tikka chicken wasn't too spicy and had a nice aroma. My favorite was the slow-roasted angus brisket! Omg the textures of this taco was brilliant. The soft taco had a glaze of cheese on the outer shell which gave it a nice crunch. The brisket was tender and juicy! The toppings balanced everything out. That taco was just wonderful!

TLDR: Come here for relatively solid Texan tacos with good flavor (not Mexican street tacos or anything particularly mind blowing). The green chile queso is tasty and worth a try!  Did a "taco crawl" with friends and Torchy's was our first stop. Their meats are well seasoned, queso isn't gooey but still delicious and packed with flavor, and the salsas were well made! I was expecting less, but turns out Torchy's is a great solid option, and the patio is a nice bonus - easy and chill. The flavors aren't aren't as wild/fun as Velvet, and not as authentic as Tacos Tierra Caliente, but I would be happy to come again.
Thank you so much Benji for your great review, it really made our day! We always strive to please our guests, and sincerely appreciate it when you choose to dine with us at Torchy's!

This torchys is the absolute worst at to go orders. They batch their orders so instead of bringing orders out as they're ready they wait until they have 10-20 orders ready and then bring them out. It causes you to wait at least an extra 20-30 min from your pick up time. Terrible process! Also causes your delivery orders to take way longer than expected

Hi Angela - Thank you for your review.  We've setup  torchysfeedback.com  where you can quickly share any issues that you've had at one of our restaurants. Our management team would love the opportunity to contact you directly and personally make it right.

My sister's husband loves this place so we had to make a stop here while in Houston for him. Not like your typical mexican street taco or your average fast food mexican spot like taco bell or del taco. They do serve mexican style dishes which were good but nothing mouth watering. You would order your dish and they would give you a number and you would grab a table. A waiter will bring out your food to your table for you. I had ordered the green chile queso dip and the crossroads taco. Their taco isn't like the small street tacos. Rather like a medium sized tortilla shell that could definitely use some extra toasting. Large slices of avocado and your typical barbacoa. Certain taco order will come with it's own salsa but my significant other and I asked for their avocado salsa which I would highly recommend. Reminded me of the el pollo loco cilantro avocado sauce but with a spicy kick. Their green chile queso dip was delicious. Spicy, cheesy and packed with flavors. Some of their chips were stale which was weird. Like they reused old chips and mixed it in with new chips hoping customers won't notice. I love that they served alcohol here. Their slush was strong. My significant other got the peach margarita which was good. I'm not a tequila fan so I didn't like it so much but kinda reminded me of fat tuesdays in vegas rather less diabetes from the excess sugar. I opted just for a regular mimosa and my sister got the pineapple mimosa which i would highly recommend. You can tell their juice to champagne ratio is not stingy at all.

Hi Kimmie - Sounds like we have some work to do.  We thank you for your feedback as it will help us become better at what we do.  We hope that you'll give us another chance, and return for another visit soon!

Never been to Torchys but came highly recommended by numerous people. Of the four total tacos, two were the Trailer Park (make it trashy aka covered in queso), a Democrat, and Pork with green chili's.  The Democrat wasn't as delightful as the others - but it's hard to live up to fried chicken smothered in queso so it may have been a bit of an unfair advantage.  Would recommend and definitely go again!
Thank you so much J.L. for your recommendation! We really appreciate it and always strive to provide a Damn Good experience! Hope to serve you again soon!

I've been to this location several times in the past year so i finally decided to review it. Let me start by making it clear that these are some bomb a** tacos. The crossroads is my absolutely favorite; the beef brisket is insane and has little crispy bits in it. Baja shrimp is another great choice, relatively lighter than some of the others. The fried avocado is another must try even if you are not a vegetarian. They get a good crunch on the avocado and it is surprisingly filling for a veggie option. Their breakfast tacos are solid, migas is really good and has crunchy chips mixed in. Whatever you get make sure to try the diablo sauce. It's bright orange and has a ton of flavor for a pretty spicy sauce.  So why 3 stars and ive raved about the food? They are a little on the pricier side compared to some other taco places. The servers are super nice but service can be veryyyyy slowww. This is not a great go to when you are in a rush or starving.

Torchy's is good. Real good. My favorite taco of all time is the Jack of Clubs (secret menu item for breakfast), it is vegetarian and consists of eggs with potato, tortilla strips, avocado, sour cream... delicious! If you've never been, 2 tacos is a good amount for a normal meal, 3 if you have a big appetite! The Baja shrimp is an excellent choice for lunch!
Thank you so much Carolina for your great review, it really made our day! We always strive to please our guests, and sincerely appreciate it when you choose to dine with us at Torchy's!

Didn't understand the hype until I tried these! Having been used to San Diego's selection of tacos, I honestly didn't know what to expect (size and price wise). I had the trailer park and Baja shrimp tacos, and they did not disappoint!!

After seeing the mix reviews, I didn't have very high expectations. Even with regular expectations,  this was delicious!  For my visit, I ordered the Baja shrimp and Brush fire. Both were excellent and complimented their respected salsas really well. Normally, I don't really like anything breaded in my taco but it was fine by me to have breaded shrimp. The chicken in the Brushfire was seasoned really well. I ordered a side of the rice and it was not basic indeed. The rice had bits of corn and cilantro which accentuated the flavors of the Mexican rice.  Adding in a frozen margarita, this definitely satisfied the cravings for a California girl.

i will say, i usually am only really into the street style tacos but these tacos here were pretty good! i was especially loving the guacamole and chips. the guac was super fresh, had a nice zest and was served as great hefty portion in a nice sized bowl. i forgot to take a picture of the shrimp taco but that one was my favorite. light, not too many toppings and easier to eat. both the chicken tacos were good too, the fried chicken taco was paired better with the toppings in my opinion but they were all good and surpassed my expectations. torchys, i will be back :)
Hi Amira - Thanks for sharing! Our team will appreciate the kind words and we hope to serve you some Damn Good tacos again soon!

The third Torchy's run this new year and really happy to see them taking social distancing and masks seriously.  Got to love that Queso with Barbacoa added to go with the chips. I can almost have that as a meal.  I'd love them to have a drive through at this location, but this is a pretty good next best thing.  The downside here is that they really need a bigger parking lot. If some dummy parks their supercab truck in the back half of the parking lot, it's almost impossible to get by it.  If you want to get torchy's tacos inside the loop, this is a good location.

The most mediocre taco ever! Look everybody, we live in Houston, Texas. You can't drive one block without finding a place that sells tacos, so the competition is pretty fierce here. You either have to have great tacos or just go home. My husband and I hadn't visited Torchy's in a while so we thought we would to by the one Shepard. We ordered two tacos and two quesadillas to go. Simple right?!!?!?! Wrong! After a 40 minute wait, we reached into our bag to find the most mediocre taco we have ever seen in our life. Small, cold and tasteless. Look at this picture!!! Is that worth $4.95!?!?! We will be going to the many other places in Houston that serve much better tacos!!!!

I was recently in Houston and my mouth was watering for Torchys since I originally got some in Austin. I originally planned on ordering on DoorDash but due to covid 19 there was a limited menu which didn't include my personal favorite taco. So, we decided to brave the outside world and go to Torchys. At first we saw someone taking orders outside with the same limited menu. I was disappointed but I decided to make the best of it. 10 minutes later we had just been standing there while everyone walked past us without even acknowledging our presence....when we realized we could possibly go inside. Normally after being treated that way I would just leave an establishment and never come back but I just really wanted my brushfire tacos. They took the tipsy chick tacos off of the menu which was very disappointing.  I ordered my brushfire tacos and went to fix my drink. I love their prickly pear drink so I was excited to get some. However, when I pressed for it to come out only water was coming out with a slight pink shade so I had to settle for something else.  The hillbilly queso and brushfire tacos were great as per usual but the service at this location made me decide not to use this one anymore :(

This location doesn't have a bar inside compared to the location I visited hear the Heights! Tacos were bomb and quite possibly better than their sister location. Customer service was top notch as well !!

Solid food. Always good and they almost always get the order perfectly correct, which is more than I can say for most taco places. For whatever reason this location seems to run on the slow side which is the main reason for not getting 5 stars.
Hi Jordan, we'll turn those 4 stars into 5 when you visit next! Come back again soon!

Got the green chili queso and chips, Wrangler breakfast tacos and the trailer park taco!!! All three of these literally SMACK!!!  The queso definitely has a kick to it! A bit spicy but definitely worth it!!! The trailer park taco is classic taco, very juicy, delicious, the chicken is cooked to perfection and the sauce definitely adds the last kick.

They don't have many vegetarian friendly options but the fried avocado taco is delicious! We also got the queso and margaritas (both were great!). The service was a bit slow but overall great experience!
Hi Caitlin - Thank you for taking the time out of your day to leave us a review! We really appreciate it!

Add 15 minutes to whatever wait time it says when you order online. If it's busy, probably add more. If you order more food than a single taco and queso, probably add more. Honestly, I wouldn't even bother ordering online.

Hi Ana - Thank you for your review.  We've setup  torchysfeedback.com  where you can quickly share any issues that you've had at one of our restaurants. Our management team would love the opportunity to contact you directly and personally make it right.

Very good tacos.  The beef brisket tacos are so great.  they also have baja shrimp tacos that are truly awesome. REALLY good queso and chips (and it's very filling!) Friendly service.  Clean restaurant.  Don't hesitate to check out Torchy's!!

DO NOT DO CURBSIDE!! I have ordered twice and it has taken over 30 minutes! The first time it was done and they wouldn't bring it out, so I went in to get it. Cold AF tacos. Second time over 30 minutes and it was 11am , not even that busy.
Hi Jennifer - Would you like to tell us more about your recent experience, so we can follow up with you directly? Please let us know how best to reach you by going to  torchysfeedback.com
Great flavor in every taco- I don't think you can go wrong with any of the options, it just depends the type of mood you're in. The portion sizes aren't too big either. Quality over quantity!
Hi Rachael - Thanks for sharing the taco love! We always strive to please our guests, and we cannot begin to express our sincere gratitude for choosing Torchy’s!

Update: Went to Tacos Tierra Caliente again. And wanted to include my thoughts on my more recent experience. This time, we ordered the Beef, Chicken, Trompo, Chicharron and the Veggie tacos. (We would have ordered Barbacoa, but they were out!)  By far, the best tacos were the (1) Beef and (2) Chicken (and based on my previous experience Barbacoa as well). Next time, I will be sticking with those. The green salsa is awesome, and next time I will ask for extra!  P.S. The prices are now $2.00 for Corn, $2.50 for Flour tortillas.

Every Houstonian should come here to try the tacos! The food is made very very quickly and comes warm and fresh! $1.50 for Corn Tacos and $2.00 for Flour Tacos They have a good variety of proteins: barbacoa, fajita, pastor, lengua, chicharon, pollo. My favorite are barbacoa and pastor! Get those! Green Salsa is SPICY and very good. Ordering 5 tacos is a dinner-sized portion. 2 tacos is a light snack. Great location, right on West Alabama next to the West Alabama Ice House.

Tacos were very cheap and decent. You may need to speak up and repeat yourself because our orders were a little messed up. I ordered the Trompo, Barbacoa, Chicken, and Beef, and didn't get the beef.  Trompo was very meh, a little dry honestly. Chicken was good, more moist. Barbacoa was very moist, the best of the bunch. The corn tortillas were a little soft for my liking but had a good chew to them.  I'd probably give this a 3.5 but pricing makes this a 4.

Cash only!  The meat can be a hit or miss, it can be bomb as hell, or it can be a little tough. They are open for breakfast tacos, and the green sauce is good and spicy!  I usually park on the street, and grab drinks at the convenience store it is in front of.  See ya there!

TLDR: come for simple pure Mexican street tacos!  Barbacoa was especially top notch.  Beef was not stringy or chewy like some places tend to be.  Chicharrón is never for me, so will encourage newbies to stick with other options.

I think this place has the best street tacos hands down!! I brought 40 tacos to a party and they were gone so quick and everyone enjoyed them. I also like their sauces and the fresh toppings. The ladies who work there are super sweet and it seems like a family owned place. Don't forget to bring cash as they don't take any cards. But we were able to get cash at the mini grocery store right infront.

The skinny: Amazing authentic tacos The food: amazingly delicious and authentic tacos. The green salsa had an amazing kick as well. Went there and ordered one of everything to try. A favorite was the Lengua. Everything is no frills just as it should be. Tortilla, meat, cilantro, onions and salsa if you want. Do yourself a favor and swing by! Value/cost: $ Cheap tacos, authentic so on the smaller side. Cash only.  Ambiance: Unassuming food truck in a parking lot. No seating nearby so make sure you are aware of that. Don't let that stop you - the food here is amazing. Quick service.  Would I come back: Yes! Amazing tacos, drooling just thinking about it.

Not bad, we got 2 of each off the different types of meat and 1 lengua quesadilla it was only less than $25! So inexpensive! The quesadilla however was too salty to enjoy unfortunately. Really enjoyed the Al Pastor out of all of them. The chicharron was too jelly for me, needed to mix my fajita with it for texture. Had everything on corn tortilla which was perfect! Food trucks was easy to find but parking was a little random. Ended up parking in front of convenience store briefly.

Places like this do not exist in a vacuum. They share a symbiotic relationship with other stuff that's around, such as the Alabama Ice House across the street. And what beautiful symbiosis it is. Anyways, the barbacoa is particularly good so get stuff with barbacoa. Then take it across the street and get some beer.

We were so excited to try out this taco truck because of all the positive things we've heard from our friends. We have two trucks we frequent often and wanted to add this one to our rotation.  The first thing I noticed was the new prices, most items have gone up about 50 cents up to $2 for the tortas. I did my research and was excited to see some reviews stating they have complimentary avocado, however, that was not the case when we went. I also saw their tacos were small so I ordered 6 just for myself which was a good idea because I ate them all. The new menu doesn't have pastor listed as a meat but I asked the worker and they did have it. The pastor was really good especially with the pineapple. Barbacoa and fajita were solid but not the best we've had. I would skip the chicken. The two sauces were good but watch out for the red sauce, a few drops goes a loooong way.  Overall, the tacos were good but not the best I've had. They also were a little pricey for their size. I would come again for the pastor but prob won't be stopping by too often.

We were so excited to try out this place because of their outstanding reviews and we love taco trucks, but some items were very disappointing. To start we tried their beef torta, the meat was ok so we mostly tasted the bread. I wouldn't suggest getting the torta here. We ordered chicken quesadilla, but they gave us beef so that was already disappointing. The beef quesadilla was ok too, the beef meat was a let down for both. The two tacos we got were the best things we ordered. We ordered the beef flour taco and a barbacoa corn taco. Both were delicious and the spicy green sauce was amazing! The tortillas for both were soft and yummy. I'd order strictly taco if we were ever to come back again.
Seriously the best. I try other places and the next day I'll be craving tierras. My fav is pastor tacos but the chicharron, barbacoa, fajita are good too.

The wife and I visited Tacos Tierra Caliente to review them as part of our "highest rated" YouTube series. They are the highest rated taco joint in Houston according to Yelp, so we had to check them out! I got two tacos de al pastor and one barbacoa, all on corn tortillas. The wife got two fajita and one chicken, all on flour. We asked for tomatoes, cilantro and avocado on all. Each time the lady repeated the order, she left off the avocado, and I added "and avocado." She'd simply nod and start over. The order came out quickly (within 5 minutes) and we were off to the car to film our "eating show." We discovered really quickly that something got lost between my placing the order, her writing the order, and her relaying the order to the cook. I got my 3 tacos but my wife ended up with 5, which included one al pastor and an extra chicken--both on corn tortillas. And none of them had avocado. The tacos were so delicious I won't even trip about the avocado, but will just add that if you don't have avocado, just say that!  :-) So yea, the tacos were delicious! The chicken was meh, but we've learned that authentic Mexican joints don't really do chicken tacos. I guess no one really orders them so they don't put much effort into seasoning them. But all the herbs, veggies and salsas made up for the lack of seasoning on the chicken itself. Great tacos!

I was visiting from Atlanta on a work trip with my co-worker.   We decided to go taco food truck hopping the first night we arrived.  This was the first spot we hit.  Little food truck tucked on the corner of a small shopping strip, right next to a popping bar (Alabama Icehouse or something). The menu looked a little slim, but my co-worker spoke fluent Spanish and asked if there was anything else not listed...YES, THEY HAVE MORE!   We got several tacos, the al pastor rocked my socks off.  These were street style tacos, smaller.  Ate them on the back of the trunk with a few glass cokes bought from the convenience store, they didn't have drinks at the truck unfortunately.   We were in Houston for three days and ate at every taco truck/bar we could find, this one was the absolutely BEST.  We managed to hit this spot a second time on our last night after being disappointed by a different place. I will be back next time I'm in H-town! Hands down, delicious!

This unassuming food truck has some of the most perfect tacos I've ever tasted.  I got a beef, chicken, and barbacoa. They swapped my flour and corn tortillas, but the tacos were so insanely delicious I didn't even care.  The meat in all was wonderfully flavorful and perfectly moist and tender (you can't tell by looking at them!), and the salsas just took it over the edge.  Every bite was decadent, and I can't wait to come back for more.

If you're looking for authentic tacos this is the spot. This is the place where you buy super cheap and delicious tacos (cash only) and eat them across the street at Alabama Ice house with some cold beers and some doggies. Perfect date night for you and your pet!  We got the chicken quesadilla, then tacos were beef, barbacoa, tropo, and al pastor in flour and corn tortilla. It comes with 2 different salsas that are also amazing. We are definitely coming back!

I've been coming here quite a few times and never noticed if they've overcharged me or not, but never missed any items til now. Make sure you double check your bag, I had a taco missing and make sure you calculate correctly before paying. I paid 3 dollars extra and missing tacos. Pissed I've read comments that they've been overcharging and items missing as well.  Wish I read ahead of time.

Cheap delicious tacos! Craved for some tacos after some drinking and I found this place right off of Alabama.  They take CASH ONLY, so we had to go to the convenient store to get the the ATM.  It was that serious. Grabbed me a fajita taco and it was phenomenal!  I think some of the meat pieces were crispy and topped that with cilantro onions along with that green and super spicy red sauce.  To die for! Definitely a place to get some quick authentic tacos.

My housemates and I decided to stop by for tacos, and it was all of our first times. We thought everything we got was super delicious, and the lady taking orders was sweet as well. I ordered tacos on corn with barbacoa, trompo (marinated pork), and chicken. The trompo was my favorite because of just how well seasoned the pork was, but the flavors of all of the tacos were phenomenal and really allowed you to savor the food. Moreover, although the tacos are small, the portion of meat that they give you is pretty big. I will definitely be coming back here often moving forward!  For your information, they always ask if you want cilantro and onions on your taco and provide free salsa (green and red). My housemates and I didn't know that the truck only takes cash, but there is an ATM in the convenience store nearby. However, there is a withdrawal fee, so that's something to keep in mind! The lot the truck is in is pretty small, so parking may be harder during a busier time of the day.

Wow a hidden gem! My bf took me here today and the tacos were so juicy and filling. I was really hungry and ate 5, but I could've only ate 3-4 to be content. I had the beef, barbacoa and chicken today. The beef was my favorite. I need to try the pastor next time! I would pass on the chicken because it wasn't seasoned and was just boiled and shredded. Give this place a try, and a grab a drink from the convenience store in the same center. They are cash only.

Sometimes you just want some street tacos without the fancy new-fangled fusion or fluff. Then come to the almost unassuming but pretty bomb street taco spot in H-Town. For $2-2.50, you can get a corn or flour taco about the size of your palm packed with juicy, flavorful meat and two sides of green and spicy red salsa. Around 2-3 will leave you satisfied, or get more because their prices won't leave your wallet hurting. I highly recommend the trompo (pork) and barbacoa. The flour taco is slightly bigger, and therefore costs $0.50 more. They only take cash. And while you're waiting, they have a small bowl of Mexican candy!

I went to this white and red food truck that permanently resides on W Alabama St & Shepherd called Tacos Tierra Caliente (no IG). Their tacos are authentic & tasty! You can pick from green or red sauces too but green is my favorite. I tried flour tortillas this time around just to switch it up but they do offer corn. They have very fast service so you won't have to wait long for your food. Also, THEY ARE CASH ONLY! One of my favorite hidden gems of Houston!
It was really authentic and very very tasty.I really recommend this restaurant to any people who enjoy tacos and like Mexican food!
Your "live" reviews sign is a lie, but the food is delicious. I love this place. The food is delicious authentic Mexican that makes me want to move back to HTX!

Provide useful, constructive feedback. Talk about a range of elements, including customer service. Be detailed, specific, and honest. Leave out links and personal information. Keep it civil and friendly.

Chilaquiles is one of my go to breakfast dishes, especially when it's crunchy from the chips and spicy due to the salsa  For $9 you get a hefty plate with their Famously delicious corn tortilla chips cooked in their special salsa with chorizo refried beans, fresh avocado, mayocrema, cotija cheese, onions, and cilantro.   Talk about a hint of lime with a punch! At La Calle not only do they have tasty chilaquiles and bomb fajita tacos, they have amazingly delicious margaritas!!!  Mondays they have a daily special for $4 each regular margarita so you can start your week with a buzz!

So the bathrooms in this place were completely DISGUSTING! Which made me a bit concerned on the cleanliness of the workers. My husband and I had the birra tacos and a pineapple soda (they didn't have any water). The birria dipping sauce was spicy and the tacos didn't have any toppings on it.  The tacos weren't bad but it wasn't the best tacos I've ever had. The pineapple soda was good though.  Also, every person in the restaurant was staring at us, which was a bit strange. Nevertheless, this wouldn't be a restaurant if immediately go to if in Houston again.

When I tell you these tacos knocked me off my feet I mean THEY KNOCKED ME OFF MY FEET. I have heard about these tacos many times from fellow food fans,but I wasn't ready for the amazing taste, energy, flavors, and beers I experienced.  I'm lucky and was able to walk here from my loft. While I waited in line (you know the food is great when you wait in line at 10:30pm on a Tuesday) I cracked a beer and was able to finish the whole thing while waiting/ordering and grabbed another ice cold one to enjoy with my food. We love the convenience. I made friends and danced with the couple waiting in line behind me. My new friends were kind enough to advise me on what to order. One of everything and two el pastor! They were correct!! Everything was fantastic. One taco was even garnished with a pork cracklin so crunchy and delish I almost lost my mind.  Don't forget to add on a cup of the sauce. It's extra and it's worth it. Duo it all babes.  Also the breakfast tacos are life changing. They feature a full bar with food service in the deceivingly large bar/lounge/dinning room.  I want to try more of their drinks and the people watching is top notch. Expect to see a full range of Houston foodies, Astros fans, rappers, lawyers, and groovy neighbors. They also open early and close super late.

Say it ain't so! No cans, nothing frozen, no microwave. I am sold. The line was busy flowing - customer service is on point. There are two sitting areas, TV's, tables for smaller parties and benches for larger groups. Fresh produce proudly displayed. The food got no photos this time because I was hungry! However one note I will add is ..say "mild" if you pallet is weak. Everything came out spicy and delicious but spicy. I wouldn't have it any other way but just a fair warning. Enjoy :)
Food over all was ok, like took to long, by the time you check out your food is very cold. The best thing they had was the corn  on a cob

Wow!! The tacos at this restaurant are packed with flavor! The meat is so tender and the tortillas are fresh. The corn is good but has a serious kick so if you can't handle spicy food, please avoid that dish.

This place was highly recommended. I was so disappointed with the service and the cleanliness of this place. The lady's taking your order is super rude and disrespectful. They have no business working here being that rude. This was my first time here and will never return because of her service. I don't think she understands how customer service should work. The food was ok, nothing special. I don't recommend this place at all. Safe Travels. Prost
1 free Suadero Taco or Pina Colada

When I first came in this place I thought it was going to be ok tacos. But it's actually was very good .friend of mine  had the tostadas  which were beautiful taste good look good I wish I would've had got a picture... I absolutely love the view very clean place and fast .. Definitely recommend it..

Visiting Houston for the weekend, we stopped by La Calle Tacos at 1:23 am. The line was to the door. My impression was these had to be great tacos. The wait to the counter to order your food was 1 hour. By the time we ordered it was after 2:20 am. They only served tacos at this time. So I ordered  the 5 tacos. Finally we sat down to eat and the tortillas fell apart so all the meat feel through. I think the meat needed seasoning. Honestly I didn't like this place at all. The line was long. There system in the kitchen isn't working out for them. Very unorganized and the food didn't have any flavor.

I've had Yelp for years- this is the first time I've written a review. The tacos: garbage. The service: disrespectful. Loose tacos in the paper bag? Ridiculous. Overpriced bs.  Extremely disappointed.

This is my 2nd time in 2 weeks visiting La Calle and my my my I do love it. I've gotten the street tacos (beef and chicken) both times and it's been great both times. Let me tell y'all about the pineapple margarita...my gosh all mighty!!! Food is on point, drinks are definitely it and the atmosphere is very laid back. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the parking but that's a small downfall if any. Overall...I love this spot!!!

Super friendly staff and surprisingly short line for the first time ever! We stopped in for #tacotuesday and happy we did! You can get 5 street tacos plus birra soup/sauce for 9.99. (There are other taco Tuesday deals too) There's a good-size salsa and topping bar where you can help yourself. Limes, fresh chopped onions, cilantro and 5+ salsa options.  Yep my mouth was on FIRE when I left, but it was legit worth it. I missed the tequila selection at first, but saw it later. They have a bunch of good options and TVs in the bar area with games on.  The vibe is fun and authentic, seems like the team enjoys being there - apparently you get free tacos if You work there!!
This place reminds me of Austin. It's cool. One side is food area and the other is bar with seating. It was very hard to hear and understand ladies taking orders also cooking. But tacos were great.

At a friend's suggestion, I checked it out. It's downtown so I'm guessing lunchtime pre-COVID has some parking challenges. Luckily, when I went there was plenty of street parking to grab a to-go order or even dine inside. I was also surprised to see it had so much seating on the other side of the ordering system.  Ordering was easy and pretty quick. I got an order of  5 Chilango Street Chicken Tacos. They're really small so 5 isn't too much. It's comes with a side of spicy Birria to dip. I'm guessing that's the reason my friend loved the place but since I don't eat beef or pork, I didn't try the Burria. Without it, the tacos were just okay. Not the worst taco I've had nor the best.

Taco Tuesday for my birthday  first thing first ! Make sure you pay the meter ! The parking meter authorities are fast ! The tacos are so delicious , not an ounce of it was dry The people who work there were sweet . Thank you

I've been here more than a dozen times and have never had a problem with service at the bar. ‍‍ SMH, I guess Austin was having a bad day yesterday. It won't stop me from coming back as I love the food and drinks, was just disappointed as we brought a new patron to your establishment and she was NOT impressed at all. Wish Santos was serving at the bar, he's great! Very friendly and outgoing!!! ‍‍‍

Very disappointed with our visit this past weekend. After, the half marathon we were looking forward to eating there. It's our go to in downtown. After the little drama between the cooks cause one didn't tell the other what I had ordered. We finally sat down and ate. The food was waaayyyy too spicy. The chorizo, esquites, and the birria were just too much. Definitely looks like plenty of new staff. Maybe these new ones use a different recipe, but it sure was different. Hope it gets fixed.
1 free Suadero Taco or Pina Colada
Start your review of  Liberty Taco .

Wow!!! I was really impressed by the Baja Fish Taco and the I am somewhat of a Taco addict so when ever I pass a Taco joint I have to try it.  And I must say these tacos are legit. I was going to take a picture of my Tacos but once they were placed in front of me I completely forgot. Liberty Taco will definitely be one of my common stomping grounds.  Chill Vibe and Great Service!!!! Did I mention they also are BYOB... #Clutch

So I ordered breakfast tacos after a night of....partying way too hard for Sunday funday, and needing something to revive me before I caught my plane. And also...breakfast tacos? Rare in California! So why not?  After receiving my delivery, I dug in!  The jalapeño sausage, egg and cheese taco was ok. The sausage was a little chewy for me and there was no pronounced jalapeño flavor, just some smokiness.  The brisket, egg and cheese taco left a lot to be desired. The brisket seemed like it was one of those prepackaged and pre sliced ones you hear and serve to make sandwiches with....definitely wouldn't order it again. My absolute FAVORITE was the potato, bean, and cheese taco!! It was DELICIOUS! The beans were nice and creamy, the potatoes were cooked well, and there was a perfect amount of everything! I seriously kicked myself for only ordering one. The tortillas were good as well! Nice chew! Either they're made in house or they get bought from a really good vendor!  All in all, this California girl was happy. The bean, potato, and cheese taco is where it's at!! Also...the salsas were just ok. The creamy chipotle? Way too hot for me.  They also forgot to deliver my drink, but it's ok. Whenever im in Houston again, I will definitely order to go again or sit down and eat in the restaurant.

I went here because I was craving some tacos.  You basically just order, take a number, and they bring the food to you.  I got the tequila shrimp tacos with chips and queso. Everything was really good and the service was super nice. Would definitely go back.

Breakfast tacos!!!  Got 4 breakfast tacos for $10, I mean I think that's decent since 2 tacos will fill you up! The tacos are filled! Brisket taco, chorizo, potato bean egg, potato, egg and cheese. You name it!  The tomatillo sauce is seedy not creamy**  Mild, medium, hot are available for sauces  Corn tortillas available! Order over phone and no Apple Pay in store

I had an assortment of tacos... wayyy too many tacos. Lol I had the 10 Chicken Tinga, 12 Thai Basil, 14 Honey Chipotle Rib, 15 Citrus Pork, 8 Tequila Shrimp, Kogi Taco, and the Caribbean Chicken quesadilla. The Thai Basil, Tequila Shrimp and quesadilla were standouts that I liked the most while the Honey Chipotle Rig was just ok bc the flavor wasn't bold enough.

One of the great taco pleases ever I have been. Employees are so nice and quick. I work at Galleria Mall and get my breakfast taco almost 3 times in a week. Potato egg and cheese and brisket egg and cheese are favorite. I would recommend Thai basil and liberty chicken if you are into chicken, also you should definitely try liberty steak and kogi. Foods are delicious and great ambiance. Never hesitate to go there.
Brisket egg taco is very good, good portions and wow the "hot" sauce is indeed that!!! Loved it good flavor good coffee!! Will recommend

This restaurant deserves no stars in my opinion. But, since you have to give it at least one star here's the one star. I ordered through door dash. My delivery driver was beyond amazing. He had nothing to do with the inaccuracy of my order. I clearly wrote down that I did not want cilantro or jalapeños in any of my tacos or in my queso. As soon as I opened the food I could smell the cilantro. I had to throw everything away. I am highly disappointed and extremely angry! I will never order from this restaurant again or eat here. I am hoping to be compensated in someway because my money basically went down the drain.

I had just a bit of time for lunch so I called and place a to go order for a Baja fish taco & chicken tinga taco! The Baja fish is always my go to at new spots and they didn't disappoint. 10/10 would get again because it was so flavorful. The chicken tinga could be left out in the next order. I thought the chicken was too dry. The sauces that came on the side were also really delicious!!

I didn't expect much for the first time here, I was randomly on the way home and brought up Yelp to find a few options in the area. Came across liberty.  The environment is small and personal, but not too small to where it feels cramped. The staff is friendly, the place is clean, the order process was pretty easy  The drinks was one of the highlights for me, they have this very unique soda system with all these different flavors that make you want to just go try each one by one. They all tasted great as well. The tacos were great, cooked well, and the portions were really well too, so two tacos is filling enough for most people I would say, unless you have a huge appetite, then you may be able to get by with 3. I do wish it had more seasoning Is maybe my only constructive criticism, but it's not a huge deal, especially since they offer sauces
1 free drink with any purchase
Start your review of  Liberty Taco .

Great tacos, reasonable prices, awesome delivered! Liberty Tacos has become a regular party of my weekend ritual. The Caribbean chicken quesadilla, breakfast tacos, and wide assortment of fusion tacos are all really delicious. My go to is the Caribbean chicken quesadilla and bacon and egg tacos. Flavors are pretty good, comes with extra sauces on the side, and consistency is solid after several times. My review here is for delivery service, and food comes within a reasonable time frame, still warm and delicious to eat. Food is packaged pretty well and tortillas are still firm and haven't torn.  I know people like to compare this place to Torchy's Tacos, and I think Torchy's may have the lead on over the top saucy tacos, but Liberty Taco does hold its own, and would say delivery quality is slightly better (b/c its less saucy).

Its a solid taco place if you are looking for modern fusion tacos! I stopped by here on the early side for lunch so there was no problem parking. After reading up on yelp reviews: Liberty Steak: 8/10. Steak slices were perfectly cut and really tender. Overall consistency was pretty good, It felt too me more saucy than juicy, which is something I really want out of a steak taco--- without creating a mess of course. Baja Fish: 4/10. Panko battered fish? Totally wasn't expecting a horizontal taco when it came out. Almost felt like I was creating a pop tart to eat it. Fish was was well cooked, but overall taste was below expectations. There's several places in the city that have baja fish tacos that just kick it.. Thai Basil Chicken: 7/10. Had a slight Asian flavor, with strongest flavor being the basil. I was expecting a Thai basil stir fry (Kra Prao) flavor but wasn't quite what I was expecting. Overall flavor and consistency was solid though.  Bacon Egg, and Cheese: 9/10. Simple and basic but well done done! Ingredients all super hot and fresh, with ample bacon, and no liquids running anywhere.  Portion size is on the larger size.. so this place is a huge value for the cost! Overall flavors are good, but would say it's definitely not a Torchys.

I ordered two bacon, egg and cheese breakfast tacos. I love their bacon. These tacos are incredibly flavorful and if you want to add a little spice they provide you with three different sauces to try. Be mindful the orange one holds a lot of heat! Enjoy!
Once again really happy with the food here. Definitely worth the drive out. The queso was great and so we're the tacos.

Great tacos and great staff! The place is spacious too so that's a bonus. The staff was really nice and happily explained the options and such. The food was delicious. My personal favorite is the liberty steak with habenero sauce on it. Their drinks are also craft sodas so that's a plus!
Really fun experience tasting all of the different sauces. Each of the chip dips were delicious. Will be coming back here for SURE!

Yup, Liberty Taco is my fave taco spot (not street-style, for those who are extremely picky/knowledgeable about their tacos) so far in Houston. I have only ever called in to pick up my order here since COVID started. But I knew this was a spot I needed to check out after seeing the high ratings and plethora of reviews for this spot. Their phone service is superb. They have never gotten my order wrong, and they also read out the menu especially because I don't eat meat as a pesca.  My go to's are their veggie breakfast tacos (potato, egg, cheese) and (bean, egg and cheese). OMG they get it RIGHT every single time. Moving from Austin, I thought I was going to be at a sore loss for my solid breakfast tacos...but Liberty Tacos makes up for what I miss from back there. Their seafood is also DIVINE. I've had their shrimp quesadillas as well as their shrimp tacos and grilled fish tacos. I gotta say EVERYTHING is done right. Their tacos are definitely my favorite items to order, but their quesadilla is filling too (and comes with a solid side of guac). I love this spot. Everybody there is nice and their wifi is free and STRONG. Their parking lot isn't too large, but I've never had trouble finding parking. Call to order and pick up. Trust me. They also have dine-in seating, but it's limited and spread out to abide by the law. They're fab. Support local.

Great Tacos! Definitely my go to in Houston. I prefer them over Torchy's and Blanco. #SorryNotSorry.  I've tried a bunch but the one that's stuck with me over the years is the Baja shrimp tacos (wrapped in lettuce). Another fav or mine is their Habanero spicy sauce. It's so good that they sell it by the jar!  I buy it every time. It brings the heat but also has lots of flavor.  I believe they're also BYOB. Which is great!

Decided to check out taco Place when I was in this area and it didn't disappoint. I ordered the chips and salsa ( the salsa is served warm) I personally am not a fan of hot salsa we specially when it's 109 degrees outside but it was fresh. I had 2 tacos the beef ribeye and the shrimp taco with mango. Both of the tacos were delicious and very generous portions. The tortilla chips was light and fresh!

I ordered via DoorDash. The tacos are tasty, a lot of choice and great flavors. I take one star off for packaging - they roll tacos tightly in an aluminum foil (like burritos) which ruins the shape. Plus I got one item wrong. Hopefully they can iron these things out, because I hope to order again.

Give me liberty or give me tacos! Well I can have both.  This popped up on my YELP after my Tuesday jog so of course I rolled up here for taco Tuesday.  Ordered two breakfast (brisket & jalapeño sausage), Liberty steak, Cajun fish, and the Cali club.  All were packed with filling which is what I expect living in Texas.  I don't have a favorite as all of them were delicious, filling, and flavor filled. This place has been hit by the pandemic sadly but they seem to still have good business with take out orders.  My take out was packed securely and still was presentable when driving back the 15 minutes.  While I thought about eating in the car, the comforts of your home with tacos in front of you is much more enjoyable than eating while driving. This will likely be in my taco Tuesday rotation.  Maybe when things open up, they can build one near me.  Do it Liberty!!!
I'm obsessed with this place. Im my opinion, this is by far one of the best taco places. Been coming here for yeaaaaars
1 free drink with any purchase

Food is great and they are conscious of cleaner palettes and dietary restrictions. I feel like their menu options decreased? For some reason I feel like there used to be far more options.  Anywho, what we enjoyed our last time was very good. We shared the pizza as an appetizer and each had a soup. My butternut squash soup was delicious! Fun fact, this was my last meal before giving birth, maybe the spice

This place was SO cute-love the indoor/outdoor vibe and with all the string lights and cozy seating, it was a casual romantic ambiance. Service was good and drinks and food were delicious. Next time we have to come for a full meal. We came at 3pm and they do a "more limited" menu from 3-5pm, however it was still a stacked menu so didn't feel limited at all. They have tons of keto and paleo options which is great, but doesn't feel like a weird hippie place. To drink, we got the spicy Paloma (standard good, and actually spicy but not overly so), spicy cucumber martini (refreshing and the same yummy spice level), and carajillo (this was delicious, but I think I may have just gotten an espresso martini-didn't taste any citrus at all and our bill actually noted espresso martini instead of the drink I actually ordered. Again, it was still delish so not that big a deal). For food, we just wanted a small snack and tried the paleo alternative queso-this was by no means cheesy, but it was delicious! Kind of a green creamy dip somewhere in btwn guacamole and hummus. The paleo child served with it were tasty and crispy, should have asked for more. Overall very impressed with this place and highly recommend if you're in the area! Cool for any time of day!

I had an outstanding experience here last night for a friend's birthday. The setting: a sultry summer Monday night at 7pm. We made a reservation for an outdoor table (thanks, COVID) and were immediately greeted by one of the most dynamic and engaging servers I have had in a long time. He made sure our experience was top notch, recommending excellent drinks, appetizers, etc and wowing us with his history with the Ruggles family (he has worked with the original Ruggles and now here, so he had a lot of great stories and recs!). Besides the outstanding service, everything we ate and drank was amazing. We started with the brussels sprouts (a must-get), the paleo "queso" (think of it more like a flavorful hummus), and the chicken wings (also falls in the must-get category). For the entrée I ordered the Spinach Chicken - it was soooo good! Cheesy-spinach stuffed chicken with roasted veggies, yes please. The server let me know this was a very popular dish that has been on the Ruggles menu for a long time and I can see why - it was excellent. To top off the night we shared a few slices of cheesecake: the oreo, tuxedo, and strawberry. Oreo was the favorite overall but all varieties were yummy. To drink I had the Ruggles Breezer, a raspberry rum drink; very light and refreshing! Someone else at the table had "The Big Sexy" pork rib stack and let me tell you, it has to be seen to be believed - it is quite the dish! Mouths fell open when we saw how large and over the top this entrée was!  All in all, we could not have asked for a better birthday outing. Even despite the Houston heat; the patio was well-shaded with fans and twinkle lights. I will say like others how silly the parking situation is - so many spots for the neighboring Taco Cabana/Pepper Twins. Since it was a Monday I had no issue getting a "legit" Ruggles spot...I could see how during busy times you may need to utilize the bank (when it is closed) or hope the Taco Cabana/Pepper Twins doesn't tow.
Excellent inventive food. Every time I've come here, it's been impressive. The decor is weird/quirky and the place is small but so what because the food is great!

The food was OK... but the overall experience was much less than so. D for our first time there, we were given a rotten table right off the bar... and the server totally forgot our appetizer order. Went right to the salads... I feel as if the mgmt just expected us to be thrills with sub par service... we won't be back!

I took my mother here for her birthday... I had been looking forward to going to a place that offered legit Keto options (my mother follows more of a paleo diet) so this was a perfect option. I was excited yet skeptical... I'm a picky eater & I just didn't know if I'd like this place considering Keto isn't common.  I was impressed. The taste! The quality and the keto DRINKS! I rarely drink anymore due to my lifestyle change, but it was nice to have a flavorful  option that was also keto friendly!  I will be coming here again (hopefully sooner than later.) It's a bit pricey or I'd come every week

Being on a keto diet (some of the time), I was BEYOND STOKED to see that they have an entire keto menu.  We got there when it opened and waited at the door for just a couple minutes before one of the guys told the hostess staff that we were standing there. After that we were promptly seated. The decor is super cute and aesthetically pleasing, but it's definitely a tight little squeeze or a spot.  We got the keto bread appetizer. It was served hot, sitting in a bright green liquid, which I presume was some kind of micro green infused oil/butter but it was not salted. The bread was bland and like... wet... and I asked for butter but they brought out melted unsalted butter which added zero flavor to the bread. Neither of us enjoyed the bread. I got a keto Queen Sophia & my husband got a keto margarita. He didn't love his margarita, but I quite liked it and my drink was ok too.  For our meals, hubs got chicken enchiladas and I got the carbonara. Neither of us really cared for our meals. Mine had a sweetness to it that I wasn't expecting and didn't really dig. The hubs didn't like the enchiladas, though I can't really remember what his specific complaint was. We actually both liked the taste of each other's meals more than what we had ordered for ourselves, but still not really happy with it. I really  liked the flavor of the enchiladas, but after several bites of gristle, I couldn't stomach any more of it.  We ended the meal by splitting a chocolate dessert of some sort that we were both expecting to be somewhat like a chocolate mousse pie, but it was more like a very dense/dry brownie type cake which also tasted weird.  I know what you're probably thinking... what did you expect from an entire keto menu?! But I promise you, I have made keto-fied foods and have eaten keto versions of foods from another restaurant as well that were delicious! So, I know it can be done. I reeeeally wanted to love it.

My husband and I used to love this place. Foods always amazing but tonight the atmosphere sucked. All of the servers were so rude. When just walking to our table there's servers coming at you with food. No excuse me, no let me step out of your way. No it's you step out of my way. No smiles. Our waiter spilled steak juice all over my husbands pants and decided to brush it off like it was no big deal. Handed him a wet rag and walked away. Keep in mind we were here to celebrate my husbands birthday. I told the server 3 times that it was my husbands birthday and he just ignored me. The last time he finally acknowledge me but did absolutely nothing. Not even a happy birthday. He just brought us the dessert we ordered (we also paid for) and walked away. No credit, no manager, no I'm sorry. Honestly thinking twice about going back.

Paleo what?! Before you shoot it down, you must try this place! The food was beyond amazing. My fiancé & I tried the Spicy Teriyaki NY Strip & the Fried Rice Snapper. Delicious! The way they put the flavors together is amazing. The presentation is gorgeous. Service was perfect. Our server was very helpful and really helped us decide. Everything on the menu sounded so good! After such an amazing dinner, I had to try dessert. Holy options!! We decided on the Carrot Cake & the Goat Cheese Cheesecake. Both were to die for! The cheesecake came with their homemade coconut ice cream which was really yummy! I definitely recommend making a reservation because the place fills up fast. Definitely can't wait to be back! So much more to try!

We had dinner at Ruggles for the first time last night, and we absolutely loved every moment! The atmosphere was phenomenal, so warm and inviting. The food was absolutely incredible. I had the pistachio crusted snapper, and it was one of my favorite meals I have ever had! Every single bite was an incredible combination of flavors. The crab spring rolls are also a must have. Our server was very friendly, and very informative about the menu. We highly recommend, and will absolutely be visiting again!

Met our dear friends in town for the day for lunch today at their choice of restaurant.  They are big into the Paleo diet and keto so a welcome choice for them.  I'm not so much and so was tentative about the choice but Ruggles earlier versions were always well done so I was game.   The menu was different to say the least with choices for those inclined to paleo and keto as well as an array of options including CBD.
