So I loved that there was plenty of sauce on the dish to eat it with Arrachera ($17): was my least favorite dish of the night. I liked the flavors of the salsa and the pico. But man the meat was so tough and dry that even the sauces couldnt save the dish. I asked for medium rare but it was more like medium/medium-welldone. I didnt finish the dish. Oyamel Margarita Pomegranate ($13.50): This margarita was delicious and definitely a must order. The tart pomegranate balanced out the sweet drink. The salt air is a nice touch! Its like drinking cold foam but on a cocktail. Not too salty either!  I think for a jose andres restaurant no and it being a tapas restaurant, the price is alright. But I guess higher expectation of ingredient quality.

-----ATMOSPHERE------   The inside is nice and was crowded on a weekday so make sure to make a reservation. They asked for proof of vaccine.  The waiter was nice and told us that the beans had pork after we ordered them. I really appreciated that since I do not eat pork but did not get his name.  ------FOOD & DRINKS------ Rice with beans - It was okay but bland. 4/10 (make sure to ask if the beans are vegetarian if you care because some contain pork!) Guac with chips - The guac was not bad but the chips were oily. 6/10 ------PRICE------ About 20 dollars for a meal WOULD I COME BACK? No, I did not love the food

Food was really good but unfortunately I found multiple sharp bones in my enchilada. I brought it up to the staff to let them know since it could have cut my mouth or been a choking hazard, and they just took the plate and didn't say a word. I found that that to be a bit off-putting, so it made the rest of the experience less enjoyable. My friend tried the margarita which she really enjoyed, and the tacos were great. I hope nobody else experiences sharp bones!

Oyamel is a good option if you have various appetites in your group and love to try lots of things you may not have come across on other menus! Cute place for small plates to share in a bright, happy, butterfly themed dining room. I enjoyed everything, especially the ceviche verde, but the portions were very small even for small plates. So, 4 stars.  I highly recommend glancing over the menu before you arrive to make sure you'll be satisfied with the small plate style for Mexican food - I did not see basics like a quesadilla or burrito (not a criticism!) Just be prepared for creative, tasty small plate options. Cannot attest to the drinks, but based on our food, this seems like a rockin happy hour place for nibbling.

We came to celebrate my 50th birthday on a Thursday evening in late June. Open Table gave a very early timeslot that the restaurant was able to manually move for me by a half hour to give us adequate time to arrive. We found parking on the street just a block away. We lucked out and got a corner table around back that looked like it could seat 8-10 but we were a group of 5. They had makeshift plexiglass dividers as an extra precaution and this felt really safe and was nicely done. We ordered a few happy hour items and items from the regular menu as well as a pitcher of margaritas. It was so nice to be able to celebrate with my family and just dine out. Delicious food and drinks made for a very memorable outing!  Not sure what to eat?  Try everything!

Great Mexican fine dining! I love Mexican food and it's sad to me that it is often seen as a "cheap" food. While there is great cheap Mexican food it can also be upscale and worth a high price--as Cocina Oyamel proves. They have a creative collection of signature cocktails, especially margarita based ones, that compete with any classy bar. And the food, which all comes as small tapas plates, is delectable. Though many of the items are familiar (enchiladas, quesadillas, tacos) they are done with a particular care and flare that makes it high brow food while retaining authenticity. And there is also a long list of unusual and creative dishes that are either unique creations or authentic deep cuts. In both cases they are great. The ambiance is light and fun, while still formal, and the service is great. An excellent choice for a fine meal in DC.

Good environment. The place was extremely packed and seems like it is best to make a reservation. We got there around 6PM and the next available table was estimated at 9PM. We ended up seated at the bar so it was okay.  The bartender was very attentive and made great suggestions. The restaurant was a little overrated. The prices were quite high and everything was a la carte style. Personally, I wish the chips were saltier or had more flavor- they weren't my favorite. The margarita (flavored but can't remember the name) was delicious as were the steak tacos.  I think next time I would try somewhere else but it was still a good atmosphere and experience.

Cannot say enough about this authentic Mexican restaurant. Chef Jose Andres creates the smoothest sauces and guacamole. One could just drink the salsa verde from the Verde Tamal. It is one of the finest verde salsas I've had. The enchilada verde is a mix of white and dark chicken meat. This is a different tasting sauce with cheese. It is very good.  The corn tamale tastes like warm sweet soft cornbread. It was warm and sweet. Think of corn pudding in solid form - so good!

A mucho grande bueno! ayeeee!  Seriously though, beautiful place, great location, food is authentic! Coming from a N, Cali-girl!   This is legit! great great chips snd salsa. meatballs are a must snd the pollo verde tamales were so tender! great sauces. Tacos amazing!  Cynthia our waitress fantasico

Oyamel has solid food and an even better vibe. The interior is decorated beautifully, the staff are super nice, and the outdoor seating is comfortably out of the way of pedestrians and traffic (but great for people watching).  I LOVE that you get free chips and salsa here, it seems like it's not too common in DC. The seasoning on the chips was amazing, as was the salsa. We also got the guac - at $15, definitely overpriced, but it was very good, and a fairly generous serving. I really appreciated all of their vegetarian options, and went for the hongos taco and the chilaquiles. The taco was perfect, and though on the pricier side, I'd get it again. The reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is the chilaquiles. They were not good. They had almost no sauce, and resembled an underdressed plate of nachos more than actual chilaquiles. I've seen mixed reviews on Yelp about them, so maybe I got them on a bad day. I'm looking forward to trying the rest of the vegetarian menu!

The vibe at this restaurant is cute and sexy, love it for date night.  Best dishes of the night: - Brussels sprouts with peanuts and sesame - fish tacos - chicken enchiladas  I thought the beef and pork tacos were just ok. The flavors underwhelmed me. The service was great. His staff was accommodating to our many requests. Lol Pro tip: if you plan to get a vaccine soon, brings your vaccine card to the restaurant and they will give you a $50 gift card until the DMV is 70% vaccinated.  Happy Eating!!!

We stopped at Oyamel after getting rejected from the National Archives for not having tickets (sad face).  The chips and salsa were excellent. The chips were nice and thin and well seasoned and the salsa was smoky without too much heat.  I had the Oyamel margarita and it was good enough that I had two.  Hubby had the brunch special taco which was a pork fat flour tortilla with beans, eggs, chorizo, and potato. He said it was excellent. I decided to order it too but they ran out. Hubby also had the fish tacos and said they were good but not as good as what he's had on the West Coast.  I had the chilaquiles and they were ok. They were supposed to have chorizo but it must have been a very small portion because I didn't detect much of it.

Listen the food and service is amazing. It's beautiful inside butterflies everywhere. Watermelon mojito best thing ever just get the pitcher now that's how good it is. The Meatballs shrimp and ribs are soooo good

I was very satisfied with everything we ordered. Right from the start, the hot tortilla chips and the fresh salsa were a perfect tentempié while we browsed the menu. We ordered the guacamole to start and it was perfectly dressed and went well with the salsa. We then ordered three tacos: the special barbacoa taco, the cochinita pibil, and the chilorio taco. Best taco: Chilorio de Res. Flavorful and tender. We ordered the tamal verde, softer than what I'm used to but absolutely delicious! The sauce was spicy and very slightly sweet. The ceviche verde at first was an interesting first bite, but again, the salsa was so refreshing and the fish was fresh.  The service was too notch. Stephanie did everything to make us feel comfortable and satisfied.  The only thing I did not enjoy were the two drinks we ordered. The Mexican Gin and Tonic and the Paloma. Both were more focused on the alcohol and had a slight twist of flavors. However, I usually like my cocktails to hide the alcohol, so that wasn't for me. The Gin and Tonic especially was unfavorable because of  the small hibiscus flowers made it hard to drink. Big bill for two people, but we ate well and had a nice experience. Will be coming back probably for special meals!

Oyamel serves the BEST tamale (verde) and enchilada (verde) I've ever had. Their ancharro steak and ceviches are also absolutely amazing. 10/10 recommend. That being said... their tacos are just fine and their frijoles refritos con queso was dry- so stick to the first items I suggested and you'll be so happy!

Looks like I am determined to try all of Jose Andres' restaurants! While The Bazaar didn't really do it for me, this place knocked my socks off! Their food was all around amazing. My favorite was the quesadilla and the Plato de Suadero. Both so good. Even though they're small plates, there was still more food than I expected. I took some leftovers home to enjoy later that night for dinner. Aside from the food being delicious, our server, Jan, was so awesome! Friendly, attentive, and knowledge. We had a few members of our party that have food sensitivity, and he made sure that the chefs were aware and made sure they ordered dishes that they would have no problems with. My recommendation is to make a reservation, as we went a little past lunchtime and it was still busy by the time we left at 4 pm. There is garage parking conveniently located across the street. I can't wait to go back!

I have been here a few times and the food is pretty solid. There are definitely better options, and menu is small and so are the plates, but everything I have had has been consistently decent. I won't call them favorites but my preferences are the fish tacos, mushroom tacos, tres leches and pomegranate margarita. The one dish I would not recommend is the shrimp appetizer, Aguachile de camaron. It's not worth the cost and the presentation and taste was mediocre at best. The customer service is consistently great as well which keeps us coming back.

I love this restaurant! Every time that I'm in DC I make it a point to have a meal here. It is consistently great food, atmosphere, and service. I recommend it to anyone that I know who will be in the DC area. I fly from the west coast for this restaurant!

Not bad, but definitely over-priced for ok food. Very cute place though! Enjoyed the complimentary chips and salsa. My favorite thing was the Ceviche Rojo. Had another good ceviche, tamale, and good margaritas! The tacos were decently sized, but tasted just okay.

If your looking for a decent filling meal with a nice drinks and great ambience  I enjoy the frozen Margaritas after a long day... You can sit outside and relax The daily menu specials are great... So the menu has a variety The Lamb fajitas are seasoned well.. must Salmon Relleno is always Good Definitely a great place to unwind with a good meal & drink

If you are looking for a neighborhood Mexican spot, you have found it.  It's an easy walk from most places and super easy to find.  I stopped for an unplanned lunch as I was walking by.  The covered patio is enormous and very well shaded from the sun and other weather elements, I chose to dine inside.  It's a very large restaurant with loads of seating.  The menu was adequate and had all the typical things you would expect.  The staff was friendly and the food was good.   I ordered a chicken and spinach quesadilla and a side of the grilled bacon wrapped shrimp.   While the food was good, I never discovered the spinach in the quesadilla and the shrimp was absent of the bacon.  The Guacamole was fresh and delightful.  I also enjoyed the queso which was not your typically white cheese dip.  It was good lunch and I would dine there again.

*Visiting from Houston* I was in dire need of some Mexican food so I was initially walking from my hotel (Hilton-Washington) to this Mexican spot that I found on Yelp. But it was extremely hot out so I opted for this restaurant because I still had a 10 minute walk to the initial spot. What drew me to this place was the outside seating and when I approached the restaurant, I noticed it was Mexican...so winning!  Walked in, I was immediately greeted. The host asked got indoor or outdoor. At first, I said outdoor but I remembered I've been walking and could use some cool air so inside it was LOL. The host sat me by a window which was great and appreciated because despite being hot, it was a beautiful day.  There was a lunch menu available but I didn't see anything I wanted besides the Sangeria that was about $5.50, I believe. So I ordered that (red one)...I didn't like it at all but I drunk it anyways...later, I got the house margarita which was 1,000,000x better (would recommend).  Food wise, I ordered beef enchiladas, it came with rice and charro beans. I personally didn't like the beef enchiladas because it was shredded beef, I was under the assumption it was going to be ground beef. At this point, I was hungry so I devoured it. It was okay, not too pleases about it.
Absolutely LOVE! Highly recommended for Mexican food enthusiasts. Great Margs , authentic food!

We were looking for another restaurant when we observed this crowded restaurant across the street so we went to investigate.  There was so much seating in and out of the restaurant that we didn't have to wait.  YUM am I glad!  The menu was incredible and diverse with Mexican, Spanish, Cuban and other menu items. They served Mexican chips as a started. They were warm and crispy. They had lamb fajitas which is what I ordered. So good! My friend ordered a Cuban pork dish.  He is Cuban and loved it. The food was fabulous. The service was excellent and the restaurant is very nice. I can't believe I never heard of this place but it is my new go to once a week. You could never eat your way through their menu. Can't imagine you being disappointed.

I came here this Saturday with family, and I would say that it was satisfactory experience overall. The restaurant is very covid friendly and provides hand wipes for the table upon arrival. The service was also very quick and the prices were GREAT. In terms of food, I ordered the mussels as an appetizer which I shared with one other person (it also came with a complimentary slice of toast). The dish was quite good, however the portion was a bit on the smaller side. I ordered the chicken quesadilla for my main, which was mediocre in my opinion. I found the chicken to be a bit dry, and the guac tasted a bit old as well. Overall, I enjoyed my experience but would most likely would not come back.

This old favorite is still my favorite! I love that they have expanded the space in the back with a huge tent. Their frozen margaritas as second to none. I used to get lemon strawberry swirl but tried a mango strawberry swirl and it is my new FAVORITE. I could make a meal out of their chips and queso, but of course also ordered dinner and got the chicken and shrimp combo fajita. Also a new favorite! I would eat here once a week but all of the carbs would kill me! We had an awesome girls' night out and the service was fantastico.

Two years after my previous visit, eating outdoors in early October. Enjoying the spicy salsa.  Very large outdoor seating area, but much of it is in the sun (not our table, however). When here before we enjoyed the modern interior.  Still the same mostly avocado guacamole. The way it should  be.  Today they're having a salmon special, so I'm trying it.  It is great. The plantains are the best.

Lots of space. A bus of high school students arrived (prom like) to challenge that capacity just after I typed that first sentence, though.  Crab and shrimp enchiladas with cheese. Very good seafood.  Guacamole is mostly avocados as it should be.

This was a homey little texmex inspired brunch spot we found while planning a family reunion. As a visiting Texan I wasn't sure what to expect but stayed optimistic.  First impressions were quite poor: there was a bird flying around inside and the salsa tasted like watered down tomato sauce with chunks. The friendly and attentive staff made up for most of this and the meal came hot and timely.  Quality of the meal was okay. I definitely came in with high standards for this type of cuisine but received pretty boilerplate food. Not great not bad. All servers wore masks, provided sanitizer wipes, and were overall very covid conscious.  Probably wouldn't be back but enjoyed my time with my family.

I love it here! Every time I've been it's been at less congested time. I was able to get a table quickly.  Indoor and outdoor seating are offered. The food is good. I had the spinach quesadilla as this was a quick dinner before hitting the club! It was delicious. (Sorry, in my hunger I didn't get pics). Oh and he best part, free parking for customers though it is a short walk on California and 18th!
Family styles  Not complain  Things are good  Service is ok.     Much options  To choose   Price is valid for the food.

Always a favorite!! The parking lot was turned into outdoor seating. Street parking only. The servers wore mask.  Went for a birthday party of 20 ppl on a Wednesday night at 7pm. We had two separate tables and one server. He did a great job. Drink: Mango Lime swirl. Entree: Lamb Fajitas. It was delicious. My friends had the ground beef taco and seafood enchiladas. I will definitely be back and probably try something new next time.

I made reservations for 9pm and was able to get seated immediately on a Friday evening. Even though my party was a bit late, they were very accommodating. We each ordered the Combo Fajitas which came with chicken, shrimp, and beef as protein. It also came with a guacamole, pico de gallo, onions, and tortillas. The fajitas were pretty good. The chicken was my favorite. The beef wasn't very seasoned but, the meat was very juicy. It also wasn't well done, which I enjoyed. The shrimp wasn't that tender and was a little rubbery in my opinion. If I were to return, I would just get the chicken fajitas instead of the combo.  We also ordered a pitcher. We couldn't decide on one flavor so we did a swirl with a frozen mango margarita and a frozen strawberry margarita. It was pretty good and mixed well. The pitcher was overpriced for the amount you receive. We would have been better off getting separate drinks, it would have been cheaper and made more sense.  My friend ordered the flan for me as a treat for my birthday. I've personally never had flan before. It tasted like coffee with caramel and custard. The texture threw me off and it was just okay in my opinion. The bottom part of the flan was terrible. Because the caramel hardens at the bottom, it become crusty and weird. It wasn't pleasant. It did come with a bit of whipped cream which turned an ok flan to a pretty good one. It was interesting but I probably wouldn't get again since I was not a fan of the texture.  Overall, I enjoyed my time. Our server was extremely friendly and personable which I enjoyed. He made sure we were always good.

I've noticed that Lauriol Plaza is a popular restaurant for locals, especially millennials. If the weather permits, who doesn't love a frozen margarita? Everyone loves their "swirls." I've been a handful of times and I'm not ever really tipsy off the drinks.  *whispers* they're overrated.  Don't get me wrong, they taste good.. Food is decent but it's not the best margarita you'll taste. I went yesterday with a group of 5, had shots and 2 pitchers and wasn't tipsy. So either, my tolerance is high (and it isn't) or they aren't being honest about what they're serving lol.  Service was good! The wait staff is very accommodating and attentive to patrons so that's a plus! The wait estimate wasn't too bad considering it was a nice day. But because of how busy it was, a lot of appetizer options weren't available due to supply shortages. It was a bummer but understandable, I guess. So I'd suggest being prepared to wait or just get your drinks and food to go if you're impatient!

I was starving and wanted tacos so my friend and I made a detour. Honestly, we could've skipped this place. The drinks were weak, the food was meh and all tasted the same. After so many amazing culinary experiences in DC, this place felt like an afterthought. Also, I thought the service was subpar.
Lovely interior and outdoor seating. Fantastic, professional staff. Appreciate the large restrooms.  Excellent spot!

I am always looking for a new places to try and I love Mexican food. When we visited it was National Margarita Day! A friend from the area recommended this place. I immediately looked it up on Yelp! The food looked good and the prices looked even better! Even with Covid, I expected to have to wait to be seated. The city just really opened dining back up, it was dinner time and it was National Margarita Day. I was prepared to wait. Luckily, our party of 3 didn't need to.  The ambiance was great, the service was great, the margs were hittin' and the food was good.  We got 2 pitchers of the Lime Margarita on the Rocks. I think we got 5-6 full glasses out of the full pitcher. Chips and Salsa were complimentary (always a plus). I ordered 3 chicken enchiladas with rice. They were really good (even the leftovers I had for breakfast the next day/this morning). Overall, I really loved this. Can't wait until it's warmer to sit outside. If you're interested outside is open and has tower heaters but the cold isn't my thing. The prices were also very fair!  Highly recommend.

We had a great experience at District Taco!   We were hungry for lunch and in the area and decided to stop by District Taco. We were shocked to walk in and see few customers sitting down in the shop. We both ordered custom tacos: 3 chicken and 3 pork. The meat was perfectly cooked, and the vegetables were fresh. Everything tasted as if it was made to order.   If you're looking for great tacos on the outskirts of DC, District Taco is the place to be!

We had a great experience at District Taco!   We were hungry for lunch and in the area and decided to stop by District Taco. We were shocked to walk in and see few customers sitting down in the shop. We both ordered custom tacos: 3 chicken and 3 pork. The meat was perfectly cooked, and the vegetables were fresh. Everything tasted as if it was made to order.   If you're looking for great tacos on the outskirts of DC, District Taco is the place to be!

Pretty good fast-casual spot for tacos. I ordered a Breakfast Burrito which was pretty good. You can add as many toppings as you want which was pretty cool. The hot sauce was great, very spicy. Overall, decent spot to grab food to start out my day.
We were hungry and this was the first place we came across. The tacos were decent, not bad but definitely not the best I've ever had. Lots of sitting area and outside seating too.

Honestly, if I were rating this just on the tacos alone... 2 stars. Taste-wise is average at BEST, but the entire composition of their tacos deserves nothing more than 1 star. These tacos were super messy, soggy, and the shells didn't even keep any of the contents together. Had to end up basically eating these with a fork, and it was NOT the bidness, I tell you. This spot is highly rated and conveniently located near the National Mall. I was hangry and looked up some spots that were walking distance from the White House, and this was one of the places that popped up. I liked that it was fast casual, so I walked on over to try it. Service-wise, everything was on point. The young lady who helped me at the register was super informative about the menu and helped me with the ordering process.  They have a nice salsa bar with some good salsa options. Decided to order their fish tacos since this seemed like a popular item and was also recommended to me by the sweet cashier. Also got some chips and guac to go along with it. They have two levels but both don't have a ton of seating. I sat on the second level and the place was pretty busy (pre-covid). When you order they give you a number and then they'll deliver your food to your table. When I saw the fish tacos, I kind of had a feeling that they weren't gonna be all the way right. They just looked sad. And I was right. The tacos were soggy AF. The actual flavor wasn't half bad, but nothing to go out of the way for. What annoyed me the most was that as soon I went to pick one up to eat it, everything started falling apart instantly. They were extremely messy. Luckily that chips and guac were tasty, but that's not a meal. I really wanted to love the tacos, but they just fell flat for me.  I feel like the main reason that this place is so highly rated is because it's convenient and cheap. If that's what you're looking for, then it may work for you. However, I myself would not go out of my way to come back here again.
No good,  mis deluxe tacos de pescado,  ni siquiera se les veía el pescado por ningún lado, más bien parecían tacos de repollo, dejan mucho que desear. No regreso a este lugar.

Solid meal, though a bit expensive (it was about 30 bucks for dinner for two- each got an order of tacos and a drink). Perfect to grab and go eat on the mall.  We got the pork tacos and the fish tacos. We liked that you could customize them, but we agreed they both needed some kind of sauce. The soda selection was really different - not a brand I recognize, and they had really good flavors!
Excellent tacos and other Mexican food. Usually crowded inside and outside. If you drive here, good luck trying to find parking.  Some of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Some are not.

Do yourself a favor and get out of this district if you want decent food. Let's taco 'bout it. The place is overall kinda grimy feeling and kinda confusing. There's not much space to stand if you're not ready to order- so come prepared with your order. They don't have many options either. I got the build your own bowl and it just lacked flavor in general. The same was true for my friends burrito. They charge chipotle prices for mediocre at best food. But they at least have bathrooms. Would not recommend going here. (Just go next door to Roti, at least their food has flavor). This place is a pass.
Decent tacos, they have build your own options which I really like.  The guacamole was very good.  Corn tortillas were strong.

District Taco offers scrumptious and authentic tacos for affordable prices. I love the ability to mix and match your toppings and tortilla types. The tacos come warm and gooey. My only issue is that the meats were light on flavor - I would have preferred more spice and flavor intensity. That's the only thing keeping this from being a five-star experience. Otherwise, the staff were friendly, and the taco-making was decently prompt, although you will need to wait a couple minutes for them to make it all fresh.

DONT DO IT:  Evening staff is terrible. Went there Monday night. Myself and another had to stand around while the kid at the register finished texting on his phone. Looked up at us then went back to texting.  Zero courtesy or greeting. After ordering engaged with the ladies that were cooking. Same response. Zero personality, engagement and clearly showed they didn't want to be bothered.   I will say the manager was really friendly and engaged.  The food:  dry meet, bad salsa. Maybe the day staff is better but totally does not warrant a 4 star rating.

Got a quesadilla and three tacos from this place and felt like it tasted like taco bell. Very little thought put into the ingredients and the food was somewhat sloppily made. Unfortunately just not good tacos in my opinion.

Oh man, I love District Taco. This is coming from a man who has been to Mexico and Texas plenty of times. I was not expecting to love this place so much. It's perfect for a quick lunch in the city if you're in between meetings. My office has also gotten catering from District Taco and it was a hit! The fish tacos (which I believe are only served on certain days) are so good. My favorite is probably the pineapple al pastor and I really love the toppings bar. It's solid food without the frills; consistently tasty.

I'm double parked so let me be brief. There was no line and a short wait on the Friday night I was here, guess everyone was at the ballpark. I took it to go and the food wasn't marked so we had to figure out who's was who's. Aside from that everyone enjoyed it. They packed the bag full of different salsas which I have been enjoying all weekend long on whatever meal I was having!

We both had the three tacos special for $9.99; one each of chorizo, carnitas and carne asada with cheese and lettuce. None of the meat looked fresh and was precooked. The corn tortillas tasted burned. With guacamole the whole bill was over $25. Not worth the money.

A quick walk from The Mall; overall food was decent; atmosphere was maybe a 2 at best. Walk in and there are little footprints to follow in a circle, two guys behind the counter and neither one excited to be there. I asked for salsa, they say oh tell them in the back, I go to the back and ask for it and they say you had to order it up there... I said I tried. So she says she's out of it and then hands me two small containers for 3 orders. I proceed to go outside and sit down only to see two girls pack up because they were getting swarmed by bees. We decided to take our chances and sit to eat, the same happened to us. Not sure why this was rated so highly, I wasn't too impressed. The food was tasty, probably needed more salsa, but I wouldn't run to try again.

A solid good. The build it yourself menu put me in mind of a "Moe's"  or similar semi-fast food location.  Only steps from the White House it was refreshing to find a low cost, casual meal option. Seating was an issue, place was loaded up with lingering diners, forced us to use the outdoor seating. Decent food and salsa/pico bar. I wouldn't call is "authentic", sort of an elevated Taco Bell. Flavor was a bit pedestrian. I do wish they would more closely emulate a Baha-Mex street cart menu.  Overall, a solid not bad.

Great taco restaurant near the Whitehouse I came here during lunch, which was a massive rush of visitors and local federal workers.  The staff is  nice, even though it's rushed and people are rushing from the line, you can get help with ordering. I had two tacos using the Itza veggie protein, it's a meat-alternative crumble.  I had one taco Jefe style, which is the Mexican style of cilantro and onions.  On the second taco I just did "build your own" and added a bunch of veggies. After you order you wait by the kitchen in the rear of the restaurant and they call you by name when your order is up.  There is a salsa bar with a good selection of house made green and red salsas, that range from mild to super hot. There is plenty of seating upstairs because there are bars that give way to single person seating. Overall, great food, good service.  It's a little hectic here, but worth the stop for good tacos.

Poor quality even for takeout/delivery. How can anyone decide not to eat their rice and beans because they taste more like wintergreen toothpaste than cilantro lime? El Pastor tacos were a 5 out of 10 pts Barbacoa were much better at 8 out of 10. Guacamole also was left uneaten .... There's a first time for everything... Bland and spineless... A little bit more TLC might make DISTRICT TACOS better for others  and that still wouldn't give me that " I'm  having a hankering for them again" feeling.
Solid. Not exceptional. Probably rated higher because of the lack of quality quick serve tacos in the area.

After an afternoon of Black Friday shopping, nothing is more enjoyable than a happy hour menu at El Centro in Georgetown. I didn't think places even had happy hours anymore. We enjoyed a few El Centro margaritas, an order of Don Nachos, and the three featured tacos. What I appreciate about El Centro's food the most is the attention to flavor: each bite is special. Whether it is the spicy charred meat of a taco paire with a sweet pineapple salsa, or the fresh crema on top of the smoky black bean purée on the nachos-- every bite is flavorful, fresh, and delicious. highly recommend stopping in for the great service, delicious food and drink, an reasonable happy hour prices.

Went on Saturday for bottomless brunch for the first time in about a year, and the changes the restaurant has made (I'm guessing due to COVID) were a letdown.  Firstly, the bottomless menu was slightly smaller. Several items had been removed, including the quesadillas, which had been my favorite menu item, and the agua fresca drinks, which had always been a unique and delicious option for a boozy brunch that I've not seen anywhere else.  The way the brunch was presented was also different - small dishes are brought in batches as courses, and after a bit of confusion we were told that we could also order dishes individually. This was the most disappointing part of the day - on previous visits, small plates were dropped off on a pretty consistent basis and we were rarely, if ever, left with an empty table. With this new course structure, we were waiting for 20+ minutes between courses. The restaurant was no busier than I have seen it before, so it was surprising that the service was so slow. On top of that, the few individual small plates I ordered (about halfway through) didn't come until the very end of our 2-hour time limit after I reminded the waitstaff several times. They brought the check immediately after, so there was no opportunity to order anything more. We also did not receive the "dessert" course.  The food was fine, but not good enough to wait so long for.  I've been going to bottomless brunch at El Centro pretty regularly for the last 5 years or so, and this was the first time I was disappointed. I think that if this was advertised as more of a prix fixe-style brunch, it would make more sense. Otherwise, the 2-hour time limit coupled with slow service pretty severely limits the "bottomless" aspect of this brunch that typically keeps people coming back.

Hi Allie - Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review. We're sorry that your brunch experience did not meet the high standards we set for ourselves. We'd love to hear more about how we could've made your visit more enjoyable - please reach out to us at  info@eatelcentro.com  so we can make this right. We hope we can get the chance to give you a five star experience at El Centro!

Had a really great experience at El Centro for dinner with some friends!  Service:  Everyone was very nice and the service was super fast. One pro-tip I have, MAKE A RESERVATION and MAKE IT IN ADVANCE lol. For DC in general its difficult to find restaurants with quality food last minute at a decent time. We were lucky enough to snag a reservation day off on a waitlist. The ambiance was cute, more on the casual/trendy side than anything else -- but I really enjoyed the vibe. Food: AMAZING.  We ordered the guac as an appetizer. It was slightly bland but I love avocados so naturally I couldn't stop eating it.  The chips were also definitely made in house! I loveeee fresh, warm and crispy chips. So freaking good.  For dinner I got cheese enchiladas, it came with the delicious green sauce, and yummy rice and beans!  Ask for the hot sauce -- it seems like they have their own brand and it was so good with the enchiladas -- its honestly probably what made me like it so much. I'd go back just for this dish.  Drinks: The only downside was the fact that I didn't love the house marg. It was too sweet- tasted more like mixer than anything. I probably won't get this again if I go.  Overall 9/10! I'd go back for the food!

Had a great brunch experience here on Sunday! We were a party of 8 but made a reservation beforehand. You pay a flat rate and get bottomless drinks that you can switch between mimosas, margaritas, bloody Mary's or bloody Maria's. You also get small plates of everything on their menu, and if you liked something you can order more as well. The concept is great for trying new things as the size is small and you are free to order more. There is a 2 hour limit, but you still get a chance to try so many food and drinks.  Our service was amazing, they really helped make the experience even more entertaining! This was a great place to have brunch and then walk around Georgetown after. Hoping to come back soon!

Reserved a table at El Centro for a brunch with my girlfriends. We were excited for the bottomless brunch option. The spot has a dive-ish feel which I don't mind. It is casual and fun. However, the service and food did not impress. Drinks: They have four bottomless drink options, two of which are Bloody Mary's and they were out of Bloody Mary mix leaving us with two options. I didn't mind, but you could have thought for a bottomless brunch spot, they would be prepared to have a high demand for their drinks. The traditional margaritas were great. The glasses are tall and the right ratio of marg mix to tequila was there. I didn't try their last drink option, mimosas, however my friend did who seemed to like them because she kept with those the entire brunch. They come in a much smaller glass than the margaritas so you'll need a good couple of them. A big downfall though, it took sometime for the refills. I was out of a drink for quite some time before our waitress finally came around to refill my glass.  Food: Fruit Cocktail (4.5/5) - it's fruit and sorbet, not much too it but enjoyable. I will say, didn't like the seeds it was topped with. It felt like when you bite into a seed while eating watermelon, didn't want that crunch with my fruit. Chicken Tinga Tacos (4.5/5) - best savory dish, chicken was super juicy, loved having all the toppings  Steak Tacos (3/5) - dry, I wish the toppings on the chicken tacos were also on the steak Chilaquiles (4/5) - nothing special, tortilla chips were soggy  Fried Eggs (4/5) - salsa verde was good, but nothing special, soggy tortilla Breakfast Enchilada (3/5) - didn't taste like anything but refried beans, eggs were bland and over cooked Huevos Rancheros (4/5) - nothing special, soggy tortilla Sweet plantains (3/5) - extremely undercooked, they were hard Churros (5/5) - the saving grace of the food! Crisp, lightly sweetened, and delicious A small side note, we had asked for an additional order of a dish which our waitress originally forgot about and we had to ask for it again. It still took some time to finally come out. That kind of thing usually doesn't bother me, however, since our service was slow to begin with, it added onto the poor service. Not only were the drink refills slow, the arrival of the food was too. There was one point were we were just looking at each other waiting for something to happen because we had no drink or food. I get it can get busy during brunch, but being a long time bottomless brunch spot, I expected they would be a bit more prepared for the brunch rush.  Definitely wouldn't return for the food, but we did enjoy the drinks and general brunch experience together. We'd still come back for drinks in the evening.

This place is authentic. Great adobo and mole sauces. loved the Sparkling from Spain. Reminds me of Artesa Cordoniu. Good vibes, great music.  sadly ran out of water & tables so wobbly it can be a challange not to spill. Lively! Come for the food & drink.  Guac & salsa yum

It a cool place. We ate upstairs which was very busy. Their happy hour food specials were good . Or server Ricardo was great. We had the flank steak tacos and cheese enchiladas which we enjoyed very much. There's strawberry margarita is very good and seems to be very popular

I'm a sucker for Mexican food, so when I was in town for a bachelorette party and needed to find somewhere that could accommodate a large group, this was my first suggestion. Love that they take large party reservations on OpenTable. Our table was ready for us exactly on time. Service was a little spotty. I'm sure it was harder with us being a larger group, but we had to ask for single glass refills of water several times before a pitcher was finally brought over. The margaritas were quite good--very strong and pretty fresh, which I can appreciate. We snacked on a few appetizers that were pretty good. We were mostly too full on chips and salsa to order entrees (#relatable) but got a few plates of tacos to share. The tacos were just alright. They did the trick but nothing to write home about. Seems like a very fun atmosphere that gets by on booze and the food is a secondary concern, which served our purpose just fine.

I dined at El Centro on Saturday, May, 22, 2021 at 8 pm. Not really a big fan of Mexican food, but I won't let my personal preferences skew this review. It was a good thing we made a reservation in advance because when we arrived, they were no longer accepting walk-ins. Having that in mind, I was expecting some stellar food and service based on how popular this place was, but I was disappointed.  Service was slow. I understand it was a busy Saturday night, but it was unacceptably slow. After being seated, we waited for a good 15 minutes or so before someone came to take our drinks orders. Then we were informed that there was only one person working the bar. The drinks didn't come out until after we got our appetizers.  El Centro has good guacamole and that's probably the only good food to eat. I honestly would have been satisfied with eating 2 bowls of guacamole with chips because my entree was pretty lackluster. I ordered the Chesapeake enchiladas and it was bad. I had better enchiladas before elsewhere, but these tasted like they were poorly executed in terms of flavors and presentation. The platanos were bland and the rice were a bit rich. There was no way I could have finished this plate.

Came here on a Sunday for Brunch. I didn't know that it was bottomless, and that everyone at the table had to do bottomless or a la carte. A few of us did the full bottomless (drinks +food) and some of us did just the bottomless food.  The food was fine. It was fresh and diverse but not the best Mexican food. It's a great place to get your fill and enjoy a decent meal. Service was poor. They were very confused and delayed with everything most of the time. I didn't get a good view inside but they must have been extremely busy. However, with good planning and organization, this doesn't have to be a problem.  We sat outside on the street patio with good weather. Beware with the bird droppings in the large trees that shade the area.
The food was not as good as I expected. Service wasn't the best. Plantains are SUPER sour. Crispy shrimp tacos were a hard pass. Fajitas were good.

First impression its small and off the side the sun does not shine on until the end of the day. Other than that the food was bomb I felt bad for the waiter because it seemed like he was the only one working so we had to wait awhile for our drinks and food. Even the next table to us he was by himself waiting awhile for his food and drink. He offered us chips and some spicy guacamole. The chips had no salt but the guacamole was sooo damn good. We also ordered mango margarita on the rocks and strawberry margarita frozen. Definitely had me lit a little bit. We were still eating for our food to the point the waiter offered us 2 more cups of chips and guacamole. I assumed the guacamole was free with the chips but it was not. My friend and I ordered the same thing the seafood enchiladas. It was sooo good and filling. I just didn't like that they only give plantains as a side with it. I don't care for plantains and I asked if I could get the rice and beans but they would not adjust it. We sat outside but the decor inside was okay could definitely use better lighting. The bathrooms are single but it's two of them. I recommend due to the food and drinks definitely get the guacamole!
Seriously, seriously delicious. Literally the best table salsa I've ever had. Mexico City-style tacos, A+ margaritas, and do not miss the queso fundido. So good.

Honestly... this has never happened to me anywhere before. My friend and I showed up for happy hour and were told about a 45 min table limit. That's absolutely fine, we ordered the margaritas and realized the margaritas didn't taste like alcohol. So we ordered another... and didn't feel anything. I then realized I had my breathalyzer in my purse. At 130 pounds... I should be have a pretty high BAC after 2 margaritas. I blew a 0.0, there was no booze in the margs.  I was told the taco Tuesday menu was on a different part of the website under a different tab. After 45 mins of waiting for my tacos (after the 45 min limit) I asked about my tacos. I was told that I ordered off a menu that wasn't updated and those tacos weren't available.  The tacos were great. The drinks were straight up sour mix with no alcohol. And the wait times were disappointing.

This place does not have authentic Mexican food, I got the Huevos Rancheros this is the one plate you can't go wrong with and it was not good. The tortillas are totally drenched in oil, they are soggy, my avocado was black, the plate itself was messy. The bloody Maria I would expect to taste rich in lime juice, tomato juice, Woschestire  sauce, pepper, tajin, like a Mexican drink would but honestly it's tasted like a regular American Bloody Mary. There's nothing Mexican about this place but the STAFF. They helped us out and where nice, the management on the other hand I can't say the same. Thank you but no thank you. Don't come here if you're looking for REAL MEXICAN food.

I would never be spiteful and post a negative review about a restaurant without taking all the factors into consideration, but after  visiting this location several times, I think this review is indicative of the overall experience. I write this review in the hopes that this DC staple will see this as constructive criticism, as what we have experienced on this visit was clearly not a one off experience.  After a full work day, and trying to take advantage of the beautiful patio weather, my wife and I made an 8:30 reservation for El Centro.  We showed up early and were sat at 8:25.  The server comes by and asked us to quickly place an order because they were closing at 9pm.  We had a few questions but we were ready to order when he showed up.  In short he told us, "We don't have what you want.  It's a popular item for Taco Tuesday."  Because of that my wife asked, "Can I have another second to look over the menu?"  And he replied, "No you need to order now before the kitchen closes."  Again, at 8:35.  Five minutes after our reservation.  I'm of the opinion that a restaurant is well within their right to close a kitchen before closing their doors, but don't offer reservations for 30 minutes before closing if you're going to cut service short.  Our drinks arrived and food arrived roughly 20 minutes later and the server apologized for the wait.  Then he appeared with two shots on the house!  That's when it hit me: Our waiter was also the bartender and deep in the weeds with nearly 10 tables.  This isn't his fault by any means, rather management that has understaffed their store for a Taco Tuesday night.  I understand stores are strapped to get by during the pandemic, but there has to be a better way to operate so that all stakeholders involved have a positive experience. Needless to say with the photos attached, the food was great and the drinks hit the spot.  But El Centro can prove to be more stressful than it's worth at times, especially with all of the other Mexican restaurant options in town.

Dear Jacob, I want to thank you for your review and your feedback. It is always helpful for us to know how we can improve the experience for our guests. Our team is always striving to create a fun and memorable night and  I want to apologize because we clearly let you down. If you'd be willing, I'd be very appreciative if you'd let me try to make it up to you. Please email me at  guestrelations@richardsa…  or come by and ask for the manager on duty. I want to do whatever I can to make this right. We love making our guests happy and hate seeing them disappointed, so I hope you'll let us fix this as we'd love to serve you again soon.

Always 5 stars for El Centro! I was crushed to learn that the 14th Street location had closed permanently, but we'll always have the Georgetown one. The food is always solid -- hot, fresh, and flavorful. The same goes for the drinks, which are average in cost for the D.C. area. Obviously, we're still in the pandemic, and I was pleased to see El Centro taking so many precautions to keep limited indoor dining safe. Tables seemed to actually be more than 6' apart, which was great, menu is a QR code, and hand sanitizer and social distance floor markers are readily available. If you're looking for a taste of the before times, make a reservation at El Centro!
Hi Zack, We truly have the best guests! Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a glowing review and sharing your experience with us. We hope to serve you again soon!

I see all the other 1 star reviews so I see the experience is the same for everyone. I used to love El Centro's 14th Street location, but this location the service was absolutely terrible! We wanted to sit outside because inside was too hot. Two tables were finished but the waitress took 30 minutes to process their payment. We complained several times to the two people at the front desk that the tables were being serviced to no response.   As we stood there observing this for so long, we saw that no table was brought silverware and napkins. Every table had their food delivered with no silverware. You would think after the first incident the waitress would think to bring the silverware when she takes the order but no. One time the server brought out three plates of food, put it on a tray on the sidewalk and left, never to return. The table only realized  this 15 minutes later and just took their plates, with no silverware. How do you leave people's plates on the sidewalk with so many people walking by??? When we ordered food, same thing happened, so I asked the man who delivered our food if he could bring us forks, he didn't. The table next to us said they got their food without water or the cocktails they ordered. The Esquites was way too spicy and not served with any chips.  The bathroom on the first floor was gross. It connects to a large closet where the staff keep their cleaning supplies and the door was left open and the room was dark which was creepy so I didn't use that bathroom. The table next to us did use that bathroom and took a picture of it. I used the other bathroom whose door doesn't lock properly.  We went upstairs for the late night dancing and they don't have club lighting so its practically pitch dark in there.  We asked for plastic cups to take our drinks to go but the cap didn't fit the cup. Is this McDonalds, do they serve multiple sized drinks? The waitress brought back a new cap that didn't have a straw hole.  Never returning.

This was the worst bottomless brunch ever. We walk in the door and are instantly hit with a foul smell. It was like a combination of cow manure and feet. We should have left then.   The drinks....disgusting. The margarita tasted like rubbing alcohol, water and lime. The mimosa tasted like flat sparkling wine and watery orange juice. The bloody Maria tasted like watery tomato juice and spices. None of them were good.  The food was decent but, nothing to rave about.  Needless to say, we won't return.

Food subpar, Service... what service? I made a reservation here to celebrate a birthday at their Happy Hour. The prices looked good and I read good reviews on the food. Much to my dismay my experience was not at all as I expected.  We were sat at a table in an uncomfortable far corner next to a DJ booth, with steps leading up to the level,  where one seat was dangerously close to those steps and the person who sat there was uncomfortable the entire time. Our server did not pay us ANY attention whatsoever. We had to call him over several times, which was the ONLY way we could get his attention and place our orders. He did not give us silverware or napkins, we had to grab them from a table near by AND clear our own dishes from the table by stacking them ourselves and placing them on the table next to us. I wish I could make excuses for the poor level of service but we did notice that all the other tables received attentive service and were cleared as well.  To make matters worse, when it came time to pay and we requested separate checks our server admitted that he did not know what each of us had, so we had to write it down for him... I repeat, we had to write it down for him. Which added even more time to our checking out process which was already delayed because our table was being ignored. The food was just okay. The Happy Hour margaritas tasted watered down and inconsistent. Obviously, I will never return there again. There are FAR too many better restaurants in Georgetown to return where the food/bev is subpar and service is non-existent.
Start your review of  Mission .

Mutual agreement - Maki is probably the nicest waitress we've ever had in our lives. Fantastic service from start to finish - she got our orders right, took back an item when the kitchen slipped up, and had us laughing the entire night. She is a born entertainer. Great place overall, and we will be back, but Maki was the highlight for sure.

We recently hosted a birthday party in the Loft room of Mission and it was fantastic! Coordinating and reserving the room with Kati was a breeze, the room was spacious, and the private bar and bartender was amazing. I highly recommend Mission in DuPont Circle for any events!

My partner and I stopped here for dinner with a friend on a Saturday night (10/2). We're from out of town and our friend suggested The Mission because of the great food and lively night energy. She was right! We loved the extensive outdoor seating. Our server, Maki, was attentive, professional, and friendly. We could tell the place was absolutely slammed and Maki was juggling way more than one server should have to. Still, she made our night! Kudos to her, the other servers, and all of the kitchen staff who were obviously working with a short staff. Food was delicious, especially the mushroom tacos!!

A go-to happy hour or brunch spot in Dupont Circle! I am long overdue for a Mission review. Bottomless brunch drinks: server very attentive and consistently checked on our table and brought out more drinks. Food: is it the best Mexican food in DC? No. But I have not had a bad experience with any of my visits. Food and drinks are consistently good. I recommend the tacos or quesadilla. Their chips are delicious too!!  Great place for groups and they have a ton of heated outdoor seating. Decent happy hour deals as well. The atmosphere is very fun at night. Would definitely recommend Mission if you are looking for bottomless brunch drinks or a good weekday happy hour.

This is the most honest review you will see. I am a 25 year old. I came here with high expectations, the menu looked wonderful and the bottomless brunch was looking promising. We got here at 1:15 and were greeted appropriately, the waitress took our order, brought us out drinks but was then not seen for another 45 minutes. In that time our food was brought to us. My girlfriend waiting for our waitress to come back just to ask for sour cream (took 40 minutes), and i sat there with the coldest enchilada you ever did feel. We paid for the bottomless brunch but were served one drink within the hour. The food was fine, but mine was cold since the second it touched my table.  It is a fine place to get drunk at bottomless (if your waiter comes back before 45 minutes) but not worth the price for unlimited drinks that arent attended to. I understand the shortage of workers at the moment but not being checked in on for 45 minutes is a bit ridiculous.  The eats are fine as long as long as your fine with cold food and not getting your moneys worth for the bottomless brunch.  Thanks :)

I am normally not a fan of DC brunch but Mission has changed my perspective. First off, the serving sizes are huge, unlike the other bottomless bunch places  who serve only small plates.  Second, all your food is delivered at once which I can appreciate. A lot of bottom brunch places deliver food slowly so you can full quicker.  Last, despite our server working both the top and bottom floors - she was extremely courteous and attentive. This is probably me new favorite brunch place!
Their brunch menu is limited but love their bottomless mimosa! The staff and waitress is wonderful and friendly! I would like to try their happy hour menu one  of those days!

Nice place in a nice area. The drinks are pretty good, and the food is fine (though nothing super exciting). Service was nice but definitely rushed since the place is pretty big and busy. It was a nice vibe but not one that I would spend a ton of time at or make the main part of a night out.

New to the area- I have celiac and I ate here and didn't get sick which is super important  to me!!!!!!! We had an amazing waitress (can't remember her name but we were upstairs and she had awesome curly hair and glasses) but she was really great and understanding of my issues and just so friendly and bubbly. Also, good prices for large portions, attached a nacho pic/ couldn't finish it it was soooooo good

My friends wanted to do brunch last minute in DC and considering how reservations book up quickly (1. Due to COVID 2. Because DC brunch is amazing), this was the only place I could think of that had bottomless drinks + available reservations.  God bless the weather was pleasant this day, because I could only get outdoor seating at an appropriate time. I had originally made the reservations for 1:30PM, but of course I was running late and they called so I decided to change it to 1:45PM.  We got seating right outside the restaurant as opposed to the street - another bonus! Half of my party had already arrived by the time we got there.  Our kind server informed us about bottomless brunch. We all ordered our drink of choice. As my previous review, I still share the same sentiments on their service. It took him FOREVER to bring out our drinks. Luckily, it was pitchers vs actually glasses so we didn't have to constantly track him down for refills. I know it's not his fault and more so the bartender (which he mentioned), so he gave us tequila shots on the house!  Onto the food -  I ordered the Taco Salad...again. Impressed this time. No mistake from last time with the added meat. Honestly, I should've ordered something else but nothing enticed me. The salad was basically just lettuce, cheese, and dressing. I wish there was salsa, sour cream, beans, ya know what a Mexican salad should have!  My boyfriend ordered the tacos, but said the meat was too dry. It could honestly be because it was or because he didn't add any sauces because of his dairy allergy.  My friend ordered the breakfast quesadilla, which I had a bite, but I don't eat eggs or mushrooms so I didn't enjoy it. My other friend ordered the chicken enchiladas and he said they were also mediocre. The drinks were strong and I'm glad I didn't throw up knowing how much tequila and sour/citrusy drinks disturb my stomach.   I'm not sure if I'll be making myself back here for brunch, but it is a great last minute option!

I came here for brunch for St. Patrick's day. First of all, I made reservations so not sure why they had us waiting for over 15-20 minutes. Finally got our seats and waited another 20 minutes for our waiter! We wanted to get brunch going before it ended and get as many bottomless drinks as possible, but at this rate that wasn't going to happen. Finally the waiter came and we gave in our order. I ordered a taco salad with no chicken. Of course when I got my salad, there was chicken on it! The waiter took it back and brought me basically a bowl of lettuce and dressing. At this point I gave up wanting to eat. I was expecting a literal Mexican salad. I can get a better Mexican salad at chipotle for a fraction of the price. Besides that, the drinks took forever to be filled. We had gotten our food, but no napkins or silverware so we had to wait to eat. Service was not so great. I understand it was St. Patrick's day, but still. My friend also didn't like his tacos and thought the tortilla was a day odd. Food wise this place didn't hit the spot, brunch vibes it did.
Start your review of  Mission .

Mission is a great place to go for happy hour! I went with a friend and we got a mimosa pitcher that was a good deal. I got the chicken tacos which were at happy hour price and they were very tasty. We were able to sit outside and enjoyed the weather, but it was very crowded. One complaint is that we had to wait around 15 minutes even though we had a reservation. They also make sure that you don't stay at the table past a certain time limit. Other than that, it was an enjoyable experience!

So I was really excited about having brunch here, since my friend was bragging so much about their brunch and drink deals! The drinks were phenomenal, I was tipsy after two drinks which for brunch is acceptable, right ? The food looked so good but when I ordered the shrimp quesadillas that come with veggies and jalapeños... came with just a few pieces of shrimp and cheese! The service was good before the food... and then when the food came, the service got so slow.... I couldn't even exchange it for something else! That was disappointing! The tostada my friend ordered came without beans or any protein which she specified! So, overall i would give them a 3/5 since the main thing we came for was the brunch food and that was very disappointing! But... The fries were very good though!

I love the setup they have on the outside, and the weather is beautiful for that outside seating. The food is goos, but my fajitas were all the way cooked and chewy.  The service and the waiters are on point and this is key for restaurant, especially with all the people and outside sitting

Good food, ambiance and music here. They have lots of different indoor and outdoor seating options. They're also open till midnight, hence a good late night watering hole as well.  The house margaritas and palomas were pretty good. For food, we got a small bowl of guacamole. Size is def small but fresh and delicious. Also got the al pastor and steak tacos. Both of them were very good and quite filling, though the steak taco was slightly sweet.  Overall, very good spot for Mexican food. They have good happy hour deals as well. Would def recommend coming here if you're in the area.

Bottom Line Up Front (BLUF): Fun Friday Vibe! Made the trip from Alexandria, know your directions because if you rely on GPS be prepared for the DC transit stress. Lucked up on street parking though. Surprisingly there was no wait for inside (pre-pandemic definitely would be a wait). Got to table and waitress promptly greeted us, answered a few curiosities and took a drink/appetizer order (White Sangria, Sierra Nevada Hazy IPA, Mission Margarita and the Chips and Chorizo Queso Fundido).  Wife liked Sangria and I thought it was refreshing as well. Mission Margarita is on draft so it wasn't as balanced as an individually made Margarita. The Sierra Nevada was great nice citrus taste and smooth going down. Star of the night was the Queso Fundido w/ Chorizo and Chips. Chips are the best I've ever had and the Queso did not have a heavily produced Queso taste, it was perfect.  Entrees came shortly after (Chicken Enchiladas, Braised Pork Al Pastor Taco, and Steak Dinner Burrito). Wife had Enchiladas and she like them. I tasted them and they were ok, sauce was good but the lettuce at the top was not for me. The Al Pastor Taco was good, I'd double back for it again (waitress recommended flour tortilla, great call for the portion). Steak Burrito was good as well but only finished half (hoping the reheat at home makes it even better).  So for the Friday night vibe of DCs DuPont Circle, a great restaurant atmosphere, and the Chips and Queso Fundido, I definitely recommend Mission and that's the bottom line!

After checking out the Swingers Crazy Golf nearby, we decided to grab light bites at Mission Dupont. Since there was a long wait for outdoor dining, we decided to grab a table inside. Our server Erin S. was warm, friendly, and hospitable and our service was excellent.  Brendan enjoyed a Mission Margarita, which was made of agave based tequila, triple sec, lime juice, and simple syrup shaken, served over the rocks, and garnished with a lime wedge in a semi-transparent blue-colored glass.  We shared a mild Guacamole, which was topped with a dollop of salsa and served with crispy tortilla chips. Each of us enjoyed a taco without fresh jalapenos. Brendan enjoyed the Mexican Chorizo taco, which consisted of a corn tortilla with braised chorizo, pico de gallo, cotija cheese, and mexican crema crispy potatoes. I enjoyed the Arrachera Steak, which consisted of a corn tortilla with marinated carne asada, pico de gallo, shaved romaine, and manchego. Both tacos were full of flavor.

I hosted a happy hour at Mission Dupont for my graduate school student organization, and the experience from start to finish was fantastic. Kati made reserving the event space extremely easy, and helped me find a good way to maximize our budget. Our bartender was very helpful and responsive, and our group had a great event. Would recommend!

Came here with friends before the nats game and it was definitely the spot to be at. It was busy and loud but a lot of fun. My food was great, I loved the breakfast burrito and the potatoes were very well seasoned. I also liked the chips a lot, on the denser side and salted well. Only downside was my friends food came out later than ours, but they took it off the bill and understandably they were really busy. I'd like to come back another time on a day less busy than the last nats game of the season. Bottomless drinks were definitely worth it too, they had options for the whole group: mimosas, beer, bloody Mary's, and margs.

Great place for some Tex-Mex! The staff is friendly, service is quick, and the food has always been amazing. The potatoes that are served at brunch are so delicious. My only complaint is that the first time I went, there were empanadas in the menu that were some of the best I've ever had, but they don't seem to be on the menu anymore.  Would definitely recommend!

Love Mission!!! Despite knowing it's more of a young adult, happy hour crowd, I took my 3 boys (who are over the age of 9 and well behaved). We arrived a little on the earlier side of the evening, before it got crazy busy with happy hour goers.  We started with queso fundido which holy moly I wish I could eat that all day, everyday. It's the kind of queso that you can dip with chips. Not the queso fundido you see in some Mexican restaurants that you have to eat in a soft tortilla shell.  So damn good.  For dinner I had 2 tacos, chicken and beef and they were perfect.  Honestly y'all. If you're expecting to go to a Mexican restaurant and have your food taste all Old El Paso then that's not true Mexican food. Mission has it right. This is what authentic tacos taste like.  For dessert I had to order 2 orders of the churros and my boys wanted me to order a 3rd! It's true, they're ridiculously delicious. They literally melt in your mouth. It's insane. I'm not sure I've ever had a churro that's tasted so good.  Also, skinny margarita is delicious!  I'm not from DC but I will definitely stop in the next time I'm here!
Start your review of  Chaia .

Wow, what a pleasant surprise and delicious experience! Healthy and delicious food served in minutes at a very reasonable price: what more could you ask for? I was genuinely blown away by the variety of vegetarian options to choose from, the amazing flavor, and the speed with which I got my order. The cauliflower taco was especially yummy. I will be back many, many times. This place is worth every penny.

Chaia Tacos speak to my soul! These tacos are spectacular.  The menu will often chage based upon the season, but so far fall has the best flavors in my opinion (and I'm pretty picky).  This time I removed the cheese and all 3 tacos STILL had amazing flavors.  Don't sleep on Chaia Tacos!  My only recommendation would be to open a location in Union Market

This place is not in plain sight. If you are looking for vegetarian/vegan tacos, I would recommend this place as there is a lot of flavor in most of the tacos. I ordered the eggplant, sweet potato, and the mushroom ones and they were good. The eggplant was a bit soggy and the mushroom one was a but tough. The flavor was there for both and the sweet potato was just the sweet potato flavor overall. It was nothing that I would travel very far for. The layout of the place was interesting.  I probably wouldn't come back again as 3 tacos were $11 and I did not think it was worth it.

Ummmm...where have these tacos been my whole life?!  My family asked me to pick lunch. None of them like mushrooms and I had been craving a mushroom taco since basically the start of my life so as soon as I saw this menu I knew it was where we would end up for lunch.  Their ordering system is completely self driven. You can order from your phone or order from the kiosk inside the restaurant. It is and easy to use system and took no time at all.  My youngest child ordered the cheese quesadilla because she's super picky and I wanted her to have something she would actually eat. She devoured it so needless to say, it must have been good.  My oldest child had the skillet corn taco, the creamy kale and potato taco, and the scrambled egg and black bean taco. She said they were all really good, but the creamy kale taco really surprised her with how delicious it was. She commented that we obviously need to come back here so she can try some of the others.  I had the braised mushroom taco, the sweet potato hash taco, and the creamy kale and potato. All of them were so flavorful, so delicious. They were exactly what I was looking for. I also tried the chips and dip and really enjoyed the tahini black bean (the habanero pepita was very good too, I just preferred the texture of the black bean dip).  My husband had the sweet potato hash taco and skillet corn taco and gave them both two thumbs WAY up.  Such a great lunch or dinner spot. We will definitely be back.
I liked it, and the prices aren't bad! Very good , healthy, vegan food. I would have like to see outdoor seating, and the wait was kind of long, but I'll definitely be back!

Beyond delicious, super reasonable prices, and almost no wait time. Came in at about 5:30 and had my three tacos and drink by 5:35, ordering is on a tablet so it's super quick. Three tacos come for 11 dollars which seems beyond reasonable especially in Georgetown. Love that you're able to mix and match tacos and love the vegan options. Absolutely delicious food, my favorite was the sweet potato taco, sweet potatoes were delightfully crispy but still soft on the inside. Food had great flavor and was delightful. Will be returning.

I had every single taco here. Amazing. The best ones were the corn, creamy potato, and sweet potato. The mushroom was good too. My least favorite was the eggplant. That was kind of soggy. I loved the food here. I would absolutely come back.

Delicious, happens to be gluten free, and also has plant based cheese options! We absolutely loved the tacos, especially the kale and potato taco. Apparently it's their most popular. Will definitely be back when we're in the area! Also have truly delicious kombucha on tap (tastier than just bottled). Loved the ginger one. Some indoor seating. Lovely airy yet casual atmosphere. Great customer service as well.

We stopped in here since my travel companions are vegan. So, yes, there are vegan as well as vegetarian options. The ordering process is all on a touchscreen tablet, which there is only one of. So, if they are busy, the wait time kind of increases because you have to wait for people to complete their order on the tablet. Then, people were waiting in the little alcove right next to the tablet for their orders to be called so it was confusing to know who was in line to order and who was in line to pick up their order. I think that part could be streamlined to not make the entryway and food preparation area look so cluttered.  The dining room is pretty small and they seemed to still have the tables spaced out for social distancing so that made things look even smaller. There is an additional dining area upstairs but on the day we went it was quite warm outside and the heat rose to the upstairs portion which is not air-conditioned. The downstairs was air-conditioned though. The bathroom is also upstairs and the lock/latch was broken, so you kind of had to lean against the door or hope no one busted in on you which you're using the toilet.  Now for the food, I ordered the black bean enchiladas and a scrambled egg and black bean taco on the side. The enchiladas take a bit of time to make as they have to bake them. The aluminum container that they were baked in was scalding hot, so if you order them, please proceed with caution when taking them out of the bag or taking off the lid. It was kind of a good thing it was scalding since the taco seemed lukewarm and actually quite unremarkable and the enchilada container seemed to heat up the taco so it was actually palatable. The enchiladas were perfect though. *chef kiss* The cheese was amazing and the black beans were subtle in flavor but melded together with the authentic tortillas and sauce and green rice. Per the menu it's "two enchiladas with pepper jack, salsa verde and pea greens, served with our herby green rice." I think since they were piping hot, that also helped since I was so hungry. So it was worth the wait.  The total price was $13 for the enchiladas and $4.50 for the individual taco. The enchiladas were actually very filling and I could have done just fine without the taco. I also got a bottle of water which I think was $4.50 so a pretty decent meal for just over $20.

I've been coming to Chaia for years after stumbling across them from dcfoodporn's instagram. The food has always been nothing short of exceptional. They create the most delicious tasting vegetarian tacos with homemade tortillas, creative ideas, and healthy ingredients. I have never had tacos that taste so good and original/unique. My favorite taco is the creamy kale and potato. I can't even describe what it tastes like but all I can say is that this taco is must get if you come here. I also love their sides of black beans and rice. The black beans are so creamy and top them with crema and jalapeños. The green rice made with pesto, feta, and pumpkin seeds which elevates the rice so much. I love the little crunch of the pumpkin seed. Overall  this is one of my favorite restaurants and I definitely will be back soon!
Start your review of  Chaia .

Honestly, I'm baffled at all the positive reviews, because my food was terrible.  No flavor, no seasoning. I ordered the mushroom taco and the eggplant taco, and this was the worst meal I had in a while.  Ftr: I'm vegan!

Hi Catherine, we are sorry the food did not meet your expectations.  As you can see from our other reviews, flavorless food is not the norm so we’d like to make it right. Please email us at  info@chaiatacos.com  to redeem a free lunch or dinner on us.

We weren't expecting this. This was the best meal we had on an 8 day trip. It was some of the best and freshest Mexican food I've had in a while. Everything was made right in front of us. Also the adult drinks were delicious.  Also the owner and staff were super nice and helpful

Lived up to the reviews.  We really enjoyed our tacos from here.  The service is great too.  You have to order on a kiosk but the people working are super friendly and helpful.  I am so glad we finally got to try this healthy veggie taco place out.  I can't wait to try the enchiladas next time.  The price for the food is great too.  We got the egg and beans tacos and sweet potato tacos. Everything was excellent.

How did it take me this long to try these AMAZING tacos? Chaia is the perfect place to grab a meal to go and eat by the waterfront. I got the sweet potato taco and an order of chips and tahini black bean dip. All of us tried the sweet potato taco and everyone gave it rave reviews. The flavors were subtle but still really tasty, and it was surprisingly filling. I loved the bean dip, too. The tahini adds such a unique flavor. I'll definitely come back here when I'm hungrier to try more of their taco flavors!

these are some great tacos, the variety is amazing and the quality and environment was good. I order a classic trio of tacos, sweet potato hash, creamy kale and potato, and smoky collard greens. The taste with all was amazing and I'm very happy with my order. The only problem with the restaurant is the music was a bit loud
I'm not vegan, but I love a good taco. The potato tacos I ordered were very good, while the egg taco was not my favorite. Overall, would come back if I'm around the Georgetown area
Best vegetarian tacos I've had! Got two: chipotle sweet potato hash and scrambled egg & black bean.
Delicious food!!!! A truly unique meatless experience without the use of processed plant based alternatives. Such variety and creative cuisine! My favorite was the creamy kale and potato.

I tried this place on Saturday afternoon after my coworkers were raving about the tacos. Since I'm vegetarian it's nice to find a place that has a lot of vegetarian options! I ended up ordering every taco except for the eggplant taco. My favorites were the mushroom, kale, green beans, and corn. I ordered the green rice on the side which was OK. I also had the black beans, which were a little salty. I would definitely recommend this place for any vegetarians. They were very organized, placing a takeout order was easy.

So I have always been curious about vegan tacos but never had the chance to try them until now. The inside setup is small but there is also patio seating if needed. Ordering is self but there is also someone to verbally take your order as well. We got the recommended tacos: creamy kale potato, braised mushroom, and sweet potato along with a squash blossom quesadilla. The tacos were as everyone else described and for the same price point I would probably just go to my local taco place (since I do not have dietary restrictions).
