The standout was the creamy kale and potato mushroom for me. It was unique in flavor profile --creamy, starchy, and also slightly sour from the pickled radish. The braised mushroom left little to be desired and the sweet potato was just sweet potato. The real winner was the quesadilla. I have never had vegan cheese taste so great and it went perfectly with the spicy sauce it came with. The chips and sauce were also great! Overall, as a non-vegan would maybe come back if I craved some quesadillas or a unique taco.

Best tacos I've had in so long! My boyfriend and I came with $19 cash but our order of 6 asada tacos and a coke came out to $20 we told the man helping us we were short a dollar even told him to take the coke back so we had enough, he not only gave us the tacos and coke for $19 he also gave us 1 miso taco for free! I 100% will recommend to everyone wanting bomb authentic tacos!

If I could give them more stars..I would! My boyfriend has been coming here for years & I recently gave them a try and blew my mind! Fantastic tacos, my favorites include the asada, pastor & campechanos:) The flavor is impeccable & all the meats are juicy and tender.  I highly recommend checking this place out. I personally think they have one of the best tacos in the DMV & eating here is truly an experience!

3/5 stars for tacos, 5/5 stars for service. My husband and I each got a pollo, asada, and al pastor which came out to $18. We paid $25 and wanted to leave the remainder as tip, but the cashier insisted he also throw in a Mixto. That was really nice!  After paying, we waited probably around 10-15 minutes even though they said it would take 3-5 minutes. We have no problem waiting, but it does suck a little having misaligned expectations. I noticed a lot of people came up and picked up faster, so I am assuming call ahead is the way to go.  When we finally got the tacos, we came back to our apartment and went one by one. The Pollo was okay, slightly on the drier side. The al pastor was definitely the best. Our asada tacos were a little off, the tortillas were really chewy almost like they were stale. And then we split the last Mixto taco, which was decent.  Idk, maybe it was just going in with really high expectations but my mind wasn't blown. If I go back, it'll be just for the Al Pastor tacos or to try something else.

Re-upping my review. Best tacos in the DMV hands down. I've been going about once a week for over five years lol. When they ask if you want habanero, say yes. Also, most the people giving this fewer than five stars are gringas from SoCal who want to feel special and say they're from LA.
Best tacos in the area hands down. Also, Jesus is awesome. Great customer service. I go here at least once a week for lunch and I've never been disappointed.

Don't walk to Chilango RUN!!! These are literally the best tacos I've ever had. My favorite are the pacos which are a blend of chicken & chorizo topped with his salsa verde you can't go wrong. Aside from the tacos being phenomenal the owner Chilango is one of a kind, he is extremely welcoming & happy to serve you & makes sure your order is always right. As a frequent customer he treats you like family! If I could give it ten stars I would don't miss out & try the best tacos in Arlington.

We passed this on our way to another restaurant and felt compelled to come back here another day after seeing it. Super quick to order. Their menu is pretty straight forward. My friend says I'm pretty harsh on street tacos so let me say these are probably in the top 10 tacos I've had in my lifetime. They are flavorful, adequate amount of meat and cilantro/onions and their shells didn't fall apart on me. The staff was super nice and welcoming. I had ordered 1 steak and 1 Campechano. They asked if we wanted the habanero sauce which I believe was like a pickled onion. This is where they really thrive! If you love spicy, get it!!! The tingling and burning is doable and lingers but is just the right amount. I loved their verde sauce and the red sauce was just okay--just a note that I generally prefer the verde over the red sauce almost 9 out of 10 times. I need more tacos like this in my life and really shortchanged myself by only ordering two. Side note: my friend ordered the chicken which she also liked. She said it was flavorful!
The best tacos in Arlington.  Fresh authentic tacos with excellent friendly service.  If you don't a lot of time call to place your order it gets really busy at lunch time but it's worth the wait

If you're not having tacos here, you're not doing life right. This is the tacos al pastor. They have perfected every flavor element. I have fallen in love with a taco truck.  Personally they are all good. But the sauces are dank. All the meats are juicy and perfectly flavor. It's just a well balanced palette.  CASH ONLY. Honey, I carry cash only for this place.

You know it's 5 Star Worthy when your brother has his birthday lunch picked up from here for the last 4 years and counting. I told my fam that their tacos are ten fold better than the ones I had in Tulum, Mexico when I was there for a week last summer!!,.  The tacos are authentic, ingredients fresh, the meat juicy, and best of all- the service top notch. The owner always has a beaming smile and friendly conversation. He has spaced out lines to stand on and sanitizer for precautions and his truck is immaculate as it's open from the back so you can see them working.  You can layer different salsas they give to up the heat to what you feel comfortable with, the green one is my go-to. For meat---steak is my favorite, tongue is my brothers fave.  It's become a tradition and we look forward to it even if it is a 50 minute drive to pick it up, worth it :)

What a hidden gem! Some of the best tacos in the DMV and at a great price ($3/taco). I ordered a chorizo taco and a mixed chicken and sausage taco, and they were perfect. Juicy and flavorful, with just the right amount of spice. I especially loved how they were served with radish and cucumber, which added a nice crunch.  The owner, Jesus, heard it was my first time visiting, so he made me a special el pastor taco for free. Delicious again, and just a perfect example of how friendly the people are here at the truck! I know I'll be back soon.

These tacos are great! There were a lot of people waiting but we got our order pretty quickly. Tortillas are amazing, the meat was a little dry. Salsas were good! There was street parking right near the truck.

Delicious tacos with the traditional onion and cilantro toppings, radish and lime on the side. The steak are my go-to and the chicken are my husband's go-to. Both are juicy and flavorful. $3/taco I highly recommend.
Best Street Tacos in the Area!! Authentic and fresh a must go to!! The mixto with fresh habenero is where it's at

The BEST tacos in the DMV by far. These tacos are filled with so much flavor. Everything is perfection. Their salsas have great texture and heat. All the other tacos I've tried in the DMV don't even compare to the tacos here. Highly recommend and they service was excellent as well.
Most authentic Tacos in DMV! Delicious food; friendly owner, Jesus and team are friendly and helpful. Cash only but who cares!
Tacos are decent one of the best in the area, Tacos al pastor, lengua had a good taste.
The best taco food truck! The tacos are so authentic and delicious . This has been my go to taco place for years now.

Super fun to try in Arlington! We were driving around looking for parking and my boyfriend saw the truck. He immediately decided that was indeed what we were going to have for lunch. When we walked up there was a little line forming. Definitely a local favorite for sure. As the other reviews mention, this spot is CASH ONLY. We ordered 5 tacos (phrased as, "I'll have 3 and she'll have 2"), but they came out to us on one plate with no mention of what the different ones were. Not a huge deal, but a little tricky when you're eating off of a ledge on the side of the road with paper plates. Hey, you get what you pay for and this is no doubt a deal. Just presentation wise, I could've used a slight upgrade. Again, not really here to judge cutlery... Moving on... The flavors are amazing. I had a steak taco and a chorizo (I think!) and thought the steak was cooked very well. The fresh onion and cilantro were on point too. No frills (a little mess and fuss), just some darn good street tacos. I'd try again next time as a to go order.
Yum, amazing food! Would highly recommend... I am never disappointed. So fresh and tasty
Sooooooooooo good wow go support this guy absolutely delicious and the guy is super nice! He hooked it up really hard dude go here
Tacos are fire!!!! Been craving them for a while now. Finally had a day off, had to take advantage lol. After a beautiful day truly the spot you'd love to go eat!!

Literally THE. BEST. TACO. SPOT.  I highly recommend making a visit here! My friend and I ordered the Birria tacos - chicken tinga and grilled chicken and they were excellent!! They come with a beef side and are sooo juicy and delicious. They have pickled onions, jalepenos, cheese, and other good ingredients in there. We also got the loaded chicken tinga fries and they were amazing!! I am definitely coming back here very soon. Very satisfied

I really love their Mexican street corn. Whenever I come to Mixt Food Hall I always grab a few sides to enjoy. I've also had their jackfruit tacos which are pretty good. They are cashless - just walk up, place your order on the electronic pad, pay with your card and wait for your order.  While you wait - grab a drink from the bar. The non-alcoholic drinks are just as good as the alcoholic ones.

If y'all want some bomb birria tacos make sure you go anywhere but Little Miner Taco...not only do you have to take your own order, the service sucks and the tacos are . Dry tortilla, dry meat, no cheese and no dipping sauce. Also, the street corn is way over priced...$8 for a few spoonfuls smh.

I love Little Miner! I have gotten tacos from their truck, and now their Brentwood location. The birria taco is incredibly delicious, from the meat to the stew to the shell. I also tried the side of street corn (corn with cheese, sauce, and spices), and it's also fantastic. My gf got the burrito with fries inside, which had a lovely sauce on it and was also great. I don't live nearby so I can only hope they open a location closer to me soon! If you know what you want, I suggest ordering ahead so it's ready when you get there - they are popular for good reason!
So fresh so fun so flavorful ! Delicious! Great start to the day! Would love to have this fresh and not delivered with an hour wait time on uber eats lol ! Great job to the restaurant tho

Ordered this for delivery from Uber eats. Overall the food is decent. I ordered the carne asada fries, birria steak and cheese, with sides of salsa. This place seemed very promising, but  with the couple of missing pieces and lack of attention to detail I probably won't order from them again.  Birria Steak and Cheese: I was starving so I ate half before taking the photo. The entree is described as having onions, cheese, cilantro, and chipotle sauce. As you can see there really wasn't any onions or cilantro. I paid for added guacamole which also wasn't included, however I did get my refund. I requested the sauce on the side so that it did not get soggy. It was decent, definitely missing the refreshing balance of cilantro or onions. It just feels too heavy and salty, unfortunately not anything special. I included a photo of how it's described and shown. Obviously I don't anticipate my food (especially when delivered) to be just as shown, but this is to show the description and what's clearly missing.  This was also missing the side of beef consommé as described by the Uber Eats menu. However I did receive the sides of salsa I requested.  Carne Asada Fries: This hit the Mark a little more. It could have used the guacamole or something like radish to pull it all together.

Since there isn't a Yelp for their taco truck I'll just review this on their main page.  Stopped here on a trip to the Towson area where their truck was set up.  My main concern is that there isn't an option to do online ordering for the food truck so you have to go and stand in line for 20-30 minutes depending how busy they are. Definitely need to have online ordering ON.  Ordered 3 carne asada tacos, along with an order of the street corn.  The steak was good - very tender - and the sauce was good. I also really liked the taco shells themselves.  The street corn was okay - the corn kernels were somewhat wilted and didn't look too good - but the sauce and cheese was very good.  Overall I liked it - would rather go to a sit down version and try it.

What you see is what you get at Little Miner Taco. In other words as it is advertised is what you get so if you want salsa or any other type of sauce/condiment include it with your order and expect to pay an extra dollar or two. That isn't a problem at all just a helpful hint. Now I have been on the hunt for a "slap your mama" it's so good Taco for some time and today I can say I still haven't found it. Though the tacos were average to good, they were not great or the best I've ever had. The tacos were very fresh tasting which I like. But they were lacking the flavor of a really good taco.  As for the street corn....yes!! Get it, taste it, you'll enjoy it! And the Queen Wrapped Burrito is delicious. If I had only ordered the burrito this would have been an easy 4 rating...if not a low 5. The kid's meals are free and they are good as are the fries.  Would I go back? Yes, why yes I would after all I haven't tried all the burritos. New Name Alert "Little Miner Burrito" because our tacos just aren't that great.

I picked up the Birria de res Quesotacos from here and they were delicious! I ordered the guacamole and it was really good, lots of flavor.  I recommend getting 2 orders of guacamole since it's small & not ideal for sharing. The restaurant is located in a food court. There is seating available and a few parking spots around.  Ordering online through their website was easy and my meal was ready when I arrived.

I'm blown away - the birria tacos with broth was the most delicious food truck fare I've had in a very long time.  I eat red meat maybe twice a year, but I'm pleased with this exception to my normal pescatarian diet! The beef was tender and crazy flavorful, not to mention very fresh and well crafted. Crack!!!

The birria tacos are the bomb! That's it and that's all. Soo good! I'd suggest ordering online and doing pick up just to avoid waiting outside. We actually walked in and placed an order. It was contactless, you place your order on the monitors and make your payment. You'll receive a text when your food is ready.  The tacos are so flavorful. Can't wait to go back!

Ordered curbside pickup on a weekday afternoon. The estimated time was accurate and the link to notify them you're outside was easy to use. The tacos...it was my first time having Birria tacos. Believe the hype! It was exactly what I expected, and my expectations were high. The lime and the onions are a must. It all blends so well. The broth had a great taste to it. I love that this restaurant has multiple locations. Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu!

So good. This spot is located on the main floor of what looks like an apartment complex. There is limited parking, which may require you to be a little brave when it comes to parking. When you walk in, there are social distancing stickers on the floor, you wait in line until you go up the the front, where you use an iPad to make your order. You are then texted when your order is complete. We ordered 4 birria tacos and carne asada fries, which took about 15-20 min. So I would recommend calling ahead if possible.  When it comes to seating, there are tables and a bar inside, but no seating outdoors. So we ended up taking it to go.  The food was so bomb and kept well for the 20 min car ride back home. Will definitely go back.

Have been seeing this place on social media for a while and finally decided to give it a try.  Order was not correct and had to drive back (25+ minutes) to get the correct order.  Tried the birria with consume. No different from any other taco place in the area.  Liked that they put extra onion on the side. Street corn was different, have never had it not on the cobb. Liked the taste Unsure if I would return if I was in the area again

This was my second time having Little Miner. This was my first time trying their food truck. I must say I like the Brentwood location better. I ordered the carne fries and it was mediocre. It had a salty taste to it. The fries are like thick cut/potato wedges. My cousin tried it and loved it though. If you follow their IG you can see their schedule of where they will park the truck.  I ordered online and scheduled my pick up. Pick up was super fast. I would eat there again, but will make sure to go to the restaurant location.

Absolute Aces in my book! We got two queso burritos with carne asada and birria beef and a bulgogi beef burrito. The birria beef burrito was the best IMO so packed with flavor and I would compare it to have beef stew in a burrito. All the flavors really come through with it. The carne asada burrito was exactly what I was expecting with it being well, chopped up steak. It's not what I was in the mood for today but my coworker liked it. The bulgogi beef burrito was a different breed. It had kimchi fried rice, a different sauce and Korean sauced beef. Really good but it's a bit weird to me. I would expect this on it's own and on a plate but not in burrito form. Definitely worth a try for the people that like that kind of tangy korean flavor. There's a lot more to try here. I'm looking forward to going back for their taco Tuesday and oyster mushroom tacos.

I love this place. I'm pretty sure I've tried the whole menu but my go to's are the veggie burrito, chicken burrito supreme, and beef tacos (sooo good).  Not sure what people are talking about with the bad service reviews. I've always been treated kindly and had great service.

Super disappointing... Maybe I was spoiled growing up near Jackson Heights in Queens. Perhaps I was too coddled in Hartford & New Haven Counties during my twenties while residing in CT. I've even had SoCal tacos so my taste buds aren't completely East Coast biased. We ordered lengua (tongue for you uninitiated), cabrito (goat), chorizo, pork and two pupusas (one beans and the other herbs).  Let's start with the main reason we went to this spot, .  These are some of the worst tacos I've had in my life. From the double tortillas, to the meat, toppings and sauce on the side, nothing positive can be noted. Why are the tortillas burnt and crisped up in oil? Why are there two? Why is every meat seasoned exactly the same way and with too much salt? As someone who loves authentic Mexican food, it was insulting to see scallions, iceberg lettuce and wilted cilantro in my taco with tiny shreds of radish. But to make matters worse, there was no respect for the distinct flavor that each meat holds. A properly, pressure cooked lengua should never taste the same as shredded goat or pork. The end result is an aftertaste of fat mingled with the residue leftover of saltiness. Lastly, the sauce which is meant to breathe in the final notes of acidity, heat and seasoning into the taco was a watery mess with a kick but 0 flavor. The pupusas were the only saving grace due to their flavor although they too could have been improved by a higher ratio of masa to filling.  Thirty minutes later, I am sick to my stomach. I do not recommend and I will not be going back.

Still going strong! If they cleaned up the front of the shop and the kitchen a bit, I'd elevate to 5 stars. The proprietor isn't super big on cleaning, but that's how it goes sometimes. My current favorites: -goat burrito supreme -chorizo tacos -homemade hot sauce

Maybe not "authentic" as some have said, but still an outstanding take-out place with reasonable prices and quick service. My favorites:  goat tacos chicken fillet sandwich, beef tacos. Keep in mind that it can get very busy at certain times of the day.  Parking is limited and so are the stools inside.  Most people end up getting food to go.

Pupusas were horrible. They were just dough nothing inside and horrible after taste. Looked like they were pre-made. Steak tastes like it warmed up and not fresh. Bad portion of chicharrón to yucca. Will NOT go back!!  Plus guy at counter was in his phone and no one was wearing a mask!!

This place is a  neighbourhood gem! The owner started from a truck and worked his way up to a great restaurant. I like the fish burger and the tacos are very good as well. I highly recommend this spot if you are in the mood for tacos or pupusas done right!

The tacos here are amazing!!! They tend to use a lot of green onion which may not be for everyone, but I love it. The homemade salsa there is so incredibly flavorful as well! There is limited seating and it's cash only. Check this place out!

This used to be one of my favorite places to go to a while back.  Their tacos and pupusas were the best and I'd take every chance to go there.  However, I just went back after sometime, and the food is totally different. It barely has any flavor.  Maybe a portioning issue? And to top it off, there is a big sign on the door stating "you must wear a mask" which I think is great for the safety of everyone, but when you walk in, you see the person at the front counter without a mask taking your order and talking to people as they walk in, this becomes an integrity issue. This is a behavior that, to me, relates directly with the food integrity as well. In my opinion!

El Charrito may not be the best Mexican ever, but it is the cheapest Mexican food I have ever encountered. I always get the Chicken Burrito Supremo ($4), which comes with beans, cheese, rice, and lettuce. It has just the right amount of chicken, is super filling, and tastes delicious. Plus it's so cheap! I still want to try the pupusas and tacos.  My colleague has always brought food back so I have never been here, but I'm always excited when it shows up.

Awesome place to to get your taco fix! My tacos were sooooo good and normally I dress mine up with cheese and salsa but these amazing tacos don't require it. They add their own toppings and a side of their own sauce. I loved every bite , definitely would come back here. This is how tacos are supposed to taste.  Heads up, they only accept cash

I grew up eating here. It was just a few blocks away from my childhood home. I absolutely love this restaurant-- authentic, affordable, and absolutely delicious food. All my efforts trying to find a place like this far from home have proved unsuccessful. No restaurant ever has and ever could possibly be better than this one. My favorite thing to do in my hometown is come back here and order some beef and lengua tacos with the "white drink," formerly known as the "pink drink." Truly delicious and never disappoints. You know from just looking at this place that the food will be amazing. You'll never have to pay $14 for a burrito bowl at Chipotle again after tasting these AMAZING tacos. I've eaten at Michelin Star restaurants and none top the flavor of the food at El Charrito Caminante. Also a great place for takeout! The Cheese Pupusas were the epitome of my childhood. My dad would pick them up from work with a pink drink to surprise me and it always made my day. The yucca they make here is excellent as well.  This is the best Mexican restaurant you'll ever go to & I promise you won't regret it!
Start your review of  El Charrito Caminante .

Overall it wasn't that great. The prices have been raised so it's hard to let things slide. The pupusa revuelta was lacking in the meat and cheese. The yuca con chicharrón only had about for tiny pieces of chicharrón!! Four bite size pieces! The tamal de elote was a bit dry. However the tamal de pollo was delicious. It was not the best tamal I've had and I'll say that it is Salvadoran tamal and not a Mexican. In addition it's a cash only establishment. Finally, the service isn't friendly. Parking however is easy to find.
We absolutely love el charrito. Everything there is authentic, delicious, and you can't beat the price.

We stumbled upon this place and it's a hidden gem! FYI it's small, 5 barstools available, and they only take cash (there is an ATM inside). They have so many options but also have combos which is what I got. They give you so much food for $7.50! I got a pupusa (soooooo good), quesadilla, and yucca. But with the combo they also give you rice and beans. Such a good deal and big portions!

Was very thrown off by the steak and cheese, sandwich was extremely soggy, all the contents fell out, who the hell puts mustard in steak and cheese? Was very disappointed by the steak and cheese as it was my first time. Pupusas were mediocre, nothing out of the ordinary, tacos were pretty good however. For the pricing it was great but being a steak and cheese fanatic i was highly disappointed.

It's the hole in the wall type of gem That ARLINGTON doesn't like sharing with all the tourist and random people who drive through the area.  Tacos papupas carnisada u name it they got it! And it's decently priced and good portions!

Ok this place is a hidden gem. Their food is amazing, it's cheap, and the staff is very friendly.  I def recommend one of the combo meals. They come with rice and beans. The tacos and pupusas are by FAR my favorites. 4 stars because 1) I believe it's CASH ONLY and 2) I wasn't really impressed with their tamales (unfortunately I love tamales so this was a big letdown)

Different kind of Burritos.                                                                                                     Unlike burritos that we're familiar with everywhere, the shapes of their burritos are folded instead of bundled and sealed on both ends.                                                                             I ordered Burrito Supreme Cabrito (Goat Burrito Supreme) and that costs $5.00.              Good price for a decent size burrito.                                                                                            I didn't taste Mexican in the burrito (dense, black or pinto beans, spicy, lime) like when I get them anywhere in California, this was more like an El Salvadorian style of Burrito.                   It was like eating a large folded goat pupusa instead of a burrito.                                       adjust your expectations accordingly, it's only $5.00 and you're not in California.
They are the best taco's in NVA except for the taco truck located on 14 street between courthouse and Rosslyn
I normally go there at least once a week the tacos are very tasty, the service is not best the guy seems like he is angry all the time. That is why I don't give the 5 stars.

I am dealing with some serious taco cravings lately and this was yet another stop to get my fix. I was in the area and my Yelp Nearby found this place. And I am glad it did!!! We were lucky to get one of the coveted parking spots. There are quite a few but it is luck since it is a sheared lot.  I had the pork taco, beef taco, and queso papusa. It was too much food! Next time I would get two tacos and split a queso papusa. This place is small. And very, very casual. Really more like a takeout joint with some stools lining the counter. There were a couple of free stools on the end of the bar to sit. I sat while my friend placed the order. The other stools were taken. We were the only ones speaking English. While we waited, many men came and placed to go orders. Families started to pile in mid afternoon. Tacos were delivered to us.  Both tacos were flavorful. The queso papusa was also very good. Everything was made fresh.  There was a bottle of a hot sauce that got passed up and down the bar.  I would stop in here again to get my taco fix.
Start your review of  Super Tacos & Bakery .

Looking for authentic Hispanic food? I'm talking mariachi band on your tastebuds....Well what the heck are you doing at Taco Bell? Super Tacos & Bakery in Adams Morgan is where it's at!  Food: they have an extensive menu from tacos, burritos, chimichangas, flautas, etc. In addition to food, they also have a few dessert options including tres leches cake, churros, etc. Most meals come with beans, rice, and salsa. Between my husband and I, we've tried the hard shell chicken tacos, nachos, and flautas- all of it was tasty with the exception of the rice. We've had 3-4 experiences of the rice being hard and not all the way cooked.  Ambiance: it's a very small restaurant with very little indoor and outdoor seating. Very colorful inside. Most times that I've visited, there has been Hispanic music playing (almost too loud). Service: I don't have much to say here as I usually order via phone for pick-up. However, the last time I ate here I was pissed about my rice being hard again, so I called and asked to speak to the manager. When I asked for the manager, the woman on the receiving end just asked what was wrong, so I'm not even sure if I got to speak to the manager or an imposter.  Value: Great pricing for the amount of food you get.  Location: Located in the Adams Morgan area of Washington, DC. If you're not from the area, just know that locating a parking spot in the area can be a hassle.  4 stars because the rice isn't good and who wants refried beans without rice? Not I.

I've gotten takeout from Super Tacos a few times now, and each time it's been pretty good. I like that I can order online and by the time I get there to pick it up, it's ready. The tacos are always good - I haven't had one I didn't like yet. My fiancé recently got the chimichanga and said it was good too. The only thing I didn't love was the sopes. It was just too much onion and cilantro for me. Oh, if you don't like your guac chunky, you won't like it here. It's got loads of onions, tomatoes, and cilantro in it. I'll continue to get takeout here for the tacos and the salsas; they're ready quickly, reasonably priced, and delicious.

D.C. is definitely known for the jumbo slice, half-smoke, and wings with mumbo sauce. However, I've heard peeps complain about the lack of a decent taco joint in these parts. Are you kidding me? Apparently these naysayers don't know about Super Tacos & Bakery in Adams Morgan! Listen, don't sleep on this hole in the wall. I'm no taco aficionado, but Super Tacos can dish out a damn good taco. Talk about a fiesta for the taste buds. I always get the carnitas tacos...think tender, flavorful pork stuffed inside of a pillowy taco shell. FYI: They always add tasty toppings (small containers of pico de gallo, hot sauce, and pickled red onions) to my order. Now, let's talk about the refried beans. OMG! What a perfect side! Tastes like a concoction of homemade yum for the tum. No straight out of the can tomfoolery here. These refried beans are the real deal! Special mention: The menu is EXTENSIVE! There are lots of options to choose from...burritos, quesadillas, chimichangas, tortas (sandwiches), and sooo much more. For those who have a sweet tooth, there are dessert slices on deck. Need a cake for a special occasion? Look no further than Super Tacos & Bakery. Limited indoor and outdoor seating. You can do takeout or delivery. Personally, I prefer takeout. Extremely friendly and efficient customer service!

This was a cute shop by my Airbnb. Loved the selection and the service. I ordered the Pork Combo with a Jamaica as my drink. The Jamaica was great. Loved the Carnitas and Pastor Taco. The Chorizo was missing the spice but still a great taco. Would recommend if you want a filling and solid taco.
Kinda just middling. Had a mole tamale, a chicken taco, and the flautas. The flautas came with a red sauce with a kick, but the tacos and mole tamale were super bland.
Probably the best place ever. They treat everyone like family, and everything is just amazing.

I order from them monthly because the food is tasty, reasonably priced, and always arrives hot.  The serving sizes are large.  The tacos are flavorful, illegal burrito filling, and my fav, the chicken tamales-totally filling also. I grew up in LA and my family went to Mexico all the time, and could also easily find authentic Mexican food all over California.  This little place takes me back to my childhood and trips to Mexico.   Super Tacos is a little place where you can find really good Mexican food at a reasonable price in DC.
Thought the Al pastor tacos were just okay, they lacked flavor and we're soupy w liquid

I come here to pick up a carnitas, chicken, or steak burrito occasionally, it is always very good. They give me chips with queso and salsa with it. I haven't  been there for awhile , but it is a tasty burrito, I'd say one of the best burrito in DC I've had, not fancy at all just good fast food.

If you are looking to try different local Mexican food, I highly recommend trying Super Tacos! Their food is delicious and very affordable. Their ordering platform was very easy to navigate, so that also helped to make the experience very convenient and easy.  Onto the food! We ordered the Burrito Ilegal, Carne Asada Tacos, and the Nachos to share. The burritos were packed with fillings and flavor and were the perfect size for one person. They even came with a side of chips and cheese. The steak was cooked to perfection! It was definitely the highlight of the entree. As someone who likes smothering their food in sauces, I used the salsa verde and roja to drizzle some more flavor onto each bite. Overall, it was an excellent choice. The tacos, which were given in TWO tortillas, were the perfect street taco stuffed with plenty of fillings. Although I have to admit, the meat was overpowering the taco as there was not much else to it, and I am usually one to prioritize filling variety. However, the simplicity of it added to the deliciousness, and once again the meat was soooo good. Lastly, the Nachos were a perfect appetizer to split! The cheese was melted so perfectly onto the chips and spread evenly throughout, something that is so rare with nachos. They were a bit on the soggy side since they had been delivered, but personally I prefer it this way.  In addition to the amazing cuisine, they labeled all of the food so it was easier to divide our food. They also fulfilled the special requests we had indicated on the online order, which was very nice of them. Also, since there was WAY more than we can eat, we had plenty of leftovers, and the food reheated very well. Made for two great meals! Would highly recommend ordering from this place.
Start your review of  Super Tacos & Bakery .

Love this secret little DC gem. Long before great taquerias like Habanero and Xochi, this was my go to spot for authentic Mexican street tacos. Love their tacos, burritos, and tortas. Glad to see they're still doing well during the pandemic!
Autentico! Taste of real Mexico. Fresh ingredients, no foofoo fakey fancy American-style things on the menu. Habanero sauce especially tasty! Thumbs UP!
Excellent food, each bite was full of culture and flavor. I absolutely would recommend to anyone looking for a hidden gem.

As a transplant from San Diego, my taco and burrito benchmark is unreasonably high. In a year that's been unequivocally dumpster-fire-esque,  I have no tolerance for stale corn tortillas that break when you fold them. Miss me with "salsa" that's watery with mushy tomato chunks (if you're gonna do pico de gallo, do pico de gallo). And if you stuff my burrito with 80% rice, we can't be friends. Super Tacos & Bakery is none of the above. They're the closest thing to San Diego mexican food that Ive found in my 2 years of searching. The chicken tinga taco tasted like home -- well seasoned meat with corn tortillas that were so fresh I almost cried. The ilegal burrito had the perfect steak:rice:sour cream ratio and, once slathered in their habanero salsa, was the ultimate hangover cure. So happy to have found this oasis.

Super delicious, ordered the 1lb of carne asada taco, flautus, carne asada chimichanga, and a tomal verde. Everything was packaged really well and stayed crispy. Appreciated the variety of sauces provided.
Best Mexican food in DC hands down!! We've tried the tacos, flautas and most recently the torta cubana...AMAZING  Highly recommend!!

So I came to get my tattoo done nearby and realized I didn't have breakfast. Well, I needed a quick bite and this place was downstairs so my choice was easy. I went ahead and ordered the al pastor and carne asada. The food was made super quick (like within 8 mins of ordering) and I wolfed it down fast. Both tacos were delicious. Each came with a good amount of meat, and there was plenty of flavor in both items. The price was also fair and there were enough seats in the tiny shop for me to sit and enjoy my meal. The bakery part interests me so I gotta try something sweet next time.
Ok, the nachos and the al pastor tacos were just ok (not up to Pica levels, and those still are not perfect). All of this is to say, come here for the Chilaquiles which do not disappoint!!

Omg when will the gringos stop whining about 'service'?! How much emotional labor do you need to go with your $3 taco or, in my case, massive $12 chilaquiles plate. And speaking of, the chilaquiles plate here is damn good, a hot steal at $12. The chips are crisp and fresh, the sauce spicy, the eggs runny, and it comes with a side skirt steak (carne asada). I usually share it with my partner cause it's big. Eventually I need to try the asada and especially pastor tacos-both also look solid.

AMAZING place to get cheap authentic tacos!!! It right below Embassy Tattoo, and I've been there many times. Glad that someone recommended me this place after my tat appointment! It wasn't busy on a Tuesday afternoon so our food came out pretty quickly. The tacos are a good size and only about $2.75 each. Comes with corn tortilla, cilantro and lime. Really enjoyed my chicken and al pastor especially. Put the sauces on for a kick!!!! Also tried the gordita which was also delicious. Will be back when I get another tat/piercing hehe
I orders Pasole I was disappointed on how The serve it and how super greasy it was. FYI if you looking for a Mexican delicious and tasty MEXICAN posole " Super Tacos & etc. is not The place for you.

This was hands down one of the best dining experiences of my life, from start to finish! First, the ambiance is beautiful inside. So cozy and warm. The environment is perfect for a date night, family dinner, or in my case- a dinner date with one of my girlfriends! The complimentary bread basket was AMAZING! Such a treat. Cocktails were incredible. I am a lover of espresso martinis and this might have been the smoothest one I have ever had.  Our server was very knowledgable and immediately made recommendations that were curated to our tastes and preferences. He was NOT wrong! We ordered the beef bourguignon and steak au poivre. Both were incredible. It was the best beef bourguignon I have ever had. And the black pepper crust on the steak was to die for. We finished our meal with profiteroles, where are server came out to drizzle it in dreamy layers of chocolate sauce. Would recommend this restaurant a million times over and can not wait to visit DC again, solely for this restaurant alone!

I continue to enjoy visiting Le Diplomate. Even during the ongoing pandemic, the restaurant continues to strive to ensure its patrons have positive experiences. That said, business seems to have picked up a bit of late, so I'd still recommend a reservation. While I remain partial to brunch, the menu overall is on point and offers a nice variety of selections. I wouldn't mind if there were more Starr Restaurants in DC but I suppose life doesn't take requests. That said, other venues in the group are worth checking out as well, if you find yourself in the PA/NY area, especially.  The outdoor dining set up is tasteful, even though you are technically dining adjacent to 14th Street. I do think the dining rooms could be arranged a little more spaciously, especially in these times, but the experience remains good all other things considered.  The daily features are good, notably the lobster risotto or dover sole. That said, you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu be it the French onion soup, the shrimp salad, or the salmon entree.  Overall, I find the DC dining scene to be on the decline, but Le Dip is largely deserving of its acclaim and is worth a visit for either everyday dining or a special occasion.

Le Diplomate is a great location for any meal. I tend to go during brunch on the weekends, but you can't really go wrong. The restaurant tends to book very quickly so it's best to plan ahead and make a reservation or you could be waiting quite a while. Whether it's the café items or meal entrees everything is very well done and authentic. The service can differ but most of the time it's pretty consistent. Le Diplomate is definitely worth a visit, and among the better places for brunch in DC.

It is way overdue for me to visit this place.  Everything Washingtonian told me to check this place.  It wasn't disappointed at all.  I was there during Veteran day and their Burger American is right on the spot.  However the freedom fires was  the only error.  The presentation, taste and perfection on the bun definitely felt like the work of french chef (or not : ).  The cream burlee and profiteroles were great combination.  Even next table (a group of mid-aged women) had to chat with us about the dessert.  Our waiter was friendly and charming in different way during our conversation (a little shocking).  The interior decor was ok, but nothing too fancy. There are more than one hostess at the main door.  However, I noticed one of them wasn't too friendly (name will not mention, darker color hair).  After my meal, I went up to the front to talk to another hostess (blonde hair).  She was talkative and sound like a car sale person; and hook us for another reservation in December.   I definitively recommend this place for dinner and people w date.  However, parking always was/is/will be a problem in this area.  Do your homework on parking.  The traffic is picking up again.

This is a lovely, spacious restaurant on the bustling 14th street of DC.  We were lucky to visit on a beautiful Sunday morning for brunch and enjoy the open-air, private dining tables outside. I immediately fell in love with this concept. These tables have individual vents for heating and cooling, so even in the dead of winter (with snow on the ground), you can dine relatively comfortably.  This does, however, mean that their capacity likely exceeds what their kitchen can handle, a fact I'll elaborate on. We were seated outside immediately. It was 15 minutes or so before we were even acknowledged.  Our server was very soft-spoken and kind, but everything felt a bit tooooo leisurely.  There is never a sense of urgency. Maybe this is just the French way, but our entire brunch from the time we sat until we left took 2 hours, which blows my mind.  After we placed drink orders, it was another 15 minutes or so before we had our coffee and cocktails for our friends.  We ordered and it was probably a solid 45 minutes before we got our food.  So again, I don't know if this is just the result of an overwhelmed kitchen or if it's supposed to be this slow.  Either way, the wait for everything was frustrating. So - to the food and drink.  After ordering, we received a full basket of fresh breads.  These were amazing! I love the baguette and fruit & nut breads.  I did appreciate having fresh bread to graze on while waiting for our entrees. Of note, the coffee was some of the best I've had!  Our friends enjoyed a bloody mary and aperol spritz.  They have a very well-stocked bar and impressive beverage menu.  My husband tried the Poached Eggs Basquaise, which he enjoyed. I tried the Egg White omelet. I had asked for it be cooked well at the recommendation of a friend. It was not.  The inside was runny, had far too much gruyere and was very heavy for an egg white omelet.  The accompanying greens were fresh and tasty.  Our friends enjoyed the gruyere omelet and cauliflower gratin. This is certainly a place that was nice to experience and I would come back, but I definitely would change my order.

Not only does this place have a gorgeous interior, but the food and drinks are excellent, too! We came in around 3pm on a Friday and were surprisingly able to get seated right away with no reservation. Our server was extremely attentive and we loved the classic French vibe of Le Diplomate.  I ordered their Espresso Martini which was incredibly well made, one of the best I've ever had (definitely the best I've had in DC). My friends got the Cidre Épicé (delicious, perfect for a colder day), and Nouveau Carré (she liked it a lot, but not really my drink of choice). We also ordered a dozen Assorted Oysters (sooo fresh, these were clearly very high quality), Escargots à la Bourguignonne (amazing garlic butter), and A Selection of 3 Cheeses (loved it! the cheeses came with truffle honey and all three were fantastic). The experience could not have been better - Le Diplomate is a gem!

Came here as per recommendation of my boyfriends roommate. We (me, my boyfriend, and his mom) came here for brunch on a Sunday. No reservation or anything just walked in and they had availability, no waiting time whatsoever. It was closer to lunch time than breakfast for me so I ordered a sandwich. My boyfriend and his mom ordered eggs. They really enjoyed their meal. I thought mine was just okay. I personally feel there wasn't anything special about my sandwich, maybe I ordered the wrong dish at a place like this. I did like the bread basket a lot though, tasted super fresh. The 4 stars is mainly for the aesthetic of the place. Super cute all around.

As a vegetarian, I was a bit worried going to Le Dip. Obviously, Le Dip has a reputation that precedes it. I've always walked by it, allured by the charm. So finally, I decided to check it out. For appetizers, we got the ricotta ravioli. You get four pieces, perfect as an accompaniment to the bread basket for two (on the house). For my main, I decided to go with the Pasta Primavera. The pasta is a spaghetti, covered in a garlic Parmesan sauce, cooked with tons of veggies including peas, zucchini, and broccoli. It's a large portion size, and I had leftovers to happily munch on later that night. It was our anniversary, and they brought us complementary champagne!  Definitely worth the hype.

Recommended by a couple of girlfriends who had lived in DC as a must try. And they were right. Delicious food and festive atmosphere.  The pate paired with the French baguette was just the perfect beginning to lunch. The mushroom tart was beautiful. The tart was nice and flakey while  the mushroom topping was appropriately rich and creamy. The salad Nicoise with tuna, haricot verts, egg, and vinaigrette was a nice and refreshing lunch. I really enjoyed their "S'epanouit "cocktail. Very balanced and topped with a pansy.

Sublime perfection is the only way to describe last night's dinner. My dear friend and I went out to celebrate our fall birthdays, and Chakib gave us an experience that was absolutely excellent. He was attentive, fun, kind and warm. We could not ask for a better server or more beautiful night to sit in the gorgeously crafted private booths outside on 14th street! We felt lucky to have such great accommodations, though there is other nice outdoor seating for those who want to enjoy the weather or, like us, don't feel comfortable inside yet.  Note: we had a 7:45pm reservation on a Saturday - I don't suggest showing up without a reservation, though they can be tough to nab!  Chakib gave me a great drink recommendation, and was more than happy to let us enjoy the meal and order course by course instead of rushing us through. The onion soup was just as delicious as everyone says it is - cheesy, chock full of onions, and a flavorful broth. The steak frites were amazing and Chakib recommended having spicy mustard with them and remembered to bring it out (along with my beloved ketchup and a side of no judgment). We ordered dessert, but he surprised us with a beautiful on-the-house dessert plate for each of us with candles as well as delicious espresso martinis. Yum! What a great way to end the night. Thank you so much to Chakib and the entire team for the perfect birthday celebration - I felt so loved and cared for, as did my companion!

Such a beautiful restaurant. The interior is a gorgeous French vibe. The restaurant was very busy, but we were seated immediately. We got fresh bread and butter when we sat down. Our waiter was very inattentive and standoffish- very rude. I ordered the omelette which was huge, but very delicious and fluffy and came with a side salad. We also got the chicken sandwich and Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese was amazing! It was baked and had extra layers of cheese on top- some of the best Mac and cheese I've had. Really enjoyed the food and the interior of the restaurant. The service was very poor and parking was extremely difficult, but worth it.

Magnificent!! Went for lunch and exceeded our expectations. Jake our waiter was Exceptional.  He was very helpful and attentive. Our food was so good that I will be returning for dinner in a few days . The escargot is must.the  total package, ambience,, service,and food are top notch !! Two days later we did not have The same experience for dinner. Our dinner entrées were ok. The steak was not as good as before and the muscles lacked flavor. Our server had a real attitude and she was rude throughout the whole dinner. We ended up paying our check and having our after dinner cocktails at the bar. The bartender Jay made us welcome and was extremely nice. He is a great conversationalist

Magnificent!! Went for lunch and exceeded our expectations. Jake our waiter was Exceptional.  He was very helpful and attentive. Our food was so good that I will be returning for dinner in a few days . The escargot is must. The total package, ambience,, service,and food are top notch !!

To start the Covid protocol here is outstanding!! They are taking things seriously and I really was impressed.  I picked up a burger for take out and it was excellent. I would highly recommend going here. It was my first time here and I will definitely be back.
The layout and price of the seafood platter has changed a bit, but it's still the best place in town for a seafood tower. Come around 3:30pm on a Sunday and you won't have to wait!

Food 4/5 I went to Le Diplomate on two occasions recently and this rates both a brunch meal and a dinner meal.  The seafood tower here is by far the best in DC. We ordered a French Onion Soup and when we said it came out a bit too salty, the staff brought out a new one that was perfectly seasoned.  The Bread Basket and butter here are consistently good as well. Service 4/5 The service is great. There was one instance I came in the evening for drinks and the staff said the current DC protocol was to order food in order to get drinks.  This seems to be different from what I understood from other locations, but was fine given the great service. Cleanliness 5/5 Le Diplomate is following adequate COVID safety measures and taking people's temperature at the door. Ambiance: 5/5 The ambiance at Le Diplomatr is as warm and inviting as it was before covid as after covid.

This place has been on our date night list for a long time and we finally made it for our 12th wedding anniversary. It certainly didn't disappoint, but it also didn't blow us away.  We sat in the outdoor seating, which was surprisingly nice with greenery, nice framing for the plexiglass, and nice atmosphere from dim globe light hanging over each table. The tables themselves were incredibly cute and set up cozily for two or four in a way that definitely felt like a French bistro. The only missing piece of ambiance would have been music, but it certainly wasn't a mood killer to not have it. We started with the Macaroni at Gratin (fancy mac and cheese) and it was good, but not amazing. It just didn't stand out in any real way. The crusty herbed cheese on the top was essential to it being more than just cheesy pasta and there wasn't quite enough of it for the whole dish. The cheese was good, but a bit too mellow--or it needed some more herbs/spices to kick it up a bit. That all said, the bread basket that came with the start of the meal was _really_ good with a mix of baguette, a dense fruit and nut bread, and some more earthy sourdough bread. Since we were at a high-end French restaurant for a special occasion, we took some time with the wine list and and had somebody come out to talk to us about the options. That was one of the highlights of the meal. Not only did we wind up with a fantastic (maybe the best I've ever had) bottle of (admittedly pricey) French wine, but we really got to appreciate what we were drinking and what we were looking for after having spent some time talking to somebody who clearly knew what they were doing when it came to wines. Understanding the details of different Bordeauxs and what we might expect depending on the age of the wine really rounded out the experience. When it came to entrees, we shared the Beef Bourguignon and the Entrecôte (the Saturday dinner special). The Entrecôte is probably the single best steak I've ever had. It was medium-rare, but still tender and not at all chewy the way I sometimes feel even a good filet mignon can be. I am not a steak person and this was amazing. My wife is a steak person and still feels like it was probably the best steak she's ever had. The bernaise sauce and the wine all brought the thing together in a way that was a thing of beauty. The only complaint was that both the sauce and the steak were saltier than I cared for and I think saltier than they really needed to be. I'm usually on the lower end of salt tolerance though, so maybe not a problem for others. Still, I feel like over-salting things is a crutch that shouldn't be needed a restaurant of this caliber. The Beef Bourguignon was excellent, but not as stand out as the Entrecôte. That might be because I regularly have the similar Flemish stew at Et Voila in the Palisades and this wasn't really any better than that. The first few chunks of beef were incredibly tender, but a few of the latter pieces were a bit more tough. The overall dish was still not at all disappointing, although also saltier than necessary. We wound up being too full for dissertation there and got the Milk Chocolate Pot de Creme to go. It was a great chocolate pudding and the crunchy chocolate balls on the top took it to the next level, but in the end it was mostly just a very good chocolate pudding. It's not something that I would come here for.

One of the most popular and tastiest places to eat in the DC area. Of course, I would suggest making reservations so you can check out this very tasty French restaurant.  It was my first time here but this is so memorable. The interior and exterior make you feel like you are actually in France.  The food was amazingly tasty and the service was very quick! The seafood tower was fresh and had a good variety. The free bread that they put on your table was so delicious. I loved each style of bread! Don't forget to get some tasty snails (escargot).  I thought all the dishes were a nice compliment and honestly, I wouldn't mind coming back here! This would be so awesome if you lived around here and to be able to walk and enjoy this place is just amazing.

I loved Le Diplomate- the ambiance, the staff and service, the food, but I will say I think it is a LITTLE overrated (just because of all the publicity it has received). VERY hard to get a reservation here (will need to look weeks in advance). With that being said, the food is really good. I ordered the lobster frites (with garlic herb butter) and fries for dinner. REALLY delicious, great flavor, just not worth $59 (a bit overpriced). Great experience, and overall I would recommend this place to others.

This place is AMAZING and deserves ALL of the hype! The location, food, ambiance, and service were all incredible. We made a reservation for an outside table (the only openings left) but it started to rain right before our dinner. We asked the hostess if we could sit inside and she was happy to accommodate us! There are so many unique cocktails and wine - we started with a martini and a speciality cocktail, both were great! We moved on to a bottle of Bordeaux for our meals. We weren't sure which one we wanted so our server let us taste a few. Now for the food - the free bread you get is so moist and exactly what you need to start off a meal. We split the French onion soup and the escargot. Both were spectacular. The soup was so big, plenty for two people to share. The escargot came out hot, buttery and garlicky. We then moved to our main dishes: we had the beef bourguignon and the veal. Both entrees were out of this world! The beef melted in your mouth and it came in the most flavorful sauce. After those, we ordered two desserts: the pot of chocolate and a fruity dessert recommended by the server. We preferred the chocolate. To round out the meal, we had espresso martinis and they were delicious!  Ultimately, I would come back to this restaurant every time I am in DC and I would bring friends!

Firat we orderes Mushroom tart, it was a great savory and it was delicious. We got other foods like egg benedict, pancakes, Norwegian eggs, and all were ok (not great or different). All their breads are great tho since they bake them in house, so it was a good exp.  Also during weekends it is busy and it is good to have reservations.

Celebrated my girlfriend's birthday here. I made the reservation via phone asking for "the covered area, not main dining hall" thinking that it's the area where has pretty wall decorations connecting the main dining hall and patio. But they misunderstood and reserved the covered patio for us. It's a humid and hot day, the covered area was very uncomfortable due to lack of air flow. After we asked, the manager moved us to the uncovered outdoor dining area. Not what I originally asked but I appreciate their help. Service from the server was standard nothing impressive. The manager was very attentive and helpful. 4-star is mainly for the food. Everything we ordered was delicious, it was one of the best French cuisine I've ever had.
I was very disappointed in the dinner we ordered tonight.  I ordered French fries & received mashed potatoes.  They are NOT comparable.

We're very fond of the trout almandine from here. I even like the green beans that come with it--& I generally hate green beans!  We've learned, though, that we need to reheat the trout once it arrives. 10 minutes at 350 degrees & it's perfect.  We're not keen, however, on the mushroom tart. The crust is way too thick for our taste.

We made a delivery order to Le Diplomate & were very happy with our meal.  I had the beef bourguignon & it was excellent! Melt in your mouth beef! Well prepared with lots & lots of tasty onions & carrots!  I also ordered a side of pomme frites to see how they would be with delivery. They would have been great in the restaurant, but they obviously suffered from the time that passed between when they were made & when they reached us. Crispy but not hot.  For dessert, I had the pot de creme & my husband had the creme brûlée. They were both fabulous. The delivery was by Caviar. The service & communication were both excellent.

We made a delivery order to Le Diplomate & were very happy with our meal.  We both had the trout almandine & thought it was excellent. Well prepared with lots & lots of tasty toasted almonds.  I also ordered a side of pomme frites to see how they would be with delivery. They would have been great in the restaurant, but they obviously suffered from the time that passed between when they were made & when they reached us. Crispy but not hot.  For dessert, I had the pot de creme & my husband had the creme brûlée. They were both fabulous. The delivery was by Caviar. The service & communication were both excellent.

We had a lovely dinner here this week. We loved the setting, which is very much like places in Paris. I had the strip steak with spinach & it was excellent. My husband had the steak frittes, which wasn't great because of the tough hanger steak.  We also really enjoyed the pot de creme.

Such a great dining experience. I suggest making a reservation--I went at 2pm on a Monday alone and it was packed. Luckily, I had reserved a spot and was seated right away. The oysters were some of the most delicious I have ever had. I only ordered a half dozen and easily could've put down a dozen or two on my own. I had the steak frites for my entree but everything on the menu looked incredible. The steak frites was a great portion and the butter was to die for. I had the server recommend a wine with each course and was pleased with both. I will definitely come back on future trips to DC.

A very French bistro near Dupont Circle. So crowded on a Friday night (glad we made a reservation). They had windows fully open for air flow, and their chairs and tables reminded us of those at Parisian cafes! A banner out front says they are celebrating the 20th anniversary.  Hot bread with butter was offered (and there's a bottled water on the table already). Paris kiss (the cocktail) was fruity and very good The mussel with lobster meat and shrimp was heavenly. Huge portion (I'd say too big for one person).  The rabbit has lots of small bones but was really good. Comes with pasta.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a last minute stop for dinner and this place caught our eye.  Pretty much everything on the block was about to close, but the waitress welcomed us in with just 10 minutes left for the kitchen. The restaurant is very lively and plays loud music, so this place may not be for you if you were looking for a quiet and romantic date night spot. I've personally never had authentic French food minus the typical crepes and other pastries  so I was looking forward to giving it a try.  You are first greeted with a loaf of bread and creamy butter that's hard not to get carried away with. The waiting staff also immediately would provide us with more so we well appreciated their quick service, especially given the kitchen closing soon.  We were told the mussels and the french onion soup were the most popular items on the menu. We decided to give the French onion soup (Grant i née des Halles) a go as well as the  sausage (Petite fricassée de Merguez) and the salmon open face sandwich (Tartine Baltique). For the soup, I really enjoyed the mix of cheese and bread that was immersed in the French onion flavor. I felt the onion flavor was tad too strong for my liking, but overall great consistency and taste. The sausage dish had a spicy kick and came with an interesting sauce that was a blend of various vegetables. This was my favorite dish because the sausage was cooked just right and the sauce was flavorful. I wasn't a big fan of the open face sandwich, it was creamy but lacked flavor. Next time I go, I definitely want to try out one of the popular mussel dishes.  Overall, the servers were very prompt and friendly and I enjoyed the liveliness. I definitely would order one of the three dishes we ordered again but I'm giving this a 3/5 since I wish I had like more of the food we ordered.

My girlfriend and I were looking for a place to eat at. As we were walking down the streets of DC, we stumbled upon this place. The windows of the restaurant were opened, as if they were inviting us to sit inside. A strong waft of sea food passed along the street as we walked by so we instantly knew we wanted to eat here. As we looked into the restaurant, we saw a crowd of people laughing and enjoying their food. Without a doubt we knew this was the place we wanted to eat. Despite being after hours. we explained to the waiter how desperate we were to eat at the restaurant as it was appealing to our senses. The waiter talked to the kitchen and agreed to keep the kitchen open for 10 more minutes. This gave us enough time to place an order.  We first started off with a bucket of bread with butter.     Normally I don't have expectations for the bread as it is free with the meal. However this bread was cooked so well. The bread was not too dry and had the right amount of moisture. Service The service was splendid. In most restaurants, it is a hassle to get more bread as it is free of service. However here, they constantly brought new loads of bread despite our asking which I highly value. Furthermore they would switch our waters out so that we always had a full cup of water. The waiters were very friendly too. They were always checking to see if we needed anything.  Not to a point where it was too much and not to a point where we felt ignored. Id rate the service 8/10. The Food We got two appetizer and one entree. We got three foods: Salmon ravioli, beef/pork sausage, french soup. The salmon ravioli was average. The ravioli pasta would melt in my mouth. That being said, the pasta had a very strong seafood flavor. I know some people prefer this flavor but I do not. Therefore I did not enjoy eating this. It felt forced to eat this just because I didn't want to waste the food. As I was taking bites of this food, I felt regrets that I had not ordered some other entree on the menu. The pork beef sausage was also average. It was very flavorful. Reminded me of an indian curry. The sauced contained a lot of spices that I could feel with every bite. However, it felt weird not eating this type of food without rice. I did not like the flavor with the bread that was given. It was good but it didn't match well with the bread. Last but not least was the french onion soup. Oh my god. This was AMAZING. I can't stress that. It was absolutely amazing. Despite me filling full, I wanted to continue eating this as it was so good. That is a feeling that I strive for when I eat out. The top layer was so cheesy yet crusty at the same time. I could feel the cheese melt in my mouth as I took each bite. Underneath the cheese was a flavorful amount of soup. I cannot stress how much flavor was in this soup. I would recommend coming here JUST FOR THE SOUP. It works well with the free bread that is given. OVERALL, I would give this place a 6.5/10. The french soup was amazing. The other two dishes were average. I left with a feeling of regret that I did not other something else on the menu. And that is not a feeling that I want to have if I am eating somewhere. I am still happy that I had that french soup. I know tonight I am probably going to dream of myself swimming in that soup :)

I've been coming to this French bistro for years, and it hasn't changed a bit. While I love so many of the French restaurants D.C. has to offer, there's something so charming about Bistrot Du Coin. It's casual, old school, and unpretentious.  Our server was friendly and had a great sense of humor, even cracking a small joke when my date absolutely butchered the pronunciation of his dish ("Your French is already improving!")    My fella's steak and frites was exactly what he wanted. We were just in time to order off the brunch menu too, so I got an omelette campagnarde (Goat Cheese, Roasted Tomatoes, Spinach and Fresh Herbs). The brunch menu offers more vegetarian options, and I wish the dinner menu had more meat-free fare, but you can't hold that against them.  I appreciated that the omelette came with both French fries and a really nice little side salad. Isn't that always the hardest choice, fries or salad? The fries were a bit soggy and would have been better crispier, but the salad and omelette were both perfect.

Solid spot in DuPont. I'll start by saying they were clearly understaffed (not the servers fault) but it did take away from the experience. We sat outside and were definitely forgotten about. I'd recommend inside for better service/AC Covid depending.  We started with the escargot, French onion soup & liver. The liver was slightly dry but the soup & escargot were good. The meal starts with bread which we dipped in all the yummy sauces.  For our main we had the muscles, steak, & beef tar tar. All were excellent especially the steak! The muscles were a generous portion as was the beef.  We finished with the chocolate mousse (yummy) & creme brûlée (even more yummy).  It's slightly expensive but the food was excellent.  The outdoor seating is not accessible (you have to step down a curb) & the inside entrance is a tight hallway but the restaurant is open.  Easy neighborhood 2 hour parking & generally LGBTQ friendly.

One of my favorite French restaurants in DC area. Beautiful atmosphere and tasty food. We ordered escargot, steak tartare, mussels, and hanger steak. All so tasty. I will definitely dine here again in my next trips to this beautiful city.

I was waiting to come to this place for the weekend; I wanted to find a French restaurant that wasn't extremely high-end but also captured the French food and atmosphere well, so I found this place. I made reservations through Yelp at 5 pm, but thankfully the restaurant wasn't packed yet so there wasn't any problem seating us... but it got pretty packed after we came! And the food and service was amazing! I had gotten the onglet à l'échalotte (medium-rare) and it was honestly one of the best hanger steaks I've ever had! It was tender, juicy, tasty, and the level of salt and grill taste was on point. It went well with the red wine sauce, which also was good sauce to dip the frites in. I also got to try the coq au vin and the chicken was amazing! The flavour the chicken had with the red wine sauce was delicious.  For dessert, I got the pêche melba which consists of vanilla and strawberry ice cream with poached peach at the bottom with whipped cream and some red berry sauce on top. I loved it - the fruity flavours were refreshing and nothing was too overly sweet in my opinion - everything went well together. The price is on the $$ side, with me spending around maybe $50-60 for my own items including tax and tip, but I would say it was worth it for the delicious food and service.   The staff were very friendly and attentive, especially one of staff members who'd often go up and make small talk and make sure you got everything you needed. Very nice to speak in French to him sometimes too. Even when they were attending other people, they would notice whenever you needed something. You definitely felt comfortable to ask them for anything or if you needed any suggestions or help with the menu items.  Everything here seems authentic; the interior, music, the staff, menus, almost everything gave off real French vibes. I was sitting near the windows as well, so you can see a lot of people passing by and deciding to try it based off the exterior of the restaurant.  It's definitely a nice place to drop on by when you're in the Dupont circle area. I would probably go to French restaurants more closer to me, but this is definitely somewhere I'd go to eat if I was ever in the Dupont area for dinner or lunch.

What a charming French bistro in between Admo and DuPont. We have been coming here since DC restaurants reopened and it has not disappointed. The mussels pot (the one with bay leaves) is amazing and I am literally still dreaming about it! The mussels sauce is buttery and well seasoned and you get a side of warm baguette to dip into this heavenly sauce. We upgraded to the entree size of the mussels this time and it came with the side of fries. The hanger steak was a perfect medium rare. We prefer the bearnaise sauce over the wine sauce. Dessert was creme brulee and it was the perfect way to end the meal.  There is outdoor and indoor seating! The restaurant is decorated to make you feel like you traveled to a small bistro in France and def will be back again!

This has been on my list of places to try for quite some time, but there are so many other go-to French restaurants in town (Le Diplomate, La Piquette, Le Chat Noir to name a few). I had been craving duck cassoulet, but none of the other restaurants have had it on the menu lately. I found it on this menu so finally ordered from here through Door Dash.  I have been disappointed by some restaurants when getting takeout or delivery bc the temperature on meat might not be right (things continue to overcook or dry out on the way to the house), but that doesn't affect the seasoning or taste so much. With that said, I was pretty disappointed by the food here. The escargot was pretty greasy. I know it's just cooked in oil and garlic, but somehow this was much more oily than I've ever had before, and I get this dish every time it's on any menu. My husband enjoyed his burger, but the fries were soggy and under seasoned. Now for my cassoulet. It had all the right flavors, and the duck was tender and fell off the bone, but I couldn't get past how salty it was. Note that I typically like very flavorful and well-seasoned food, so it was undeniably salty. I ate it with bread, but it was still too much. Unfortunately, I will not order from here again.

Five stars for a phenomenal French cafe in the heart of DC! Don't let the casual atmosphere fool you - the food and service are fantastic and the outdoor seating was the perfect place to enjoy some French onion soup. (I also ordered the ravioli dauphinoise and am still thinking about it... ). I dropped in to enjoy an early dinner and was blown away by how delicious everything was. Attentive service, delicious food, reasonable prices... what more could you ask for? I can't wait to go back.
40-50  mins

I had made reservations through Yelp for Mother's Day, and I'm so glad that we did. Bistrot Du Coin was phenomenal. The Bellinis were delicious. (My boyfriend suggests that you skip the Bloody Mary and go right to a Bellini.) The food was incredible too. This is a great place to order classic items, like the French Onion Soup (best I've ever had) and the Eggs Benedict (we were here for brunch, absolutely incredible without that heavy feeling). The atmosphere made us feel like we were in Europe. One note, the bathroom is up a set of stairs. We managed fine, but this could be tricky for handicapped guests. They had some outdoor seating under a tent in the street for pandemic cautions as well. The tables were very spaced out and the staff were wearing masks (May 2021).  TLDR: Stick with the classics, because they really do them right!
A very busy place, make a reservation. Foie gras is very good and served as a chunk vs pâté'.

Our Airbnb hosts recommended this place; we had enjoyed a stellar meal when we visited Bruges a few years ago, and looked forward to our dinner. We were seated upstairs, then 5 other tables were seated. One waiter was covering the whole area-- he finally came to our table after going to 3 of the tables who came in after us. We got our drink orders, then ordered our food. 40 minutes later, we got our salad and appetizer. Later, our entrees were delivered by a kitchen server- - my entree was incorrect. I did not see the waiter, so flagged down a lady who was assisting with water and bread. The waiter later brought me my correct meal 20 minutes later and said , '' sorry about that.'  He never came back to check on us; when we finished, we flagged him down for the check. Also, the water pressure in the sink in the Men's bathroom is inadequate to adequately cleanse hands.

Great dining! Arrived early with a reservation and was immediately seated. The restaurant has a typical bistro appearance with knick knacks and posters advertising aperitifs and similar bar ephemera. High ceilings and distressed wall paint complete the decor that sets the space in post war Paris. Drinks delivered without delay. A mesclun salad delicately tossed with a whisper of vinaigrette.  A very much needed and enjoyable starter. Mussels in white wine, shallots and herbs; a peppercorn crusted, pan-seared pave served medium rare with pepper cream sauce and homemade fries. The mussels were cooked through precisely in a seasoned broth with a hint of wine that required loaves of bread to sop or a big spoon to soup.  The tournedos was a nice sized cut, with a rare but not bloody center. Crusted with pepper and accompanied by thick cut fries and a zingy peppercorn cream for dunking both steak and fries. A very, very good meal. An excellent server and service overall. Priced as expected. Not the best I've ever had but most certainly a restaurant I look forward to returning.

I love that my better half is up for anything, otherwise I'd probably never would of tried this place. After an hour of super zoomied dog park activities, we turned our furbos on and left our frenchie baby to sleep it off while we stole away to visit our regular restaurant, the one that we visit so frequently, we don't really look at the menu when ordering. On our way there I  mentioned to my beloved that there's a cute French bistro just up the street that I'd love to visit at some point. Let's go now, he says. Go now and what? Try new things? Feel adventurous? Enjoy something different? Forgo tried and true for the evening? I vote YES.  As we approached the restaurant we were greeted immediately by a very sweet gentleman who ended up taking care of us throughout the whole experience. Wish I remembered his name. Very professional, patient and sweet. The restaurant had only outside seating at the moment,  a handful of tables, all following the social distancing rules, each with their own electric heater attached. A tarp separated us from the road, but it didn't really do much but flap angrily every time a large vehicle gone by,  but there was literally nothing that could be done about it, so we just laughed every time a bus would go cruising by. Corona time, man.  We ordered drinks, we ordered soup. The mushroom soup was unbelievable - I want to write songs about it. I want to introduce it to my best friend. I want to bottle it and call it my personal happiness juice. It's that good. We ordered food... we ordered drinks... but the soup... THE soup... the SOUP is what we talked endlessly about. Then we ordered desserts and talked about soup some more. Amazing.  As I understand, the restaurant is open for indoor dining now and I simply can't wait to go visit my favourite bowl of soup in DC. I must accentuate the fact that the customer service was outstanding,  something very hard to come by in Washington DC unless you're spending big bucks, and even then,  you're not guaranteed to be treated well. Go, spend money, support our local businesses, especially this one, for they deserve it fully.

Overall: One of the only restaurants where the food tastes like in France and Belgium. The menu for indoor dinning is rich, but they operate on a reduced one for take-out. However, their food is still outstanding, even when you enjoy it at home, instead of the restaurant.  Tastiness: Authentic and tasty. This is probably the only restaurant I tried in DC where both the escargot and mussels were delicious and cooked in the the classics way. This is also the only restaurant I trust to prepare a mouth-watering rabbit stew in DC.
