Carnitas means "little meats" in Spanish, but I know it as a delicious and succulent pork dish.  So my curiosity was piqued when I saw the Crispy Duck Carnitas on the menu and it did not disappoint.  I can see that Bayless stuck to the literal translation of the word, focusing on the little meats part instead of pork.  The duck was from Gunthorp farms, which is known for its pasture-raised ducks, pork and chickens.  The duck was beautifully presented with a charred tomatillo-serrano chile salsa, chiles torreados, black beans, guacamole and tortillas.  The chiles torreados were too hot for me, so those were given to The Queen to eat as she is about all things spicy and hot.  I got a side of rice to go with the entrée, which was perfection for me.  I ended up not finishing the entrée because I had a starter beforehand.  The Individual Appetizer Sampler was a perfect taste of Frontera's Michoacán guacamole, tuna ceviche, Mexico City-style cheese quesadilla, crispy chicken taquito with homemade crema & fresco cheese.  I love having a taste of everything and this was a great way to accomplish this.  Because I couldn't finish the duck carnitas, I had leftovers for breakfast the next morning and man it was great.  I had some apple strudel toast and mimosas because it was breakfast, but that duck maintained the integrity and flavor of the dish. The BFF got the Enchiladas Norteñas (heirloom corn tortillas, braised Creekstone Farms beef short rib, roasted tomato-serrano sauce, Samuel's artisan cheese, black beans).  I had a bite of that dish and it was also very good.  I love beef short rib meat and this was a nice complement to the corn tortillas and sauce.  I could see myself getting this as well on another visit.   The Queen is all things seafood, so she got the Veracruz Seafood Pozole (Sinaloa shrimp, squid, Hudson Canyon scallops & pozole corn braised in guajillo chile broth). It was topped with a fresh garnishes, tostadas, lime, and Mexican oregano. She normally ends up taking food home from her meals, but this dish became a member of the Clean Plate Club. I tried some of the squid and it was very nice, not overcooked.   The Doctor got chicken tacos and the tortilla soup.  The chicken was cooked nicely, you could taste the wood-grilled flavor.  The soup I didn't try but it was interesting as it was a dark brown broth with pasilla, grilled chicken, avocado, artisan Jack cheese, homemade crema, and tortilla strips. We didn't do dessert but I did have bubbles with dinner (2018 Raventós, Blanc, Blanc de Blancs, Conca del Riu Anoia, Penedès, Spain).  This was a nice complement to the meal and at $55, that is not bad for a downtown restaurant.  For me, this meal was Mexican food on steroids.  I loved every bite and it was just as good the next day.  Now will I stop going to the corner taco stand?  Nope.  But I have been to the mountain as far as carnitas goes and my eyes were made to open to a new way of thinking about carnitas, so there is no turning back from that.  Pork, I am still madly in love with you, but from time to time I am going to cheat on you with that damn crispy duck from Frontera Grill.
The manager should be fired. We have never had worst customer service from a manager.  She was rude, argumentative and completely condescending.

I was so excited to be on vacation and finally eating at Rick Bayless' place. It did not disappoint. It took some time to get the cocktails and the appetizers, but everything was well worth the wait. The sopecitos were amazing and the dessert... OMG the dessert. The apricot gelato was one of the most divine things I have ever had. Then you get a bite of the sweet corn ice cream and it is just the freshest most surprising flavor in a dessert and it was delicious. I think we licked the bowl. The pictures dont do this food justice. Cant wait to get back to Chicago to try it again and again!

Frontera Restaurant Week 2021 did not disappoint!! The margaritas aren't very large, but they are so tasty/fresh and shaken tableside. The appetizer options (ceviche, corn masa quesadillas, and tamales) were all incredible and started the meal on a high note! The Skate Wing and Carne Asasa Brava entrées were so delicious. And the meal was perfectly complete with the dessert choices, both of which were phenomenal (Oat Milk Flan and Chocolate Tres Leches). The Tres Leches has a topping that was like marshmallow fluff- yum! While I do wish the portions would have been a bit bigger, it was overall a lovely meal. The ambiance was okay. We were outside in the tent and the heat lamp was definitely broken/off (even though the hostess told us it worked), so on a chilly and rainy evening it wasn't the best spot for dinner. They also still have Christmas decorations (like Santa, Christmas Trees, etc) hanging inside the tent, which was weird.  *Oh, and they do add a 20% Service Charge, so just keep that in mind when you get the bill*
Everything was beautiful and delicious: Guacamole, Oysters, and my favorite was the perfectly cooked Carne Asada. So flavorful!

I'm just a girl on a solo trip weekend getaway and they were so sweet to give me a birthday surprised.  The food was amazing. The waiter is attentive even when I'm sitting outside in the patio. Thank you Frontera! I will definitely be coming back

I was here recently for lunch. The service was perfection. I think they share tables because a few different people came by to check in and they were all very friendly. I ordered the limonada, sopecitos, chicken taquitos, and the carne asada brava. The mashed potatoes are amazing. My steak was undercooked and they fixed it for me quickly. The tomato pepper sauce that comes with the steak is very spicy, a little too much for me, but the quality is good. I love this place still and look forward to returning. I stopped in again for lunch and sat in the bar area. I tried the tortilla soup, the little gem salad, the pork flautas, limonada, flan, and ice cream with hot fudge. I did not love the dressing on the salad and the flan was bland. I liked everything else. The flautas need something to balance the spicy red sauce though, like crema or guacamole. The scoop of ice cream was tiny but the chocolate was very good.

I was here recently for dinner with my bestie. Overall we loved the décor, the service, and the food. We started with the flavored water, which was much more flavorful than we expected. We also got the lime drink, which is very fresh and sour, but you get used to the flavor. My friend got the chicken quesadilla with vegetarian black beans. I got the carne asada tacos with the pinto beans and guacamole. We liked the black beans better. The cheese tamale was good and we loved the plantains. We liked the chips and salsa but would prefer more user friendly salsa dishes over the tiny square ones they give you. Overall we were very happy and will return. I think Xoco next door is equally good at a lower price point if budget is a concern.

Great food !   Frontera's has a program where they let you order food and then on a certain day they deliver it to the northern Chicago suburbs for you to reassemble in their dinner kit.  We did this and got our bag of food yesterday and it was great! We started with tostadas (pictured here) and they were easy to heat, assemble, and they were fantastic !!!  We would definitely get this again.   Next we got the short rib enchiladas and they were really good.  I didn't take  a picture but it was great.    Lastly we got the  topolo margarita and it was very good.  They don't include any salt but we had some so no worries.  It was a great experience and the instructions were laid out well and easy to follow.

The food was great. Unfortunately their service is lacking. As is the world in Chicago today, we had an unfortunate incident with a mentally ill gentleman screaming at our table and the table next to ours. We resolved the issue with no help from multiple onlooking employees, but later wanted to make the situation right for the table next to ours. The manager refused to help with the situation and would not allow me to buy a round of drinks at the bar for the table next to us. After assuring us that she would handle the situation, she did not address it. The establishment serves great food, but does not care about the diners experience. We saw multiple other disappointed guests. I guess you can do that when you are in downtown Chicago. Others may dine in the future, but you will not see many return guests...

Rick Bayless who introduced America to the Oaxacan  kitchen still runs this awesome source for excellent dining, very causal, still very good and still standing strong. During Chicago's much stricter protocols than Los Angeles, FG is open for outdoor covered and aerated dining (one side of the rectangular outside dining room is open, facing the restaurant -- less chance of frigid wind blowing in).  Other restaurants are following suit.  The travails of the restaurant scene in Chicago can be sensed here: digitaledition.chicagotr… We had the smoked chicken tacos (a signature treat), guacamole, salmon, carnitas and much to our expectations the food was as I remember: original, delicious and authentic (Rick Bayless was an anthropologist studying in Mexico when he was smitten by authentic cooking history and products).  For a non-native I appreciate his respect to authentic Cooking traditions.  Loved the food, loved the service. Muchas gracias Señor Bayless for staying consistent and serving food I can revisit over and over again.   Tip: Adjacent to  Topolobampo.   He opened a causal tortas, churros, joint next door to that called  Xoco that serves signature tortas at his outpost in ORD.  Love the churros and tortas here also.

I went out to Frontera Grill today where they offered indoor seating (due to the new Chicago guidelines). On a Saturday night it was pretty full, so I would recommend making a reservation on their website before going. The food was great at a reasonable price and the service was excellent.  We got the Friday/Saturday special which was baby back ribs with grits and mango slaw. The seasoning on the ribs were great but it was a little dry. I also thought the grits were a little too sweet. I also tried their little gem salad which was fine but nothing special. We also tried the cheesecake with grapefruit on top which was fantastic. Perfectly sweet, tangy, and sour. The cheesecake was the star of the show!

TL;DR: the service sucked, but the food was great, which was the saving grace.  We made a reservation for 7:30 pm yesterday. Arrived like 5 minutes late, but still had to wait around 20 minutes. It happens.  It took a good 10 minutes just for our server to come by. We ordered margs... one person asked what kind they have, they picked cucumber, he warned them it was spicy, so they said n/m, I'll have a regular. Apparently that meant they don't get a drink, because only 3 margs came. It took 5 minutes for us to get his attention and he said they didn't want the spicy one.... Huh? We also ordered apps.. chips and salsa, tortilla soup, and the quesadillas. All were delicious.  It took a long time for us to get any attention after that. I had to flag the waiter every time I needed something. Like... our drinks are literally empty and the ice is almost melted, can you come by and offer us another drink? Finally, they come by to ask for our entree orders. We ordered skirt steak tacos, both enchiladas dishes, and carnitas tacos. All were delicious. Food was great.  Then when it came to check time, the servers disappeared... we waited probably 20 minutes just to get someone to get us check. We were tired from a long day. We waited 5 minutes for the check and nearly 10 minutes for our cards back after.  And for this great service, we were forced to pay 20%. As much as I wanted to love this place, I won't be back... I've had better service at Tacos El Norte. It's a shame, because the food is delicious.

I went to Frontera Grill once many years ago and had such fond memories of my experience there (it's the only restaurant I can ever recall, literally licking my plate). So of course I was excited to come back and try this place again, but for takeout. Needless to say, I was very disappointed. I paid $24 for a salad (with chicken) and an appetizer. Everything felt just OK. But I felt that they were very stingy with their ingredients. For $16, I got a salad that consisted mostly of lettuce, a tiny container of dressing (that, tastewise was just OK), and a fairly paltry portion of chicken. (The chicken is an extra $7; the salad without is $9). The other appetizer was also OK and honestly tasted like it could have come from a supermarket. I probably won't be coming back.

Went here for a friend's pre-birthday celebration so let's just say there were lots of drinks and some food involved. Upon entering, I was excited to be seated in the restaurant which seemed buzzing but we were sat in the lounge downstairs. It was a decent lounge but the upstairs bit caught my eye a little more. For drinks, I started off with Misty's Sleeve because I love me a good sour cocktail, so I asked out server to amp up the sourness and dial down the spice of this one. Really enjoyed this cocktail but we were all here to have a good time so none of us were stopping at one. The next couple of drinks I ordered were the Passion fruit Margharita which was pretty sour and sweet hence quite perfect.  To accompany the drinks, we shared a trio of regular Guac and chips which was very enjoyable and went down rather quickly. To have something more substantial, we all shared literally all the tacos on the menu. My top three were the Shrimp, Chicken and Pork Tacos. Should I go again, I would only order more of the Shrimp tacos because that won it for me. We also got a couple of shots since the occasion was celebratory. Even though the night ended up hazy for the alc consumed was high in count, the Mercadito experience was a memorable and positive one.

Five stars for our server Genesis, super sweet and gave great drink recommendations. We got the watermelon margaritas, so good!  My Baja fish tacos were okay. I would like to try something different next time because my friends seemed to really enjoy their food.

I've been wanting to try this place ever since living in the River North area and was finally able to try it this last weekend!  I love Mezcal but there was only one drink on the menu with Mezcal which didn't sound the best to me. The bartender quickly suggested adding Mezcal to the Pepino and it was delicious! One of the best drinks I've had in a while.  We started with the seasonal guac which was delicious and included pomegranate seeds. For our main meal, we got Mahi Mahi tacos were were similarly delicious. The exterior was deliciously crispy and the inside was tender and juicy.  I will definitely be back! On a Friday night, it was definitely a little noisy so probably not the best spot for a first date but otherwise is a very fun atmosphere!

Mercadito was SO MUCH FUN! I went with a few friends over the weekend and thank goodness we made a reservation, because this place was buzzing. We were seated shortly after arriving and were greeted by our fabulous waitress, Constance. She informed us right away about the 90 minute reservation time per table, which was really appreciated. She knew the menu  well and had wonderful suggestions for all things food and drink. Myself and a friend started with the spicy aguacate: a spicy avocado margarita. Oh my goodness, this was one of the best margaritas I have EVER had! Perfect amount of spice, lots of salt, and just so flavorful. My other friends went with the amiga sandia, which is a watermelon margarita with basil. This was so, so good too! I cannot emphasize enough just how much we enjoyed the cocktails here. We decided to each place an order of tacos and share since they come with four each. We went with the baja, carne asada, pastor, and pollo. All the tacos were fresh, packed with flavor, and filling!  I was truly impressed with the ambiance, service, food, and cocktails here. I can't wait to come back bring more friends and family. I now understand why it's such a busy spot!

The stars are solely for the service which should receive 5 stars for the incredible bartender who made our first margs and our awesome server!  The food here doesn't deserve even 2 stars.  Chips seem store bought- not like what I remember from our first time here. We got 3 different salas all of which were not good. I LOVE spicy but two of them were actually TOO spicy and no flavor. The green is normally my favorite and this one had zero flavor. The server brought out a 3rd salsa after I requested that resembled thousand island dressing. I was very confused if he brought actual salad dressing or salsa. We got guacamole which also had ZERO flavor. Not to mention it's a tiny serving. All four of us ordered a different kind of taco plate. I'm usually the most basic and get chicken, it's just what I like. These were the most basic chicken tacos I've ever had in my entire life. They don't have pickled onions- only raw!? Wtf how does a Mexican place not have pickled onions!? So basically my chicken tacos were just dry chicken on a shell.  Brisket tacos- good but nothing to it other than brisket and a shell. Steak- best taco but still not amazing. Pork- kinda dry and also nothing to it. Brussel Sprouts- Tiny serving and they seem like they're drenched in some type of mayonnaise sauce. No clue but they were kinda just a soggy weird mess. I would not recommend this place to anyone! If you're in the area already go to Barrio which is right across the street. Antique tacos easily blows this place away! Also there are about 20 other amazing taco/margarita spots in the city to try! Sad we wasted our Friday night time & money here.

Thank you for your detailed review and your praise to our service! We are very sorry to see that you did not enjoy your meal. We would love to connect with you privately regarding the details of your meal to understand what went wrong. All of our tacos are presented with various toppings and fresh ingredients, and we are confident that if you gave us another try you would enjoy a dining experience more akin to the lofty standards we hold ourselves to.

So I stopped by for drinks here, did not try the food. I was blown away by their delicious cocktails. The bartender seemed a pinch grumpy but the drinks made up for it. The Avocado cocktail was my favorite.

Awesome service!! Awesome food!!! Awesome drinks!!! You will not regret it!! The waitress was very friendly, answered all my questions and was able to accommodate one of us with the food (she doesn't eat spicy) he made sure she was happy with her food. Overall every was GREAT!

Great place for tacos. Tried the pastor and the pollo tacos. While both were great, I preferred the pastor tacos because they had more flavor. The drinks were also good, tried the amiga sandia (watermelon margarita), pepino el pyu (cucumber marg), and the classic margarita. We also tried the Mac and cheese which was below average, but this is a Mexican restaurant so I'm sure it's not their specialty anyways.

I've had not been here in a few years but since i was going to be in the area a friend and i decided to dine here. I made reservations a few days prior. Reservations HIGHLY recommended! It's a popular summer spot. I decided to sit at the the outdoor patio.As inside is the hot spot it's loud, music and busy.About 95% of people did not have on a mask so you can decide if that's a place for you. The food was good and tasty i had the chicken tacos and a mango margarita. I give both a thumbs up. I also tried the papas with the spicy alioli sauce i think, pretty good also. Definitely a place to try!

Not a huge fan of this place. For starters, we tried to go here shortly after the city began reopening after COVID. They did not follow protocols (distancing, enforcing masking) so we skipped our reservation. Tonight friends picked this place and we didn't have a say. The place is super loud, making it very hard to have conversations. They shove soooo many people in and don't adhere to reservation times. We had a reso for 8 and didn't get seated until 9:15. Truly insane. The food is overpriced. I will say that the tacos were really good, but $17.5 for four small tacos is ridiculous. I was DD tonight but the others in our party said the margaritas were really good. They do get 2 stars for that and for the service.

Hi Mandy, Thank you for your review - we are so sorry about the wait time and would like to chat with you privately to connect about the issues you had as well as invite you back to join us again for a really great experience. We will be messaging you privately.

We made a reservation for restaurant week last night. We didn't even wait to be seated. One look at this place and they are clearly not taking COVID restrictions seriously. The tables are absolutely not 6 feet apart. Customers aren't required to put a mask on when servers approach. There is no protection for the bartender or patrons at the bar. Those waiting are allowed to congregate at the entry. And there is no way they are operating at less than 50% or whatever the current allowances are. This looks like pre-COVID operating. I get that restaurants are struggling but I can't imagine being a staff member here. We cancelled our reservation. Nothing about this experience looked safe. No food is worth contracting COVID or spreading it to those who might be more vulnerable.

I will say I enjoyed the food here. I was able to get a variety of tacos with someone and also the corn and the guacamole dip. We also enjoyed some margarita drinks which you can never go wrong. One thing that did make us uncomfortable was our waiter standing over me while I paid for my food and left tip. I'm not sure if this is policy or if this was just that one night and that one waiter. It just felt awkward to have someone over your back paying and putting in the tip. The tip and payment is put into a tablet by the way, so as she handed it to us to pay she waited there for us to be done and that's why it had to be done right there. Really turned a good outing into a weird one right as we were leaving.

I came here for a birthday dinner with friends, and it was definitely very busy on a Friday night. Even though we had a reservation, it took us a bit to be seated and served. The service was pretty slow because of the amount of people, and it was difficult to get our waiter's attention. Other than that, our experience was very fun and enjoyable.  The margaritas are delicious, and the guac and salsas were tasty but small. I loved how I could get the fish tacos in lettuce cups- these were fresh and flavorful. The Brussels weren't crispy and a little disappointing, but the potatoes were tasty as a side. Overall, this is a nicer Mexican restaurant for a night out, and the ambiance is fun. The portions are small and service on the slow side but expected in the river north area.

Loses two stars for adding a four percent covid surcharge. News flash, pandemic is over, restrictions are all lifted.  Raise prices if must, ok.  Adding surcharges is bs. Are they going to remove it one day?  Of course, not. They have had it now over twelve months. Who do they think they are fooling??!  Their competitors don't pull this garbage.  Add this surcharge to tax and tip, and price you actually pay is over thirty percent above listed menu price  Lose another star because portion sizes are tiny for prices they charge. Too many better alternatives.  Go elsewhere.
Hi, thank you for your review. We no longer collect any COVID-19 tax and have not enforced this surcharge in quite a while.

Went here for a birthday lunch with my friend. It is easy to miss from the street. It's a really small hole in the wall place from the outside, but the inside is absolutely beautiful. We ordered the crispy chipotle shrimp to share. It was amazing! The flavor of the chipotle is sauce is perfect!  Then I ordered the camaron tacos and my friend ordered the carne tacos. Both were incredibly tasty. The camaron tacos are very liquidy due to the chipotle sauce inside but I think they were still amazing. Just be forewarned if you are sensitive to texture.  Overall, loved my experience and the food!

Went on a Thursday evening , was lucky enough to book a spot for 2 +1 yr old just two hours before our dinner time so that was nice.  But they were definitely busy, trying to get you in & out - which was good bc our food was speedy quick to arrive but the waitress/waiter was definitely trying to get you through quickly. They were great at refilling waters though, always asked if you wanted something more to eat/drink. Food was great as well too!  Not cheap, but the (carne) tacos were stuffed full and super fresh tasting. My husband didn't love his mahi-mahi tacos and they were a little skimpy on the flavor & amount of stuffing in those ones. The guac was a hit (extra, but complimentary), especially with our 1yr old.

Nice taco place in a good location. Parking isn't hard to find. There is a parking garage across the street, or you can try and find street parking. The margaritas were good. I really enjoyed the parajo loco, great for pics. The guacamole was ok, we just had the traditional. I had the shrimp tacos, very good. The shrimp came in some type of garlic sauce, which were the only 2 things on the taco. It comes with 4 small tacos, so if you're hungry order a side. I also tried the street corn, it was pretty good as well

Visited Mercadito for drinks and appetizers! Fun and lively atmosphere! Queso was delicious, make sure to ask for tortilla chips for dipping (in addition to the flour tortillas it is served with)! Service was average.
The food was great, great atmosphere, however I do not recommend coming here for a birthday or with a group larger than 4 people. They do not split checks and leave you to do the the math.

Thank you for your feedback and we are so glad you enjoyed the food and atmosphere! We are very sorry about your experience with how the bill was handled. we'd love to invite you back for a discounted meal so that we can make this right, and will be reaching out privately. This billing policy is currently under review by management. We hope to see you back soon!
I recently went there and saw so many amazing products. The food was great and affordable. I would definitely recommend this place!

While spending labor day weekend in Chicago (being a tourist in our own Chi town), we came across Mercadito and it didn't disappoint at all. While most restaurants were buzzing in River North, this one seemed a little less busy and off the main grid,  we were a little unsure of what to expect! Mercadito was a pleasant surprise to our expectations and we had one of the best 'from scratch' tapas style meal. Their street quesadillas were our most favorite dish,  other items such as flautas, chicken tacos and fish tacos were equally delicious! Their habanero salsa was more flavorful then most other places we've tried (there's a $3.50 upcharge for salsa,  which I didn't like). The food was delicious and so was their customer service.  Highly recommend trying this place out and it will for sure exceed your expectations!

Finally stopped into this place after passing it every time I walk down Milwaukee! Very delicious tacos and price was reasonable. I got a special taco (Chica.. something, I can't remember), the Garlic Shrimp and Crispy Fish. The special and Garlic Shrimp were so good! Crispy Fish was just okay. My roommate got the chips and salsa and both were great!  Would recommend and would come back!

I had no idea this place existed until my husband casually mentioned it. I am so glad he did! We tried the Potato and Poblano tacos. The sweet and spicy chicken tacos, the crema de elote, and the Horchata milkshake. Potato-poblano: AMAZING!  Sweet and Spicy chicken: tastes like a Mediterranean taco...not my favorite. Something was missing...it was a bit dry.  Crema de elote: Great, loved the flavor and the chips that go with it are authentic, crispy, perfectly salted.  Horchata Milkshake: DO NOT SKIP THIS! I would come back just for this shake. It's the perfect amount of sweet, surprisingly refreshing, and the perfect amount of richness.  Definitely coming back. We ordered our food to go so not too much staff interaction but they seemed very nice.

Sweet and spicy chicken taco was my favorite. The beef is good too, not too spicy if you avoid the peppers. And their house chips are amazing. Staff is very friendly, patient with all my questions about ingredients (because I'm allergic) and masked up of course. The park benches outside are ideal on a nice day.

Found myself in Wicker Park on Sunday and we were wandering up and down Milwaukee looking for a place to grab a quick bite. I'm so happy we landed on Antique Taco! The set up is easy enough- order your tacos at the counter and grab a table. Since this was my first visit here, I went simple and got the steak taco (my go-to anywhere) and the crispy fish. The crispy fish actually ended up being my favorite! I loved how the smoked cabbage complimented the the fish (that was ACTUALLY crispy). The steak taco had a lot of good flavor too and I loved the queso that came on it. The tacos are decently sized, but at $5(ish) a taco, the price is definitely up there. The quality of ingredients definitely makes it worth it in my opinion though! My husband got the fried chicken burrito. He LOVED it and has brought up going back multiple times since sunday LOL. I kept stealing the chips the burrito was served with because they were so tasty. Since we were in and out pretty quick, we didn't get the chance to try some other menu items. Really looking forward to another visit and trying the chips/salsa and the horchata milkshake!

My Chicago taco search has been dreadful... Antique was next on my list to try.  The service:  I can't speak to this much. I ordered to-go each time. There are always adequate napkins and they give you salsa, and the people are kind.  The food:  I tried the pork carnitas, garlic shrimp, grilled steak, and the crispy fish.  The pork carnitas is delectable and there is a slice of bacon to top it. The carnitas with bbq sauce is well seasoned.  The garlic shrimp is the least of my favorite, but still good. The elote cauliflower adds a different taste. I am not certain I like the kale with this taco - it stands out more than it should.  The grilled steak is one of my favorites. The flavors go really well together and the steak is SEASONED and tender. It doesn't require the other taco dressings to pull it up (like many tacos I've had around Chicago).  The crispy fish taco is a welcomed surprise and it is also another favorite. The smoked taste of the cabbage and the spicy tartar sauce stand out. Cod is such a light fish, but still stood out and was nice and flaky. It is a good combination of flavors! I finally have a trusty taco place in Chicago. I've tried many - I just like seasoned food, down to the meat, which should be able to stand alone. *I will be back

My go-to is the Antique Taco Salad, add chicken. It's so filling and tastes great but still seems healthy. Always comes with a generous portion of strawberries! Just had the fried chicken burrito for the first time and it was so good. Had a nice little kick to it too.  Tacos are all solid - I haven't found a favorite yet but do chicken and shrimp most often.  Nice outdoor seating off the main street. Simple seating indoors.

Ate lunch here a couple of weeks ago. Greeted at the counter by a very friendly, helpful young lady. Best tacos I've had in many years. Between my husband and I, we tried the steak, pork, chicken, cod (with smoky cabbage) and shrimp tacos. All fantastic in their own way. Also had their elotes which was so good, we got another container to take home. I tried their strawberry basil margarita which was obviously hand-crafted and one of the most delicious cocktails I've ever had. Good thing we don't live closer or we'd be broke from wanting to eat here all the time.

Came to check this place out for lunch and it was amazing! We literally ordered probably everything on the menu hahaha and had drinks soooo good! If ever in Wicker Park in Chicago this is another great place to check out for tacos, margaritas , and more. Definitely did not disappoint l!

Such a delightful place! I have Crispy Fish taco, Grill Steak taco, and Garlic Shrimp taco for to go. While waiting for the meal, I took several pics for their cute mural and that made my day. Needless to say, their tacos are in such a beautiful traying, it's colorful, healthy,  and absolutely tasty!  Personally recommend:  Crispy Fish: fried fish, red cabbage with spicy sauce  Garlie Shrimp: crispy kale with seasoning shrimp

Tried the garlic shrimp, carnitas and the special mushroom fajitas tacos. Annnd wow so flavorful. I didn't even want to put salsa on them. But i did because I had to try it so ate each taco half with salsa half without.  Each taco was felt light but rich with flavor and a pretty good size. The tortilla has good flavor and holds up. No breaking even after scooping some thick salsa.  Garlic shrimp was incredible. I kept stopping to think what flavors I was getting because each bite was almost completely different. I think my tastebuds were just exploring everything on that taco.  Carnitas taco was good. Almost a lighter and fresh version of a pulled pork sandwich.  Mushroom fajitas taco was great as well. If it wasn't for texture you could have fooled me and told me it was steak. Also the toppings that just make all these tacos complex and delicious.  The spicy salsa wasn't spicy, it had a little kick but it was delicious. I'm curious to how it was made. I got some butternut squash flavor. And it was a bright burnt orange color.  This is definitely a place where you can enjoy some tacos and eat them like if you were a sommelier.

Food: I got the shrimp taco, pork and steak. Pork and steak one's were off the charts good. The shrimp one was also fantastic, but it felt like an exploration taco (kale, eggs, shrimp).  - Also make sure you get their hot sauce and salsa. Vibe: natural sunlight, wood tables, good place for lunch Service:  fast and nice

I am in LOVE. Antique Taco, don't ever change.  I ordered delivery through DoorDash, full well expecting that the food would not be in its prime. But if this was not its prime, then what does the fresh version taste like?! The chips are not too thin and not too thick but fried and salted flawlessly. The creamed elote was creamy, spicy perfection with both tapatio and tajin. But the best part? The homemade tortillas for the tacos. They were on par with those I've had from a true, Mexican home and I'm downright obsessed.  I've had more than my fair share of Mexican food, having married into a Mexican family and lived in Los Angeles. And Antique Taco is Mexican food perfection I thought only existed in my head. There's not even a hint of "too trendy" or "over hyped here." It's an elevated authentic, and I can't wait to order more on the menu. You can't go wrong with this spot.

The tacos were good but overall a bit pricey for me. I'd be happy to eat Antique Taco again though.  We did delivery during covid. Everything was neatly transported and I'm glad they threw in some salsa as well.  We started with a tortilla soup which was just ok. I wouldn't get it again. It was a bit bland and was crying out for some chicken or something more. I was glad to have the cheese and tortilla chips sent separately.  We also started with some elote which wasn't quite elote. It was tasty but it was technically like creamed corn with elote seasoning. Definitely not quite what was expected. I did like the roasted salsa quite a bit though. Oddly it was like a hint of creme was added to this as well.  Not a wide variety of tacos, the classic options, all done right. The pork was the best, most heavily seasoned. I would definitely go for this again. The chicken was a bit average but spicier than expected which was nice.

I've heard great things about Antique Taco, so when the craving for tacos hit, I knew I had just the spot! A Sunday afternoon delivery order was fast, food was warm, and everything was packaged well. I ordered three tacos (pictured) and my boyfriend got the Fried Chicken Burrito. We had to order the Creamed Elote after hearing rave reviews, too! Glad we ordered it becuase it was my favorite part of the meal.  With tacos priced between $4.95-5.50, there are definitely cheaper options out there, but the interesting flavor combos at Antique Taco and quality of ingredients seem to warrant the price. However, I was so disappointed in my Grilled Steak Taco. The meat was SO dry and chewy, it hurt my jaw to chew through a bite. There weren't many other flavors or textures on the steak taco so I dumped my salsa on to salvage the priciest taco in my order. Maybe it was an off day for steak? The Pork Carnitas and Sweet and Spicy Chicken tacos were good, Pork being my favorite. I'd be willing to give Antique Taco another shot with a few order modifications. That Creamed Elote was just too good to forget!

One hit and one miss on my test run for Antique Taco. I was looking for a new taco place and tried the two on the menu that by far looked best to me: steak and fish. The former was great, but I could barely stomach the latter.  The takeout process at the side window was efficient and friendly. When I got home and opened my container, the smoky smell of the sauce on the fish taco was overwhelming. I gave it a chance, and unfortunately it just wasn't for me: the sauce overwhelmed it and made the fish taste off. It might have been less overwhelming if the ratios were better: lots of sauce and cabbage, but the piece of fish barely stretched half the diameter of the tortilla.  On the brighter side, the steak taco was outstanding! It had a very generous amount of flavorful and nicely cooked steak, and a pile of arugula to provide some freshness and bite. The salsa that came with the tacos was very tasty but unnecessary given how much great flavor this one had.  So, the best I can do is three stars for this visit. I'd order the steak taco again in a heartbeat, but I'm skeptical about the rest. They have more creative combinations than most taco places, but I think it's just not for everyone.

I've been here twice, but the most recent time I was most impressed. I got the fried chicken burrito, and it was so good! They definitely don't try and be authentic, but the flavors were all there. I like how they added some greens to contrast everything else that was fried. The burrito was also a better price point than the tacos. I don't remember which tacos I had gotten the time before. I remember liking them, but I don't remember exactly what was in them. They have a window where you can order outside, which is nice for warm summer days and covid precautions. I've never seen what the place looks like on the inside because I'm pretty sure it's been closed since I discovered the place.

Stopped in Antique Taco in Wicker Park this past weekend.  We ordered the Taco 10 Pack to go.  The tacos were packaged well and made it through our travels home.  We ordered the Sweet & Spicy Chicken with jalapenos on the side and the Pork Carnitas . The chicken was not too spicy , and the pickled onions and cucumbers added a bit of spice .  The pork was very good.  It came with a full bacon slice on top, along with avocado , onion, queso and spinach.  The spinich was not necessary and did not add much flavor. The pork carnitas tacos were so good and all the flavors were a perfect blend.  Would definitely try again.

DELICIOUS TACOS! It's a little on the pricey side for tacos, but it's well worth it. You must try the habanero salsa. It's not terribly spicy, but incredibly tasty and smoky. The elote side is a must to share for the table. Adorable space and very eco-conscious!

OMFG, best steak tacos I've ever had, and I spent 20 plus years in Southern California. Beats Big Star by a long shot. Huge tacos, that include onions, what I believe was arugula, and a side of hot sauce that is the perfect amount of heat. Two and I was full!

The tacos were pretty good in taste! We got the potato poblano one that's on the menu and 2 others that were on the specials. I just wish they had more than 1 vegetarian tacos on the main menu!  We got lucky because 2 of the specials happened to be vegetarian. They have few benches outside for seating which is nice in the summer!

I've walked past this place a bunch of times. Finally my brother and I decided to check it out.  The atmosphere is awesome! Great Latin decor combined with perfect tempo music. It makes you want to try everything and dance while you do so.  My brother ordered the torta which is what I intended to. Unfortunately, I decided to go with the Jibarito. While it was pretty good, it paled in comparison to his. The combination between really dry plantain flour(?!) for the breading, the moist chicken breast, and the raw vegetables made for an impossible-to-hand-eat mess of a sandwich. The flavors weren't a bad combination when I could get them all at once just not what I had in mind.  Again, I mis-ordered so this is still a five star place. The food my brother had was amazing, the rice/beans side dish was amazing, and the drinks were mixed just right. I'm looking forward to returning to try anything else on the menu!

This is a favorite spot in my neighborhood, with fast and friendly service, and delicious food.  Most recently my friend and I went here for brunch on a weekday. It's exciting to see a local business so busy and energetic even on off hours! The place was busy but we were seated pretty quickly and both had egg based breakfasts (she had an omelet and I had one of the rice and beans and eggs options). The food was great, as was the iced coffee.  One thing to note- it's a very small space so probably not ideal to bring strollers into, and may require some maneuvering during busy hours with wheelchairs. I'll definitely keep coming back and enjoying this local gem!

Overpriced the entire menu This isn't TimeSquare or Downtown Jibarito should not cost +$14.95 and EXTRA FOR CHEESE!!!!! Some of the dishes lack flavor including the Jibarito. 4oz of Wine $9.00!!! Stop it please stop it.

Disappointed. Embarrassed.  I eat here 3x or more a week, going on 3 years... work schedule.   Anyhow,  I showed up with family and friends and was told I couldn't get a table until everyone showed up.... but tables were empty?!  Almost everyone including owner see me weekly! The staff is also trained to quickly remove your plate if it looks half way empty.  They don't ask you,  they take it! The waiter was so annoyed that we kept on ordering and wouldn't close our check.   Food is ok but def not a 4 or 5 star so please.... I struggle to return and see customers leave dont continue losing customers.  There are many great places in the neighborhood that will easily wipe you out. Revisit your strategy.  Perhaps start a reservation system.  Waitlist. Open table. And let me/us enjoy my $200+ tab,  family,  food and moment.

This place was suggested to me by a friend and Definitely now is one of my favorite places to go to. Love the food, fast service. One of my favorite dish here is Chilaquiles Verdes. Highly recommended

Amazing food, drinks and service. The food came out fast and was fresh, generously portioned and piping hot. I got the huevos con bistec and would highly recommend. The cafe con leche was also perfection and the freshly squeezed orange juice was both refreshing and delicious. I will definitely be back again.
Wow wow  Latin food  Puerto Rican  Mexican food  Cuban food  Triple threat  Lol My kinda restaurant
Got takeout and the food was Great. Good size portions especially the burrito.  Came fairly fast as well

Went here this weekend with my boyfriend. I got the chilaquiles verdes, which came with rice and beans, and my boyfriend got the chorizo and avocado omelet which came with potatoes. We got empanadas as the starter and they were so good! The chicken tingga ones were our favorite! Horchata and the cafe con leche from here were really good too! Friendly staff and cool area! Would come again!
Excellent Chilaquiles Verdes with a side of avocado and cappuccino. I enjoyed this while sitting on the sidewalk, watching the world go by.

We really enjoyed our dinner here. We had a reservation, and was given a table right away. They did take a little long to take our order, and once the order was taken, I had to wait patiently once again for my drink to arrive. But other than that their service was flawless.  I tried their house margarita for $6 during happy hour. Regular price is $10 so I jumped on that real quick. My wife ordered their Ropa Vieja sandwich and I ordered their Asada Enchiladas once I noticed that they are served with skirt steak.  The Ropa Vieja sandwich was served with rice and black beans. The sandwich itself was delicious. Shredded braised beef served with cotija cheese packed in between French bread.  My skirt steak enchiladas were amazing. The skirt steak was diced and covered with salsa ranchera and crema. The steak was perfectly cooked but would have preferred the salsa to have a little more of a kick. It was still flavorful and served with a side of Mexican rice and retried beans.  You can't come to Cafe con Leche without actually ordering some Cafe con Leche. It was delicious and large so leave some room for some after dinner sipping.  We wanted to try some dessert and were shocked to see they actually offered Capirotada. I've never seen Capirotada on any menu ever, so we had to get it. You get a slice of house made Mexican bread pudding made with chocolate abuelita, piloncillo sauce topped with vanilla ice cream. It was very filling and you could tastes hints of that abuelita.  Overall, I really enjoyed my entire dinner and wouldn't hesitate returning. And they have parking in the rear which is a huge plus. I will be definitely back very soon.
50-60  mins

Last time I trick myself into thinking "this time will be different". Every single order regardless of delivery time is a soggy flavorless mess. This is the third and final time we order from Cafe con Leche. Avoid.
Had dinner recently ordered tapiqueña steak the meat was very tough and hard very disappointed. Please tell your chef tto marinade and season the meats. I will give you one more chance to come back.

This spot was cute and cozy!! The staff was amazing and we got our food right away for breakfast on a Monday ! Make sure you get the cafe con Leche it's such a yummy drink, not too sweet not too bitter. It's just right
Bistec sandwich we'll done is amazing 10/10 Enchiladas 7.5 /10 Big coffee / expresso selection The owner is super friendly. Takes care of the place very well

One would think it's a small restaurant but there are more tables and seats in the back. They were pretty busy when we came but since we had a reservation, we were sat down quickly. The menu we received did not have horchata in it but luckily, they have it! It was so refreshing and delicious! I have not had horchata in ages and this beverage definitely filled that void. It was not overly sweet, and just a perfect touch of cinnamon. We ordered a bunch of appetizers and dishes. The ceviche and empanadas were delicious. We had some plantains but I did not find them memorable. We also got chimichurri steak and steak jibaritos. Everything we got was tasteful and cooked on point. We also ordered caramel flan which was a perfect balance of sweetness and creaminess. One thing I regret is living too far from this place! They also have a parking lot in the back for customers!

This is one of those places I have often heard about for years and have walked past, but never made it inside. This past Saturday, I had the opportunity to swing by as a friend suggested we go for breakfast. I beat her there and knew we were gonna sit outside so they asked front or back. I didnt know there was a back patio and figured it would be better than the front and it was more than enough space back there. The woman controlling the seat situation told me they dont normally seat people that dont have their whole party there. Out of around 15-20 tables, only 3 were occupied so she figured it made sense to seat me at 9:30 am as it wouldnt have made any sense to have me standing around. Once seated and waiting for late ass, I decided to order a pineapple mimosa which was good. One she showed up, we ordered and I went for the breakfast burrito with chicken. I expected so much out of it and I just wasn't that good...lacked flavor. I assumed the refried beans and rice would be on the side, but it was in the burrito. Sauces didnt do much for it either.  I would like to try again for lunch or dinner, but not sure when.
I went here so many times for different occasions! Everyone loved the foods, drinks, and ambiance. The wait staff is so friendly and the food is delicious. I enjoyed the Cuban sandwich and breakfast!

Today, Sunday Jan, 17th I came to cafe con Leche for the first time.  Very disappointed. This place has no taste in their food. Very simple and pricey for the amount of food you get. My server was not nice. I place my order, 3 empanadas. Two tinga and one beef. I shorty not even a min later called the server to change it to one of each, and he said "sorry I placed the order already"  did NOT care to change it giving the fact that it hasn't even been.one min, I didn't think it was gonna be a problem. I was surprised the effort.they give to satisfy the customers.   My food was not tasty at all. The quality was very disappointing. There omelets don't even come with pancakes, everything is separate. Please check there menu before coming in here.

After a good morning run, my friends and I were looking for a good brunch spot in Logan Square.  When we saw that this place had good breakfast burritos we were sold.  To the surprise of none of us, the burritos were fantastic as advertised.  Be sure to use the sauces they give you on the side to add some extra flavor and spice.  The side of potatoes admittedly leaves a little to be desired from a flavor perspective, but besides that it was a fantastic meal.  With outdoor seating both in front and behind the restaurant, this is a great option for your summer brunch.
I'm afraid of posting a positive review because if more like me post them, I'll never get a seat at this popular place.
50-60  mins

This place is such a comfort food place: quick, delicious and great portions! You order at the cashier and then like 5' later they bring out your food. I am not even kidding-- that was how fast they are! We ordered Korean pork BBQ tacos, Bulgogi "banh mi" and a small fries (not the Kimchi fries). Everything was so yummy!! Portion size is reasonable, not too small, not too big. If you know me, you know that I like to break down different qualities to review :)) Overall: 4.5/5 1/ Location: 4.5/5 Nice area, near a bunch of dessert and coffee places so you can walk around and get a few treats easily! Parallel parking, so at times it can be tricky. 2/ Food: 4.5/5 Food was delicious! My BBQ pork was very good, and the bulgogi on "banh mi" was a nice touch too. For the tacos, the cabbage was mixed in with the pork well (and the cilantro too). I think I might like some fresh flavor/ingredients sprinkled on top to make that the perfect Korean taco for me! 3/ Price: 4/5 Reasonably priced for the area. I wouldn't say they are super cheap, but based on location and portion, that was a decent price. I would recommend anyone who likes some Korean fusion food visit this place when you are in town! I had a great experience! The place is a little small though, so you might be sitting very close to another table.

Was in town for a concert and dined-in here before making my way to Lincoln Hall. The food was great! I ordered the shrimp banh mi (which I devoured before I got the chance to take a picture) + a kalbi taco and got both in less than 15 minutes. The staff was kind and helpful.  The shrimp banh mi was amazing. There were lots of good flavors that went well together, they surprisingly didn't overpower each other. Some very minors things though: the sandwich wasn't cut in half when served and it was pretty saucy so it wasn't the neatest eating experience. I'm not sure if shrimp banh mis are easily findable around the area, but as a New Yorker it was a nice surprise menu item that I don't see often enough. Definitely recommend!! The kalbi taco was filled with a generous amount of marinated meat and veggies. It was a tad on the more flavorful/slightly salty side, but was still pretty solid. Utensils and drinks are self-serve and the food is brought to the table (please clean up after yourself!). The place was not the largest which made it a little hard with the self-service, but it is definitely worth it because the food and staff. It seemed like a popular place given the amount of people going in and out. Hope to come back again when I'm in town!

Amazing Korean food, definitely try the shrimp or kalbi tacos, the tofu hotpot and fries are great too. Korean flavors with a modern twist, love all the food here. Shrimp, kalbi, fish tacos are a must try. The tacos are very loaded, meats and veggies all taste fresh and the flavors are rich and satisfying. They all do use a spicy mayo which is a little bit of an easy win but the food is executed well. The fries are some of my favorite from anywhere. Thin and crunchy with a creamy yet light dipping sauce.  I very pleasantly surprised by the tofu hotpot. the portion is bigger than other Korean places and comes loaded with a lot of extras like shrimp, clams, a mussel, and some meat. As well as I think two eggs vs the normal one. They all come together for a very filling and satisfying meal. I wish it could be spicier, so I'll try to ask for extra spicy next time. Utensils, water are self service, you order and they bring it out to you. atmosphere is nice and modern but the space is a bit cramped. Price is good, especially with the crazy inflation we've been seeing lately. This will definitely be one of my go to restruants and if you have the chance, definitely give them a shot!

We live so close by and this is a wonderful grab and go place with decent food and fast service. There are other Korean fusion/street food places in town, but somehow this place has more substantial menu items. It's definitely more friends hangout place rather than sit down dinner restaurant.

Definitely my favorite spot to get quick and tasty meal. I have been coming here for quite some time now. The taco and bibibum are always good choices. They also have bento box, which comes with rice, a salad, and choice of meat, and its huge so super filling.

Parking is non-existent, so save some time and commute/walk here and explore the area while you're at it. Plenty of seating inside and a few seats outdoors. Can get packed, but clears out quickly because the food comes out quickly! Order at the counter and they'll let you know which table to sit at. Someone will bring the food to you, but be sure to clear your own table! You can't go wrong with any of the tacos, but I would definitely focus most of your energy on the bentos or soups/hot pots. The tacos were underwhelming- fish could use a little extra seasoning and kalbi was too heavy-handed on the toppings.  The star of the show is definitely the wings! It's 8 lollipops per order, perfect to share between two people. So crispy and the sauce is a perfect blend of sweet and (mildly) spicy.

This place was great just reading and watching how they have patrons assisting the staff in keeping the restaurant tidy. They have a list of rules on the table that mention things to follow. You basically bus your table for the most part. Getting into food, the Kalbi taco was something I wasn't expecting, the short rib meat with the slaw and and relish had an uncanny match, it was sweet and savory, but I wasn't gonna spend too much because each taco is 3.50. The OG chicken is definitely a share size and 1 serving can take care of 2 people easily. Would visit again.

All really good food in a a casual spot. Love that they have some classic Korean dishes but also modern takes on Korean food too. Ordered at the counter and was given a number where we were served pretty quickly. The food was great!! Really loved the bibimbop in the stone bowl - the rice at the bottom got nice and crispy so after mixing it up, there were wonderfully crispy bites throughout.  My partner really loves their tacos and said they didn't disappoint so I'll go with what he said! The kimchi fries were also good if you like kimchi :) surprisingly stayed crispy even under the veggies and sauces.  Definitely will come back here!

Best fusion for the right price. Del Seoul is playful with Mexican and Korean food and came up with an outstanding fusion menu.  Since there are plenty of Yelp reviews. I just give you my recommendation - go for tacos, you can't go wrong. If you are conscious of calories, skip the kimchi fries.  The four of us ate so much yet we walked out spending less than $20 per person, drinks and 18% gratuity included.

Easy and convenient Korean food, served street style. What isn't there to love?  We came when it was close to closing time, and felt sheepish for eating within an hour of when the employees might be trying to get customers out. However, the service was friendly and efficient, and I didn't feel rushed to get my order in.  I came with a small party of 4, and we each ordered something different. Unlike a Taco Bell, everything tasted different from each other and had distinctive fusions of Korean flavor.  I got the Bulgogi Banh Mi. I was pleased with the tall mountain of fresh vegetables and picked vegetables on my sandwich, but the bulgogi felt a bit tough. I was expecting the meat to be a bit more juicy and filled with sauce, but it was on the dryer end (probably because it was closer to the end of the day). I wish they had added some sauce of some sort because it was all rather dry in my mouth, but everyone else's orders had no problem.

Came from Texas , found this gem on yelps, look so interesting about their Korean tacos, so we wanted to give them a try. Simple menu, easy choices. Not too pricey for Korean food. We wanted to try everything on the menu. We end up order hot stone bibimbap and bulgogy bento box. Very yummy!!! Another delicious food we explore here in Chicago not a big restaurant fir you to hang out with large group , but definitely a great place for your tummy if u love Korean simple food.

I don't know how many times to say this but the shrimp tacos at this restaurant are amazing! I've been eating these tacos for like six years every time I visit the city and it exactly hits the spot every time! The gamja fries are not to be forgotten too! The restaurant is super casual and they suggest to sit at the table for 60 minutes.

Ok I know the wings are supposed to be the star of the show... but the tacos here are the best I've had in the city! I LOVED them. My husband liked them but wasn't as thrilled as me. We came for the wings for him. He enjoyed them and the sauce but said they could have been crispier and we agreed, they could use a little more heat for our preference. I ordered the shrimp and the carne tacos and I loved them both. One of the best shrimp tacos I have ever had. I would definitely come back just for the tacos.

My friend said "this is the best restaurant in all of Lincoln Park". A bold statement but I'm not going argue! I can't believe I've lived here for 2 years and just came here for the first time, I could eat here once a week and be so happy.  Top favorite items include: Shrimp Tacos, Bulgogi Bento Box and the Bulgogi Sandwich.

Wow. Where have I been. I can't believe I haven't checked this place out until now. We arrived right right when they opened up. The line started getting pretty long after we placed our order and sat down. The guy that took our order was great. Very welcoming and assigned us a table once we were done ordering. About half of the people sat down and the other half were call in orders. This place was jumping!  I ordered their sesame-chili shrimp tacos, bbq pork taco, and their Kalbi Taco. The shrimp taco was my least favorite. It was very tasty, but my wife makes something similar at home and just didn't feel unique to me. TAnd I probably wouldn't order it again because of that reason. I would still highly recommend it though. It came with sesame chili aioli, onion/cilantro relish and their secret slaw. The bbq pork taco was my 2nd favorite. It tasted similar to al pastor but not quite there. Would order it again. My favorite was their Kalbi. The beef was tender with a hint of sweetness. It's marinated in sweet soy, and served with their onion/cilantro relish and their secret slaw.  The cool thing about this place is that they have a lot more to offer than just tacos. I'll definitely be coming back. They have wings that I want to try and we'll as their bento boxes. Can't wait!

LOVE this place!! Not the fanciest by any means, but anything you order will be amazing. It's the perfect lunch spot! Indoor and outdoor seating available. My husband and I always order the sesame-chili shrimp tacos and split the seasoned gamja fries. We each had 2.5 tacos and were content with the portions. My only critique is that the fries could have been seasoned a little more. Otherwise, be sure to check out this place in Lincoln Park!

The service was fast and great. The staff were very very friendly. I had a hard time finding a parking spot, but I also don't live in Chicago, and was only visiting. I would've given 5 stars, but I just wasn't a fan of the tacos. And to be fair, it might've been my own tastebuds that didn't agree. However, I did love the fries. Masks are required at this location. I would visit again for the Kimchi fries.

Missed dining here so much! I've been craving for the shrimp tacos and kimchi fries so finally had a chance to dine back at Del Seoul. I called prior to dining to make sure they were open. I was told it's first come first serve, and that indoor dining is open. There seem to be less tables than before with some space in between the tables. I felt safe dining there since it wasn't a full house on a Friday night.  Ordered shrimp tacos it was exactly what I remembered. They were really good! Kimchi fries- absolute must, my favorite!!!  Fish tacos- I think they're my new favorite! Definitely going to get them next time!  Kalbi tacos- it was more like bulgogi tacos to me... I wouldn't order again only because I'd rather have shrimp & fish tacos! BBQ pork tacos- I wasn't a fan of them. I wouldn't order again.  K-town chicken wings- they're lollipop chicken wings. I enjoyed the flavor and the size of the wings Service was outstanding. Restaurant was clean. I sat next to the large window that was open. I can't wait to go back and enjoy some more!

Forgot how good this place is! Easy and convenient Korean style street food. Prices are incredibly fair and the variety is definitely there. Typically I get the bibimbap bowl in the hot stoneware. However, wanted to try the Bento box and tacos (was just as good). They are following guidelines - mask wearing when you are ordering, but if you are sitting you can remove. Felt safe eating there. 10/10 recommend!

Admittedly, I don't LOVE everything on the menu but let me do enlighten you to the best I've tried. The shrimp taco, fish taco and kimchi fries. You will not be able to find anything like them in any other fusion restaurant. They are some of the best tacos period that I have ever had! I wish I was back in Chicago so I can get me some more of these!

First I ordered shrimp tacos, kimchi fries, and bbq chicken tacos. The shrimp taco was unique and the sauce was delicious. Each bite had sauce and plenty of it. The kimchi fries were great as well. The bbq chicken tacos were a little too salty for my taste and less unique than the shrimp tacos. Walking in I saw all the bentos and vowed I'll be back to try them! All decently affordable, good portions, and very delicious looking.

Amazing flavors!! Loved everything we tried and we ordered a lot thinking they would be bite sized.  BEWARE: Their tacos are large and filling. 2-3 per person is more than plenty!  Chicken tikka, Nashville hot tofu, falafel, battered cauliflower, brisket, shrimp and grits, Cuban pig - wonderful flavors and textures  You will not regret eating here
Sonia, we love to hear that! Thanks for stopping in and we hope to serve your favorite tacos again soon

I love Velvet Taco because they stay open late and always bring out fresh food! My go-to is the Nashville Hot Tofu, which is absolutely amazing. The Korean Fried Rice taco is okay, definitely not Korean but still tasty. Their tater tots are good but not wow-worthy.  The service is fast and I love how the place looks inside. Perfect place for a quick snack or meal!
Sarah, we love to hear that! Thanks for stopping in and we hope to serve your favorite tacos again soon

I feel like fusion tacos can be hit or miss, but I was pleasantly surprised at how the tacos here were actually pretty tasty. A friend highly recommended the brisket taco and it was definitely a must-try, really tender and juicy. I also tried the spicy tikka chicken taco and shrimp and grits taco, and those had so much flavor. The picnic chicken taco and korean fried rice taco were meh though IMO -- you couldn't taste any potato salad in the picnic chicken taco (I was looking forward to that part specifically), and the korean fried rice taco didn't have as much flavor as the other ones.  Service is pretty quick here and prices are not bad either.
Iris, we appreciate the 4 stars and for joining us! Glad to hear you enjoyed the #12 angus taco and we can’t wait for you to enjoy our tacos again

So pleased with our visit! I enjoyed two tacos (friend paneer / Nashville hot tofu with a yummy ranch. I loved both of them and they were both super flavorful. Friends also ordered the 2 other vegetarian selections beer battered cauliflower/falafel and 2 pork tacos and everyone was in love with their taco choices and can't wait to go back! There is limited seating, but the vibes are right here from staff to music and of course tacos!

The tacos you probably haven't had before. TACOS WERE DELICIOUS! Each taco was unique varying from American, Indian, to Korean flavors. It's worth the visit when in Chicago. Seating was very casual and first come first serve.

I arrived in Chicago on a late flight and wanted something quick so I ordered online to pickup when I arrived (make sure to order on their website! Not through a third party to pay regular prices). I ordered a Rotisserie chicken, a Nashville hot tofu, and a Korean fried rice taco. They put cholula and a special hot sauce in the takeout bag. These were packed well so on my 10 minute walk home they did not spill or anything! My favorite was the Korean fried rice - it had the most flavor and texture. The rotisserie chicken tasted a tad dry, but was good if you add the special hot sauce they give you. I liked the flavor of the Nashville hot tofu, but the tofu was softer than my liking and with all of the sauce it was a little too rich/fatty
Hi Laura!  So happy to hear that you enjoyed the variety of tacos we offer.  We hope to see you again soon to enjoy some of your favorites.

We will be frequently visiting this place during our stay in Chicago. It's next door to out hotel and has solid food.  My husband had the jerk mango chicken taco. He enjoyed it. I had the mexi- Cali shrimp taco. I really liked it as well. The queso Blanco with the various salsas in it is definitely worth trying.  The hot sauce is done very well.  It has a smokey flavor to it along with a little kick- definitely ask for it on the side.  The kick ass margarita is sweet but good. I didn't have much hope for since it was coming out of a machine but it was solid. Not to mention, I love the name- the velvet taco!

I was really impressed with this spot. I love the concept and think it's executed pretty well. There's a wide variety of tacos, and a few options for vegetarians. It also looks like a lot of fun for a night drinking.  My favorite was the chicken and waffles taco. The waffle was cinnamon-y and it truly felt like brunch in a taco. They've got three vegetarian taco options (falafel, Nashville tofu, fried cauliflower) and tater tots too!
Sophie, thank you for the rave review!  We are so happy you enjoyed your tacos and the experience you had.  We can't wait for you to join us again.

Carryout Order: Picnic chicken - rotisserie chicken, avocado crema, warm honey-dijon potato salad, crispy chicken skin, cilantro, flour tortilla. & MexiCali Shrimp - blackened shrimp, napa slaw, citrus lime crema, sriracha, avocado corn pico, micro cilantro, flour tortilla Chicken was dry. Blackened shrimp was cooked alright. In my opinion, these tacos weren't terrible but are a classic example of "less is more". Even if they want to go fusion style, I think there were too many ingredients that were a mess together instead of harmonizing. Tacos were pricey. I don't think they're worth it for quality but at least each taco is pretty packed.
Nolan, we apologize that our tacos didn't hit the spot for you.  Please reach out to us at  Velvetgoldcoast@velvetta…  and let us know how we can make things right for ya!

So I lovvvveeeeee Velvet Taco. We ordered a Fried Paneer taco and a beer battered cauliflower taco, and OMG! Fried Paneer taco: Excellent! The paneer wasn't completely fried but I was happy that way. The flavors were soooooo goooood! Cauliflower taco: Complete surprise! How is that crunch being created? I love it. The spice with the corn create a wonderful contrast in taste. So two tacos should fill you up, but you can get an app or extra if you are super hungry. Price wise, not super bad. Service is alright, but it's a order and pickup place, not a dine-in type. There are seats upstairs if you want to seat in.  The food won't disappoint. Really.
Thank you for the 5-Star review!  We are so glad you enjoyed some of our vegetarian options and we hope you come back soon to enjoy your favorite tacos!

Doesn't look grand but serves GRAND food! The fried paneer taco and the beer battered fried cauliflower taco are the best tacos I've had so far. It had the right amount of spices and offers a great fusion of Indian and Mexican food. I absolutely loved the taste and we ended up ordering the same thing twice. I wish this place had a branch in California! Great place for vegetarians craving spices.

Great food not nice people. We loved the queso Blanco. We were sure to get seats by the window first. Despite having a seat, we were told we had to get it" to go" . The margaritas and Paloma look great but No virgin options. The tacos were not worthy of a picture as they were smashed into the box. I tried to explain we had seats but rudely told sorry. Bad experience.

Velvet Taco is a solid taco spot that spices up its menu with unique flavors and ethnic influences and merges it into delicious bites. Service is pretty quick and there's a good amount of seating. If you come late, you just have to make your way through the lengthy line for Jeni's. The Spicy Tikka Chicken had a good cook and decent flavor. Light on the spice but they have condiments around to kick it up a notch.  Cuban Pig - Was a solid taco that hits as expected  Tacos are of decent size for the price.

Loved this place! The Indian fusion vegetarian taco options were so unique and delicious! Wasn't a huge fan of the falafel taco but loved the paneer one! The queso and chips are a must.  Perfect spot for a delicious meal that's quick and super satisfying. Will recommend to others!
Thanks for stopping by and trying out some of our unique tacos.  We hope to see you again soon Isha!

Velvet Taco - open in Columbus Ohio! My mother and I ordered five tacos and their Tator Tots. We were definitely eating with our eyes as each taco is filled heartily with yummy goodness. The flavors are simply amazing. Each taco has the taste you would expect from its name.  While we did not finish all five tacos in one sitting, we did enjoy them a bit later that evening and they were still tasty.
Marie, we are so happy you and your mother enjoyed the tacos!!!  We pride ourselves in global tastes and tacos filled with yummy-ness!!!  We are happy ya'll were satisfied with the food!!!

It was so delish!  I was pleasantly surprised.  My brother and I each tried 3 tacos a piece.  The cheese burger taco was my favorite that chicken taco was great too!  The manager in training greeted us and explained everything to us.  That margarita was perfect.

Short review- People Place Product Price The full review People - Hip groovy staff, hopping to get the order done in a line of mostly millennials at Noon on a Sunday!  Place - great location in the heart of rich Gold Coast. The second floor has a great view of the park in front of Carmines - nice spot for super car watching.  Product- Cuban taco was good. The black angus my wife like a lot. All the taco meats were generously portioned including the shrimp. However, the green chili pork is the piece de resistance. It seems to have cheddar grains in the taco, very distinctive. Quality in every bite.  Price - all the tacos except for the shrimp was about $4.50 the shrimp was $5.75. Folks the park across the street sells the most expensive Gelato/ice cream I've had in Chicago. The restaurants lining this triangle plaza are all very ritzy. Velvet Taco is in a bougie spot you can have on a beer budget.

Pretty good tacos. I loved it. I ordered the Buffalo chicken, rotisserie chicken, and spicy tikka chicken and the fish and chips. My favorite would probably be the fish and chips. I am biased for fish tacos. Second favorite was probably the Buffalo bc I always love a good chicken tender.  The one I liked the least was the chicken tikka, only bc I don't like rice and didn't realize it had in there. Other than that flavor was good.  I liked the rotisserie because it had a lot of freshness to it like lettuce and tomatoes, and corn.

While I've gotten tacos from here over the years, I feel like it could be a hit or miss. Sometimes the ingredients are dry (Cuban pig, always) but other times it's good. This most recent time it was GOOD.  My bf and I took tacos to-go since it was near closing time. He ordered the Korean pork and I got the Grilled Flank Steak and Shrimp 'n Grits, both which I've ordered before. He liked his and I really enjoyed mine. Meat was tender, both were flavorful, and they really hit the spot after a couple of drinks.  I love to come back here when I'm looking for specialty tacos.

Still, hands down, my favorite taco place.  My friends and I came here after a night out (move over Chinatown and McDo's). I don't know why we didn't do this sooner.  The place was busy but nothing crazy. I ordered the Kobe or wagyu burger taco and the shrimp 'n grits taco. The burger taco was really good but the shrimp 'n grits one was AMAZING.  This place is worth going to at any time of the day.

I finally came back after a year! I went in October with a friend. I ordered the flank steak taco, Cuban pig taco, and the margarita. The flank steak was still my favorite. It was tender, juicy, and cooked to perfection! The Cuban pig was decent. The margarita was quite strong and for a good price too. I'll be coming back here for a long time!

I LOVED this place :) I went here with some friends to catch up because one of them said she heard raves about their tacos. I ordered the Cuban Pig and Grilled Flank Steak. The steak was my favorite but I will definitely come back to try the others. I have suggested the place to my mom and other friends, but maybe I should keep it to myself so only I know about it :P (just kidding). Also, the Crispy Tots & Local Egg was mouthwatering and delicious.  The place also looks nice: clean and very colorful. Two floors and long tables with stools. The mural is great, too. We are all her when we eat here!

I was very surprised by how good this place was. Not a lot else was open for food on a Tuesday night around us, so that's why we came here to be honest. Being from San Diego, we are spoiled by top notch tacos, so my expectations were low. But, the tacos we got tonight were so delicious. We got two steak, one or the Indian curry, and one Buffalo. So delicious.  I spoke with the manager afterwards to let him know and he was very humble. Would recommend.
Nima, we appreciate you stopping by and leaving such a wonderful review of your experience with us.  We hope to see you again the next time you're around!

Best taco and good portion ! We go to del Seoul for tacos but this place blows them away ! My Jew favorite place for tacos . The portions are generous. Which I appreciate. I wished we lived closer so we could go more often ! Definitely the best fusion taco In the area !

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

We got take out from here and it was awesome! The Korean tacos (pork and beef) are such a fun twist on traditional Korean food, and the jap chae and bibimbap were excellent too! I ordered on Yelp and they called immediately after placing my order to let me know they were out of white rice and offered the black rice instead. It was delicious and I appreciated the quick communication! It was ready in about 30 min for pick up. The toppings on the bibimbap were amazing, and I hope they add a dolsot (hot stone bowl) option once they reopen for dine-in service!

This is by far my favorite restaurant in Chicago. It comes down to two things-  Price -  It's only $8 for two tacos and they are quite large so that's basically a full meal. Instead of chipotle, try to mix it up for less money and get more flavor  Taste -  Their tacos are insanely flavorful, i especially love the spicyness.
