The shells are so soft and perfectly hold the meat and toppings  This is a must try in the Wicker park/ bucktown area!

This place is terrific! I've been wanting to try it out for years but now that I live closer, will frequent this places It has a small menu - paratha tacos, bibimbap, sashimi bap, and a few appetizers like dumplings and japchae noodles. I tried their pork and beef tacos - they are pretty sizeable and I was stuffed from two tacos. The shell is flaky and delicious A- reminds me of a Chinese scallion pancake without the pancake. Each taco order also comes with a spicy aioli which was delicious - spicy with a hint of sweetness.  My husband and I both preferred the beef over the pork because the pork texture is more broken up, whereas the beef is more distinct pieces of bulgolgi. The spicy pork was also pretty high on the spices, which we usually enjoy but it meant we couldn't use as much of the aoili. All in all, both were good and we will definitely be back! Only suggestion would be to add some items as appetizers like kimchi fries.

Food: excellent  Service: quick Counter service spot with a few communal tables that has been in this same location for many years. Love how fresh the ingredients are - the bibimbap bowls are delish and their tacos are so, so, SO GOOD. THE "tortillas" are fried or something and it makes them flakey and extra delish. Two tacos is plenty of food for a meal. The pork is my favorite meat there but is a bit spicy so buyer beware. Have been coming here since 2014 and will continue to!

This is my go-to quick dinner spot. They have fast service and the tacos and bubimbap are my favorite. The cashier is so nice and always greets you with a smile and hello. When I lived a block from there - I'd eat here at least once a week. Never disappointed, constantly delicious.
Love En Hakkore. I've probably already given them a good review but they are truly one of our go to eats especially now as we don't eat out nor order out much since last year.

I absolutely love En Hakkore. I generally get the two tacos when I go -- Of them are good: tofu, veggie, pork, beef. I'm not a fan of corn tortillas and the tortillas here are flour which are a great fit for the Korean flavors. If it's been a while since I've been there I start to crave them. I know others who love the bibimbap. Staff is super friendly and on the whole the atmosphere is good. Sometimes the music can get a little bit loud. I wish they used compostable Takeaway containers.

Love this place for a fresh twist on bibimbap and some Korean fusion dishes. I always get their bibimbap w/ beef and the spicy pork paratha tacos ~ really really delicious (I'm Korean so my standards for Korean food are pretty high lol). Indoor space is cute and always clean which I appreciate.  Parking is usually pretty easy on Damen. Service is friendly and professional.  Definitely one of my go-to places in Chicago for fast fresh Korean food!

The serving sizes were pretty decent besides the kimchi. The side of bulgogi was more like a rice bowl and the sauce for the bulgogi fries were great. They didn't put sauce in the bibimbap sushi burrito but it had a great assortment of things like imitation crab meat and avocado. It doesn't come with a large amount of sauce but it doesn't really need it. I ended up just putting it in a bowl with the kimchi and the sauce so that I could mix it all up. I got this delivered, so not sure what the restaurant experience is like.
35-45  mins

I've been here twice now, and plan to come back again soon (I HOPE)...  These Paratha tacos are so good and tasty, you can't go wrong with either BBQ Beef or Spicy Pork. I eat these so quick, because they are so good when fresh and hot out of the kitchen.  I'm not a food chemist but...  Crispy, slightly chewy, sweet: Paratha Salty, sweet, spices: Marinated Beef/Pork  Fresh, crunchy: Slaw I think that hits all the corners of sensation to unleash an amazing combination that simply hits the spot so good when you're craving asian food/spices.

Here's the long/short of it: this place has the best Korean BBQ Beef tacos I've ever had. Period. It doesn't get any better than the way En Hakkore does it. Would highly recommend to anyone who is looking for something that is truly best in category of tacos and Korean BBQ. Will be returning again, again, and again.
Be aware when you pick up pork taco- sauce is dripping!   (Beef taco was okay) Yet the taste is good. Hopefully they change the taco packaging.

It looks cool, It feels cool, and It taste great. I had the spicy pork and beef taco. The pork is a touch too spicy but I'm not complaining others might and the full effect of the spice takes about 5 seconds to bloom. The Beef is great. Now I have previously stated Del Seoul has excellent tacos - they still do. What this place has is tons more atmosphere. Look at the pics Thanks to Nick G for leading to this place  Excellent tacos as usual 032619 had the beef, pork and tofu it's spicy- be warned.  The bimbimbap plates was good but I much prefer the Tacos.

It looks cool, It feels cool, and It taste great. I had the spicy pork and beef taco. The pork is a touch too spicy but I'm not complaining others might and the full effect of the spice takes about 5 seconds to bloom. The Beef is great. Also their tortillas is unique it's, It's has more substance than your usual tortilla. Now I have previously stated Del Seoul has excellent tacos - they still do. What this place has is tons more atmosphere. Look at the pics Thanks to Nick G for leading to this place.

Can't go wrong with a meal from En Hakkore everything is delicious. The portions on the quality well worth the meal you are that experience. Whether you're with a group of people or just on a date or considering ordering you can't go wrong. Flavors are amazing

Like this place! The menu consists of unique dishes they execute very, very well.  My go-to dish here is the sashimi bap, which is essentially a salad with tons of fresh/pickled/marinated veggies, chunks of sashimi, and served with rice (go for the brown rice!) and choice of sauce (go for the gochujang for something a little spicy).  Mix it all together, and voila, you've got the best rice bowl in Bucktown. So good!! When I'm in the mood for something more decadent, the paratha tacos and mandoo are fantastic. En Hakkore is right by the 606, and folks who run the place are always super friendly :-) If you've been there, you already know this place is legit. If you haven't, be sure to give it a try, you can thank me later.

Middle of the road. Not bad, not great. I'm thinking the tacos might really be where it's at, but unfortunately I had the Sashimi Bap with a side of paratha bread and didnt have an experience that is really worth talking about. The paratha bread was really good, and that's what they make their tacos with. The sashimi bap was a huge, half-filled bowl that consisted mostly of shredded cabbage. Very small portion of rice, tiny portion of sashimi, no sauce on it (though there were sauces on the table).  Once I put sauce on it, it was tasty enough, but I felt like I paid $11 for a bowl of raw cabbage. Probably would not order again. There are many other places that do poke better, even though this was not called poke. The service was very surprising. One cook, one clerk, and a bustling neighborhood of hipsters and millennial moms dining in and everybodyntheymama ordering delivery.  For some reason my paratha bread came out 10 minutes before my meal...*shrug* This place is also really small, offering cramped communal seating. And since so many people are crammed in a small space it is really loud. It is a personal pet peeve of mine when a place has a tip option on their checkout if I have to place my order at the counter and bus my own table. The girl walked three steps to bring my meal. I feel like a jerk if I don't tip when it is an option, but if I had not been prompted to, I wouldnt have even given it a second thought, since it was mostly self-serve. I might give this place another shot and try the tacos next time, but I dont really have high hopes for my opinion changing.

This is fusion done right! They make paratha tacos that are this smooth, silky, and buttery like taco that is also crispy. It has a soft crunch before it gives and the taco just melts in your mouth.  The spice level is great - it is hot, so beware of that! But it lets me enjoy my food really slowly and really take in the flavors of the pork. I also tried the beef and it is quite a competition for #1 between them. They are both so good. If and when I come back to Chicago, this will definitely be one of my first stops! Also for $4 a taco, this is such a great deal because it is so buttery and filling. I had a larger breakfast that day, and one taco was enough for me. As a meal by itself, two tacos would probably be best but I can see how one is adequate. The sauce and flavoring of the meat was to die for I really can't wait for the day I come back!

I'm not a fan of bibimbap just because of all the veggies but I can't deny the freshness and presentation. My friends all liked the mandoo and tacos which I feel like would have made more sense for my palate and I should have gotten instead.

The beef paratha tacos are worth visiting this place but the pork one is a tad too spicy.  I would skip the bibimbop as the rice was a bit dry and meat / protein proportion to the rice was underwhelming.
35-45  mins
Amazing customer service,  jamia was very attentive and the food was amazing! definitely coming back!
Thank you for your review, Ajax and Jamia will be very happy to hear your feedback. Please join us again soon for the best happy hour in town!

The food was really good and they have a great selection of margaritas.  The service is what set my experience apart.  Our server was very friendly and was eager to help us navigate through the menu of food items and drinks to make a selection.  Even though the restaurant was busy while we were there, it didn't impact our service or our server's attentiveness to our needs.  I had to look up her name on the check and wanted to make sure she got credit for a great experience. Great job Emma, we will be coming back because of you.
Hello Karl, We are happy to hear about your experience! We appreciate you taking the time to share! Emma and team will be very happy to hear your feedback.

Pink Taco is a VIBE. The food is delicious , but the entire place was decked out with incredible mural art, and OF COURSE I loved all of the pink touches. I went for brunch, but I saw they have incredible deals on Tuesday's for taco Tuesday.  Here's everything I tried: Pink Tacos: The OG Pink (shredded chicken), Sweet Potato, Baja (fried shrimp) Strawberry Margarita (in a pineapple) - to be honest, it was just ok Pink Churro Pancakes (my favorite thing we tried) Mexican Bread Pudding French Toast
We are happy to hear about your experience! We appreciate you taking the time to share. - Sarah Barnard

Decided to give Pink Taco a try-- and I enjoyed! I do recommend making a reservation if you are coming on a weekend. We made a reservation and we were seated promptly however, we did overhear that for people walking in there was a 45-1hr wait.  I loved the ambiance here for a Friday! Very vibrant, great music, and lively people. The service was also amazing! Our server, Emma was great she was very attentive to our table, she gave awesome recommendations and was very prompt.  I ordered the fried lobster tacos and so so good. They came with fried lobster, a mango salsa, cheese and a sauce. I loved and would definitely recommend! We also tried the lobster enchilada and when I say it is  MUST try, I loved the cream sauce, the cheese blend and the rich flavor. Again, a must try.  We also tried their margaritas which was great. I tried the mango and the strawberry in the a pineapple. Not only insta worthy (lol) but it was tasty, and strong. -- Overall this was a decent place if you're downtown and wanting to get some food and drinks. Give them a try! For more food content follow me on instagram @dinnerwithnea

Thanks for leaving us such a wonderful review. We are glad that you loved our services. Our staff will be pleased to learn of your high praise. They work very diligently, and it will provide them with great encouragement to keep up their hard work! - Sarah Barnard

Solid after work spot if you're looking for a yummy nacho and a decent marg. I like the vibes after work because they play good/up beat music.  It's not a place I'd go out of my way to for dinner but I like is as a happy hour option. Also they use creamy nacho cheese rather than melted shredded cheese which is a personal favorite method.
Thank you Rebecca for your review. Please join us again soon for the best happy hour in town!

Love this place so much! It's the place for IG spot lover. Sweet corn is my fav one. Guacamole is nice. I tried 3 types of popular tacos there but I love lobster the most! So happy to go to this place
We cannot thank you enough for the kind words about our restaurant. Your review means a lot to us and lets us know we are on the right track! – Pink Taco Restaurant Group

I'm going to be pretty frank about this. I'm half Mexican and the food here is not going to please Latinas or Latinos. I image this being really good food for people who have never had their abuela make them tacos or tostadas homemade. Actually the quesadilla was good. I was satisfied with the quesadilla if you need to pick something from the menu. Also I'm from Texas and in Texas we know a thing or two about good tacos.  I give it three stars though because it wasn't a bad experience. Great atmosphere and amazing drinks. Hell after a few drinks their food will most likely taste like heaven. So start with a few drinks and then get your eat on! Very beautiful decor, so if you're looking for your next Instagram post, Snap, or Tik Tok then this is a lovely place to get those pics.

Hi Corie! We are so glad you liked Pink Taco Chicago! We appreciate you taking the time to leave such a great review and give us a little love. It makes our day to know we made you happy! Come see us again soon! Best regards

It is my first time here and I would 100% come back for second, third and so on. Alexis, the wonderful and attentive waitress gave us great suggestions and details about all the food and drinks. It is a great highlight of our Friday night. What else can you ask for more, maybe Alexis and tequila shots!!!!!!!!!!
Thank you so for your review. We look forward to seeing you again soon! – Pink Taco Restaurant Group

We checked into our hotel and were looking for food. It was a Saturday around 2:00 pm and Lou Malnatis was an hour wait. So while we waited, we saw this place nearby and decided to order some snacks and drinks. It was very busy here so we had to sit at the top bar area. Bloody Mary needed a bit more alcohol flavor in it. The steak taco bowl and steak tacos were all decent. Meats were soft and flavorful. Food took a while to arrive but drinks were fast. They had some Saturday brunch deals going on. Good drink deals.
Thank you for the review Crystal! We love feedback like yours! Please join us again soon for the best happy hour in town!

Food is very bland and mediocre. Best part of the experience was the service. Our server Alex was amazing!! Other reviews say service is bad at the restaurant, we went at 5pm when it was not busy and did not have any issues. The frozen mango margarita was my favorite thing we ordered. We tried the carnita,al pastor, barbacoa tacos.  The best tacos were the carnitas.  Nachos were basic nothing special. Overall ok experience would not come back based on bland and basic food.  Happy hour 5-8 Taco Tuesday 4- close
Thank you for your feedback Mag T., we will share your review with the team. We hope to see you again soon!

I wanted to try this place for a whole year and boy was I disappointed today. My friends food was cold, bland and so bad it was left on the plate as we paid our bill and left. I was starving after ordering a breakfast burrito that was suppose to contain sausage and Mexican seasonings. The burrito was almost completely black beans which you can tell by the photo. It basically has no seasoning and was not something I ever thought a restaurant could screw up!  Why is this place so busy?  It has a catchy name, a great location, the drinks are amazing and the decor is very stylish. It is a hang out spot for young yuppies in the River North area. Once you've had a few drinks in your system you may be hungry enough to eat, I guess.  Lastly, the staff is very nice and provided polite customer service. When they noticed we left full plates of food they didn't ask if it was okay, and I suppose they are aware that their food is not good. They just need to do something about the ... food and this would be a great place. :-(  I provided one star for the customer service, and one star for the drinks otherwise the food was so bad I would've given it 0 stars, if I could.

Hello Kimmie, We would like to earnestly apologize for your recent experience. We take pride in being the best we can be and sincerely hope that every guest is treated like family. We want to make this right – please reach out to me Arthur at 347-264-6787. Regards
Checked out their happy hour! They have $8 tacos and $8 margs on Tuesday-Friday from 5-8p. So good!!
Thank you for your review Julie, please join us again soon for the best happy hour in town!

Alright, still can't stop talking about the chips they serve at the table. PHENOMIAL. Salsa was alright but not here to complain about free chips & salsa.  The filling in the sweet potato taco was on point but the shell was kinda meh. Trying to hard to be pink.  Service was pretty slow over the lunch hour.
Thank you for taking to time to review our food and service.  We look forward to serving you again.

**Vegetarian Friendly** Came her on a Saturday night, and we had more fun than we expected. Great place to catch up with friends, or just to come for tacos. This is also a larger restaurant, so great option if you're a larger group. I can see this place being very popular for Happy Hour and Taco Tuesday. I had the Sweet Potato Pink Tacos - they were tasty, but incredibly greasy. Sadly, they only have one vegetarian taco on the menu - but they have other vegetarian dishes. My one annoyance - the website says Happy Hour daily 3-7pm, and the restaurant would not honor it. We came here thinking we would be able to catch HH. Turns out  it's only Monday to Friday, but it's not reflected accurately online. None the less, we will be back! **Beans and Rice** Vegetarian = Black Beans + Cilantro Lime Rice NOT Vegetarian = Pinto Refried Beans (made with lard) + Mexican Rice (made with chicken stock)

Thank you very much for your review Neeketa! We work hard at Pink Taco to make sure you have a great time whenever you spend your time with us! Come enjoy some tacos and great margaritas at indoor/ outdoor seating, See you again soon!

Such a disappointing experience. This place has such potential, but there were so many disconnects and missed opportunities tonight, we will never return.  Server was sweet, but lacking the "with-it-ness" a server needs to be successful. Drops off a carafe of water with no glasses. We had to ask for glasses. Drinks from the bar took 20 minutes (maybe more). We had to ask for silverware, napkins, and straws more than once. Same with more chips. Our company's tacos took 40 minutes. We asked her twice about them and she just said "ya I'll check on them".... But never resolved the issue. I got up and reported this to the manager because I had had enough. The table next to us were also very frustrated they had to ask for everything.  I also can't believe that we sat there for 2 hours and a manager never once checked in on us. Had the manager checked in he could have caught and resolved the issues early on. Poor service all around.  Also- ONE of the four stalls were working. One was locked, one was completely clogged, and the large handicap accessible stall's door didn't lock. Completely unacceptable. I told our server, a food runner, AND a manager.

Hello Alicia, Thank you for your review. We sincerely apologize that your experience was not a positive one. Please call me at 3472646787 at your earliest convenience to make this right. Regards, Arthur

Came in on Saturday for my birthday trip to Chicago. Of course we went into the Pink Taco because of the name, and because of the atmosphere. When we first arrived I ordered a Bloody Mary. My drink didn't come out until after my food was already at the table... I took a sip of my Bloody Mary and it literally tasted like water with lime and a splash of tomato juice. Filled with ice. I ordered the "fan favorite" per my server, the chicken taco bowl. There was absolutely no flavor, had way more beans than chicken and had pickled cabbage piled on top. The chicken was so dry I needed to drink my luke warm water they provided just to swallow it.  In conclusion, I wish I could give them 0 stars. Avoid the pink taco. The bloody Mary's are disgusting & the chicken taco bowl was HARDLY edible.

Thank you for your review. We like to sincerely apologize that your experience was not a positive one. Please feel to send me an email with your contact information so I can make it right for you. Arthur Setlight  Arthur.Setlight@xperienc…  –Pink Taco Restaurant Group

Doordash'd this. Got the Al Pastor Tacos and Sweet Corn. The tacos were pretty good.  The sweet corn came on the cob, but the pictures on the doordash page showed it off the cob. I prefer off the cob, so this was a slight disappointment. Overall, Pink Taco is alright, but not my favorite taco spot in the neighborhood. The value for quantity isn't quite there, and they charge extra for any salsas.
We cannot thank you enough for the kind words about our restaurant. Your review means a lot to us and lets us know we are on the right track! – Xperience Restaurant Group

Cool restaurant, great drinks & excellent tacos! I tried the al pastor, Baja and carne asada tacos with a mojito. The tacos were all very flavorful and the mojito was refreshing. My friend had the lobster tacos and literally sang with each bite!!! Seriously, it was so good that we drove an hour the next day to have I again!! Only reason I knocked a star off is because the service wasn't anything to write home about. The 1st night, we sat at the bar and was never even offered a refill on drinks. No, it wasn't busy at all as it was within an hour and a half of closing. The 2nd day we went, the server wasn't very attentive but the hostess was. Meh, the tacos made up for it!
We can’t thank you enough for your kind review of Pink Taco Chicago. We look forward to seeing you again soon for some fresh guacamole and some sizzling fajitas!

I can't say enough wonderful things about the Pink Taco. I moved into the River North neighborhood in August -lucky enough to be right around the cnr from the PT. First place I went. And I've been back every week since. Great atmosphere. Great Drinks. Great people. A trip there is worth the visit, even if to hang with Jamal, truly one of Chicago's great bartenders.

Was super excited to try pink taco for the first time, and as a vegetarian, I saw that the majority of their food had meatless options. Ordered the nachos for pickup, and when I got back to my place the nachos were covered in chicken, even though I hadn't paid the extra $5 for the chicken. I guess it's a plus if you're a meat eater, but for someone who hasn't had meat in over 12 years, not a great first impression. There was so much shredded chicken that even though I tried to pick as much off as I could, there was no way to make sure there wasn't any. As a heads up if you're ordering online and are a vegetarian, make sure you specify no meat, because I guess they'll put meat on your food even if you don't pay for it.
Thank you for your review. We apologize your experience was not a positive one. We would like to make this right please call me at 3472646787.

After having a bad experience with another Mexican restaurant (which shall go unnamed), I began my hunt for a great taco. I decided to give L'Patron a try since I heard good things. I ordered two steak tacos (which came  with the usual cilantro and onions), and added lettuce and tomatoes. Also, ordered a small (more like tiny - 1 oz) guacamole and chips. While most of the meat was tender and hot, some pieces were chewy and indigestible, the tomatoes were not ripe, the guacamole was really pico de gallo, and the some of the chips were soggy (lime juice?) and too salty. Also, something gave me an allergic reaction; my face started itching. My search for a great taco continues.

I was craving tacos and this just hit the spot. I'm more upset at myself for not discovering this sooner.  Standouts included the al pastor and carne asada. They were out of lengua so that's for next time. The meat to tortilla ratio is about twice as much as other places nearby. And less greasy. Bring cash, I called for pickup and my order was ready on time.  Oh yea, my profile pic is me eating L'patron on my patio....

This restaurant does cook to order and can take a while before the food is ready. We were told it was take 30 minutes to prepare our tacos and burritos, so if you're looking for a quick bite, this might not be the place for you. Overall, not happy with my experience. The food was bland and overpriced for what you got. Guac and chips costed a whopping $7 and you only got a small side of guac for all the chips they gave.  -Cashier wasn't super friendly and very stingy. We wanted to order just guacamole because we still had chips leftover, but she insisted that we would have to pay $7 again.  -L'patron taco wasn't all that great. Tortillas were dry and the meat took a second for the flavor to come through. While I can tell the meat is of higher quality, I'm disappointed that it wasn't seasoned to really shine through the rice and beans.  -Elote was super bland. When i mixed it up, it was just oil and corn. I was expecting way more seasoning and spices, but they barely put a dash of paprika.  -Guacamole was meh. Really watery and had a lot more of the filling than actual avocado

First time here and would highly recommend; I look forward to coming back soon. Tacos are a bit on the expensive side (~$4ish) but really good nonetheless. They were out of tongue when we got there but considering it was past 8pm, it seemed reasonable.  I really liked the vibe of the place, they have a patio out back that seems to either have just opened or got a fresh new furniture change, definitely a great vibe - they call ur name on a speaker so you can hang outside if you want to. They also have a window upfront for pickups and take out, much appreciated mid pandemic. Drinks were also in the expensive side $10 each - it seemed like a lot for the baby margarita you're served, but they do give you a good sized Michelada that also comes with what seemed like a full cucumber hahah.

Came here for the first time and it was so so good! I ordered two carne asada tacos, one poblano taco, elotes, and a side of rice. The only thing I didn't care for was the rice because to me, it was stuck together and had a gross texture. Just wasn't the rice I was expecting. The steak in the tacos was so fricken good and it had amazing flavor... almost had a burnt/charcoal taste to it without being burnt. The meat was instead so juicy and perfectly cooked with no fat. The poblano peppers were also so good! The elotes was also so full of flavor. The corn was sweet and buttery, and then the cheese on top made it a little salty. The flavors mixed together were perfect. I wish you could buy a taco dinner with rice and beans on the side, because they make you pay for everything a la carte. They also have two salsas: salsa verde (the best one) and the red hot salsa. I didn't realize this place is CASH ONLY, so please make sure you bring cash before coming. They do have an ATM, but who wants to pay to use an ATM. No thanks.  The decor is vibrant and colored, and the workers were all friendly. The way you order is uou order at the counter when you walk in, and then sit down and wait for your name to be called so that you can pick up your food. They also have a takeout window where you can wait in line outside so you can take food to go without stepping foot into the restaurant, which I thought was cool and convenient. I also heard they have outdoor seating in the summer and have a food truck! Overall, the food was great and I'll be back!

Ok so we had no idea what to expect finding this taco joint walking distance from our Airbnb but good god. After an afternoon of day drinking, L'Patron had everything we needed to recover.  The menu was not what I expected from a usual taco joint - so I had trouble deciding what to order. I figured I couldn't go wrong with what was labeled under the House Special. I'd never heard of the gringa or the gringo so I decided to try one. The gringa is tortilla filled with carne al pastor and melty cheese and GOOD LORD ALMIGHTY. The greasy meaty goodness was all I needed and then some. Paired with some refried beans and rice? I was in Heaven.  Prices are cheap, although cash only. Although sometimes, you know a hole in the wall restaurant isn't any good unless they're cash only. I've gotta come back and try other options from the menu next time I'm back in town!

Ordered carne asana burrito and a L'patron taco. Both items were excellent. The char on the meat was perfect and the lettuce was fresh and crisp. I haven't seen a burrito wrapped this nicely in a long time. The tortilla was fresh too. Nothing more you could ask for in a good burrito. The taco was equally delicious. Highly recommend L'patron tacos.

Excellent limeade and lomo encebollado (ribeye and onion) burritos.  I ordered the tasty gringa (al pastor and cheese between two tortillas), but my friend Sarj's lomo was definitely the stronger choice and better value.  Cash only, but there's an ATM inside.

The best Lomo Tacos I've ever KNOWN I drive for hours for that taco ALONE Tastes as good as when Trump was OVERTHROWN Come and get tacos at L'PATRON Gives me funny feelings in my private ZONE Sometimes I've drove here, sometimes I've FLOWN One of the best baez in town, like JOAN Everyone loves tacos from L'PATRON Drake's girl used to call him on his CELLPHONE Austin Powers got down with his own CLONE Ian McEwan told us how to ATONE But nobody makes tacos like L'PATRON Can't afford a taco? Take out a LOAN Cause skipping this taco I can never CONDONE Bring a bunch of friends, or come on your OWN Cause nothing tastes better than L'PATRON L'Patron Salsa is my fave COLOGNE You don't like the tacos? I don't like your TONE I'm gonna put "L'Patron" on my TOMBSTONE It's the Queen Of Tacos and my mouth is the THRONE Afterwards we'll go to the hotel and BONE And after a few you'll say "my how you've GROWN" I'll tell you a joke, you'll ((rolleyes)) and GROAN Then you'll spread your legs like Sharon STONE I'm way more attentive than the dudes you've BLOWN The whole hotel will hear you MOAN I'll put the Desi in Desire like SUNNY LEONE And afterwards we'll go back to L'PATRON WHAT Chicago's best taco. One of the best 5 ribeye tacos in USA (which is the best kind). One of my 10 fave taco places ever (and I've tried a f**kload). My first experience here? Having my car stolen. I told a cop: hey, my car was parked right here, now it's gone! He said, damn, where'd Chicago? What to get: Lomo Encebollado Taco What is it: Ribeye w/Grilled Onion Why: It's life-changing What else to get: All their meats, tacos, tortas, etc, are good Seriously, Patron has - and for many years now has been serving - some of the greatest tacos in the history of tacos. They've grown up from a little place that not too many people knew about when I first tried it over 10 years ago, to being one of the most beloved and popular (and to some degree hipster) taco places around. With hipsterism comes responsibility (crap menu additions), but they still manage to crank out some of the most wondrous tacos you'll ever have. The ribeye (Lomo Encebollado) is the way to go, no matter what you usually like in your tacos, no matter what anyone recommends, you have to try it.  There are not that many people that can make a truly life-changing ribeye taco, but these guys are those people. I'm pretty sure I will always be in love with their tacos, and if they ever up and close on me, the punishment level would be cruel and unusual. Luckily this life-changing taste of these ribeye tacos has helped to make them very popular in a very Latin town (Chicago has better Mexican than NYC). The decor is gorgeous too, colourful, orange and memorable. Perhaps Chicago's best Mexican food - definitely up there, tied with Gorditas Santiago (in the real Barrio). A word of warning though: If you have expensive CARGO And have to drive to FARGO Don't stop in CHICAGO Or you'll be asking "where'd my CAR GO" Now let's finish with more rap: So no need to be miserable, no need for the SORROWS Tacos will cheer you right up, so you don't need WALLOWS I promise that I'll follow back if you give me FOLLOWS And then we'll go for dinner at L'PATRON TACOS So I can sit right on your lap like in Santa's GROTTOS Or I can lean into the rolled down window of your AUTOS Or I can bring my Barbi and you'll think you won the LOTTOS But the best plan of them all is that we go to L'PATRON TACOS I will bring my Devil's Tower and Barbi'll bring her LAGO You'll find I'm a strict machine, but not like the GESTAPO Barbi's hotter than Ipanema girls, and I'm bigger than SAO PAULO And the best Rib-Eye Taco is an L'PATRON TACO Barbi charges more than I do for her AVOCADO And when she gets Chilly I take her to SANTIAGO Then I make her squeal repeatedly just like VIBRATO Then we're hungry so we get an L'PATRON TACO! Some people say I'm girlie, others say I'm MACHO Some people know real Mexican food, others just eat NACHO I cross the Rio Grande at will, you just watch RIO BRAVO And when I'm in Chicago, I get an L'PATRON TACO Barbi doesn't like to suck but me I love to SWALLOW Anything for Barbi or for money is my MOTTO I've had some problems down in Houston just like the APOLLO But when I want Chicago Tacos, it's an L'PATRON TACO I've been to South America, the Mid Easts and MORROCCOS I've been labeled deep AF while others think I'm HOLLOWS Some say we're a cute couple, others call us PSYCHOS But one thing that I know is that we love L'PATRON TACOS I like to pretend I'm okay but that's just my BRAVADO Sometimes I feel so cold inside like Frances was in FARGO Sometimes I feel so frozen I'm like Barbi in CHICAGO But when in the windy city, I get an L'PATRON TACO! WHAT

I've ordered takeout a few times here, but have yet to dine in. I heard there's a patio open now and the place it fairly busy so I'm happy that business is doing well after the past year. But anyway, on to the food! The tacos are fantastic. The al pastor is probably the best, so much flavor. It's sweet and smoky and charred... Let me stop drooling thinking about it. They have the Gringa and Gringo items, which are handmade tortillas with cheese and either al pastor or carne asada (get the al pastor). It's rich and delicious and a lot heavier than a taco. I had a burrito here recently and while the meat (I got al pastor lol) was delicious, I was suuuper disappointed they put lettuce and tomatoes in it. Like wth. Burritos consist of rice, beans, meat, cheese, salsa, and maybe guacamole and sour cream. Is that so hard to follow? I'm not at Chipotle, so I wasn't expecting to find such a thing. Guacamole is good but portion is a little small. The chips are tasty tho, you can tell they're freshly fried in house and seasoned with the perfect amount of salt. Overall, a really good spot. Just stay away from their burritos, but everything else I would gladly order again :)

Not sure what happened during the pandemic but steak in our food was all dry and hard.  I've never seen it this bad before.  Pre-covid I've always been able to get nice juicy pieces but it was like jerky if anything.  This was quite disappointing, especially since all that food I ordered was supposed to be for a birthday celebration too. Felt so bad! Avoid their asada at all costs for now.  Not sure what the reason is but it's pretty much inedible. I won't be ordering that any time soon. If you want steak, go for their lomo(rib-eye).  That was totally fine.  This one tends to take longer to make than the asada but it's worth it. It was flavorful and tender. When my order was taken over the phone they asked if I wanted "everything" in the burrito but when it came time to eat it, "everything" was not in there like I had asked.  Where was the rice?  Where were the veggies?  It was pretty much a dried meat jerky burrito. Ack!  Pass! The shrimp was spot on.  Love the slaw they put on top.  Normally I'm not a big fan of slaw but I do make an exception when it's from here.  The shrimp was very plump and juicy just like you'd want it.

Whatever taco you order, make sure you get it with the handmade tortillas.  It's worth it.  Definitely a game changer.  I've been spoiled by this place that it set a new standard for me for what I look for in a taco. The tacos pair well with the escabeche (pickled veggies).  It's the Mexican giardiniera.  Make sure you wash it down with their horchata and tip them well.  They're so hardworking.

Have you ever had a roasted veggie burrito because you should definitely try that. The cashier and I could not stop giggling, we were both in a silly goofy mood. The first time I came here was with a new friend, the second time with an old friend. Sharing tasty meals with your loved ones is among the nicest things in life. Xoxo we luv u l'patron
Good decent Tacos.  They have a very modern approach to the Taco business.  Many interesting choices and flavors are really good!  Worth trying.
Kept calling to order and the guy would say please hold and never answered the phone. It's cash only and the ATM didn't work. Why do they make it so hard.
2.5 stars, Expensive for a taco spot.... Nothing special  One of my last Logan square taco options

I don't give out many 5 stars but my first offering from here was fresh and phenomenal. I was serviced immediately walking in the door by the cashier who grabbed my 2 go order. I had there legendary ( America's 5th best ) carne asada burrito. Fresh, decent portion, and wrapped suitably to go. I will try rest of menu as this was my first

The hubby and I ordered 2 al pastor burritos The first bite I took I could taste the pineapple, which is the right way al pastor should be cooked, with pineapple. My only complaint is that the al pastor meat was shaved off in very big chunks, al pastor should be small chuncks of meat, these were BIG  I personally was not a fan

Authentic and delicious!!  Two tacos was perfect!! The rice and beans combo, so tasty. I loved my pollo taco with a nice cilantro sprinkle! The shrimp, wow!! My daughter loved her carne asada. Cash only!
Tacos are so freaking tasty. I highly recommend the gringo. Homemade tortillas are dreamy. Cashiers are always so nice and give plenty of extra salsa.

After hearing they had the 5th best Burrito in the Country , to be fair , i went in expecting some serious magic , Entering the restaurant i noticed it was very clean and somewhat stylish , i was soon greeted by a very polite server , so far so good ,  I started with chips and guacamole, the chips are great, assumingely freshly made , The Guacamole even though fresh ,  was really bitter due to unripened avocados , im sure this changes day to day but they dropped the ball on this visit!  I ordered a side of rice and beens and they were spot on , to drink i ordered a Horchata which was delicious , (quick note)if rice and beens are bad and if a place uses powdered horchata , run for your life , its the simple things that count !  Now for the Steak Burrito , (5th best mind you) Steak was good but only just slightly better than average, sorry , i felt they do use good steak and put a bit more time into preparing it so thats a plus and worth mentioning , the rest of the ingredients were fresh, but if your looking for a great Burrito , its worth the stop, if your looking for a life changing burrito , i personally i don't think so ,

I did not know Vietnamese was on my favorite types of food list until I tried Le Colonial. Definitely a special occasion type of place. I went with a large group so we got to try multiple different plates and that's exactly how I'd do it again.  The way they layer their flavors is truly incredible. You can have a bite that has heat, sweetness, and savory notes all in one. Too many amazing dishes to recommend just one. I will definitely be going back.

I had lunch with a colleague,  ordered a waterdown Vietnamese iced coffee, egg rolls, and Pho .   When we left I noticed my jacket sleeve was wet.  Today I noticed spill stains on my jacket sleeve and side if coat.  When I return to San Francisco will have to get my coat dry cleaned. What a horrible experience for over priced subpar Vietnamese food

I came here with my parents for lunch. When we took the elevator up to the 3rd floor, I was mesmerized by how inviting the atmosphere was. It feels high-end and fancy but also homey at the same time. I made the reservation 3 weeks back, and we were seated within 2 minutes of arriving. The menu is not too overwhelming, and each dish is unique in its own way. I'd actually never tried Vietnamese cuisine before coming here, though our server made good recommendations, and the food was out of this world. We enjoyed our Bo Bia appetizer as well as the seafood soup. The chicken curry was flavorful and perfectly hot. Highly recommend this place and will return soon.

Everything was perfect! Party of 1 for lunch. No reservation, fit me in immediately. Love that for me! Wait staff was great. Asked for drink/cocktail recommendations...lychee martini it is. It was ok. Nothing extraordinary for $16. Appetizers: fried shrimp and pork egg rolls. And chicken dumplings. Both were very good. Egg rolls have a definite fishy taste. The dumplings were some of the best I've had. Main dish: shaking beef and garlic noodles. PERFECTION. Beef is tender and cook to medium rare. Flavorful and delicious. Garlic noodles are simple and devine. Soooo good. First time patron but definitely not the last time. The total was $95, w/ tax $106. Loved it

Example of a restaurant continually going down in terms of quality, service and value.  I used to go to their old location pretty often it was sporadic in terms of performance but still one of the better places in the area I have been to the new location a few times and each time I've noticed it's gotten worse and prices have gone higher. Sauces tend to be real sugary and sticky. Essentially fake flavors under excess salt and sugar and call it food.

i have been continuing going to Le Colonial for the last few years...i reckon i enjoy it enough, in particular for the neighborhood that i go to it so much. Food is really more of a 3 than 4 but all in all fine. Maybe lately more of a hit than miss  :)

hit or miss...but more hit than miss. light food can be had. outdoor sitting nice. last week's host looked and acted like he worked for a small town chain cafeteria....yesterday's champ was real good. last week's waiter brought two wrong items (for which we paid)...yesterday's was good. i have been going to le colonial for a few years now, starting with their restaurant in san francisco...i know what not to expect, so i'm fine. y'all too. set your expectations at about average, give or take and y'all's expectation will be met.

What an truly unique and delightful experience.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and truly felt like what I'd imagine a colonial restaurant in Vietnam or Singapore would have felt like back in the day. We ordered a number of dishes, primarily so we could get a sample of the delicious menu and we were not disappointed, everything was perfectly flavored and seasoned, with the only disappointment being the lemon tart, which I felt was quite bland. Everything was presented beautifully and tasted as amazing as it looked. Our server was new, so that was a little obvious, but her shadow was always close by and checked in on us on multiple occasions. I will most definitely be back!

So disappointed in the entire encounter. We arrived at our reserved time and were offered the worst table in the house....a table right at the entrance while there were five other empty tables in the same room.  We were moved to a more suitable table as we would not have eaten at the entrance  From the bus boy removing plates while we were still eating (having to put my hand up to stop him as I was chewing!), to food being left on the table the ENTIRE meal, to food being over cooked and not edible, to a server with his mask under his lower lip, to the manager who really didn't care when we told him, the entire experience was disappointing Clearly coasting on their reputation, it's hard to swallow a mediocre $200 meal for two.

I really liked their old location but they have done wonderful job with the interior of their new location. It's beautiful. The table my mother and I sat at was a bit small once our food arrived. We got the whole fried fish but ended up having them debone it for us because we felt we didn't have enough room at the table. I would have liked to have done it myself. It was delicious. I visit Chicago to see my sister regularly and will definitely continue coming back.

Horrible customer service and for togo orders.  I called to place a pickup order. I was put on hold and then hung up on after three minutes. Called again and placed on hold again for 13:28 minutes. I walked over and they weren't busy and just standing around.  After reading the recent reviews about the place going downhill, I now understand. Recommend ordering pho from somewhere that actually responds.

My friends have raved about this restaurant, and it's been around for a while - for good reason. We came here for a nice dinner for a bachelorette party and ordered a variety of dishes as recommended by our waiter. I also got a nice refreshing cocktail (le piquant). Every dish was delicious and superb. The snapper was amazing and worth the hype- a must if you like seafood. The sauce is just so tasty. The shrimp on sugar cane, crispy rolls, and spring rolls were all fairly similar appetizers but delicious and fresh nonetheless. The shaking beef was so tasty too. The scallop salad was also a nice refreshing noodle dish. Crispy Brussels were actually perfectly crispy. Green curry was flavorful. I cannot wait to come here again and try more dishes. The decor was also so refreshing with lots of beautiful greenery.

I have now been to Le Colonial twice and the food is superb! Unfortunately the service is spotty. On both occasions they have forgotten to bring items we ordered to the table. Plus on this last trip, they were so slow and it was difficult to get the check when we were ready to leave. The food, the food, the food. This is where it is at. Every dish is completely on point! The curries are the best I have every had! I have tried both the chicken curry and the green shrimp curry. Different from each other and hard to choose a favorite. The whole sea bass is AMAZING! Beautifully presented delicious to boot. The spring rolls and the ribs are a must to start your meal. The peanut sauce with the spring rolls is creamy peanutty  goodness. And the sticky sauce on the ribs is finger lickn' good! I also tried a taste of hubby's seafood dumpling soup. It's going directly onto my must order list!

The ambiance is so good. It's a combination of southeast Asian and French.  And the service is sweet. They offered to cut the fish for us. The red snapper was actually not too good. Fish is fresh, however, the inside was not that tasty. Spring roll is really good with the sauce. Pho is refreshing. And I love the Vietnamese coffee!

It's not often I disagree this drastically with the majority of reviews but in this case I couldn't have been more disappointed. Not only is this place extremely expensive for what you're getting it's essentially flavorless. I can stay with certainty that I've had better take out. The only reason I'm giving this place to stars it it is a beautiful location and the staff was ver professional and nice. I ordered the Bahn Xao and thank God there were onions in it because without this dish would be bland and wet. I ordered nothing to drink chicken dumplings and my main dish and with tip came out to $60 and let's not forget the $16 plus tip valet. I spent $80 and left hungry & sooo disappointed.  And that's all I have to say about that.  Follow me on Instagram @instaworthychicago Jackée

I am rating 5 stars for the Crispy Brussels Sprouts alone. I would cross oceans for it. The price point was a little concerning but the serving was generous. It was sweet, crisp, roasty toasty, and just perfect. I do not say this lightly. It paired beautifully with the Shiitake Mushroom Sticky rice.  I ordered the Chicken and Cabbage Salad which was colorful and fresh. Nothing was too heavy which is perfect if you're planning on walking up and down Chicago. The interior of the restaurant is so picturesque. We weren't lucky enough to nab a seat in the open-air portion of the restaurant, but the interior where we were seated was still lovely enough. I had a few sips of my friend's Vietnamese Iced Coffee which was very rich, sweet, and refreshing. Will come back for those brussels sprouts!

Haven't been in a while and they have not really added any more vegan or vegetarian items to their menu but was able to find these things that are dairy free and have no animal bits. Had a delicious lunch. And their wonderful lychee martini!

Came here for a late lunch. Everything here was delicious and the atmosphere and ambiance is great. Came here for a late lunch and shared a selection of the appetizers and shareable sides which was more than enough for three.  Chicken and cabbage salad was recommended by the waiter and was a great addition to the appetizers. It was very light with a bright vinaigrette.  The tuna tartare only came with a few chips so we had to load up each chip with a healthy portion of tartare. I would have preferred the avocado to be less smooth but the flavors were still great.  The Brussels sprouts were a bit on the sweet side and the garlic noodles were good, flavorful but not too intense.

Yes...yes, yes...SUPER EXTRAVAGANT AND EXPENSIVE BUT TRUE TO VIETNAMESE COOKING! Love their Gio Cha..(Vietnamese Version of Egg Rolls=Pork and Shrimp with Mushroom and the BEST DIPPING SAUCE EVER!).best sides to wrap your rolls in...my family who is part Vietnamese and Asian in it-we do it by cutting up the roll into 3-4 pieces so that "Everyone" gets a bite-great as appetizer even though it is usually used for special celebrations-Tet, dinner parties, birthdays, etc. This is TRULY THE BEST THAT I HAVE FOUND IN CHICAGO! WISH THEY OFFERED PICKLED VEGETABLES-CUCUMBER ON THE SIDE!!!

Love this place-hands down the BEST Cha Gio (pronouned Jah Ya). The Cha Gio at Le Colonial are composed of- "crisp, fried spring rolls of shrimp, pork & asian mushrooms, with chili lime dipping sauce." Cha Gio are a typical Vietnamese spring roll..sometimes filled with pork or chicken-depending on who is making it.  They are customarily eaten during special occassions. The Wrapping of the Cha Gio- Ususually the rolls are cut up into smaller bite sized pieces and wrapped in Bibb lettuce with pickled carrots or daikon, cilantro and mint leaves.  They are then dipped into nuoc cham.  Nuoc cham is a dipping sauce made of fish sauce, chili, garlic, water, lime juice, vinegar and sugar.  Absolutely divine to give a salty, sweet, and savory mouthful of flavors. The Restaurant- Le Colonial is composed of two floors with a small bar at the top of the second floor.  Upon entry you feel like you are entering someone's home aka an elegant and sophisticated mansion of sorts. The Bar is known for its signature Lychee Martini as well as its signature Saigon Sling as well other tropical infused cocktails! FYI-The food here is NOT fusion-it really is authentic Vietnamese Cuisine.  It will NOT disappoint.

I ordered the cha gio aka Vietnamese egg rolls...they were a bit on the greasy side and rather small..usually they are cut in three pieces and wrapped with lettuce, herbs, and dipped into nuoc mam which is a fish sauce based dipping sauce. I will say the sides of herbs, lettuce, and pickled vegetables were plentiful and delicious! I would like to go to the restaurant in person and try their pho and other dishes as I ordered take out.

We forget to make a reservation so it is kind of a pity to just sit indoor on such a nice sunny day. Really love the decor of the restaurant and the pho is absolutely worth trying.  Also I would like to highly recommend the roasted duck leg (forget about the official name).  Not much service there

I absolutely love Le Colonial! It's one of my favorite spots in Chicago. If you love shopping and being a tourist, it's a great spot to stop for dinner or just drinks. Takes you back to classy dinners, feather dresses and an Ernest Hemingway vibe but done with a Thai twist. The curry is awesome and so are the noodles!

This is one of my better finds while in Chicago. I am Vietnamese and am very particular about Asian fusion restaurants.  I mean how can I not be? My mom is the best cook ever, says every Asian kid. But really, I wanted to come here just for Happy Hour (I think they call it Social Hour) which is Mon-Fri between 3-6pm (bar/lounge area only and first come first served). I figured if it's not that great, well, at least I got it for 1/3 of the price. Boy was I wrong. I have to say this food tasted just like my mom's cooking, and that says a LOT! So for Social Hour at the bar/lounge area (plenty of seating) we had five drinks ($9 each) and six dishes (also $9 each). We prob could've just had four dishes but it was so yummy and with a late dinner at 9pm, we figured why not. I didn't take nearly as many photos as I could and should have. The food was really good, and the sauces are really telling. The nuoc mam (fish sauce) tasted just like my mom's! Usually, happy hour drinks are watered down but not here.  The ONE thing I would suggest is maybe adding a brown based drink. When I say 'brown' I mean like bourbon based. The drinks offered are very girly (viet gin gimlet, lychee martini and bellini). For food we ordered the dumplings, eggrolls, viet cabbage salad and spring rolls. They also do not skimp on portions. HH menus tend to be less in cost, but they also take away a piece or two. Not here. Their portions and quality of food is good and tastes so yummy. Most dishes served at least four dishes, but more like six. Btw, service is impeccable. I honestly don't remember one dirty dish on our table. Nothing was ever left sitting on the table and your glass was never empty. They get your drink order in before you can even ask. Definitely a great find and I would totally come back.

This is such a nice restaurant in Lincoln Park. The service, food, and wines are a treat. They added a nice outdoor dining area with protection from the weather. They have all the expected foods. They start you with a warm loaf of French bread and a carrot slaw for the bread. Quite good.  Our group of 4 started with escargot and used up a lot of the bread for soaking up the garlic butter. I always have to get the French Onion Soup.  For entrees one of us always gets the chicken, my wife and I almost always get the Trout Almondine, and our other friend enjoyed the Skate. The Frites are perfect for the table.  They have valet parking which is crucial in Lincoln Park!

I had never had French cuisine before Mon Ami Gabi and I'm not sure any other French dining could top it! I felt as though I had entered a Parisian paradise. From the linens to the interior decor everything said J'adore. The food was really yummy. I tried escargot for the first time which were delicious, I ordered the mussels and my guest ordered a steak. The winner of the night was for sure the mashed potatoes. They were pureed to perfection. I've heard the brunch is really good to? I've personally never indulged, but looking forward to their renovations being completed so I can return.

Even though this place is on a pricier side, but it's a great spot to have a nice dinner with friends or your loved ones. My husband and I live close by but will come here very often for dinner or Saturday morning brunch. I love the ambiance of this restaurant and the great service! Food is very descent but not sure if it changes throughout the season or over the time this restaurant exists. Overall, I recommend anyone to try this place even just for the experience. Bonus it resides in a historical building so you'll get to see the magnificent lobby that old Chicago often has.

My fiance took me here for a date night and I absolutely loved it. It was a busy Sat night and we were seated at a booth. The decoration and ambiance at this place was wonderful. I heard this location was the first Mon Ami Gabi opened in Chicago. The server is very knowledgable and patient as we trying to decide on what to order. Since it is a french restaurant, I, of course, ordered escargot and foie gras as appetite. The freshly made baguette was wonderful. The food was delicious and its pairing wine help elevated its tastes. I would definitely visit again!

Get the escargot! Drinks and food are great, but the escargot is a must. We also ordered the goat cheese, onion soup, salmon, filet with frites, a side of mushrooms and spinach. The goat cheese was ok, but everything else was worth it. The soup tasted homemade, the escargot was flavorful and tender, the steak was soft, and all the sides were tasty.

Mon Ami Gabi is located inside the Belden-Stratford Building, so it was a little tricky finding the entrance (they were under renovation). We walked past the entrance, as did many patrons after us!  However, it was worth the little detour because the food was delicious. I made two starters my meal- duck confit and half pot of mussels. My bf started with the French onion soup and had the steak classifque as his main. He also got a side of macaroni gratin. The duck confit was perfectly crisp and tender- meat fell right off the bone. The mussels were fresh and the broth was light but so tasty. I ate EVERYTHING. My bf enjoyed his selections as well, but his eyes were bigger than his stomach! The macaroni gratin  was super cheesy and rich; it reheated perfectly later. The service was attentive and so friendly. I appreciate this is a LEYE restaurant ;)

$55 Restaurant Week Menu (not in this order): 1. Dessert Trio - cotton bar, chocolate mousse, profiterole with vanilla ice cream 2. Signature Prime #SteakFrites - au poivre  3. Frisee & Thick Cut Bacon Salad - soft poached egg, champagne-dijon vinaigrette 4. Complementary wine - Louis Latour #Chardonnay / French Baguette - sweet cream butter and classic carrot râpée, honey-herb vinaigrette (Unrelated to Review: How do you eat a french baguette without making a mess??) The carrot rapee was a delicious complement to the bread. Vinaigrette not overpowering at all. The frisee salad tasted fresh, vinaigrette was a tad sour for me. Steak was tender, not chewy. The au poivre sauce which was good. It was not medium rare but not terribly dry which is decent for a thin steak. Dessert Trio is an excellent idea for Restaurant Week. Mousse had good consistency and good balance of sweet and bitter. I'd recommend lemon bar or profiterole too. Finding parking may be difficult.

This review is regarding the restaurant week menu. Pretty diverse amount of options for the starter and entree. Very sizable portions for the entree. I couldn't even finish the deserts I was so full. Worth your $55 per person.  Starters: We got the Onion soup and escargot. Escargot is a bit salty for my taste but the herbs on it were delicious. Onion soup was a lot more portion size than most places I've been. Very delicious and great to dip your baguette in. Entree: Both the mussels and steak frites (obviously), came with fries. Lots of food here. I loooved the mussels. I was expecting to get less mussels honestly, so I am very happy with it. Has a nice creamy white broth.  Dessert: Very rich. One is a lemon tart, another is a mousse, and the last is like an ice cream sandwich. Lemon tart was a bit too sour/rich for me, but the ice cream was a good palette cleanser.

My husband and I had a wonderful dinner here. Our waitress Amanda M was a ray of sunshine and made lots of helpful suggestions. Her attitude was so sunny and positive, what a breath of fresh air! We enjoyed steak au poivre and the salmon. Steak was cooked perfectly medium rare and juicy, and the sauce was delicious. The frites were okay. We also had one profiterole for dessert which is not on the menu but Amanda suggested it and that was the perfect dessert given that we were both stuffed after our entrees. Nice ambience. We will be back for more date nights and/or with family and friends!
Came across this place after a leisurely Sunday morning walk in the park.  Just walked in and got a table. Great food!

We didn't make a reservation on Mother's Day but the host at Min Ami Gabi  kindly took us in and we were seated almost immediately. Our cozy table in the corner provided us with an opportunity for a pleasant conversation away from the hustle of the main floor. The service was great. After my drink turned out to be a straight up gin with a slice of lemon instead of the Parisien cocktail I ordered, the waitress offered other options.  The fried chicken with mashed potatoes and mushrooms was delicious. Too bad I didn't ordered that and was only stealing pieces from my husband . My steamed mussels were just average, but there were a lot of them . I usually enjoy the wine broth that comes with the dish , but this time it was too bland to be bothered with.    Overall, this is one of those older restaurants that try to maintain consistent quality of food and service not trying to be trendy or too eager to get the new clientele.  Bring your parents for a dinner or brunch and they will be happy. Kids appreciate this place too from what I could tell. But for a younger people or a date there is not much on the menu and the atmosphere is lacking excitement .

This place rocks.  I really enjoyed this French bistro located in Lincoln Park.  The ambiance is special. We came this past weekend for the first time, so we wanted to try some of the more popular items to get a sense of what this place was about.  We started with the French Onion soup which I highly recommend.  We split an order into 2 cups and it was more than enough.  We also got the escargots and baked goat cheese to start.  I usually like escargots, but I actually didn't think this one was to die for.  The baked goat cheese was also just ok.  They bought a baguette to the table to share and this was terrific.  With a little butter and a dip that they brought, it was great.   For the entrees, we got the Steak Bordelaise, the Duck Confit (from the app menu), and the Trout Almondine.  WOW.  All 3 of these were terrific.  I have never had Trout Almondine, but it was nice a buttery, with a hint of citrus and almond.  Highly recomend.  The Steak Bordelaise was perfect.  Fries were crunchy and by the end, soaked up the terrific rich bordelaise sauce.  And the duck texture was crunchy, and served with a sweet cabbage.  All three I highly recommend, and I will be back.

Mon Ami Gabi is a pretty well established Chicago institution, so we decided to try it out for some restaurant week pandemic delivery. We had two restaurant week dinners including: - French onion soup - This was pretty good. - Escargot - This was packaged in a single takeout container so it ended up congealing into a clump.  It was very salty. - Salmon - It was decent.  The salmon was a little bit over done. - Prime steak frites - Thought they could have picked a better cut of meat for this dish.  The skirt steak they picked was thin and frail appearing.  The meat was cooked well done. - Profiteroles - Might have been good but it was not packaged well - the ice cream had completely melted by the time the meal got to our door.  The profiteroles were somewhat tough. The meal came with popovers which were a really great touch but probably would have tasted better if they were fresh out of the oven. I think a lot of the issues we had with this meal are related to the fact that fancy french cuisine is not really compatible with delivery.  When the weather is a little warmer and things open up more we might try eating here in person.

What a wonderful experience!!!! Everything was great.Started off with a gem salad which was delicious(May I add SUPER HEALTHY) And the goat cheese and bread is a MUST!!! I honestly couldnt get enough of it until we RAN OUT.Then I HAD NO CHOICE because we had waaaaaay moooore food COMING!!! OMG???!!!!!  Our entrees were SUPERB!!! I ordered the pork shank and my cousin ordered the Bone in ribeye with bernaise sauce.We shared.And both dishes were spectacular!!! Our server Chloe was just so ON IT!!! She made sure we had everything we needed.She is a VERY nice saleswoman as well.She even knew what we needed BEFOREHAND!!  Thumbs WAAAAAY UP!!! GREAT TIME hangingout with family!!

In one word: HAUGHTY.  Using the Open Table app, a table for two on the patio was reserved in advance. This was a first official night out with a dear friend since restaurants were allowed to reopen but limited to al fresco in Chicago. It was something I was really looking forward to all week!  On arrival the host was really snippy with us for not having a mask on. First of all this was our first time ever at this restaurant and we were expecting to sit outside to eat. We did not realize the only way in was through the lobby of an apartment building which seemed so bizzare. He immediately said, "well I dont think I can seat you right away and you canot stand in here" which was extremely off putting!! We were ON TIME for our reservation and although there were several open tables on the patio, the reason of not being fully staffed was given. So understanding of the situation we asked about having a drink while we waited. We were flatly told no. Again, not a very inviting start!  Not long after however we were offered a table in the stairwell to the patio named "the riviera" which really was a nice setup and very unique. If this were a romantic date, it would have been lovely but after a while I realized we were basically in the walkway for all the waitstaff bringing food up and down the stairs. Cest la Vie! The waiter came to greet us. I realize he is required to wear a mask but he sounded muffled and we couldn't understand him very well. He pulled his mask down and shouted "do you want fresh bread or not? I will have to charge you!" again so awkward - but we placed our drink orders and he came back soon after with our drinks. My friend received a phone call and she happened to mention to the caller we were having a strange experience. She asked me if I would prefer to leave instead and go elsewhere. I was ready at that point to quit while we were ahead.  We waived down the waiter to inform him and ask for the check. He sneered. Almost immediately the manager came over. We explained how strange this experience felt and that we would like our check. He offered to find us a different waiter and take care of our drinks if we would be willing to give them a chance. We agreed. From that point forward our service was impeccable, friendly, prompt and even enjoyable. The food was excellent too. We shared steamed muscles and each ordered a steak with frites with two sides (mushrooms and potato mash) along with another round of drinks. The portions were a decent size - not skimpy or too plentiful. The pace of food coming out was on point and this second waiter was very good about bringing out side plates, fresh silverware between courses and just in general making sure we were satisfied. She even brought out a chocolate puff pastry at the end with our check. All was fine - until we got in the car and realized that the manager never did take that first round of drinks off the tab as offered. Oh well... we didn't feel like going back to ask. At least we had a lovely meal. The way I look at it, had we left early we would not have ever gone back and now we just might go try some other items that looked good as plates passed by us on the stairwell. What a difference one person can make in the whole dine out experience!

This is a wintertime pandemic review - pre-pandemic the place was a five or higher. I went in late December of 2020 after making a reservation over the phone and found good food but very muted ambiance and really awkward staff. They told me over the phone that they sat 5 tables outside in the tent at a time and 5 tables inside next to 'wide open windows' but when I got there, there were closer to 7 or 8 tables with people inside and the windows were open but just a crack. I think they took whatever the city of Chicago rules were and did whatever they could to just barely seem to stay within the law. Some of the staff members were nice, while the majority of them seemed really confused over how and when to bus the tables or to come over to help. I wouldn't have noticed most of that, or the strange seating patterns, but it all stuck out more because the manager or whoever it was I interacted with on the phone and then in the reseating process was I hate to say it just a jerk. I really wasn't expecting that at a time when we're all trying to stay safe but we're also trying to keep the restaurant in business.  The food was great - salads were way bigger than I remembered and the steaks and fries were amazing. They did undercook my wife's steak, so maybe ask them to cook it a little more than you would normally ask just so they get it right.  Probably a great place to wait to return to after the pandemic or once the weather gets nicer again.

Finally got to eat in person since COVID.  Food is great as well as service.  Did not realize there was a charge for their bread service since we always got at least 2 loaves of bread when we ordered to-go during the pandemic. Once we were seated, they asked if we wanted bread and regular water and we said yes. The bread is good served nice and warm.  Although, the charge was minimal, I heard grumbling from another table about that charge.

Good food - nothing OMG amazing, nothing really amiss. I had one of the salads and the trout. The portions were small enough that you need to get both an appetizer and a main to fill up, so you have to budget for a $50/person without alcohol, which I thought was a overpriced for what I got.

Went to this charming location and could not have been more disappointed!! It was Mother's Day so we had high expectations for our experience.  It was a disaster! Service was absolutely terrible. Waiter was so terrible it ruined our entire experience.  We had to ask for EVERYTHING!! He never wished us a Happy Mother's Day! Soooo rude!! We ordered the waffle but he looked surprised when we asked for syrup. NO syrup!! Made zero effort to check on us!! All the other servers were running around taking care of their tables! Not this guy!! He was no where to be found! Horrible! Horrible! Horrible! I felt like the waffle should have been comped! Would never go back!!

We went here for a birthday dinner and it definitely has the feel of a classic French restaurant. It is very low-lit and cozy inside, but feels high class as well. We started with a baguette which was perfectly baked and came with a lovely carrot amuse bouche. We shared the warmed goat cheese starter which was a perfect start to the meal. The drinks here are strong, but delicious. I had the Dover sole which was cooked to PERFECTION. It was incredibly light and buttery. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant for a nice date or intimate dinner. It certainly won't be a regular spot as the prices are high, but perfect for a treat every once in awhile.

This location is better than the Oak Brook Center location.  Brunch items that are tried and true- Onion soup: 4.5 Prime burger and frites (med- rare): 5  excellent taste and thin, soft fries.  Smoked salmon Benedict: 4 (very good) Lattes: 5 Dinner- Half pot of mussels: 4 French onion soup (get the bowl if you have a large appetite): 4.5 Caesar salad: 4.5 Filet mignon and frites: 4.5 (best item on menu IMO) Bone-in rib eye au poivre: 4.5 (sauce was very good and made for a delicious dip with frites) Salmon and potatoes: 3 (salmon was overcooked) Lattes: 5 Service and Ambiance in LP: 5 Service and Ambiance in OakPark: 4
Your trust is our top concern,  so businesses can't pay to alter or remove their reviews.  Learn more.
Start your review of  NoMI Kitchen .

I think I would give 3.5 stars, but settled on rounding up.  We loved our drinks at the bar. It was a quiet midweek night, so there was plenty of empty seats. After our drinks, we went to our table. We had a reservation on Tock. It charged us $60 for the reservation, but I got that refunded a few days after our dinner. I don't like that practice. I show up for my reservations... and I seem to be punished because others don't. However, during this time of covid, these types of practices seem to be popping up at some places.  Hubby had a nice ribeye for dinner. I tasted it and it was juicy and delicious. I splurged and ordered the chef sushi/make dinner. It came our without any make on it. When I asked what the dish was, based on the description, they said the menu was a misprint. They brought me a rainbow roll... so I eventually got what I ordered. The view is amazing and is a reason to go to the restaurant if you are visiting Chicago.

Went for the 5-course tasting Thanksgiving dinner and while the food was excellent, service left quite a bit to be desired with timing off, poor communication and overall just made what could have been a special night feel much less special. They comped some wine which was nice, but given the tab for 4 was already approaching $1K, it seems like some attention to detail would have been warranted. Also, not the restaurant's fault, but a drunk table next to us was pretty loud which also affected the evening. Started with the cured meats and cheeses. Overall good, though odd that we got the same portion size as the 2-top next to us. Crab bisque was very good, but pretty unappetizing looking (brown, with white stuff floating in it). Also not fully warm. Lobster beignets were pretty amazing. Sushi appetizer was really good as well. Beet salad was more salad than beets, but very good. Turkey was perfectly cooked, but was hoping for something more homestyle (like the photo on the site), but overall was good and the stuffing was the bomb. Pumpkin cheesecake was excellent. So luscious. The pecan pie was also good (the chocolate sorbet being the best part). Pastry was a bit thick and hard. So, overall a fine meal, but the service gaffes and expectation set by the price meant overall this didn't live up to our expectations. Not one of these dishes was the kind of memorable dish you think about later... bummer.

Nomi was the last of the old money hangouts that still exists in Chicago. The impeccable dining and limitless selection still exists; but not the clientele. The Park Hyatt rival adjacent Peninsula for decades; Park being the better spot on the Monopoly board.  Dear Penny & Jay: Legacy is worth more than money. Your Obama candidate was Manchurian D=!?

It's okay! We had a burger, a cocktail  and the fish it wasn't spectacular at all, I felt I was at the Nordstrom grille in Seattle! I was expecting it to wow me But it didn't exactly! The ambiance was good and not bad, but the food was just okay! I mean I had better and cheaper burgers and fries! Cocktails just average too!

Sushi was ok and not the best quality, way too overpriced but that's what you get in a hotel. The outdoor rooftop space is exceptional and very romantic. Would recommend going there for drinks and maybe an appetizer, but go somewhere else for dinner.

You gotta try the sushi here and the desserts! Super delicious and the chef is a master! Arigato gozaimasu!! Junni the hostess is super awesome and seat us at a great table. The servers made our night. Tom and Ammedor recommended us what to eat, and Oscar showed us the best drinks on the menu. Felix is fabulous too, and we enjoyed our conversation with everyone. Great epic views of the water tower, and my parents also had their very romantic anniversary here. Can't wait to come back to NoMi's Kitchen!!

This place is such a beautiful little restaurant and the terrace is really lovely with a great view. We unfortunately couldn't make a reservation and missed out on the terrace but we we're still very happy to be in the dining room. When you arrive at the park Hyatt you have to take the elevator up to this restaurant so even if you're in the dining room you still have a nice view. The main reason I was coming here was for their lobster beignets and I have to say my mom and I felt they were one of the best things we ever ate in our lives! The serving consists of five of them with the most amazing remoulade sauce. I wasn't planning on getting a cocktail but then when they had a French 75 with Sauternes I couldn't resist that absolutely wonderful. The only thing that I'll say bad about this restaurant was that the service wasn't very attentive but since the food and the drink were so exceptional and the Decour so lovely I still felt this place deserve five stars.

if you're looking to pay a LOT of money for not a lot of food or ambiance, this is your jam. Our party arrived hungry and ready to spend, after all,it was our generous friend's treat. So, he was ready to spend and we were ready to eat. And now i feel guilty having made our friend spend so much money on the very average meals we all ate.  We started with the Seafood Tower. What arrived was a tower in the 19th century sense. You know, when 10 stories was a Skyscraper. Each level more ice than sea creatures. I'm a fan of seafood towers- they're usually quite ridiculous, even gluttonous. This tower lacked tenants. And the ones on the lease were not exciting neighbors.  Our Sushi platter was ok. Some sashimi standards of a quality that was ... standard. The cost, however, was absurd for what we got. We've been to some of the finest sushi restaurants in Chicago. We are Sushi superfans. This was opening act stuff. unfortunately it headlined our bill. Polite claps all around.  We of course looked around the table. Arrayed around were the type of tiny pretentious main courses that we all allowed ourselves to think of as Top Notch Delicacy the end of the last century. But this is 2021 in one of the food capitals of America. C'mon.  A couple of standard (again, that word) rolls completed our group's fishy adventure. They were fine. But you don't go to a fine restaurant for "fine" food.  The sake list was (drum roll) two sakes. There are more sakes at Jewel Osco.  The dessert, however, was delicious! Five stars for the pastry chef who created the wonderful chocolate cherry log. It was like a gourmet snickers ice-cream bar and i mean that in the best way. With a cherry on top.
